review_body: I stayed here during the COVID 19 scare, needing a few days outside of my own apartment for my mental health and a change of location. The staff were very courteous and upgraded me to a suite, free of charge. The beds were soft and clean, and despite being in the middle of midtown there is great soundproofing and my stay felt serene. Enjoyed the full bath and bathrobe. Didn't take advantage of the room service but they are affilitated/attached to an Indochinese restaurant that I know to be very good. Will definitely recommend to my family and friends that they stay here--whenever they are allowed to visit again!
user_name:
Scarlett M
New York City, New York

review_body: I enjoy extensively researching my destination before traveling and chose The San Carlos Hotel because reviews told me it was located by a subway station in a safe, walkable neighborhood with excellent staff. I also liked that they had suites available at a reasonable price point—allowing our family of four to have ample room. The San Carlos Hotel was all this and more! My husband, who travels for work often, told me we must stay here again the next time we are in NYC. This is high praise coming from him! When we entered through the doors of the hotel each evening after a long day of sightseeing, we were always warmly greeted and felt relief to be back in our comfortable accommodations.The following story will explain why we will be returning to this wonderful hotel: Shortly after we checked in our first night in New York, my son told me he smelled smoke in our room. Then his eyes started to become very irritated and he didn’t feel well. He is very sensitive to smoke. We called the front desk and they sent the wonderful Manny up to assist us. He tried to determine where the smoke was coming from and my husband and Manny concluded that someone had been smoking in the hallway. Twenty minutes later the smell was stronger and we realized it was coming from under the door that adjoined our room to the room next door. Manny was still in the hallway trying to neutralize the smell of the smoke so we alerted him to the situation. He approached the front desk on our behalf and we were offered a new room with an upgrade for the entire duration of our stay! Wow! We were blow away by the fact that Manny and the front desk resolved our problem so quickly and without any fuss on our part. This experience made us loyal customers of The San Carlos Hotel each time we are in NYC! They take care of their guests.Details about the room: The hotel beds are comfortable with high end sheets. The room and bathroom were clean and comfortable. The kitchen area had a bigger mini-fridge that had plenty of room for half gallon sized cartons. We ordered breakfast items from Target (delivered via Shipt) and enjoyed starting our day slowly enjoying breakfast in the room. There was also a microwave and small coffee maker. For Father’s Day we ordered bagel sandwiches from Ess-A-Bagel (on the next street over) and avoided the LONG line by ordering via Yelp. Location is amazing! We bought unlimited 7 day metro cars and rode the subway all over Manhattan. So simple using City Mapper app. Subway stations are very close to the hotel. We walked easily to 5th Avenue shopping, Top of the Rock, great dining (loved The Smith), St. Patrick’s Cathedral, and Grand Central Station. The whole family felt safe exploring the area surrounding the hotel as it was full of tourists, professionals, and locals. Safer and different vibe from the chaos of Times Square.Excellent experience! We will be back!

We came over on the 13th march on my wifes 50th birthday , unfortunatelly it was the day that lockdown commenced but even though all the attractions were closed and gradually the bars and restaurants followed suit , the welcome and friendship we received from Evelyn and the gang was so warm and attentive , especially helping us to have a room for the extra night when we found that our flight home had been cancelled. Spacious rooms and location was appreciated and ideal for all the walking we did around the fantastic city . Obviously not the best time to visit but glad that the staff looked after us . Thanks

We stayed in this hotel with our two sons of 11 and 14 yo for 6 nights. We had a room with two very comfortable double beds and a ‘kitchenette’. The latter was a bit disappointing as we had expected a little kitchen. Instead the kitchenette turned out to be a microwave, fridge, coffee machine and cutlery for two people. However, in practice this was enough for us to have breakfast in the room each day. The hotel does not provide breakfast, but we bought bread from a lovely bakery nearby and had breakfast in our room in our own time. Ideal for a family with teenagers. The room was cleaned daily, not super good, but sufficient. Also a good gym. The best feature of the hotel is its location. Walking distance to Central Park and Rockefeller Central. Bus stop and metro around the corner. The staff are friendly. All in all, we certainly would recommend this hotel. It is a very good value for money!

We had a great stay at this hotel. It was in a great position for touring around and the staff were more than helpful to any request we made. That is all the staff we encountered during our 5 day stay. Good location for Central Park, the shops and a decent walk downtown. The big hop on hop off bus stop was only a few blocks down. Plenty of eateries around the Hotel ranging in price. Would definitely stay again.

The San Carlos Hotel is an amazing hotel that is centrally located in NYC. The hotel offers well appointed guest rooms, amenities and staff that are friendly, professional and extremely nice to the guests. We used the gym available to guests which was outfitted with enough equipment to enjoy my workout. This has become our go to hotel in NYC, we love the San Carlos Hotel.

We have stayed here three times over the last two or three years. Enough that the staff remembers us. They are always accommodating and super helpful. The rooms always seem like a great value (I've paid more for less on the side of the Turnpike somewhere!).

Excellent hotel !! Walking distance to many sights and restaurants. Super comfortable beds. Very clean. Friendly and helpful staff. Nice decor in the lobby. This will be my home in NY. My message has been written

Evelyn and Fabio are the personification of outstanding customer service! For the past 10 years, I have been a monthly visitor to NYC; San Carlos is my home away from home. I highly recommend you make it yours.

Great location. Within walking distance of Grand Central, Chrysler Building, Times Square, Broadway and Central Park. Two good cafes across the street for breakfast. Subway just around the corner. Hotel and room decor good although a couple of bits of wallpaper coming off in the room but not really an issue. Comfortable bed. Room had added benefits of coffee/tea making facilities, fridge and microwave. Bath as well as shower which was good for having a soak at the end of the day. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

We always enjoy staying at the San Carlos. The rooms are a good size and nicely decorated. The bathrobes are a nice extra. The staff is always friendly and helpful. The location is great, a short walk to the subway.

Great place in NY to stay with a good location. The hotel is clean, rooms are big (I stay in one of the suite) and very quite to have a good rest at night. The staff is very nice and thanks to Ben, the manager, for send us a bottle of wine.

good price but 4 star rating is misleading. bathroom is nice but the light switches were dirty which was the first thing I noticed and something that should be taken care off. carpet and sheer drapery were dusty. Overall is is a reasonable effort for the price but should be a three star for sure. the service is great!

We really enjoyed our stay at San Carlos, highly recommend it, and would definitely return. The front desk staff at check-in was exceptionally helpful and provided unasked for conveniences to make our stay especially nice. Our room was spacious, clean, and quiet. There was always a friendly face to open the door as you enter and leave the lobby. The location is within reasonable walking distance to Central Park and the Theatre District. And there are several wonderful French bakeries close by.

Usually need a bed and bathroom. In-out. But at SanCarlos I needed to host a small meeting on short notice, then work at the room desk for several hours afterwards.I asked desk at check-in for extra chairs so all meeting participants could sit. Ended up with a larger room and beverages for the meeting. No upcharge. They could not have been more helpful. I got a great rate and the location is very good. The rooms are solid. Clean. Well maintained. Great hotel.

Excellent we stayed for 10 days , the people is very nice and helpful. Rooms were very comfortable and well keptThe value for our money was excellent Will come back and will recommend I think that minimum 200 character of review is too much.Have good 2020

The hotel is located in a very nice location, the price was reasonable compared to other hotels in the area (we rented a suite because we are a family of 5, and that suite came with a 2-bed bedroom and a living room with a pull-out couch). The staff was very friendly, especially the cleaning staff. The main drawback was the condition of the room, in particular we had windows that were in such poor state that we had to barricade them with pillows and towels to prevent the wind from oozing through (this was in february, so the wind was very cold).Also, the “resort fee” was quite expensive at 32 USD per night, for free wifi and access to a gym that was honestly just a few weights, a few cardio machines and a single multi-cable station.I might choose this hotel if i I come to Manhattan again, but not in the very cold or very hot months.

The San Carlos is a luxury boutique hotel with spacious rooms and wonderful amenities in a sea of cracker box hotels, which NYC is famous for. Not only is this hotel beautiful, clean, and spacious, but the staff is incredible. I cannot recall the last time I experienced this level of customer service. Every member of their staff was professional, friendly, and beyond helpful. When we encountered significant noise issues from a family that checked into the room next door, Evelyn, the Director of Front Office was quick to relocate us to an upgraded room and with a special treat left in our room as a courtesy for our trouble. I will undoubtedly stay here again whenever I travel to the city. A truly amazing New York experience.

Not fair commercial politics - in small letter you'll discover $364.43 extra charges that are not included in the booking confirmation - on top of many other taxes already included ... Position of hotel is okay but for same price you can find betterBreakfast not included

I love staying at the San Carlos. Rooms are spacious, well-furnished, and clean, beds are comfortable. I chose one with a kitchenette, compact but so convenient (microwave, refrigerator, plates, silverware, etc.) Staff is friendly and professional. And the location is excellent--midtown, safe, and near restaurants, shopping, and public transportation.

We stayed for four nights and had work calls so were in our room more than we would normally be when in New York. The room was comfortable and spacious which made working there easier. Business center and fitness room were also nice. On a quiet street with easy access to lots of great stuff (ess-a-bagel around the corner). Best part though was the amazing staff—helpful, cheerful, going out of their way to make our visit great. We will be back!

We visited in Dec 2019 and the location could not have been more perfect for taking in the shops on Fifth Avenue and Rockefeller Center. Large rooms -- very large rooms and well cleaned. Highly recommend this boutique hotel with their very accommodating staff.

I almost hate to rave to much as I don't want it to get booked up when I need it. I have returned here over and over for years. The staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms are roomy and comfortable. Location is perfect for business or pleasure

The lobby is nothing special, and the hotel does not look special from the outside, but the rooms are very spacious and the staff here is great. The workout room is small but has windows, so it's far less claustrophobic than other workout rooms at comparable hotels. Our family of 4 stayed quite comfortably in a suite with two queen beds and a small kitchenette for a very reasonable price. The location is convenient to 5th Avenue shopping and the theaters and is right around the corner from Essa Bagel. If you book directly on the hotel's website, you can sign up for substantial discounts. We would stay here again.
user_name:
Joelyn L
St. Louis, United States

review_body: We stayed at the San Carlos hotel for 7 days in may, the hotel is in a perfect location, away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square but close enough to walk to. The hotel is clean and the staff are friendly it was nice to have a little kitchenette in the room with a fridge and coffee machine. There was also plenty of places nearby to eat, there was also a restaurant next to the hotel but we didn’t eat there. Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel and definitely stay again.

We had another great stay in this great Hotel. Everything again this year was excellent . Everyone we met during our stay was super friendly and helpful, especially Rebecca . We are booked again to stay next Christmas and cant wait to return. Highly recommend this Hotel

I have stayed at this hotel for years, and its convenience and first-rate staff make it my NYC home-away-from-home. I know that if I need anything, the team that run and administer the hotel day-to-day are on top of it, and for business travelers who value service, that alone is a reason to make the San Carlos a hotel of choice.

Friendly and helpful staff . Being tourists they always made sure to give us detailed directions to anywhere we needed to go. On rainy days they always made sure to have umbrellas for us at the front door and anytime we needed a cab, uber, etc they always made sure to have it ready for us

This hotel is a hidden gem and while just a few blocks from all the Manhattan landmarks is on relatively quiet street. Hotel staff is extremely friendly and helpful . Rooms are very comfortable and beds were some of the best I have experienced in a hotel and I travel quite a bit.

friendly, clean, quiet, and luxurious feel. Will certainly come back in the future and have already recommended it to friends an family. One thing i would have liked would have been coffee tea and danish in the am so that there was something in our bellies as we started our journey into the big apple.

I travel to New York once a year, and I always stay at the San Carlos. It is a fabulous boutique hotel, and the location is fabulous. It is within walking distance of Broadway, 5th Avenue, and many other important sites. I love it!

We stayed at the San Carlos from December 25th to the 30th. From our first entrance, we knew we had the best hotel for the value of what we paid. Wonderful friendly and helpful staff, not crowded, great clean rooms, great location, great pricing! We would not hesitate to book the San Carlos again. . . a great find!

All staff were warm, welcoming and couldn't possibly have helped us more than they did. Nothing was too much trouble for them. The hotel was immaculately clean with a fantastic location. We would highly recommend.

Hotel was a great walking location to many attractions including the cathedral, library, rooftop bar and directly across the street from the empire steak house. Also, very close to subway station. Our room for 3 was a nice size, two queen beds, sitting area, fridge, microwave and coffee pot. All staff was friendly and accommodating, answering all questions and promptly bringing us ice and extra towels. The room was clean and the beds were comfortable. I booked through Expedia and the price was a little high, but only because we definitely wanted to make sure we had 2 queens, coffee pot and mini fridge. I would definite stay here again. Wonderful 2019 December trip with my best friend and daughter.
user_name:
ccucollagegirl
North Myrtle Beach, South Carolina

review_body: I love returning to the San Carlos once or twice a year. It is wonderful to be greeted by the same staff each time you arrive and to have them recognize you when you do come back - they treat you like family!

My mom and I have stayed at San Carlos for over 10 years every Christmas season! Close to Broadway shows, 5th Avenue and MOMA. Staff is super friendly and very helpful! Very clean and spacious. The Indian restaurant next door is amazing!

I love this hotel. The front desk attendant was so helpful! I needed an early check in and he just made it happen. Everyone there was friendly, (and not fake, polite but authentic. The room was very clean and the location is awesome. And most important for an NYC hotel - IT WAS QUIET! I hate paying so much money for a hotel and its noisy. I could not hear anyone else next to me, above me, etc. The next time I need to stay in mid-town I will absolutely come back to the San Carlos. So happy I found it!

We enjoyed staying at San Carlos. It was within walking distance to many of the sights we wanted to see. Room was large and comfortable. Great Italian restaurant around the corner. Would stay again next time we visit NYC!

Top class hotel. Staff amazing, especially Bobby. Rooms great size for NYC. We travel to NYC once a year and the only place we stay. Location great. Line 6 subway 100 yards, Central Park 15 mins walk, same distance Times Sq, 10 mins walk 5th Ave. There is no restaurant on site, but who needs that in NYC. There is a great breakfast diner opposite, and Starbucks 100 yards away. Plenty of great restaurants near by like Club A steak

The staff went above and beyond to ensure that our stay for the NYC marathon was comfortable.Traveling with a toddler is never easy especially in a big city during a large event such as the marathon. Staff treated us like family. Highly recommend.

We stayed 4 nights at San Carlos. We chose it as the suites easily sleep 5 which is rare in Manhattan hotels. The room was very nice, clean and staff were very helpful and friendly. As we had a tea drinker a kettle would have been a welcome addition but that didn't detract from a great stay.

Our recent stay at the San Carlos was excellent. Our Executive Jr King Suite was the perfect accommodation for for 7 night stay. It was clean and front desk staff very friendly and accommodating. Great!

This small hotel has large rooms for NYC. The room is kept perfectly clean. Good size bathroom. And excellent staff - ALWAYS so helpful in every way. Cannot say enough about the staff (who offered phone the other hotels on the street to try and track down my missing UPS package - and then tracked it for me online). The property is a bit dated but the other positive features mentioned above far outweigh this point.

Quiet part of midtown. Spacious rooms. Great staff. Subway on the same block. Walking distance from Rockefeller Center and the 5th avenue shopping. Our family of five loved our Thanksgiving weekend in the city. Perfect!

A home away from home with an attentive and helpful staff. Location is perfect, restaurants convenient, entertainment and transportation close by. A very quiet location where you can recharge for your next days adventure in NYC.

Rooms seem dated and not super clean. Size of room was excellent for big family, location was great. Lobby is very nicely appointed but rooms, not so much. We were in town for the NYC marathon and location was very good for the race. Overall, unless the hotel does a major overhaul, I would likely not stay there again.

Hotel was in a great location. Walking distance to many attractions and only minutes from a Subway station when we wanted to adventure further away. The hotel staff was awesome and fun to interact with.
Our stay at the San Carlos was very pleasurable! The staff was very accommodating to our needs. We loved the location of the hotel. The rooms were spacious & comfy! We will definitely stay again!

Great hotel! Friendly staff , excellent service and close to everything. Rockefeller center and Times Square just blocks away. We enjoyed our stay and will happily go back when visiting New York City.

I’ve been staying at the San Carlos for years. It’s the best. The rooms are large and comfortable. The staff is always friendly, knowledgeable, helpful and professional. They really know what they’re doing. It’s a home away from home.

What an incredible staff, beautiful facility and great location! We have stayed multiple times because the service and professionalism is consistent… Friendly, professional and willing to take care of anything we need.We prefer smaller hotels to the large chains to get a bit a serenity in the city and this gives us everything we need. Extra special kudos on this trip to Evelyn for making my nine-year-old granddaughter feel like a superstar

Wallpaper peeling off walls. Empty fridge. Tiny bathroom with tub-shower. Little room for toiletries. Room is nice size. Bed is ok. Lots of pillows. But furniture has seen better days and room smells old.For the price, it is a decent hotel. But if I am looking for upscale, this is not it.

I use the hotel for business and have spent over 50 nights there in the past year. It's location is outstanding for mid-town business. The rooms are large and very compatitable for working withing the room. Internet service is fast and easy to navigate. The hotel is located close to many excellent restaurants.

Small boutique hotel in midtown. Great location centrally located near everything. Great and polite staff. Great serviceClean rooms comfortable beds good size rooms moderate prices not noisy or crowded. An oasis in midtown.  Would stay there whenever I’m in the city! Dee Ann Mccarthy

My husband and son stayed here for a long weekend in October. They really enjoyed their stay on several accounts. 1) Super friendly staff 2) Clean and well maintained 3) Well located4) Very spacious for NYC5) Comfortable accommodations6) Safe and secure -- our son arrived later than my husband and they needed to verify his arrival before they sent him to the room.They both said they would be happy to stay here again. Thank you!!

My wife and I stayed with our teenage son for five nights at the end of October 2019 in an elite king suite. The room was absolutely perfect for our needs - a separate living room with a kitchen area and a sofa bed for our son and a decent sized bedroom for us. There is no restaurant in the hotel but there are plenty of options nearby (we liked Urbanspace for a quick dinner). For breakfast there is a traditional diner over the road which is pretty reasonable by NY standards or The Smith is a few minutes walk away for something a little bit fancier (we went for Sunday brunch which was fantastic but make sure to book as it was really busy) but most often we tended to get bagels from Ess A Bagel over the road and eat them in our room.The room was very clean, spacious (esp by NY standards) and really well located for a family vacation and the staff were always helpful and happy to give advice (especially “Bobby from the Lobby”). We would definitely stay here again if returning on vacation.

I have been a returning guest here. It is a very pleasant place, great location, well kept, clean and quite. On two days of my stay here the hotel was cut off internet connection. If I were the management I would have offered the guests some kind of compensation like free breakfast or minibar or whatever. They didn't and I left a little pissed off but I shall be back anyway.

A very clean hotel in a perfect position in midtown Manhattan. Very friendly staff, spacious rooms! Subway close by, perfectly reachable from JFK via E-line to Lexington Av/53. St.. 5th Av./Central Park, Rockefeller Center in walking distance. We will be back!

Clean, great location. Staff friendly and caring. Would recommend !!! The first room we were in was a little dated and they were able to switch us.Again location was great. If you care about food in hotel, well not the best choice but easy to get to walkingclose by.

This quiet hotel has spacious rooms, cordial housekeepers, welcoming and helpful staff, and amazing doormen. Rockefeller Center, Broadway Theaters, superb restaurants, pharmacies, and shopping are easily walked to. For years we stayed at the Waldorf. When informed about its closing we began checking out hotels in the same neighborhood and the San Carlos became our first and only "pick."

Very convenient location. Friendly, professional staff with a painless, efficient check in process. Room was spacious, well appointed and very clean. There were some snacks and refreshments waiting for us. The beds and linens were comfortable, and the shower was great with good water pressure. Always our go to in the City. Thanks, Ben and staff, we’ll see you again soon!

Very much impress by the penthouse suite. Other executive suites need to be updated. Convenient to Public transport. Staff is very helpful and provided great suggestions for place to eat and visit. My stay was 8 days and enjoyable.

The hotel was solidly mediocre, but I made reservations through their website and the price quoted was not the actual price as there were additional "facility fees" and tons of taxes that did not show up until the bill came. There are lots of other hotels in the immediate vicinity, so travelers have plenty of options.

Just want to compliment Evelyn at the front desk of the hotel. I observed her while waiting to check and in was extremely impressed at the way she was able to handle the needs of the customers that were right in front of her, as well as those that were calling in. It only got better when I checked in and she was able to exceed my expectations by making a quick adjustment to my room location. You learn a lot about people from observing and I can tell you first hand that she is one of the best people I have encountered during my travels, ever. Just wanted to make sure that you knew.

Love this place !!!! The hotel was delightful nice comfortable beds Tube in the bathroom, excellent internet clean tidy and excellent staff very helpful and caring Great for either business or pleasure

It ticked all the boxes for a business trip. Good location, older decor but well presented and clean. Professional staff and helpful management. The wi-fi was not up to standard and although that doesn't make much difference to me, I would imagine I am in the minority on that one

I can't say enough good things about the terrific San Carlos Hotel! My recent stay there was the single most enjoyable time that I've had in NY, since the Waldorf Towers closed. Not a single detail was overlooked. Every aspect of my stay was handled in an excellent manner and the staff was welcoming, personable and totally professional. I am very much looking forward to my next visit and highly recommend it to anyone visiting NY!

Well located and friendly staff. Good location for business trip and for getting around New York. Plenty others and decent restaurant's in the local area. Always a friendly reception from all of the staff.

excellent. Location, service, attitude,feels like home,close to a good breakfast place, close to a cros taown bus stop, what more could I say, that sums it up. prfeearably take a larger room.. Go for it.

Central location, plenty of nearby coffee shops and restaurants, five minutes walk to the subway, friendly and helpful staff, both in the front desk and the housekeeping. On the other hand the room price was very high. This is why I rated it "very good" and not "excellent". Probably the reason for this was because it was the time of the UN general assembly. If you want to save money never stay in NYC during this week.

Family environment , the many years staying at San Carlos the staff has not changed . The reason why is they are all wonderful I do not hesitate recommending to all. Ideal location super service. I could not think of a reason not too

We (2 adults and 2 teenagers) just spent a lovely 4 day vacation in NYC. This hotel was the anchor for our fun and it did not disappoint. If we are able to return to the city, I would certainly stay here again. The pros were the location, the staff, the cleanliness, and the queen size beds in the cozy room. Also, the business center had couches and chairs that was a nice place to relax, as well as a small fitness center. The only con was that the room had a few cosmetic issues, i.e. some peeling wall paper and paint, but overall it was cozy, comfortable and clean. The staff couldn't have been nicer and the location was wonderful--we walked almost everywhere. We took the subway once and an Uber twice (due to weather and time constraints). It was surprisingly quiet too. No complaints from our foursome.We had nice breakfasts at New York Luncheonette, Ess-a-bagel (have to get there early to avoid impossible lines), and Carol's Cafe (one man operation serving from a window adjacent to the park) in Greenacre Park (a pocket park a block and a half away). I highly recommend enjoying coffee (even if it is from McDonald's) in the Greenacre pocket park--it is lovely.

This was a great hotel. The staff were friendly and ready to help. The rate was reasonable. Beds were comfortable and the room was well equipped with utensils and plates and other kitchenette items. Hotel is near many great places but also sits on a quiet street. Good local restaurants near by. I look forward to returning.

The room was a good size. The employees are super friendly. Calm, quiet and clean. After a busy day running around NYC, coming back to the hotel is a treat. There is a decent gym and a variety of restaurants very near by - one adjacent.

Nice clean hotel fairly central just felt it lack facilities could see an onsite restaurant somewhere to have a coffee other than in room. Staff friendly towels changed daily no probs there. New York is amazing so many places and not enough time. Couldn’t fault anything about New York used subway to get around. Visited all the main tourist places no queues so good time to visit. Can’t wait to go back

I cannot say enough about San Carlos hotel and the staff. From the friendly, helpful voice on the other end of the phone answering questions prior to the stay to the face to face conversations upon arrival, it could not have been any better! Accommodations were better than expected and the hotel's location is convenient - out of the way just a bit - but still within walking distance.

Ventured to NYC for a girls trip the first weekend in October. This was my very first time to NYC and this hotel did not disappoint! Very clean and spacious room, comfy beds....5 ladies were in this suite and we had plenty of room to move about, relax and get ready! The hotel staff were exceptionally nice, friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay at San Carlos again! Thanks for making my first trip to the Big Apple a success!

Excellent stay! We booked an Elite One Bedroom Suite with 2 queen beds plus sofa bed. Not only was our room was really nice, clean, and comfortable, it was very spacious to accommodate 5 ladies. The staff too, were exceptional! They were very friendly, knowledgeable and happy to accommodate any request we made. I would very much recommend a stay at the San Carlos Hotel.

The hotel is located very close to midtown and to local public transportation.The suite was very comfortable for thw hole family, well equiped, excellent beds, and very clean.Very quick room service.Highly recommended.

Excellent hotel, fantastic position, just 15 minutes walking to Times Square, very kind staff, metro stop very close. This hotel is confortable and you can reach easily in few minutes a lot of attraction (rockfeller center, 5th avenure, times square, empire state building...). I really recommend it.

If you are staying in midtown Manhattan, this is a great option - a small, older boutique hotel, but with larger than usual rooms for NYC. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom had all Aveda products. Our room was in the back and was extremely, and unexpectedly, quiet! It was priced well, and we will stay there again!

Family vacation and first time NYC for kids. Roomy enough and small kitchenette perfect for having light breakfast. (Microwave, fridge, dishes, flatware, coffee pot) Friendly staff. Decent rate. Great vacation !

Friendly and capable staff. Clean and comfortable rooms. Centrally located. As a family of five we had the Elite Suite. It was reasonably priced compared to similar hotels on the area. The rooms were well proportioned and catered for our needs. The area had what we needed in terms of restaurants.

This is a great hotel and I love the location - close to park ave, 5th ave, Rockefeller center areas. My family of 4 stayed in the room with a queen bed and sofa bed. Room is very large and also includes a small kitchenette with a sink, microwave, small fridge, and small countertop. Parking was validated at a garage around the corner, so I believe it was half price per day. Staff was friendly and accommodating. Would definitely stay here again!

Excellent hotel.Very comfortable hotel.Hotel is located in a quiet neighborhood close to everywhere in New York.Comfortable suites give you the size of guests.Convenient place to meet customers and suppliers.Recommended throughout.

the pros : very calm, nice beds, big rooms. useful kitchenette, nice location, discret staffthe cons : a little old even though everything works fine, and the rest is quite common in NYC for most hotels = poor breakfast (we went ouside) and the infamous "facility fees" are a bad surprise when you check out (they are not mentionned on the reservation but charged when it's too late to discuss it...)

Very spacious and quiet rooms by Manhattan standard, excellent cleanliness, comfortable bed. Large and very clean bathroom with courtesy products. Very useful the kitchenette and the fridge. Very quiet common spaces, elevators always free. Great location, within minutes walk to major attractions in midtown. In two minutes on foot take the metro.

It was our first experience at San Carlos Hotel and we did not regret! close to everything but far from noise and disaster.. we went to two concerts in MSG and a Yankes Game . We would choose it again

Superb amazing hotelI have stayed here several times and each and every time I am amazed at how perfect it is!The staff makes you feel like nothing is too much to do for the guests comfort.They cater to your every need It feels like coming home Just so amazing well run friendly clean and perfectWe stay here often and are thrilled every time!!!

We decided to stay an extra night in NYC but our hotel couldn't accommodate us. We found availability at San Carlos. The staff upon arrival was wonderful - getting us into our room early and even upgrading us to a king bed. I love the smaller, boutique feel to the hotel. Very large rooms.

The Location and helpfulness of the staff is consistently spectacular.We try and make it in for four weekends a year.The room was a Suite which was beautiful and ready when we returned from the day's activities.

We stayed at the San Carlos hotel during fan week of the US open last month. We enjoyed everything about our visit. The location was perfect and within walking distance of most attractions and restaurants in Manhattan. The staff was wonderful and attentive. . We will definitely be back.

We had a wonderful experience during our stay at the San Carlos. When we arrived, we were met at the curb by the bell hop who quickly whisked our luggage to the lobby. At the front desk, we were greeted by the front desk manager, who answered questions and made recommendation of where to dine and other topics. We stayed in a spacious suite. All of the staff was courteous and always willing to help. Highly recommend this hotel.

Great hotel in midtown manhattan great central location , very clean spacious rooms , restaurant attached , good facilities , NY Lunchanette across rd , small kitchen ie coffee maker and fridge.Party of 5 , would recommend

The room was average size but for New York is considered a good size. It was an average hotel room with no stand out feature except enough space for our family of 4 adults in the 2 queen beds size room. The hotel was very clean and well cared for.Did not find the hotel noisy at all. And staff were helpful when asked but nothing out of their way or extra ordinary.Location was great and walking distance from many tourist attractions and the subway line which got you easily throughout the city.Business centre provided a nice space to check in with computers as we hadn't bought ours with us. Also agree not sure what the extra facility fee paid for as most hotels provide these services for free and there was nothing extra or new than a regular hotel.Twice re: location we had a nice suprise - once when found out on Saturday, Park Ave. was closed for an annual summer event. On Sunday, Lexington was closed for a nice market.There were some nice restaurants right around the hotel for breakfast and dinner.

No problems. Room was as represented, typically small as are most in New York, well located, near a subway, clean rooms and and pleasant staff. We would stay here again, if the price is right. We booked through Trip Advisor, and no problems.

Our stay at this hotel was fantastic From the minute we walked in to the time we walked out we were greeted with smiles. Evelyn was our first point of contact and she was so understanding. Our first room smelled of chlorine and my son suffers from bad allergies so it went straight to his noise - but once we shared our concerns Evelyn made sure we were comfortable in our new room. Beds were comfy - robes were luxurious, bathrooms spacious. Nice and quiet inside and great coffee in the rooms. Great location - not too close to Times Square where all the lights and noise are but close enough to walk anywhere. Anytime we had a question front of the house was very helpful. I have already recommended this hotel to a couple people. Thanks for making our stay so enjoyable. Cheers~

This hotel has such wonderful reviews, I guess our expectations were high. We stayed for two nights in a Jr. King Suite and the room was an amazing size for NYC, one of the largest we've stayed in. Definitely room to spread out for families. Loved the kitchenette with the small refrigerator that actually had a mini freezer. Aveda bathroom tolietries were a plus. Didn't have much interaction with the staff but they all seemed friendly enough. Now for the mixed feelings.... The rooms seemed a little dated - was a bit surprised with all the stains from the carpet to the pillows, etc... it's not that it didn't feel clean, just a major turn-off. There wasn't any sound-proofing with the hallway door. You could hear everything going on in the halls, including the guy who was walking his crying baby up and down the hallway for 30 mins. Also when you walked down the hall to the elevators, you could hear everything going on in the rooms from conversations to showers, etc... not that we were listening, just how thin the doors were! There were people slamming doors behind us on the first night (seemed like ALL night) and the wall between us would actually shake. The hairdryer in the bathroom was terrible and definitely needs to be updated. No reading lights provided by the beds. The pull-out sofa bed was not comfortable (as expected) and they only provided one extra pillow and a hotel grade blanket in the closet - we had to call for more pillows. No ice machine, was told that ice was by request only. We had to call once again for ice....see where this is going? I guess though the biggest kicker was the additional fees - $30 facility fees per night (even though we knew about this upfront.) Also, if you wanted a roll-a-way it was an extra $30 per night. I know that there are many hotels that are charging these fees but there are still many that are not. As much as we loved the large room, we would probably stay at a place where everything was included in the cost of the room. In addition be aware that there is construction going on next door - we were on the farther side of the building but could definitely hear it in the morning.

Our room was very nice and was as pictured on their website. The service was wonderful, the staff was extremely polite and helpful. I would definitely stay at the San Carlos again and recommend it to friends!

Why do I love this hotel? Oh, where to start? The reservation agents are so very helpful, bell services attendants are professional and personable as well as the front desk staff. Every person who works at the hotel whom I encountered, from the housekeeping staff to the maintenance personnel, where warm and friendly. The rooms are HUGE in comparison to many NYC hotel rooms. The hotel is clean and spotless. The location, for myself, was perfect as I was here for both work and play. There are numerous restaurants near the hotel as well as subway stations. This is my second time staying here, last year was the first, and as I was checking out this morning I booked my stay for next summer’s vacation. It is an amazing hotel!

The San Carlos Hotel is an outstanding value in mid-town Manhattan. It has offered me and my family a place to stay which is within easy walking distance of the shopping we want. The nearby restaurants offer the variety in cuisine and cost which we enjoy. And it has little extras which I do not find in many main stream hotels such as a newspaper delivered to the room each morning.I think the hotel is terrific.

We loved these apartments. Had a one bedroom premium suite. Requested an extra half bathroom which is in the lounge area and we were accommodated. On arrival discovered the kitchen area had coffee maker, fridge and microwave but no toaster or kettle, could use coffee maker maybe for water for tea but I had a travel kettle which is handier. Asked reception the following morning for a toaster and this was delivered the same afternoon. My daughter was also given balloons and wine on the day of her birthday. We can obviously say from all the above the service and helpfulness of the staff is outstanding. My personal opinion is that the decor is not very modern but more traditional, I thought it was lovely though and it was spotlessly clean and kept that way for the duration of our stay. Large apartments with excellent air conditioning, it was a little noisy but did not disturb us. We were on the 7th floor, there was outside noise, but this is to be expected in central New York. The apartment we had was quite dark even although we were lucky to have a street view. This is due to the closeness and height of the opposite buildings. There is also major renovation happening at the hotel next door which is very noisy during the day, but again, this did not affect us during our stay.The location is excellent, subway 2 minutes walk away. 5th Avenue 15 mins walk, a little further to central park. Supermarket 5 minutes away and lots of restaurants and cafes on the doorstep. I would not hesitate to recommend this property to my family and friends, we had an excellent stay, and I would most certainly return should I visit New York again.

We had a wonderful stay at San Carlos Hotel. Dates 7/25-7/28. Husband, wife and 3 kids ages 13, 11, and 8. We had a 1 bedroom King suite. This is how we normally do hotels for our family. Would have preferred a suite with 2 queens, but none available. So we brought our twin air mattress for one of the kids. This suite was so big, the bedroom was spacious with its own full bathroom and closet. The living room had plenty of room it included a pull out couch and we had plenty of space for our air mattress. There was a desk, a dining table, sink, refrigerator and plates, cups silverware... which we actually used occasionally and the main room also included a half bath as well. The room was super clean, we were on the 12th floor had good views, ac worked great. Two flat screens. We loved it. The staff at the hotel were super friendly and helpful. My daughter was unfortunately sick on arrival... not a great way to start out first NYC trip. The woman at the front desk was so kind, gave me info to the nearest Urgentcare and pharmacy.The location was perfect. We walked to most things, Empire State Building, Central Park, Grand Central Station, Time Square, ChinaTown, Little Italy, Rockefeller Plaza, midtown. Subway station is very close, but we only used it to go to Battery Park to take the Staten Island Ferry ride and see Statue of Liberty. We walked back from Battery park, so we could see all the sites on the way... China Town Little Italy, Union Square, Grand Central Station.... it was a long walk though.I will definitely stay here again!

Staff was friendly and helpful! Location was great! We were able to walk to most of the areas that we wanted to visit. Trains were nearby and easily accessible. The area had great restaurants nearby. We totally enjoyed our experience in New York City, midtown Manhattan .

This hotel has become a go to for my family. Rooms are clean and decorated tastefully. The staff is really nice and accommodating. They go out of their way to be helpful. It is in a location that feels like a neighborhood with parking and plenty of restaurants nearby. We will be back. Nice value!

I have been to NYC twice now and both times I was there the week of June 10th-14th and had great weather. Be sure and check out Bryant Park in the early evening. It's a beautiful green space about 8 blocks away in the middle of all of the skyscrapers. We were there on vacation but if you are traveling on business the San Carlos has a large very nice balcony type business center on the 2nd floor.

We stayed for 3 nights in late June. The midtown location is good and the room was comfortable. I would give the hotel a higher rating if the $34 per night facility fee had not been added to the bill. I'd booked through the front desk and was quoted a 3-night rate that did not include this fee.

We got great tips to eat, rooftop places to have cocktails, very friendly staff, down to earth. We gave feedback to the staff at the front desk to show we were happy with choices and to tell them what we discovered. We were scheduled for an overnight-er but my friends stayed longer they had such a nice experience and will be recommending to relatives and friends coming in and out of New York from Ireland.

The San Carlos is a fine old property in very good shape, with a wonderful staff. We had an executive suite, with a separate bedroom on a high floor. Considering the price and amenities, it is clearly a great value.

(couple with two son's and) stayed in San Carlos Hotel for 9 nights. Excellent holidays in the middle of manhattan. We special appreciated the excellent (localization and near two subway station !) & service and good installations.
5 of us staying in a very spacious room whilst visiting the city.We enjoyed our stay and would go back.Recommended.A special thank you to Bobby the concierge, who could not do enough to be helpful.

San Carlos was perfect hotel for first girls' trip to NYC. Rooms are spacious, beds comfortable, and queen-size sleep sofa beds allowed 4 of us to share 2 rooms without feeling the least bit cramped. Rooms are appointed with fully stocked kitchenettes and coffee supplies. We called ahead for early check-in and were thrilled that our rooms were actually ready. Staff could not have been more cordial and accommodating. Hotel is centrally located for easy access to Broadway, American Ballet Theater, Penn Station and more. Excellent value for the price! San Carlos is our "go to" NYC hotel for future trips.

This hotel is in an excellent location and a great price. One of the few midtown hotels with 2 queen beds and a nice size room. They also have a small refrigerator & microwave as well. The service was wonderful as well.

Great location, but rooms are very dated and in need of remodel for this price range. Nice size rooms, but furniture and fixtures very old. Staff was very helpful & pleasant. Facilities like business center and fitness area are not up-to-date. Resort Fee add-on not justified. Restaurant in hotel no longer serves breakfast, now dinner-only and not impressive. Could be a real gem after an update.

Only a short Yellow Cab ride from Penn Station and close to Empire State ! Lovely Hotel and very well appointed. Everything all as it should be and Fantastic Rooms which were spotless. Andy the Concierge is the man in the know and kindly arranged a Limo back to JFK for us (only an extra $19). Great Location and recommended Cheers Guys :-)

Superb hotel - very comfortable, everything works, good location, fast elevators - a real gem! big enough to have all the necessary things in good working order but small enough to give a feeling cozy warmth. Most importantly the staff are so warm and caring, and they make all the difference between just a hotel and the feeling of coming home - great place and great people - I highly recommend it.

Extremely pleased with our one night stay this past weekend. Terrific staff, everyone very nice helpful. Room was perfect, clean. Location couldn't be better, easy walk to subway, Grand Central, Times Square, Central Park and to east side restaurants. Will definitely stay again on future NYC trips

A great base for visiting NY city. Highly recommend We stayed for a week.Friendly and helpful staff.Spacious clean rooms with comfortable beds.Superb location on the east side.Just off Lexington Ave and close to subway - a stop on literally on the corner.WiFi included

Our family of six knee nothing of the New York area and the staff went out of their way to make us feel comfortable and guide us to all of our destinations! Loved the area and the beautiful, spacious room. Would definitely return!

Fantastic service, great location and very comfortable beds! Two of my friends and I came for the weekend to celebrate my birthday, and the San Carlos was perfect! The hotel staff even sent up a balloon bouquet and candy for my birthday.

This was our first trip to NYC. This hotel was in the perfect location. Our room was beautiful, clean, and extremely quiet (9th floor). The front desk and lobby staff were so very kind and extremely helpful. Things we were fretting about, they were like, no problem, whatever you need. It is walking distance to some great food places - Wollensky's Grill, New York Luncheonette, Godiva Café, etc. Also, it had the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in at a hotel. Newspaper at your door every morning. Room has small kitchenette with refrigerator, microwave, and coffee pot.

I am not a regular customer, but this was my third time at Hotel San Carlos, since 1978. It is very well located, with nice rooms and kind staff. On arrival, we got an upgrade to a junior suite and we thank very much Quron Oliver from reception for this kindness. The suite is very well arranged if you want to have some quick meals at the hotel. Nearby, you will find supermarkets, nice restaurants (Toscana 43 on 49th street) and even two jazz clubs (we went to Bonafide on 52nd street). My only suggestion to improve would be to change the coffee machines to Nespresso. I certainly recommend and will return to San Carlos next time in NYC.

Spacious, silent and clean rooms, great location, fast elevators, friendly people, fast wi-fi. Hotel's restaurant, Spice Symphony, is an Indu-Chinese restaurant, which may be not the first option for dinning at the room after a day of museums and shopping.Breakfast included was a plus but they don't offer it anymore. They recommend the cafe across the street, which is ok but may be crowded with guests of the hotel. You can have a cup of coffee prepared at your room though. Early check-in and late check-outs used to be complimentary if you needed just 1 or 2 extra hours. Now they charge US$ 50 each. There's a construction next to the hotel but this wasn't a problem during my stay. It's my fourth time at San Carlos and I would come back for sure.
user_name:
Ana P
Rio de Janeiro, RJ

review_body: the hotel is in a perfect location. we had a beautiful family room that could accomodate all the six of us with no problem. the staff was efficient and really friendly. there is a comfortable reading room with computers and printers. great diner for breakfast just across the street

We arrived at the San Carlos hotel with our two small children after a hectic day of travel. The staff was so welcoming and helpful the moment we walked in the door. They treated us like we were one of their most valuable customers, even though it was our first stay with them. Fabio at the front desk was more than amazing! We are grateful for having the clean, updated, & comfortable room in addition to an inviting, quiet environment in the city. Would highly recommend this hotel!

I stayed with my family. The staffs are friendly and accommodation is fine. It is also a good value hotel.The sight seeing spots are such as the Broad way is near. If I will go once again to NYC, I will choose this hotel once again.

Overall the best hotel to stay at in New York. Will always return. The people are amazing and very willing to help when necessary. Located within walking distance of Rockefeller center and Broadway. Perfect spot.

First time family visit to New York and having looked at other options decided on the San Carlos as reviews were very good, the reviews were right, excellent hotel in a fantastic location we walked nearly everywhere, rooms clean if a little dated and excellent friendly staff. The only reason this is not five star reviews is lack of breakfast or bar in the hotel, we would have no hesitation staying here again.

Very good experience. I enjoyed the warmth of the personnel the quality of the infrastructure. Location of the hotel is unbeatable. Prices are reasonable. It would be great if they offered breakfast services, although across the street there is a luncheonette place very recommendable.

Buy the one-week subway card that allows you unlimited trips including buses as well. Best breakfast near the hotel? Kayser at Lex btween 51 and 52. Restaurants? A few blocks from the hotel on Third and Second Avenues. Best burgers? PJ Clarke's at Third and 55th.

friendly staff, comfortable quiet room nicely appointed. convenient to subway and the neighborhood has many fine restaurants and shops. Our favorite Restaurant and bar was around the corner on 3rd avenue and 49th st. Smith & Wollensky

We loved this hotel! So much space for a NYC hotel. We stayed in the Elite one bedroom 2 queen suite with our family of 5 (including 2 teens). The staff was great and always helpful in giving suggestions on where to eat, things to do, and how to get there. They welcomed us back each day/evening. It truly felt like we were their house guests and was a home away from home! Don't miss Spice Symphony (Indian restaurant next door). I'd never had Indian cuisine, but loved it! Very nice location in NYC with so much to do within walking distance and close to Grand Central Station/subway. We pre-ordered some groceries from Shipt (Target) with great prices and was nice to have the Kitchenette to keep everything. Grocery store nearby too which we used to get a few things also. We would definitely stay at San Carlos Hotel again!

Have stayed her many times over the last ten years. The hotel location in midtown is excellent. The hotel rooms are spacious with fine beds and very comfortable furniture., the hotel staff are extremely helpful and friendly. The hotel is great value for the money in Manhattan.

My husband, adult son, and I had a comfortable stay in this nice hotel. Upon arrival, the staff was friendly and they were helpful too. The hotel is quiet and clean. We felt safe walking out at night which is a plus. There are several coffee shops close by on Lexington as well as 2 train stations. We are happy with our hotel choice and reccomend it to all.

i would rate the San Carlos Hotel as a good 3 star hotel or a very low 4 star. No food services. Not even coffee or tea available atin the morning, but there is a diner across the street. Really hotel in need of an updating, but it was kept clean!

We opted for the suite. It was very spacious, and we were able to stretch out and relax - a luxury in NYC. And Thank You, San Carlos, for always making umbrellas available during rain showers. You obviously care about every individual guest.

Very good location for going to theaters. Enjoyed sharing the suite with my nephew. Spacious rooms. Quiet. Staff was helpful getting us a cab, and suggestions for dining nearby. Subway nearby.Would return here with family.

I stayed in a 1 bedroo suite. Very spacious. The bed was super comfy. Not to firm, which I run across allot . Excellent water pressure in shower too. There were tvs in both rooms, with a good selection of channels. Kitchenette was a perk too. I only had 3 minor drawbacks, 1 there's no ice machine, so you have to call the front desk if you want ice. 2, if you pay for late checkout, they still lock you out with everyone else, and you have to get new keys. 3 the maid service doesnt pay attention to the do not disturb signs. We had ours out and the still came in and made veds and took it off our door. I just don't like people coming in and rifling through our stuff when we are not there. (They even folded my friends pjs). Of those minor things don't bug you, it's a great place to stay.

Room was large 2 queen beds and very very quiet, no street noise. I most appreciated being allowed to get in our room before check in as I arrived very early AM. Comfy beds, excellent STAFF, excellent location and we consider this hotel our go to when traveling to the city. Barbara and Susan Nicholson

Large comfortable room. Great central location for sightseeing. Friendly, helpful staff. Good value for New York but 3 star by European standards and value for money. No bar or restaurant. Plenty Restaurants, bars and diners nearby.

Excellent hotel in a very good location, walking distance to grand central station, time square, central park; our room was modern, large enough and very clean, this all we needed for a few days vacation.

Amazing spacious room!! Would definitely go back! Clean. Fast and friendly service! Conveniently located to many subways. Easy walk to many stores and restaurants. Love it! Will def return. Bell men are super super friendly! Hopefully return real soon!

This was a wonderful stay, in a perfect location. The room was very comfortable, spacious, and perfectly equipped. The staff were very friendly and helpful. I would definitely recommend to friend or colleague!

We just stayed at the San Carlos for 4 nights and we were so wonderfully pleased with the hotel. We stayed in a king suite room. The room was so spacious and comfortable. The staff were always so accommodating and helpful. Andy the doorman has so much knowledge of the city so if you are looking for places to see and go ask him. Hotel is in a great location. Subway is close by or a 5-10 minute walk away from so many wonderful things. This will definitely be our New York City hotel.

We had a 2 queen-bed room, which was a nice large size, and provided plenty of in-room amenities. There was a Fridge, Coffee maker (which will also make hot water if you don't put any coffee in), a microwave, hairdryer, and some other things. The room was spacious, and the beds fairly comfortable.The staff were all very friendly, and helpful, and helped us with anything we asked.The location is great, with plenty of convenient stores nearby, such as Starbucks, and small grocery stores. It is fairly central and within walking distance of most of the main midtown attractions.It is quite an old, short building, so the views from the windows would most likely not be fantastic, however, some of the rooms such as the one we were in don't have a view at all. They look out the back of the Hotel into a dark square filled with air conditioning vents for all the surrounding buildings. This is probably the worst hotel view I have ever had, however, it is to be expected in a small building in New York, as they have to make use of the rear space, and it is surrounded on at least 2 sides by other buildings and courtyards.

My 7 year old son and I were planning on Marching in the NYC St. Patrick's Day parade. I decided to book the San Carlos, due to it's location and rave reviews. We were only coming in from Queens for the night and wanted to extend our time in the city a wee bit more. So we booked the San Carlos and so glad we did! We got to the city early and were planning to check our bags before we lined up to March, but once we got there, the front desk did some checking and discovered they could actually get us checked into the hotel at that moment for there was a room that was ready. We were delighted! We were able to relax in our very spacious room, refresh and head out to line up for the parade. After the parade we enjoyed our friends company in the executive junior suite. The suite was spacious, the beds comfortable and the bathrobes cozy. This location is prime! We will 100% recommend the San Carlos hotel to anyone heading to NYC!

As it’s already been almost the 20th time staying at the San Carlos in the past 9 years, we can clearly call this amazing hotel home.Every time we come we are pleased to meet the amazing crew at the hotel, especially Andy,Quron, Michael,Elghis and the manager Evelyn who give us a feeling of a true home.The rooms are big, comfy, clean and great for families and couples.The hotel is situated on 2 subway stations, so transport to the rest of the city is pretty easy.In addition to that, the location of the hotel is subpar!We would like to thank the whole crew again for letting us feel like we stayed at home.Highly,highly recommended!!!!!

A great find and ideal for mid-town and attractions such as Top of the Rock, Times Square & Central Park.We had a big room for a family of four - hotel very clean with helpful & friendly staff. Fridge, microwave & coffee making facilities also provided.Thanks to the gentleman who checked us out on Thursday April 18th 2019 - very much appreciated.A breakfast diner immediately outside.I’ve no doubts I’ll travel to NYC again and the San Carlos will be my first search.Thanks for helping us enjoy our stay in The Big Apple.Hotel San Carlos gets top marks from me & my family.

very attentive staff, super location at a reasonable price for Manhattan, very clean. I would highly recommend this property for business or pleasure. The only thing missing was an in house restaurant for break feast, but many others were within walking distance.

We booked a larger room which had 2 queen size beds and a sofa bed plus a small kitchen. This worked really well as our kids are 21 and 19. The hotel is ideally situated in the middle of Manhattan just a few minutes from 5th Avenue. The positive is how quiet it is at night. We were on the 11th floor and were able to sleep which is so important when dealing with jet lag and the distance that you walk in NY.A great hotel, great friendly staff, very well maintained and clean. Absolutely would stay here again when we visit NY.

Thank you San Carlos for a comfortable stay in NY. Travelling as a family of five it is often difficult to find suitable accommodation. SAN Carlos was very comfortable with plenty of space for our family. The staff were extremely friendly and attended to our every need. Location was good with a short easy walk to Time Square. I would definitely recommend this hotel especially if you are travelling as a family.

Fantastic place to stay. Staff are brilliant. Nothing is do much. Room spotless even if ageing but no issue. Shame no complimentary breakfast now but no big deal. Great diners local. Subway 6 feet away and if Times Sq is your thing 15 mins walk and same for Central Park.

Great place to stay in NYC! We spent one night at the San Carlos and enjoyed very minute. Our room was a junior suite- it was immaculately clean, well appointed and nicely decorated. The staff take a lot of pride in the hotel and the owner is on site and often greets guests. The front desk staff are excellent - offering guidance and advice and really go the extra mile to make everyone feel welcome.
user_name:
andrew G
New York City, New York

review_body: We need big enough beds and preferably some space for four of us. A double or full size bed is too small, and it was hard to find available 2 Queen rooms. The San Carlos had the best of all worlds: one bedroom King suites with queen size sofa sleeper. Plenty of bed space, a door separating the kids, and a small eating area with sink/microwave/table/chairs. Room rate was super reasonable considering how big the room was.  Added bonus: extra half bathroom. Excellent location: It's a short walk to Rockefeller Center and there are two nearby subway entrances. Front desk was friendly and accommodating. I had a package delivered there and the front desk agent flagged me down as soon as he saw me to tell me that it had arrived.Only two criticisms: (1) the main bathroom desperately needs more towel bars - there was only in the bathtub/shower area; and (2) housekeeping was inconsistent about replenishing shampoo/conditioner/soap.

Friendly, customer-focused service. Conveniently located with intimate, boutique quality. This is my first time staying at the San Carlos. I was very pleased with the experience and would definitely select this hotel again - wonderful experience.

Stayed here for a week at the beginning of April and what a great location and hotel. The staff are friendly and of course knowledgeable about places to eat and visit. The rooms I believe are a little bigger than some in New York, we had 2 Queen sized beds, microwave, fridge (which was very handy) and a coffee maker and still plenty of room to walk round. The rooms are very clean and comfortable beds. Our room was on the side of the building, not a great view but that didn't bother us because it meant the room was quiet form street traffic noise. A supermarket round the corner, places to eat nearby and 20 minute walking distance to Broadway, times square etc. New York lunchoenette across the street is a fab place for breakfast. A gem of a place well worth another visit. Thank you San Carlos for a great stay.

Traveled to New York City with cousins for a 4 day trip. Had to find somewhere affordable with rooms not your normal New York size as women carry way to much stuff. Hit the jackpot with the San Carlos. The room was a great size with 2 queen beds which were super comfy. We were at the backside of the hotel which was the best location making it quiet and could sleep peacefully. The rooms were extremely clean, and the staff helpful and friendly. The location was perfect. Literally walking distance to everything regardless of direction we were headed. Would definitely stay again and look forward to the stay.

We are return guests - will not consider alternatives.Wonderful to be able to return to our usual front view room for a rest and relaxation Room has a fridge and a MW and one can enjoy NY delicacies with a glass of wine

Great location to everything. 15 to 20 min walk to Time Square. 10 min run to Central Park. Staff very attentive. Bell service amazing. Around the corner from best bagel in the city. A must stay for families and couples. Rooms are very spacious.

We have stayed at the San Carlos twice. Once this summer with the entire family (5 of us) and then recently with just three of us. The hotel is great. The value is great for Manhattan. Rooms are clean, staff are super friendly and remember your name. On the latest visit we got off the Greyhound (part of the adventure) at 8 in the morning, got a ride to the hotel to drop our bags and were given a really early check-in! Can't be beat. There are plenty of restaurants in the area, and its a short walk to Times Square........

San Carlos is a wonderful hotel that exceeds your expectations. Staff is wonderful and location is a great plus as well!! Rooms are very clean and have plenty of space. We walked everywhere as well. We will definitely be back soon!

I have stayed at the San Carlos several times and it's perfect for me. It's not hip or stylish, but it is clean, comfortable, unexpectedly quiet (I don't even hear any street noise, which is amazing since the hotel right across the street is as loud as you'd expect a NYC hotel to be) and the rooms are huge. I love that their regular king room is furnished with a chair and ottoman, so I have someplace comfortable to relax that isn't the bed. There's basically nothing going on in the lobby, no bar or restaurant, no coffee in the morning, but that means there are no people hanging around either, which helps keep it all very peaceful and quiet. The decor is boring and bland, but I don't care. I always have a pleasant and comfortable stay there.

We've stayed here a couple of times. Located right in Midtown so you can't beat the location. Rooms are clean and up to date and most importantly quiet. Beds are comfortable and elevators are fast and reliable. Look, this isn't a boutique hotel, but between the friendly staff, reasonable prices and can't beat location, it's easy to keep coming back. I happen to like consistency. I'm giving a plug for Spice Symphony too -- the Indian restaurant next door -- it's amazing. Don't think you need to travel 30 blocks downtown to find that special place to eat (unless you want to) -- just go next door. Check it out.

Friendly and helpful staff, excellent service and room amenaties. High end boutique style in great location, Highly recommended for business or pleasure when visiting New York. Safe and quiet block amid the histle and bustle of Manhattan,

Loved the location, the friendly and attentive staff, the cleanliness and spaciousness of our room. Would highly recommend this hotel - especially for families needing a little extra room for a fun NYC trip.

The pictures don't do it justice. This hotel is clean and spacious in a great location. Last time we were here we stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn - the rooms at the San Carlo are twice as big. The hotel staff are friendly. There's a coffee shop and diner right across the street (2 min walk) and a great bagel place about a 5 min walk. We had one room with king bed and sofa sleeper and another room with 2 queen beds. Again, both rooms were very clean and very spacious and both rooms came with microwave, refrigerator and dishes and silverware. Also, the free wifi was a plus.We had a great time.

SAN Carlos is a fantastic hotel that met and exceeded all our expectations. The location is very convenient to attractions in NYC. The staff were very friendly and helpful and eager to give us tips on making our trip more enjoyable!!!

Love this hotel my family and I will try stay there every time we visit New York. Whenever my friends ask what hotel I stay at in Nyc I pull out the pictures and rave. Not a skyscraper hotel but would not stay anywhere else. Thank you

Charming, great, older hotel with character. Excellent service, front desk clerks were so helpful and nice.Great staff! Comfortable, clean - wonderful! We'll be back for sure. This is our new favorite in NYC. The location is very good too!

A great hotel. Big and comfortable rooms. A perfect location in midtown Manhattan. Staff is polite, efficient and helpful. I stayed in this hotel many times and always enjoyed a lot. Highly recommend.

Good in service attitude, good in help offering to clients. Cleaning is OK, furnature is basically OK.No breakfast offering.Gfdhjh hfhjgghj thuggish ghhhh Druid rtyyttgy thitghjh ghfhjfygj rugfhngfv .

It was an excelent choise for a family trip, we are 4 in my family, 2 kids my husband and I. The room was big, it has 2 bathroom.and a small kitchen with a table we used for breakfast and once for dinner when we were tired

Believe the good reviews! Took my friend here for a girls trip to celebrate her birthday and was not disappointed. Arrived early but was able to check in and get our room with no problem, and they stored our luggage for a few hrs after checkout, and later the kind attendant carried our bags outside and hailed a cab for us. Every staff member was super friendly and professional.Really big rooms, uncommon for NYC, clean with nice decor. Our room had a "kitchenette" (a small but fully stocked corner) w/ microwave, fridge, coffee maker, dishes, utensils. Quiet and comfortable beds made for restful night's sleep. 2nd floor lounge is a lovely, quiet spot with an ATM and vending machine with bottled water, sodas and snacks. Very convenient. Perfect location, close to great shopping (ladies, check out De Janeiro--cute clothing for cheap!) & plenty of dining options. Right across the street is the "Upstairs" rooftop lounge in the Kimberly Hotel w/ views of the Chrysler building and DJ/dancing (we went on a Saturday night and there was no cover charge). Check out Maison Kayser bakery for a delicious breakfast (best French toast I've ever eaten). And if you're a walker and the weather permits, it's actually walkable to Central Park and 5th Ave shopping, so save the cab fare!You will impress whomever you bring here. Highly recommend. We'll be back!
user_name:
chrissie202
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I am a long-term patron of the San Carlos. It is consistent, convenient, and affordable. I find the quality of service better than at other NY hotels where I have stayed. I stay there at least every month, and I recommend it to my colleagues and friends.

This was our second time to stay at The San Carlos Hotel. Last summer we enjoyed a suite with two queens and a pullout sofa bed which was perfect for a family of five. This time my daughter and I shared a room with two queen beds. Updated, comfortable and a great value. We’ll return!

Not a bad location situated between 3rd and Lexington on 50th. The rooms are clean and well appointed. The staff are very helpful. Free wifi throughout and a good business centre. And, yes, you can print our documents. No catering on site but plenty to choose from locally.

We loved the hotel, had a great dinner across the street at Empire. The next day we saw Maren Morris on the Plaza and met the Today show staff, even got selfies. What a great memory. We will be back for sure. Loved the staff!

The room was very spacious. The staff was attentive and the rates were not over priced. Best place to stay in Manhattan East. I always prefer staying at independent boutique hotels vs. brands and this is a place you should check out for your next trip.

I doubt you’d be able to find a larger hotel room in the heart of the city for this price. Stayed as a family of 5 and had plenty of room. A door divides the beds from a living area. Glad we stayed away from Times Square- too much hustle and bustle. This is right across the street from a subway station. About a 10-15 min walk to Times Square, Central Park, Rockefeller Center. Never an issue to walk. We took subway to Freedom Tower, 911 Museum. The maid service was great. Can’t beat having a fridge. Plenty of shops nearby to grab water and snacks. A perfect place to stay for a girls trip or a larger family.

I love the San Carlos. I have stayed at this Hotel for years and it is like coming home after an exhausting day of touring, shopping and enjoying New York! They are so welcoming and friendly-from the front desk to the maids! The rooms are large and comfortable.

We enjoyed our stay here and found an excellent rate (and have seen good rates posted often). We had a junior suite so the room was large but we cannot comment on the size of regular rooms. The sleeper sofa in the room and its size meant that it amply accommodated three people. Cleanliness and maintenance is at a four star level. The décor is high quality and in Art Deco style which will appeal to some. They provide bottled water and robes in the rooms, and umbrellas for guests in the lobby. The lobby itself is nothing special. The hotel is deep on the east side but near the 6 train so its easy to move up and down the island. Cross town is a bit more tricky. The gym is a good size and all four machines were working. Only true negative is that the walls are thin and we could hear the people next door. Although there are other four star hotels we would prefer, the frequent availability of good rates means it would be on our list of East side hotels we would consider. please check out our other 20+ NYC hotel reviews. All our NYC ratings are in the context of new york, and consider the prices and room size normal for new york city. Click helpful if I was please.

We just returned from our visit at San Carlos and were so impressed! The staff was WONDERFUL. I wish we got the name of the gentleman at the front desk that performed magic tricks for my kids, but it was one of the highlights of their trip! Everyone we encountered was pleasant and helpful. The room itself was very clean and spacious and the beds were extremely comfortable. The location was perfect for our family, with an easy walk to Rockerfellar Center and Times Square. We are a family of 6, so finding a room that can accommodate our entire family can be tough. I’m so happy we found San Carlos. We will definitely be back!

We had a great stay at the San Carloshotel. I was a little nervous travelling with three kids 5 and under but they were very welcoming and friendly. Gabriele even did magic tricks and gave my kids coloring books and crayons to entertain them while we waited for a ride, he was so sweet! We would definitely stay here again.

the san Carlos feels like home away from home...from the amazing staff to the comfortable rooms...always a pleasure....its nice to be greeted with a warm hello and goodbye...as soon as you walk into the room you can feel the coziness of the room

The San Carlos is a beautiful place to stay. The rooms are spacious and beautifully decorated. It is located in the heart of the city so close to everything you would need. The staff is accommodating and helpful.

The location of the San Carlos is excellent. It is within easy waling distance of shopping on 5th and Madison Avenues. There are many restaurants nearby which have food of a variety of cuisines and a range of prices. The hotel is within waling distance of Grand Central station for access to Metro North trains.

This hotel is clean, well maintained and professionally staffed. Good nearby restaurants. Lots of tour package guests. No bar scene. Comfortable place to sleep. There are better hotels in the area, but none at this hotel’s best price point. But you have to ask for a deal.

Conveniently located, comfortable, clean, impeccable service. Love the San Carlos and how the employees especially the doormen go above and beyond to make you feel like family and make every bit of your trip a memorable one.

This was our 5th visit to the San Carlos and it will not be our last.fantastic hotel great staff many of who we now class as friends. Bobby will go to any length to helpsee you soon and we can not wait to return..
