THe staff are friendly, helpful, and courteous. The room was clean, comfortable, and sufficiently spacious. THe hotel is very well-located in Manhattan. The charge for the room was reasonable. I can recommend the hotel.

We have been staying at the San Carlos for probably 9 years and have never been disappointed. You will see the same staff year after year which says a great deal about their management. The location is perfect and they always give great recommendations for restaurants

This hotel is in a quiet area near the bustle of all the happenings in NYC. It's clean and neat and nicely appointed. The staff are great. There is a wonderful café across the street and a grocery around the corner.

I stayed 3 nights for a business trip; This one deserved a 4 or even a 5 - Great location - mid town New York - Large room sizes- reasonable prices - on the 2nd floor there is a nice business area for use without charge, at least the open areas Negatives - no washroom in the lobby area, is a piss off. Have to keep going to the 2nd floor Removed breakfast - said it's been off for a year - negative surprise! Would stay here again for business or for any other reason that I have to be in Manhattan; taking care of the negatives would be helpful. -

Had three days for business and pleasure. I was able to walk to Rockefeller Center, Empire State Building, Macy’s, Grand Central Station, Radio City Music Hall, Time Square, Broadway, Sams, the Diamond district easily. Had great food also within walking distance. The hotel was decently clean, rooms were fine. No secure WiFi, no USB plugs in the rooms. Very friendly and helpful staff.

It was my first time in NY and it was my best friends birthday and not only did we have a blast overall, our hotel was fantastic! The staff were extremely nice and helpful. The bellman Elghis was able to recommend places for us to dine as well as helping us to navigate our way to some of the places we wanted to visit. The beds were so comfortable we ended up over sleeping after our first night and the housekeepers kept everything neat and tidy. I will definitely stay at the San Carlos again!

Stayed there for just one night. The staff were so friendly and helpful. They let me check in earlier and they went above and beyond to help me during my visit. When I asked where is ice machine they brought ice for me, changed towels after two times during one night stay. I really appreciate them. The only thing that could be better was the size of the room which is understandable for the location and price. All in all I recommend it.

My three girlfriends and I stayed four nights in a jr executive suite. For an NYC hotel we had plenty of room for four women! Two slept in the queens, one slept on the queen pullout and one in a very comfortable roll away. It was updated and clean and cozy. The staff couldn’t have been nicer and more accommodating. They got us in last minute on Valentine’s Day to the delicious steak house across the street. They recommended the east and yummy breakfast diner also across the street called the luncheonette. All was easy and comfortable. Thanks San Carlos!!

Leaving tommorow after another 3 night stay at San Carlos. Stayed here 3 years ago w/ the family and decided to stay here again as we received very frendly service a few years back. This trip...the same freindly service from every San Carlos employee. This is a must stay to any traveler or family looking to have a hotel that provides freindly service and makes you feel welcomed. The front desk folks are so nice. i'VE stayed at other NYC hotels before, but ever since I found this hotel..I will only stay here. CLEAN and Freindly!!!

We just spent our third visit to the San Carlos and we couldn't be happier. The rooms are large, clean, quiet and of good value. The last two times we stayed, the rooms had recently been renovated. The staff are so friendly and they now remember us each time we return. Bobby, the bellman helps us with everything from hailing us taxis to getting us ice after my son's surgeries. He couldn't be more friendly and helpful. The same goes for the front desk staff as well. We live out of the country and we always have things shipped to the hotel. As soon as they arrive, they deliver them to us and don't charge any fees like other NYC hotels. The office center has plenty of computers and printers and the gym has all that we need for a good workout. The Indian restaurant attached serves great food and we love the neighborhood, as it has good restaurants and shops and is centrally located for most of what we come to New York for. We highly recommend the San Carlos!

My family and I stayed at the San Carlos Hotel for two nights in December 2018, just after Christmas. This is our second time at the San Carlos Hotel after a great first stay two years ago. Overall this stay was fantastic. We were in a one bedroom suite, which was the perfect amount of space for my wife, me and our three young sons. The room has a main living area with a kitchenette and then a bedroom with two queen sized beds. Everything was clean, tidy, and well maintained. The hotel is well located in New York City. It is a short walk from Grand Central Station and in easy walking distance to all the major Mid-town attractions. The hotel is very family friendly with accommodating and friendly staff (even when my boys were having a few turns of the revolving door!). Overall, I would not hesitate in recommending this hotel and will be staying there again upon our next visit to New York City.

This is a beautiful hotel with a fabulous mid-town location! I went with my two adult daughters and my 16 month old granddaughter and the comfortable room was ample size for all of us - even with a crib. We traveled to NYC during December so the room was definitely on the pricey side, but we bit the bullet and were really glad we chose that location. We easily walked to Radio City Music Hall, Rockefeller Plaza and Central Park. The staff was friendly and helpful. The lobby was beautifully decorated and was very comfortable. Would definitely stay there again!

Stay at the queen suite. Can sleep up to 6 person. 15 minutes walk to times square, rockefeller centre, madison square garden, st patrick cathedral and grand central station. Great location in the mid town area and reasonable price for family rooms. Close to duane reid (convenience store). Definetely will come back to the hotel if we visit the big apple one day.

My family and I stayed at the San Carlos Hotel last summer (end of July) for 1 week. It was the best hotel stay we've ever experienced. The hotel staff was exceptionally accommodating and courteous. Room was great size. Location was perfect. Reasonably priced. No complaints!!

My son and I spent 7 days at the San Carlos Hotel in NY and had a great experience. Every employee at the hotel was exceptionally nice and went out of their way to make our stay 5 stars. Accommodations were super, very comfy beds and linens, microwave and larger-sized refridge/freezer with eating utensils and plates, etc. for those times that you did not feel like eating out. Very close to 2 subway entrances and a short walk to lots of fabulous sights and restaurants. Fitness room had all the items I needed for a quick workout as well. Would highly recommend.

We stayed here for a second year, this visit was even better than our Last. Everything is great about this Hotel, from its central Location, rooms , But the Staff are what make it special. Everyone we met during our stay was very friendly . We cant wait to get back next December for our next visit. Its a Home away from Home.

Great hotel on the Upper Easy Side, a block away from a subway stop with loads of bars and restaurants nearby. A bit pricey but it seems that NYC has become very expensive since I last visited 5 years ago. Having said that, you get what you pay for and this hotel was definitely worth it. We had a family suite which was perfect for the four of us, the room came with a fridge and cooker. Beds were very comfortable and there was next to no noise heard from the street below. There are no restaurants in the hotel but there’s an Indian right next door and so many options a short walk away.Great hotel, will definitely consider next time we’re here

My daughters and granddaughters and me stayed at the San Carlos in early December.We had two queen suite rooms, which were spacious and easily accommodated all 9 of us. The staff could not have been nicer. The rooms were very clean and the beds comfortable. AND, it was convenient to the subway station and and easy walk to Rockefeller Center. This was definitely "an upscale boutique hotel". Thank you San Carlos for making our stay so enjoyable!

We stayed at the San Carlos for three nights, leaving on New Year's eve. Such a beautiful hotel! It was in a great location- close enough to everything but out of the way of the heavy crowds. Our room was super clean, front desk staff were all friendly, and the restaurant Spice Symphony was delicious. Will absolutely stay here again!

Just stayed one night at San Carlos and have to say it was one of the nicest hotel experience we’ve had.The staff was pleasant and friendly, especially Gabriel- what an exceptional gentleman! We had a jr suite and the room was spacious, clean and comfortable.The location is ideal and we walked to Rockefeller center, Times Square etc.Will definitely be returning here.

I've been staying at the San Carlos for over ten years. Is my home-away-from-home in NYC. You won't find a friendlier front desk team, from Gabe, to Santos, to Koron, to Barrame, and Evelyn! Rooms are spacious and comfortable with great kitchenettes. Comforter top beds make for a great night's sleep. Essa Bagel and La Belleza pizza around the corner. Can't beat the location!

There is no better place to stay in Manhattan!!The staff is amazing. The accommodations are beyond expectations. Clean, spacious and comfortable. Thank you all @ San CarlosYou made our stay memorable. We will see you again soon.

Great location and spacious room. Very efficient and friendly check-in. Had to change rooms as soon as I arrived because the first room, although very clean, smelled of mildew and bleach. The front desk sent a bellman and quickly got me to a better room. Again, customer service was fantastic. The average rating is because the hotel rooms are dated - peeling wallpaper and both blankets in our room had permanent stains on them. Sheets and pillow cases were very clean and so was the bathroom. Housekeeping was wonderful. Rooms just need to be updated. Last note is that I could hear everything in the neighbors room - conversations, etc. We were so tired that it didn't keep me up, but you may want to consider this if you're a light sleeper.

The hotel is very nice, the employees were very friendly and the room was comfortable and spacious. The reason for 3 stars is because we checked in at 5 pm, got into the room and it was not made up. The bed wasn’t made (it still had the previous guests’ bedding) and the bathroom had dirty towels. When we called the front desk, the housekeepers came up promptly and made up the room, but apparently didn’t check the shower because we found the previous guests’ shampoo, razor and soap left in the shower. It was kind of an unfortunate start for our weekend, since we were paying $450/night plus.

We had a wonderful experience at this hotel. The whole staff was so welcoming and helpful. Nicolas was just the friendliest person.the cleaning ladies were also so nice. We got very personal attitude.the hotel is located wonderfully. Subway very close.the rooms are big,with little fridge,plates, silverware,coffe machine, which made a huge difference for us.great comfortable beds and pillows.can't wait to go back!

Right in the action of midtown. With character and great spacious rooms that are newly renovated. Decor very good. Clean. Good service. Lobby reasonable. Furniture appropriate. With a New York City character.

I was in NY for a week, for business, and wanted a hotel on the East side of midtown, that offered more than just a room!The San Carlos offered a suite with a living room, bedroom, kitchenette and 2 Closets!It was large, comfortable and had a big bathroom for NY standards!The bed was super comfortable. I have a hard time falling asleep when I am in new surroundings, but I slept as well as I sleep at home!!The staff was very friendly and helpful!The elevators were super fast; I never had to wait.The hotel is centrally located to everything.My only suggestion is that the hotel purchase new bath towels. They were a little rough.I would definitely stay at this hotel for my next business or personal trip.

Situated on Lexington and 50th the hotel is in an ideal position for most things in New York. The rooms are spacious and clean. The staff are charming and very helpful. The hotel does not have its own catering but that is never a problem in New York. Wi-fi is free and there is a good business centre on the 2nd floor.

I have stayed here three times now and have always been very satisfied. The rooms are large by NY standards. I appreciate the real dishes and glassware along with the microwave and fridge. The staff is very helpful and the drivers they arranged for to take me to the airport have been great. My only suggestions are to improve the WiFi (very slow), try some better quality toiletries, and add a choice of tea. Otherwise, I’m a very satisfied customer!

This hotel was excellent in every way possible, centrical, surrounded with a variety of places to eat enjoy the night. The staff was very courteous, friendly and resourceful. The elite room where we stayed was spacious and that’s hard to find in Manhattan. The beds were very comfortable my kids slept in the sofa bed and they said that it was comfortable too, all the amenities in the room were incredible even the WiFi. So without a doubt I would highly recommend this hotel

our reservation was made through a 3rd party site and there was some miscommunication ar check-in BUT Evelyn, bless her heart, did all possible to get that straightened out to our complete satisfaction. While waiting we were thoroughly entertained by Elgish (sorry if I mangled the spelling of his name. Very comfortable bedding, very attentive housekeeping, excellent location. Rebecca (housekeeping) approached us at check-out to thank us for staying there. I'm an octogenarian NYC junkie with hundreds of stays in NYC and from now on I'd stay no place else. Thanks to everyone (oops I forgot Andy) for the hospitality

This was our 4th visit and stay at the san Carlos and as ever it was a fantastic stay.We are booked to come out in December 2018 for our 5th stay.A little disappointed to see the breakfast has been discontinued.I have tried emailing hotel 4 times and a little disappointed i have not had one reply back.

This hotel is a gem and we will definitely stay there again on our visits to NYC. The entire staff was helpful and friendly. Customer service is certainly important to everyone at San Carlos. Great job and we will see you again soon!

Our room was on the 17th floor. The window was very small so it was dark and dreary especially in November. I asked for an upgrade upon checkin. We had an executive king booked and I was willing to pay for a room with two queens since there were four of us. I was told there weren’t any rooms available. When we unfolded the sofa it hadn’t been changed. I had to call housekeeping before we could go to bed The staff was friendly and helpful throughout our stay. The hotel is on a great location. At checkout I was told they had a larger room for us !!! This after we cramped for four nights at $300 a night. It made me sad.

This hotel is lovely. My group and I felt very much at home here. The rooms were spacious and comfortable, and the staff were very accommodating. The location was very convenient. I would stay here again happily.

I spent the weekend in the Rooftop Garden Suite at the San Carlos Hotel. It was a wonderful weekend. From the moment we entered the hotel until the time we checked out, the staff were friendly, helpful, and kind. The suite was spacious, beautifully decorated with charm. Everything truly seemed so well thought out. The living space was very comfortable during out down time between activities. The outdoor terrace is a lovely setting for a family gathering, and we are hoping to return in the warmer weather with our family. The hotel is situated in a location where it is easy to get around Manhattan. We walked everywhere. The front desk staff even made a wonderful suggestion for Saturday evening entertainment. We attended a show at the Bonafide Club nearby. I highly recommend the San Carlos Hotel to family and friends who will be visiting Manhattan. It will be my home away from home when visiting Manhattan.

The hotel is on 50th between 3rd and Lexington, a bit on the east side. Decently located for walking, probably a 20 minute walk to the Theater District. The 14th floor room was the elite with 2 queens, it was nice with a decent view, and was a spacious room for NYC. It was also quiet and good for sleeping. Only other thing to mention is that they don't have a breakfast in the hotel, but there is an Indian place next door that they list as having a brunch until 10am. We decided to walk down the block to the Morningstar Cafe and ate there instead.
user_name:
Rob H
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Well situated if coming into Grand Central Station. Easy walk or #6 train to 51st Street. Most impressed: room on 10th floor, not facing street-no street noise. A first for NYC. Very quiet. Rooms well equipped and decent sized for the city. Nice to have a refrigerator for use + microwave. Housekeeping timely and very friendly front desk and door men. Close to excellent restaurants: Spice Symphony right next door great Indian food. Short walk to Club A Steakhouse on 58th. Less than a mile to Times Square/theaters. Also note: beds firm, high quality sheets, average pillows.

I found the room and hotel nice,clean and fresh feeling.The staff was very personable and enjoyable. They aimed to please ! We all agreed we would like to return at a later date. Such a nice experience. We recommend it to my friends

I have stayed in all types of hotels from 5 star resorts to motel rooms. I am not sure I have ever had better overall value than the San Carlos hotel. NYC is an expensive place, so the rooms rates at this hotel reflect that. However, the staff was excellent. In particular the doormen were something I have not experienced before. I have not seen a dedicated staff to just open the door and ask if you need anything. These guys were helpful and entertaining and made us feel like VIPs. The location was perfect for the work I was doing in the city and walking distance to everything. (Times Square, Rockefeller Center, etc.) Plenty of dining options within walking distance as well and the 51st subway is 1 block away. The room was big for NYC standards. WIFI was good and beds were comfortable. I will stay here every time I come to NYC.

I have visited New York very many times on both business and pleasure and wish I’d come across the San Carlos Hotel before. Everything about it is top class - lovely lobby (beautifully decorated for Halloween during our visit in late October), really huge rooms for NYC, very nicely appointed rooms and public areas, very efficient and super-friendly staff. Can’t say much about the restaurant as we had breakfasts/brunches elsewhere; had a drink at the bar there one evening, which was fine. The restaurant serves Indian food, which looked/smelt good when we were at the bar, and did seem busy and lively whenever we looked through the window in the evenings. Location and surrounding amenities are GREAT. Subway is one block away (both uptown/downtown and also connection to crosstown E train), Grand Central a few blocks south, Times Square and Theatre District a few blocks west, both easy walking; lots of great bars and restaurants very nearby on Lexington and 3rd Avenues and the nearby streets, from the smart (Smith & Wollensky, Davios, The Smith, Lexington Brass, etc.) to the simple (don’t miss the New York Luncheonette diner right across the street, or Ess-a-Bagel nearby on 3rd Ave, one of the very best bagel shops in NYC). Overall, great place, couldn’t recommend it more highly.

Had a suite with kitchenette. Bed excellent; comfy room. Staff was absolutely over-the-top excellent, from Front Desk through Housekeeping. Great location--easy to get to various subway lines as well as Sak's and all 5th Avenue shops, churches, or good Irish bars on 3rd (and vicinity).
user_name:
Colleen B
Seattle, Washington, United States

review_body: We stayed at the hotel for 4 days and 3 nights! Room was cleaned daily and the cleaner was very friendly and greeted us everytime we saw her taking a genuine interest in our time spent. The hotel itself is on the East side (nicer) and was around a 10-15 minute walk away from Times Square and other tourists areas such as Central park. We travelled via subway which was really easy and the station was literally across the road on the corner. This train took us to Wall Street, Brooklyn Bridge and meeting point for the Statue of Liberty. It was 5 mins away from the Rocafeller centre and 5th Avenue also. Theres a steak house, indian and italian restaurants actoss the road and also somewhere to eat breakfast. The service at this hotel was excellent from the moment we arrived with Nicholas the bell boy being the first face we saw. Nothing was too much for the staff who were pleasant and happy to help wherever and whenever with restaurant recommendations and directions. I would definitely stay here again. Be aware however there is construction works happening next door to the hotel. We couldn’t hear any noise from it but the scaffolding was a bit of an eye sore HOWEVER I WILL NOT MArK THE HOTEL DOWN BECAUSE OF THIS as the hotel and its service was great.

Stayed with the whole family for 5 nights while we explored Manhattan. This hotel suited our needs perfectly. We had two rooms between the 5 of us, one of which was a suite with the living room area and the rooms were next door to each other so made it easy to pop into each others' rooms. The beds are so comfortable and its so nice to come back from a busy day exploring to a clean room and ready made bed for you to jump into. All the staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful with bags and recommendations etc. The location is also perfect as you are close to many attractions such as the Rockefeller Center, Grand Central, Times Sq etc and anything you're not close to, there is a subway station on Lexington. I did stay here before in 2014 and its nice to see that the standards haven't dropped and it is still a lovely hotel to stay at while in NYC. Although slightly pricey, your are centrally located and will receive a very high standard of service.

We frequent ny very often as our children and grandchildren live thereI have no words to describe the excellent service and accommodation at the San CarlosFrom the front desk to housekeeping to the bell service, everyone is professional friendly and top class.We come with our whole family which include 6 young grandchildren every few months, and the way they go above and beyond so effortlessly for us is amazing.I want to mention the front manager EvelynShe is always there to help with anything needed,I kept coming to ask her for cribs , extra chairs , extra sheets and a million other things,She is so unbelievable , in a calm manner she meets every request so easily and makes you feel so comfortable asking.She is friendly nice ,and makes you feel like her personal guests.The rooms are really nice , comfortable and greaI have been coming for years and love it

Stayed here last week with my family of 6. Great hotel, fitted our needs perfectly. The room was plenty big enough for all 6 of us with a living room with sofa bed and large bedroom with 2 large double beds. The staff are lovely and extremely helpful, special thanks to Gabe and the team on the front desk and Nicholas on the door with his helpful restaurant tips. Excellent location with plenty of good restaurants around for breakfast. Will definitely stay here again. Thanks for a wonderful stay in your beautiful city

Stayed just one night (Sat) but the San Carlos really made the time comfortable. Was upgraded to a suite and the hotel provided a rollaway so the boys (13 and 10) had there own room. My bed was very comfortable and all the amenities were wonderful. We were right next to the elevator, but the noise was manageable. We all slept great.Very friendly staff! The boys enjoyed interacting with everyone from the bellman to the front desk staff who did magic tricks for them.No valet service and self-parking is offsite, 2 blocks away, but easy enough.Hotel is centrally located to the subway and easy walking distance to Rock Center and Grand Central.Would/will stay here again and recommend it to all.
user_name:
FloridaFlyer1
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I stayed with pleasure at the San Carlos Hotel, the staff is very kind and attentive to your needs, this building has been well restored and my room was spacious, spotless and quiet, while the bed was quite comfortable where I slept very well. This hotel is located in Midtown within walking distance of Fifth Avenue shopping paradise, but also within walking distance of metro stops and the Grand Central Terminal. So this hotel is really located in a strategic area of Manhattan. Inside you can access the fitness room, equipped with excellent tools. So I fully recommend this great Hotel.

Stayed for 2 nights and was blown away by the room size (which is unbelievably large for NYC, or indeed any major city), bed was super comfortable, bathroom was large with a great shower, the room had all amenities I needed for a comfortable stay. Staff were friendly and helpful - when my room wasn't quite ready at 3pm for check-in I was well looked after while I waited in the lobby. Good base for exploring the city as the 51st and 53rd street subway stations are close by and will get you anywhere you need to go in the city.

I recently returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel. Check-in was easy. The room was nice. A little dated, but clean and functional. The A/C in the main room was loud when turning on. I would say the room is on the larger side when comparing to other New York hotels. The major issue that we had on the trip started on the 1st day. I noticed that I could not connect to the hotel wifi. The hotel sent someone to the room who basically just showed us how you would normally connect to the wifi network on a device. After multiple back and forths it became apparent that the wifi did not work in the main room of the suite. The room with the 2 queen beds where I spend all 4 nights. At one point the hotel had me contact the wifi technical support who provided some help. The problem soon returned. Just to be clear this was not one device with a problem. This was a galaxy S8+, an iphone 7, iphone 6s, ipad mini, samsung tablet, and an ipod. All of these devices would not connect in the main room. After telling me to call technical support and then the problem reoccurring the hotel seemed to wipe their hands clean of the situation. They told me that they would waive the hotel resort fee and that was it. Nobody called to follow-up, no attempts were made to rectify the issue, nobody acknowledged the problem on check-out. I even mentioned this issue on a post check-out survey that was sent to me online after I left. Still no contact from anybody at the hotel. For close to 800 Canadian dollars a night I would expect that someone would address the issue and rectify it. Have the IT department come and add an extender/repeater/booster etc... It is hard for me to believe that nobody else has had an issue in this room (Hotel said they have never had an issue in this room before.). The hotel management ignored the issue and hoped it would go away. I was happy with the stay otherwise, but the handling of this issue negated all the positives. I would not stay at this hotel again. I expect hotels of this caliber to take care of issues not hide from them.

Staff was excellent, as they were very helpful and informative. Rooms were clean and spacious. The staff felt like old friends and took the time, any time we needed. Enjoyed our stay Tremendously! We will definitely be back when we hit the Big Apple.

Full disclosure: I'm a former city resident, so I know the city pretty well and have my favorite neighborhoods. I chose this part of town for its convenience to the things I needed and the people I was visiting - and the hotel was perfectly located for me to do all of those things.** Note that there was construction on the street, so there may be some noise if you stay on the front side of the hotel.The staff was friendly and helpful. I was there during a heat wave, and the aircon was incredibly refreshing. The hallways weren't cooled, though, so it was a little stuffy between the elevator and the room. My accommodation was terrifically spacious! I had plenty of room to spread out (which I'm known to do). I wish I had a luggage rack to open my suitcase, but I used the extra sofa in the room instead. The desk provided additional room for me to stash personal belongings. The bed was comfortable and the linens were soft. The bathroom felt a little industrial and outdated, particularly in comparison to the rest of the furnishings, but it was clean and useful. I wish there had been more counter space in the bathroom for personal items, but the desk in the bedroom was near enough.Overall, a great hotel! Definitely a top contender for my next trip.

Part for work, part for pleasure, my stay in the city was for ten days. The location of the San Carlos hotel was perfect: close enough to the subway to explore many (new to me) places and attractions and close to my business location.The staff was very welcoming, always friendly and very helpful. Everyone I encountered was professional and pleasant. For the room itself, it was huge for an NYC hotel room. Having both a microwave and a mini fridge in the room was very helpful. I would happily return for another stay the next time I am in the city. Well worth the money. I highly recommend the San Carlos hotel!!

Lovely hotel! Room very well looked after and large - lots of storage space and room to move around. Beautifully looked after by the house keepers.From the moment we checked in - we were created with a warm friendly smile and the gentleman that checked us in - we didn’t catch his name - tues 18th sept around 10am was lovely - very friendly. Bellboys also very chatty and friendly.All staff take the time to get to know you and remember your face - makes you feel very welcome.Perfect location. Would defiantly recommend this hotel and will defiantly stay here again.

We did a couples weekend with 2 other friends. We found the hotel to be centric. Walking distance to everything, including grand central station. Which was awesome. The room was spacey for a NYC hotel. Very comfortable.

We arrived to this hotel after a previous hotel (Lord & Moris; avoid!) didn’t acknowledge our booking, but the staff here made us feel at home; even though we only stayed for one night. Our room was massive. We stayed in a queen suite, and it was more than enough space for three of us. And the extras (i.e. kitchen, tv etc) were added bonuses. Everything was extremely clean and staff were so so friendly.

HOTELThis hotel is in the heart of Manhattan, making it a convenient base from which to explore the city. The hotel has a high-end, expensive, luxurious feel, making it ideal for romantic trips or expensed trips.ROOMOur suite was impeccably clean and very spacious. It had all the facilities that we might need, including sofa, armchairs, dining table, kitchenette, etc. despite its setting, it was not noisy at all, perhaps because it was in the business section of the hotel. SERVICEThe staff were polite, and the service was efficient throughout. The room was expensive but reasonable given the quality of the hotel, and we would probably stay again.

We had a lovely stay at the San Carlos. We have stayed here before, but I think this time was even better. Every member of the staff we encountered was welcoming and helpful. Each day on leaving and returning to the hotel, we were greeted pleasantly. We're late risers, but we were never bothered by housekeeping. No matter when we left the hotel, housekeeping was available to clean our room and they always did a thorough job. Toiletries and towels are generous. The location is convenient to public transportation and there are numerous restaurants of all cuisines within several blocks.We would stay here again on another visit to NYC.

This hotel was a very comfortable place to stay. Plenty of room for a family and very comfortable and clean rooms. I actually miss the bed! Great location, close to subway terminal. Def stay there again.

Have stayed many times. Feels like my home away from home. Hotel is conveniently located, very clean, quiet and the staff is friendly. Not loaded with amenities but if you like staying in a smaller hotel, you will like this place.

Great hotel, clean and quiet (which is something to be said for NYC), friendly-staff; great amenities in the room; exercise room; nice restaurant next door. Recommended hands down for both business and pleasure.

just a great place to stay in New York. from the Room Size, the amenities the Guest service the Lobby and Cleanest, the chocolate in the room, the Bell boy was so helpfull with directions and the location perfect

Location is unbeatable. Rooms are huge with all amenities. Service is perfect. Gabriel at front desk is awesome! Near subways, buses, restaurants, 24x7 supermarket. Powerful wifi. Nice and cozy business center. You just don't need more.

We really enjoyed our stay at the San Carlos. The hotel was very clean and the staff friendly. Also it was small enough that it was easy to get in and out and we loved being a little away from all of the craziness of the city. It was close enough to a subway stop to make it convenient to get around as well. The rooms could stand an update in the decor, but it was still clean and comfortable. We also loved having a mini fridge to store some drinks and snacks in.

Clean, brilliant breakfast diner over the road, comfortable queen beds.Has a gym, though not tried Family friendly.Staff friendly and helpful.Mid town so close to Central Park and the Rock.Try cycling in Central Park and the beast speed boat!

I had an excellent stay. The hotel is located in a fairly quiet area a few blocks from the fifth avenue, one of the most chic shopping streets. The room was very comfortable, with a fine decoration and very neat. The staff was very friendly always attent to our needs. I truly reccommend this hotel.

It’s not hip but it’s clean, spacious, and comfortable. Also far enough away from the crush of Times Square but still centrally located. The staff is fantastic. Would be happy to return. We rented a suite. Was great! Had a full bath plus powder room and mini kitchen. A rarity in New York.

This hotel was in the perfect location for my husband, myself and two daughters. We came to see my son's performance and did not need two rooms for one night. The two queen beds gave us the space we needed. Staff was friendly.

This was a wonderful place to stay. Great location, friendly staff, rooms had great amenities (fridge and microwave), nice gym , and great price. We couldn’t have asked for a better place to stay. AmAzing

Rooms were surprisingly spacious, and friendly staff. Well located with plenty of eateries around. It has a spacious lobby. The bar is adjoining and not in the lobby itself. I was there on business and will likely stay at the hotel again.

The only place to stay in NYC - great staff, location and rooms. All the personal touches that a lovely hotel & staff like the San Carlos gives which a large chain hotel never could, and seldom does. I wouldn’t stay anywhere else while in NYC.

We had a hot but enjoyable 4 day stay in New York enjoying the sights, crowds and doing all the touristy things that it has to offer. Our stay at the San Carlos was a highlight due to the lovely spacious air conditioned room and very helpful, friendly staff who made a stay a memorable one. Will certainly be recommending to our family and friends when visiting New York.

Best place to stay in NYC,parking is also reasonable and convenient...walking distance from many places to visit ...room upgrades whenever available was also done by the management and greatly appreciated
user_name:
vahan45
Egg Harbor Township, New Jersey

review_body: What a fantastic hotel! The staff are so friendly and very accommodating, from the receptionist to concierge you really could not fault anyone and always had a smile on their faces :-). My kids loved Nicholas and Bobby especially! The hotel is super clean, airy and well maintained. The location was great for us, not too busy but a stones throw from all central attractions ie The Rockefeller, Chrysler, Empire State Building, Times Square, Grand Central Station and Central Park. Will definitely stay here again *****

The staff was accommodating and friendly. From Favio, the booking manager to Quron who greeted us at the front desk to the bellmen who made sure the police didn't issue parking tickets as we were checking in or out, the hotel should be proud of the staff!The room was all we expected: Clean, well appointed and comfortable. We had a great stay and will definitely stay there again when in NYC.

Stayed for 7 nights for our holiday. The location on 50th E Street is excellent - close to "everything". Walking distance (for a Norwegian ;-) ) to Times Square, Broadway, Rockefeller Center (Top of the Rock), Empire State Building, The UN building, the Fifth Avenue, Central Park etc. The staff is very helpful and friendly. We would stay here again if we ever come back to New York.

Just came back here from holiday with my partner for his big birthday - we literally couldn’t fault it. The service, the rooms, the location - everything was perfect!! We were absolutely gutted to leave. Thank you to all the staff and we hope we get the chance to come back and visit!!

My family and I stayed her for 3 nights and it was an ideal location. Lots of things were close enough to walk to, including Central Station to get to places further afield.Our room was clean and slept the 5 of us comfortably (as long as your children don't mind sharing a bed of course). There was no view out of our window, but that didn't really bother us, and it was quiet at night, which was great.The room had a small fridge, which was helpful, and a coffee maker (the coffee provided was not very nice though i'm afraid, and coffee mate is provided as a substitute for milk).The staff were helpful at the front desk, helping us with directions and recommendations, and they had umbrellas available for use for those rainy days. The only thing lacking really, was a place to get a drink, but the hotel across the road has a bar, so it is not a big issue. We did not try the attached restaurant.I would certainly stay here again if we were to return to NYC as the location is brilliant and the hotel is clean and welcoming.

My sixteen yo and I were visiting for 6 nights - our first time in NYC. I spent tons of time searching and finally came upon a deal for this hotel on Travel zoo. Since it was a King room and I wanted some extra space, it was perfect.Check in was at 3, our room was HUGE. Large bedroom with a very comfortable king size bed, full bath, plus a living room (couch and two chairs) another bathroom!, kitchette and table for two. Two huge closets and lots of drawer space. Like I said, it was huge!We like the location too, plenty all around us and quick access to the subway.I thought the hotel staff there was great. Very pleasant, helpful, and good vibe. I would recommend this hotel.

We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. It is in a brilliant location and a short distance to Grand Central Station. A few minutes walk to the Rockefeller Centre or Empire State Building. The hotel is very clean and all staff were welcoming and helpful. The rooms were well equipped and cleaned every day. There is a business centre on the second floor and they will hold luggage and arrange airport transfers. There were a few small areas of tired decoration in our room but nothing that could not be ignored given how brilliant the location is.

Just love this hotel in East midtown Manhattan. I have stayed here a number of times. Service is beyond friendly. Rooms are very comfortable. Free WiFi. Great TV. Perfect location. Doorman would always get me a taxi. Near a Duane Read for whatever you might need. Room has a coffee maker, microwave and fridge. Also nice robes and great pants presser. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND!
user_name:
Janis F
Bala Cynwyd, Pennsylvania, United States

review_body: Hotel was fine after checking 3 rooms. First room was directly across from the elevator, next room was way down the hall and faced a wall, third room was fine. Small lobby, no real services - no mini bar, room service. WiFi was good. Guy at reception was helpful, people were nice Location was pretty good, midtown East. I guess for $300, this is all you can expect in NYC.

We visited New York for a college tour and through in a few days for fun. The San Carlos was perfect for our needs. Very affordable and well located we were a cab ride away from both the college tour at Columbia, Yankee Stadium, shopping and sightseeing.

This will be easy. Having been to NYC many times either on holiday or as a commercial ship's captain, I have stayed in many of the good hotels in the City. On this occasion with my wife.... this is our first time at the San Carlos Hotel. From the moment we walked through the doors there is an air of peace about the foyer. We were met by Doorman (Andy) with our cases and Gabriel on the desk and made to feel very welcome.The front desk or any of the Doormen will help you with advice on how to get around or whatever.There are some very good restaurants close by within minutes walking This is not your typical large chain hotel buzzing with people and things going on, but a really delightful hotel offering a complete relief from the non-stop buzz of the City.We had a Junior Suite on the 5th Floor which was generous in size and very comfortable.We were privileged to meet Janet Materi handing Sales and Marketing and also the owner of the hotel, something that will never happen in most NYC hotel.Breakfast is available in an adjoining part of the hotel which was excellent.The lifts (2) are good.The hotel is very well positioned for most of the tourist locations be it the Rockefeller Centre, 5th Avenue, Times Square and the subway.On arriving in NY, go to the subway station close by and buy a MetroCard for the time you will be in the City This can then be used in both buses and the subway. Whilkst on a bus pick up a route map. Please note, if you ride a bendy-bus (as we call them in England), you must insert your MetroCard in the blue box beside the bus stop and get a receipt before boarding the bus. If it is a normal bus, swipe your card at the driver's position.Simply a great hotel to stay. You would be missing a real trick not to stay here

We were very comfortable. Normally when visiting New York we accept really small quarters to keep our budget limits. We were happy we spent a little more and had an excellent stay. And the staff is very personable. Not much of a view from our room, but certainly in the area we wanted. The restaurant is also very interesting and different and worth a try.

Stayed here with my 12-year-old daughter for a short excursion to NYC. The hotel exceeded our expectations. Very quiet and clean with super comfortable beds and friendly, attentive staff. Solid free WiFi. The location is great (right by the train) and the price was very reasonable. We’ll be staying again. Our new affordable “go-to” hotel in NYC.

When hotels get fantastic reviews on Tripdadvisor, they don't always deserve them. This one does. It is located in the heart of Manhattan, within a walking distance to the Rockfeller Center and 5th avenue, and two Subway stations are very close, making it even easy to travel from JFK airport to the hotel by Subway.The hotel staff was always very friendly and helpful. The bedrooms are quiet, spacious and clean. We (two adults and two teenagers) stayed one week. We asked for a rollaway bed to be added in the room as we didn't want to share bed. It has its additionnal cost but it was surprinsigly comfortable.The kitchenette is super useful when, like me, you don't want to spend hours (three times a day) trying to find a restaurant which fits everybody.I would only have two small complains:-the sofa bed in the room is not very comfortable... -the breakfast in the restaurant attached to the hotel was a disappointment.. It is cheaper than in most other places but offers little.Overall, I'll definitely come back there for my next stay in the city

Stayed two nights here in June, midweek. Room was comfortable and clean. Would have appreciated a comfortable chair for reading or TV ( there was only a single desk chair). Staff was helpful and friendly. Did not try food sources in hotel. Hotel is on a section of street where it can be hard to hail a cab. Doorman was helpful here. If Broadway is your main interest, be aware that it takes a while to traverse crosstown. Streets are often one lane so the meter can tick while you sit idle.Price was about $760 including tax and fees for two nights.
user_name:
Compass802708
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I absolutely recommend the san Carlos hotel !!!!!! Everyone was so so nice and the rooms are very very roomy!!!!They were so accommodating about everything. I would stay here every time I come to new York city. Michael was exceptionally nice.
user_name:
reginarathan
New York City, New York

review_body: Planned a 4 night stay to New York City for my niece to celebrate her upcoming last year of high school. Wanted a nice, quiet hotel yet still in a business location that was close to subway, restaurants, grocery store, etc. This location was awesome. Easy to walk around to various sights as well as we both liked to walk. Just the size room we needed and quiet accommodations. Look forward to staying there on next trip.

In the interest of full disclosure, my wife and I have stayed at this hotel at least a dozen times. My enthusiasm for this hotel should be rather evident. The rooms are of above average size for a Manhattan hotel. The prices are a great value. The staff, and this can't be overstated, is second to none. This hotel is within a short walk to both the subway and many mid-town attractions.

Staying here was a wonderful experience. Friendly and helpful staff. Clean, comfortable room. The location was perfect. Plus, there were plenty of good restaurants in close vicinity. (I'd avoid the one in the hotel, however.)

We stayed here with 2 adults and 4 children. The hotel rooms were a great size, beds were comfy, clean. It was a little noisy but I expect that would just be New York!Staff were so friendly and helpful.Location was great, so close to Rockefeller and Times Square.Highly recommend to everyone!

My girlfriends and I did a long weekend trip. The hotel was in a perfect location, walking distance to all the main attractions and restaurants. The rooms were clean and well stocked. The staff were incredibly friendly and attentive. Ask for a room on the upper floors as it can be loud.

I have travelled here a few times for business, there is "complimentary" wifi (there is a service charge) which is pretty decent, the rooms are clean and tidy and the toiletries provided are nice (first place ive been given mouthwash).

My wife and I took our two grandchildren, ages 9 and 11, for their first visit to NY. They had studied immigration history in school and wanted to see Ellis Island. So we planned a week to see the main sights in NY. We chose this hotel as a good central location midtown on the east side, and I got a decent daily rate. Not the cheapest, but pretty affordable for this location -- which was a priority. The large room with two double beds was comfortable for the four of us. The staff was friendly and helpful - especially the concierge Nicholas. The room had a small fridge, microwave and coffee-maker so we could control some of our food expenses. We will consider staying again if we return.

My husband and I stayed 5 nights at the San Carlos. Great location in mid town. We stayed in a junior suite with a king bed. Large room, two closets, bright clean bathroom. The front desk staff and bell people were very helpful. Thanks to Fabio and his team for everything. Reasonably priced for NYC. Good WIFI. We were surprised by how quiet it was, given that it is in the middle of Manhattan. Will absolutely stay there again.

Stayed at the San Carlos for 11 nights during May 2018.Junior Suite was excellent, staff friendly and helpful, Included breakfast was very good considering the costs outside.Within a 15 minute walk to many of the key highlights and subway station right on next corner.Would return there for sure.

Hi I booked hotel on Booking.com last year it stated it included all taxes on the website for just over £1600. I did upgrade the room and have taken this into account but still been overcharged £500.I did discuss it with hotel many times before I went, when I got there and when I left, spent so much time trying to sort it out, but they have done nothing. The hotel is still advertising on booking.com and when prices first come up when selecting room it states city tax and all other taxes included and then when you book it it isn’t Included.

The San Carlos Hotel is very well located in the the mid east side, near subway, bus, many choices of restaurants, besides being close to the Rockfeller Center and other major attractions. The Hotel itself, is very comfortable and cozy. The staff is the best, very friendly, efficient and the most part has been there for many years. In summary, the relationship Cost X Benefit is very good.
user_name:
Glaucia V
Rio de Janeiro, RJ

review_body: Our first visit to New York and we were welcomed by the kindest (and funny) concierge / manager at the hotel. Our room on the 4th floor (away from the street) was perfect for our family of 4- very quiet, super clean, and plenty of room for a 4 night stay. Housekeeping was fabulous!!!! The fridge and microwave with dishes was perfect for leftovers, late night snacks for teens or an easy cost effective breakfast. Grocery a short walk away. We did not need a thing from staff, but feel confident that should we have had a need, it would have been promptly addressed. Location was great felt very safe. If we are able to vacation again in NY, I would not hesitate to book again.

I have stayed at the San Carlos over the course of more than a decade. When I was in a previous position, I made regular trips to NYC and always booked there with the excellent reservationist, Fabio. I don't travel to NYC as often now, but was there last month and happy to report that the San Carlos is as great as ever. Professional, friendly staff and great accommodations.

Great place to stay. Large room, and good location. The staff was very attentive and all had big smiles every day. The only thing that I would change would possibly be the restaurant. However the locationlends itself to many choices within a few blocks. This room is hands down the best deal that we foundin this part of town.

The hotel is in Midtown where there are lots of bars, restaurants and convenience stores. The metro is 2 blocks away and is easy to reach by bus also. The rooms are big and clean and very quiet to have a good rest

The good:Good service, nice smiling and efficient staff. Good breakfast in the restaurant nearby (spice symphony) - prices are outrageous as is, but if you say that your a hotel guess, it's 10-12$ per person.The room is very big and good for families. We were 4, it didn't feel crowded at all.Microwave and a refrigerator in the room.The location is absolutely amazing, minutes from Rockefeller center and a subway station 3 streets away. The beds ( 2 queen size beds) were comfortable. The bad:Cleanliness - The room wasn't tidy. It wasn't very dirty, but the cleaning staff could do more - as you can see the water sprinkler was cleaned ages ago. When we leave the room we always do a sweep - and we found under the beds a toy of a former guest.The toilets in our room were clogged 3-4 times during our stay. very embarrassing. Never happened to us anywhere else.Noise levels - I asked for a quiet room, so they put us in the 2nd floor, room 208, not facing the street. It was noisy, still - on the first night, I heard music from the street, on the other nights noises from the hallway. My sleep was disturbed almost every night (I'm a light sleeper).The ugly - The room view reminded me a prison. I would accept it if the room was sufficiently quiet, but it wasn't.

the hotel is like second home for me. each time when I come to NY I stay in San-Carlos.great service.great location.all is greatI highly recommend the hotel.there are few types of rooms. I am not familiar with all rooms. I am sure, that they take good care on all the rooms.

We have stayed at this hotel twice in the past 5 months and we are planning another stay in August. We have medical appointments and find this hotel fits our needs perfectly. Staff is very friendly and location is central to our needs.

Staff is very friendly and helpful!! The room is large for New York but a little dated. Liked having a refrigerator and microwave in the room. Location is wonderful and we will definitely stay here again!

Great location, great staff, great room. We had 5 people (2 kids) in a junior queen suite. Two queen beds and a fold out double bed in the adjoining living room. Small kitchenette with fridge, dishes, sink, and microwave was an unexpected plus. Zero point zero complainrts about the room and / or the hotel. (My kids even complimented the fast elevators after a visit the the American History Museum).Our only disappointment was the attached restaurant, an Indian / Chinese fusion place. Just go to the New York Luncheonette or steak joint across the street if Indian / Chinese is not your thing.

San Carlos is classic hotel , the one bedroom room we stayed at was big and well equipped with kitchinette and 2 bathrooms . The furnitere and decor classic . I think it’s time to give the rooms a more modern touch. Regarding room size abd facilities the price was acceptable for a hotel in this exeptional location. I truly recommend this hotel.

A memorable stay at San Carlos hotel due to its cleanliness, cozy atmosphere and competitive rates and of course great location. This hotel is a family oriented type of hotel and non discriminatory. Will definitely refer to friends and family.
user_name:
avavispo
New York City, New York

review_body: My wife and I have stayed at the San Carlos Hotel at least 6 different times in the last 2 years. I has become our favorite place to stay when we are visiting New York City!! We hope to be headed there again in late June!!

This hotel is a little gem in an excellent location in this busy city, within walking distance of the main attractions. We stayed in a junior suite which was large, well equipped and extremely comfortable to return to after a long day sightseeing. Without exception every member of staff we encountered was friendly, helpful and the level of customer service was exceptional. Although the hotel does not have its own restaurant or bar, there are a number of excellent eating places close by, so it was not a problem. We would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel and if we were to return to New York, we would definitely choose the San Carlos again.

This is a small, boutique hotel, whose staff masters Customer Service. The hotel is quaint, decorated very nicely, with bamboo plants everywhere. Great location as it is close to the midtown action. This hotel is highly recommended.
user_name:
robgotlin
New York City, New York

review_body: This hotel is located in a convenient place in Midtown East. One block from the 6, E and M trains. The lobby is nice and there's a convenient business center on the 2nd floor. The hotel has umbrellas available when it rains - nice touch. The staff is very pleasant. I stayed on the second floor and the room was worn - creaky floor, thin carpet, darkish. My experience was ok, but it looks like the hotel has seen better days, at least the 2nd floor rooms.

Located near the subway and buses, 20 minutes walk to broadway shows. Local restaurants on third avenue. All the Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. We would stay here again on our next visit. A nice breakfast dinner just across the street. Smith and Wollenski a block away.

We just completed a 4-night stay, and we loved it. Welcoming staff, clean comfortable room, great restaurants nearby, a block from the subway, reasonable prices. It checked all of the boxes. We plan to stay here again when we return in a couple of weeks.

A wonderful hotel , I have stayed with my family here over 15 times in the past decade, and you can definitely see why we come so often.The staff is great, the rooms are comfy and big, the benefits are tremendous.It’s close to everything as well.We do miss the breakfast, but we’ll live through it Special thanks and cheers to Gabriel, Johan, and my man, Andy!

Did a lot of research before deciding to stay here and more than happy with our choice. Stayed in a suite so plenty of space for 3 adults, and there is a small kitchenette area with a fridge, microwave and coffee maker, as well as cutlery. A couple of days we had breakfast in the room after buying bread etc at the local store. UK people , look for DuaneReade store, like our corner shops. Helpful staff on reception, no wait for the lift, good air con and no street noise at all. The big question , would you stay here again? Most definitely Yes! And it's only 7 hours from London, we'll be back.

The San Carlos is a great property for business or personal. Nice restaurants whether you enjoy gourmet dining or you want to catch a quick and inexpensive meal from a fast food place or if you want to be adventurous and satisfy your palate from a fast food truck. Short walking distance to Times Square.

You can't miss with the San Carlos! Everything about this hotel is wonderful but it's the staff that puts it above the rest. They make you feel like long lost friends while giving excellent service along with great recommendations to everything from restaurants to a near by wine shop!

I have come many times to this hôtel in the last ten years for business reasons. This time I came with family members and I was very happy in how gently they tok care of everyone, always trying to do their best.

Absolutely flawless. Staff as phenomenal. Location was great - walk to everything but a couple of blocks removed from the horns and the hustle and bustle. Rooms are new and pristine. The restaurant attached is fantastic. We won't stay anywhere else for the foreseeable future. It was our 2nd stay and we liked it even more this time.

This hotel is wonderful. We stayed 3 nights for our 40th wedding anniversary. The room was lovely and super comfortable (I looked up the pillow mfg and ordered two.). Everything you could think of was provided: tons of thick lush towels and upscale toiletries, microwave, dishes, utensils, refrigerator, a terrific sofa to relax on at the end of the day and an extremely comfortable bed. I could easily have stayed a month there. The staff was courteous, friendly and very efficient. I called down about the remote not working (turns out it was operator error) and there was someone at the door in about a minute who explained the proper way to use it. I wouldn't have enjoyed this trip half as much if it wasn't for this delightful hotel and its staff.

We have always been very pleased with the hotel. We were very disappointed this time to find that breakfast is no longer included--especially since breakfast choices in the area are not wonderful. Hope you ca do something about this. Your adjoining

The hotel was just where we needed to be. It was near our destination and easy to get to all weekend long. The staff was friendly, helpful and honest! They helped us navigate around town all weekend long! The room was amazing! Clean, big and very modern. It was very comfortable. The experience was a little scary going somewhere we didn't know but we will definitely go back!

Since years I am staying at the San Carlos when I am in NYC and every time I leave I say: See you next time. Great place to stay. During the yeras I needed help and support and the staff (especially Bob) are Always greatly supportive. I feel like at home.

Lovely people, very charming, close to everything, clean, comfy bed, and I loved the car service to the airport. My only complaint was the thin walls. We could hear people in the next room very clearly at some point in the night when they returned to their room...and they were loud! Other than that....I would stay again for sure.

Clean, spacious, well-appointed rooms. Exceptional staff and great location. Fairly quiet area but just minutes away from Midtown destinations. Have stayed here several times recently and this will definitely be my go-to in the future.

The San Carlos is always perfect, the people, service & place. this time I left my telephone charger & Gabe promptly returned it. Thank you for repairing my stupidity. I have no suggestions as you always address things before they are a problem or create pleasant solutions. It is a great place for families & business & the location fits my needs perfectly. Thank you for 10 years of a wonderful relationship.GEB

This hotel was recommended by friends and it is fantastic. The staff is wonderful, rooms are well appointed, spacious and comfortable with great amenities. The location is fabulous. We'll be back soon.

The room was clean and spacious with two bathrooms - good for a family of five. the location was good for walking. the staff was great. if you are parking, be sure you use the correct garage - there are several with the same name, but the hotel discount will only work if you use the right garage.

A fabulous hotel centrally located. Within walking distance to 5th Avenue, major venues, and Broadway. There are great restaurants in the area, and a great New York deli across the street. I highly recommend The San Carlos.

I started staying here many years ago when I was frequently in New York for business. I'm retired now but continue to depend on the San Carlos because its service, quality of facility, etc. are top notch. Also, the location just can't be beat.

I have stayed at the San Carlos one week per month for several years for work. It is my home away from home. The staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean and comfortable, especially the bed. They even leave out umbrellas for you when it rains!

Wonderful stay at a perfect location. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful..We were delighted at the size of the room and comfort of the bedding. The setup had a very nice kitchenette area which was great for that first cup of coffee.

Great place is so many ways.First of all: Terrific staff and customer service. Warm, friendly, engaging, and all the while professional and helpful in so many ways, Lovely people, You have to meet Quron and Nicolas who really know how to enhance your stay at the San Carlos.. They are the essence of what makes people feel good. Always with a smile, and interested in what we did that day. When we arrived late the first night Quron graciously listened to our dilemma and was able to accommodate our request to change to a suite which was perfect for our 2 teens, as there were 5 of us. All 3 generations of women taking our granddaughters/daighter to their first trip to New York! The suite was perfect for our group. We had plenty of room and the beds were heavenly. Great Location, we could walk to almost any place we wanted to go to. We did some of the time, but the cold did get the best of us. Great neighborhood to get some great coffee right across the street, bagels, avocado toast, fresh fruit etc.Have stayed through the years in other places, this is the first time I have said I will be back. I just sent a friend to the San Carlos who asked for a recommendation. I did not hesitate when asked. It was a memorable stay as New York was a memorable trip. .

My wife and I stay in NY several times a year, and when available, the suites at the San Carlos are our first choice. Nowhere else does one find the space, the luxurious bedding, the well stocked kitchenettes, that the San Carlos provides. We’ve stayed at much more expensive hotels, but we are happy to bypass the stuffiness and the inflated rates for simply a helpful staff and an affordable room. And we much prefer a unique, individually owned hotel to the cookie cutter chains, where a brand is more important than your particular hotel. I should add that on occasion we are fortunate enough to have a grandchild accompany us, and I think she liked it as much as we did.

Spent five days here. An old style hotel. The staff are incredibly welcoming and friendly. Lovely big bed. Very clean. Fresh linen every day. Quiet. Well located for exploring New York. Would definitely stay again.

We really enjoyed the San Carlos hotel. My youngest daughter made a friend in one of the front desk gentlemen. He always had something for her when we walked in or left...he taught her to be a “real New Yorker” ;) All of the staff were super friendly & helpful. The suite was nice & clean & the beds were comfy. I was impressed with the size of the suite for our family of five! We had plenty of space to spread out & be comfortable. The location was great! 3 minute walk to the subway, less than that to the bus. We walked to Times Square, Central Park, etc. (we like to walk but it was very doable). There’s a fantastic breakfast spot right across the street, & a Duane Reed’s right around the corner for any little thing you’d need/snacks, etc. We would definitely stay here again!

Nice hotel. Great location.But my main reason for staying here was the free kosher breakfast. On my last trip I discovered that they have discontinued this. Also, they used to allow you to have packages delivered to the hotel for free and they now charge after 5 packages.It seems they are cutting back on the little advantages that this hotel had, so I don't really have any incentive to stay there anymore.

The San Carlos Hotel was the perfect hotel for us. A spacious room, within walking distance to Times Square, helpful and considerate staff, and a quiet night’s sleep! We will stay here again and again!

We arrived at the hotel after a very long walk from the train station. The lobby was welcoming and the desk clerk attentive. Check in was smooth and the clerk asked if we had baggage...yes, we had just carried it half a mile. We were given our key card and pointed to the elevator. I expected our baggage to be taken to the room (why else ask if we had any?) but the advertised bellman must have been on a break. I had requested a high floor, but even though the hotel wasn't full, we were given a room in the 2nd floor with view of the service alley and brick wall. The room was clean, but the roll away bed we had requested was not there. The desk had housekeeping bring it and, after maneuvering in the tight quarters, it was set up. Our room was directly across from the hallway access door and elevator. All night there were people going in and out, slamming the door. The elevator mechanism could also be heard very loudly, constantly throughout the night. The hotel is in a good location for walking to shops and attractions, and we spent most of our time out and about. However, we did expect to be able to watch a little local tv and weather before turning in. This wasn't possible as the cable was out of order and the programming would freeze every few minutes. We told the front desk and they said they were having cable problems..."sorry, shoulder shrug...should be fixed soon". It never was. I don't usually use the minibar, too expensive and I don't drink. For some reason all of the mini bar items had been placed in the mini fridge...taking up all of the bottom shelf and the door shelves. The mini bar was there, so I'm not sure why the fridge was being used for this. My kids had to reach over the scotch to get to the sodas that I had purchased for them. I asked the front desk if this was normal..."shoulder shrug, sorry, don't know".We were told at booking that there was a free continental breakfast, or we could pay $10 for full breakfast next door. There was no free breakfast, or even coffee, available. "Shoulder shrug, sorry...there's coffee across the street."I was really expecting excellent service at the San Carlos, and it just didn't happen. Housekeeping was excellent, but the desk staff seemed not to care much. I would have expected to offered something for the inconveniences we had...maybe a breakfast voucher or something off the $30 a night fee for the rollaway, but they acted like the problems were no big deal...shoulder shrug. Would I recommend this hotel?...shoulder shrug...probably not. There are many options in the area and in this price range, and for the money I'd go with hotel the puts the customer first.

My daughter and I were in New York to celebrate her birthday. We chose the San Carlos for its great location in the city. From arrival to departure we were very well looked after. The room was lovely. The beds were so comfortable with high quality bedding. In fact we could not find anything wrong with the room apart from the TV freezing now and again.There is no breakfast offered at the hotel but there are numerous eateries serving breakfast just a few steps away.There is a building site next door but in no way did it impact on the quality of our stay.If you want a central location in a very nice area you would be hard pushed to get a better hotel at such reasonable price. Thank you to everyone who made our stay so special.

San Carlos is my home away from home on business trips to NYC; the staff is friendly and courteous. The in-room amenities are great (microwave, coffee makers, fridge). The next door Spice Symphony offers some of the best Indian cuisine.

We had a great stay! The stay was very friendly and helpful, and the room was great. The room was way bigger than expected, especially for New York, so it was very comfortable and also clean. We loved the little kitchen suite, and the bathroom was a great size.

Excellent location, lovely to have microwave, mini refrigerator and window that opens; comfortable bed, were outside the country so this review is late. Our only quandary was the pain of getting the Guestbook discount, fortunately Johanna Vargas sales manager took care of it for us. Too long a process ! This hotel should have a more simple way to get discount to returning customers; we enjoyed the ability to have continental breakfast next door at Spice Symphony although not the best, we are very sorry to read it is discontinued. Apologize for forgetting the names of the two bellmen who took care of us (checked in March 9th, young man who recommended Italian restaurant in Queens; and the man who shared many tips about the big island of Hawaii on check out Sunday March 11th). Courteous and professional. Highly recommending it to family and friends, we shall be back !

Clean, well appointed rooms. Friendly staff. Good location to shops and restaurants. Very comfortable sofa sleeper. I like the Wolfgang Puck coffee. The orchids in the lobby are a nice touch. I would definitely stay there again.

I have no idea how it is possible for travelers to give this hotel a 5-star rating!It was a disappointment from the moment the limo dropped us off. The reception employee kept calling my friend a "bodyguard" every time he encountered us. I am a university professional, and my friend is a Manhattan based artist. We were going to see a concert at Carnegie. Comments like "bodyguard" are absolutely inappropriate and out of place. The free breakfast is no longer honored, even if you purchased a rate including the breakfast. A discounted breakfast is offered at the Indian restaurant next door. We went there for a quick bite, and the place was unprofessional, messy, with chipped tables, and staff members who lose control over the place just by serving about 10 people. They are very quick to hand you the bill, though (even if you are in the middle of your conversation and in the middle of consuming the food).There is no classy restaurant in the hotel, the lobby is very small, the elevators take a long time, but the rooms are comfortable.The bathroom, although not dated, was not the cleanest. I had a green snot stuck to the shower curtain, and several black hair in the bathtub and on the floor. Disgusting.The toilets are slow (better flush twice).When I was checking out, the reception employee failed to ask how my stay was, if everything was OK with my room, or if I needed a copy of my bill. The housekeeping knocked every hour on my door - 9, 10 and 11AM. The receptionist called in the meantime, mumbling something, and then claimed that someone told him that water is needed in my room. What???

Hotel was central to all locations we wanted to see so we did not have to use bus or other means of transportation. All we had to do is walk to go on places we wanted to see. . Staff were friendly and helpful. I will come back to this hotel again and will also recommend to friends and families.

This was a last minute booking and it ended up being great!! Great location, staff was very friendly and helpful and the room was just perfect! I would definitely stay here again or recommend it to a friend in the future.

We ended up with a suite and it was perfect. The space was nice to have with a family of 4. We have stayed in other hotels and found this location to be perfect for the theatre and shopping. We will be back for sure. Great trip!

Very happy with my stay at this hotel. Large room with super comfortable bed with lots and lots of pillows. Sheets and pillows were new/fresh. Large desk with many outlets. Small (but standard small for NYC) bathroom that was clean. Microwave in room was a nice touch. Fridge, coffee maker, robes all made it very comfortable for long trip. Loved small but well equipped fitness center which is rare in NYC. Terrific location and fabulous customer service. Had to check out early and in a rush and they did not charge me for last night. Once in the plane, I realized I left clothes on back of bathroom door, but manager quickly delivered it to coworker who was still at hotel. Very appreciative of staff’s accommodations.

I’m a woman who spent a 7 night stay at the San Carlos Hotel with my 3 family members. We decided to pick this hotel due to the good reviews and location of the hotel and the Free WiFi and gym room was a plus. I had booked a hotel room with two bedrooms , a kitchen , and bathroom. When we checked in and went up to our room we quickly discovered that it was a one bedroom hotel room with a queen size bed and a sofa. When I stated this to the staff they offered to give us a suite as it was apparently the only other room available. We agreed on paying the extra $240 until the staff member told us that he had made a mistake and it was actually $480 so we quickly declined and they agreed to make the sofa bed immediately instead. We had to wait an hour for the house keepers to make the bed. The television channels cut off after watching 10-12 minutes of the same programme. The Free WiFi was extremely slow and did not allow me to use it on apps such as safari and Facebook on my Iphone. I was on the 7th floor and was expecting city noise but the windows always seemed to sound open and they let in a big draft. The toilets blocked very easily with more than 3-4 sheets of toilet paper. The shower drain didn’t work well at all and the shower/bath filled up to my ankles while using the shower. The Free shampoos/conditioners/ mouthwashes etc were half full and not sealed which gave an impression that they were previously used.Many light bulbs did not work and the mirrors in the bathrooms seemed to be old as they were scratched and marked severely. The housekeepers came in to our hotel room at 8:30 on the first 2 mornings after just one knock on the door and when they seen me awake and my family asleep they quickly said sorry and left. The beds are comfortable yet very squeaky. We were given four key cards to the hotel room and the four worked up until day 3 when only one worked. On the last night I got a nose bleed and unnoticed got a small patch of blood on the bed , if I had noticed I would have reported it to the staff straight away. I went to dinner with my family and when returning back to the hotel none of the key cards were working. I went down to the lobby to consult the staff when they explained in a harsh manner that they deliberately locked us out of our room due to the small patch of blood I unintentionally and unnoticeably left on the bed. They then charged me $350 for the bed sheet and explained that if there was even a drop of blood on the mattress then an extra $1000 would have been charged to provide a new one. I was also told that the $75 that I was charged when I checked in for insurance Incase of any broken furniture would not be given back.I had enjoyed the very welcoming , polite and helping staff who brought up conversation until I noticed the constant ask of my plans and how long I will be gone. My hotel room had been entered every time I left the building even when I kept the door sign of do not disturb on forgetfully. I know of this because of the constant change in movement of my objects.I really did not enjoy my stay at this hotel and would definitely not recommend it to anyone , have never had such an uncomfortable experience in a place I have dearly paid for and will never be returning to this hotel.

The front desk staff was just OK and nothing special.Location is very good Rooms were nice, spacious and bed were comfortable, services is also very good, Only breakfast is very poor very limited stuff & most of the stuff is cold, disposable plates which for a 4 star hotel is not acceptable. Very much over prised. So all-in-all the stay was just an okay experience, but not what I expected based on other reviews,

I was so excited to stay here with my family of 2 adults and 2 small kids after all the glowing reviews I read on here. Unfortunately it didn’t live up to the praise everyone else gave it on here. Upon check in, the staff was polite and reserved but I wouldn’t call them warm or welcoming. Unfortunately we didn’t encounter Quron or Bobby until we checked out and like everyone else said, they WERE fabulous even just in the 5 minutes of interaction we had with them. They were very friendly, Bobby held the door for us (no one else had done that when we lugged our luggage in), and they appropriately joked with our kids.
