The other drawback was when I booked this several month ago, all the reviews and hotel’s descriptions on the travel sites touted “free continental breakfast”. Apparently this is no longer true and now they only offer “American style” breakfast at $10/pp or the upgraded version at the attached Spice Restaurant for $15pp. (Probably because all the TripAdvisor idiots complained about it.) Not a horrible price, but we hadn’t budgeted for breakfast for our stay, so we ended up just getting breakfast supplies at the nearby Walgreens and using the kitchenette in our room. We had a junior suite with a queen bed and a pull out sofa. The bed was comfortable enough but the kids complained the pull out was uncomfortable, but I guess that’s to be expected. There is no ice machine, so you have to have them bring it to you if you want ice...but then you feel obligated to tip each time. I will say, when we had asked for ice and extra blankets, the service was extremely fast, so that was a plus. It was also pretty quiet at night which was nice. As everyone else pointed out, the location was great and I doubt you’d find a cheaper hotel with this great of a location. In all, we may or may not stay there again. I guess it depends on what you’re looking for.

Nice hotel. The location of the hotel puts you in mid-town close to St. Patrick's Cathedral, Rockefeller Center, and similar locations. The staff was friendly and helpful. There were multiple nice locations to eat nearby. The room was clean. The only negative thing I can comment on was that the beds were uncomfortable.

Staying in Midtown was great. Walking distance to broadway and Times Square but away from the madness. Great restaurants nearby. Family visit was great. One recommendation. Add a short happy hour in that cozy lobby area. An hour or so. The other places we’ve stayed in nyc had one. Just a nicety that impresses.

The San Carlos Hotel has it all friendly staff, comfortable clean rooms, extra kitchen area and the best location. It is in easy walking distance to popular tourist sites or subway is just a block away. On our next trip to New York would definitely stay again.

We stayed at the San Carlos Hotel over March break and we were very pleased with our stay. The hotel room was large and fit our family of five very comfortably. Kids were extremely happy with the 2 tvs so they could watch their own things. All the staff we encountered were really pleasant.The hotel does not have parking or offer a valet service but they do partner with a nearby parking lot for parking at a fantastically discounted rate BUT we were extremely upset about what happened to our vehicle while it was parked there. We assumed Manhattan didn't have many gas stations so we filled up on our way in. When we picked up the car it was on empty, so much so that we were panicked we wouldn't make it to a station. While the the San Marco is not to blame, this hotel should be aware they are sending their guests to a lot where gas was siphoned. If we hadn't already driven away when we noticed we would have absolutely raised the issue.Aside from the parking lot, I highly recommend this hotel. There are a number of great places to eat nearby, close to the subway and within walking distance of Times Square, Central Park and shopping.

I am a big fan of the hotel and its staff. Good value and reliable. I find the rooms spacious, clean, and comfortable. The internet access is reliable, and the inclusion of a refrigerator and a microwave is helpful if I want to bring in take-out.

Just returned from a business trip to New York and stayed at the San Carlos for two nights. The hotel was clean and looked nice. Desk staff was very friendly. My admin had booked my room and requested a king bed, however I believe the room was actually a queen bed, which was okay. My room had one small window located high on the wall, above the heating/ac unit and was impossible to see outside, which again would have been okay, but for the fact TV service was poor. On the first night my TV was having issues with the signal and I was unable to watch certain channels. The next morning, when I turned on the TV to get the news and weather, I had no signal at all. Since the weather was suppose to be bad, I called the front desk to report the TV and asked for a weather update to determine if a top coat was necessary. So all-in-all the stay was just an okay experience, but not what I expected based on other reviews, Maybe others had rooms with windows and good TV service.
user_name:
Michael P
Carrollton, TX, United States

review_body: I hate to travel...but, I had such a great stay at the San Carlos last week. Even with the storm, meeting delays, being alone, having to extend my stay... the team at San Carlos was so helpful, easy going, would do anything I needed. No hassles! I had a jr. suite with a little kitchen set up and a nice living room area. I held two meetings both with 5 people and it worked out great. And I really liked the attached restaurant also. Spice Symphony's has great food and again, nice staff! The San Carlos is now my 'go to' NYC hotel.

I do not think there is a more comfortable place to stay in Manhattan than the San Carlos Hotel. I found it by accident more than 15 years ago and have stayed there ever since. Great Midtown location, friendly staff ( many have been there from my first visit) and clean kept up rooms keep my husband and myself coming back.

I have been staying at the San Carlos for many years. I have stayed in every 5 star hotel in NYC and I just love this hotel. Friendly staff, comfortable clean rooms, GREAT beds and the best location which is midtown manhattan.

This Hotel is in a great central location, there are plenty of good restaurant's nearby. We had a one bedroom suite, room was very clean with everything we needed. Staff were all very friendly and helpful. Will stay here again.

I use to stay in San Carlos hotel whenever I come to New York City which is quite often. I love the hotel. The rooms are large and very comfortable. There is a kitchenette in each room. The location in midtown Manhattan is superb. The staff is professional, polite and friendly. I feel like being at home. I highly recommend this hotel to whoever comes to the city either as a tourist or for business.

We've stayed in many NYC hotels and this was a total winner. The rooms are large with plush bedding, and nice amenities. It's meticulously clean, the location is ideal, the price is right, and the service is top notch. The little touches made us feel at home: umbrellas, free NYT and USAToday, chocolates! The elevator comes quickly. A real person answers the phone. We checked in with no wait. AND, you can open the windows and let in the fresh air! We'll be back again for sure.

Our family was stuck in Manhattan last November while my father was ill at Lenoxhill hospital. We found this hotel in a hurry and thought we would only stay a couple of days, thinking that he would leave the hospital soon. We ended up staying more than a month. San Carlos has everything we needed: clean, confortable, well located very spacious rooms, and loving attitude from everyone in the hotel. Thanks to all, thanks specially to Hy, Ben, Evelyn, Gabriel. I should add, that when my father left the hospital the handicapped suites were fantastic. THANKS DEARLY!!!!

The San Carlos is in the middle of things, but set on a side street, so it is quiet. The people were so friendly and helped us learn more about the city each day. The room was a junior and was perfect for our 10 day stay. We did pretty well as mastering the subway, so the transportation costs were good. There is always the right time for a taxi/Uber, but if you always do that in NYC, it can get expensive. It was a perfect hotel for our visit.

We had two family with a total of 10 people between adults and kids. The hotel is family friendly. Friendly and helpful staff. Rooms were spacious and very clean. The hotel is located near all sites of interest and has great restaurants just blocks away.

This hotel is in a great location, 5 mins walk one way to St Patricks Catherdal on busy 5th Avenue and 5 mins other way to good Irish/sports bars and grocery stores away from tourist areas, lots of eating places all around, yet the hotel itself feels calm and attached on to it is a wonderful restaurant "spice symphony". I cant fault this place, the free breakfast was appreciated, nice juice and hot chocolate. The rooms were modern, had everything you need and cleaned very day. We stayed in elite suite, a family of 4 with two older teens, it was perfect, although the sofa bed could sleep two, we got a rollaway bed for 30 dollars extra a night(so they didnt need share bed), all the beds were really comfy and there was loads of room for extra bed, it is ideal hotel in NYC at decent price for family who need some space. Nice lobby, computer area and gym, and I think its family run which shows in how they look after guests, I would stay here again if back in NYC

We stayed here for 4 nights with our 3 children aged 5, 12 & 18. The staff were so friendly & helpful. We had a one bedroom apartment which was perfect. Was so clean & very spacious. The kids loved having free wifi In the bedroom. The continental breakfast was great, enough choice for all & set us up until lunchtime. It was freezing outside but room was always warm. Bathroom was a perfect size & shower had lots of hot water. We had dinner in the restaurant Spice Symphony which was really good too. Reception were great for arranging family restaurants for us. We will definitely comeback to this hotel as was a great find & within walking distance to most attractions.

I had to take a quick trip to NYC and had delayed in making my reservations. I found a sweet deal at San Carlos. I arrived and immediately was welcomed. The room was absolutely lovely. Everything about my one night stay was excellent at this property. There is a complimentary continental breakfast that has something for everyone. I would definitely stay here again!

We recently stayed at the San Carlos. This was our first stay here, and we were very pleased. We had a queen suite which we found to be very large. It easily accommodated 3 adults. The room was nicely furnished and very clean. Having a microwave and refrigerator was very handy. The beds and sofa bed were very comfortable. All the staff, from the front deck to housekeepers were very friendly. Bobby, from the bell staff, was very helpful. The location of the hotel is very convenient- only a 10 minute walk to Rockefeller Center. The breakfast is adequate and a very convenient feature . This is something most NYC hotels do not offer. I will return to this hotel on future visits to NYC.

My wife and I stayed at this hotel for four nights in early December and were very pleased with our stay. The room and bathroom size well exceeded my expectations for what a NYC hotel room would be. Everything was very clean, and there was ample storage space for our belongings. The bed was also one of the more comfortable hotel beds that I have slept on. The free wifi was fast (30mbps when tested), and the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The great location was also a major positive, as the hotel is near several subway stations and within walking distance to many tourist attractions.The only negative I can think of would be the breakfast, which consisted of various cold breads and muffins along with yogurt, coffee, and orange juice. The breakfast is complimentary for all guests though, so there isn't much room for complaint there.Overall we enjoyed our stay very much and would stay there again.

We stayed at the San Carlos for 5 nights and it was a delight. From Bobby at Concierge arranging a car to pick up us up at the airport before we travelled to the friendly, helpful and positive attitutde of all of the staff when we arrived. I would recommend a suite as had lots of room and having stayed at both the Lotte Palace and Waldorf on previous trips is certainly one of the biggest and cheapest rooms for the size in NY. They offer a complimentary continental breakfast which is basic and served on plastic plates etc, but its good if you are in a hurry to see the sights and its FREE! Its a great location , being only a 5 to 10 min walk to 5th Ave for the shops and Rockerfeller etc and I would certianly stay here again.

My adult daughter and I visited New York for my birthday and to experience the Christmas decorations. We checked in and were given a room upgrade to a suite. Our room was amazing. It was clean, spacious and was above our expectations. They even included complimentary robes for us. Also included was free wifi and a continental breakfast. The location was great and only a 2 minute walk to the subway. Everyone was friendly and helpful and went above and beyond to make our stay special. We were treated like family. The staff was amazing, especially Quoron, Bobby and Janet who is the Director of Sales & Marketing. We love the bag Janet gave us along with all the goodies. We will definitely be back and cannot wait to plan our next trip. Thank you to everyone at San Carlos.

My family of four stayed at the San Carlos at the end of October. I can only reiterate what others have commented upon in regards to this hotel. The location is perfect, walking distance to many great bars and restaurants in the immediate area. The room was spacious and the breakfast option plentiful. The hotel is very clean, extremely well maintained and easy to find. Part of its charm is the personalized service and very friendly nature of the staff. In particular I wanted to highly commend two individuals who really made the experience such a positive one. Baramee at reception knows his stuff. Each of his restaurant recommendations were absolutely spot on and places that we would have struggled to find without his local knowledge. One always remembers holidays for a variety of reasons - for our family the food experiences are key and so a big thanks. Andy at the door was absolutely first class. After we arrived after such a long trip his genuinely warm and friendly nature gave us that early reassurance that we had made the right call in terms of hotel choice. I was really impressed and over the next week both really went out of their way to ensure our experience in NYC was a great one. Congrats and thanks to both the guys and one of many reasons why I really rate this place highly and would return.

We are really excited about this place! First time here and very happy. We needed a spacious room for our family of 5. It has a kitchenette. Dinette table/area. Living room with pull out couch and a separate bedroom with 2 queens. A tv in both LR and BR. Very clean. Reminds me of someone’s apartment. Love it. Also location is pretty great. Definitely will be back when with the family and maybe otherwise!

Excellent service from all levels here. From turn down service to Bobby in the lobby surprising our kiddos with a limo ride back to the airport. Also, the front desk staff had fun with our kids and their coin tricks - thanks Gabrielle! Rooms are spacious for NYC and close to most everything!

San Carlos is a average hotel, the room was clean, comfy beds. Great location, near to all attractions. The staff was friendly especially Gabriel at the reception.The hotel offer a complimentary breakfast which is very poor, disposable dishes which for a 4 star hotel is not acceptable

Nice little property only a short walk from attractions, about 10 mins from 5th Avenue. Staff was friendly and able to accommodate an early check-in. Room was very spacious, had a king bed, living room area with pullout, small kitchenette, dining table, and 1 1/2 bathrooms. There were some small signs of wear, but overall very clean. Very little noise inside the hotel, it looked like each floor only had about 10 rooms on it and there was some space in-between them. The room I was in was at the end of the hall furthest from elevators in its own little alcove. The room was still only a minute walk from the elevators, which was convenient. The side of the hotel facing the street was noisy at night, but I would expect this from NYC hotels. It may be better to request a room on the opposite side of the hallway to minimize traffic noises- you aren't giving up much of a view.

I went with 3 friends to NYC to see the Opera. I found this hotel on a site and I must say that we were very satisfied with the location, the room and the breakfast. I would recommend this hotel for people looking to stay in mid-town. We might return !

Nice clean room, comfy bed/bedding, very good shower, TV, fast free WiFi....I will come back! Friendly staff. Price for the room a good value...hard to find in New York. Plenty of electricity plugs for chargers and computer.

It was the little details that rated only three stars: rusted surface on floor lamp; slow drain in the tub (it was like taking a shower and a bath at the same time); used pod still in the coffee machine. Probably won't stay here again.

We stayed here for a long week-end with friends. It was a most enjoyable stay. Rooms were clean, roomy, and well kept. Continental breakfast was supplied every morning and was delicious and sufficient. Just what we needed before sight seeing, San Carlos is centrally located for sight seeing New York City. We felt safe and the staff couldn't be nicer. We got a decent room rate. We will definitely stay here again when in NYC.

Good value for money in Manhattan with good location near subway station and fifth avenue shopping. Also complimentary breakfast available for all quest. Rooms are clean and spacious, fitness room and free wifi.

Amazing place in a very good location, great and clean room, very friendly and helpful staff. Major touristic spots are in a walking distance. This wasn't my first visit and I'll surely be back! Highly recommended!

We came here to celebrate my birthday. Spur of the moment reservation thru Hotwire . I was surprising pleased with this hotel .. they up graded us to a suite.. this has to be one of the most cleanest rooms we ever stayed in and we travel world wide. Thank you the wonderful staff here.

My wife and I stayed here for a weekend getaway to see the city and it was perfect! The staff was very welcoming and the location could not be better for seeing everything the city has to offer! If you want to go to NYC and have a great time, this is the place to stay!

We stayed at the San Carlos Hotel in Manhattan and it was average. Upon entry there was no doorman around and we found them talking to other employees and not acknowledging the patrons. I requested ice on several occasions and had to wait about an hour and a half for it to be delivered. The continental breakfast is nothing special and they serve very cheap food. The toilet was stopped up and their was a need for a surge protector to provide additional electrical outlets. The front desk staff was just OK and nothing special. The highlight was a doorman named Andy who appeared to know how to greet customer and provide good customer service. The beds are comfortable and the business center could use an update and some privacy. There are no premium channels on the television and there is no bar in this hotel.

Quad Deluxe- 2 Queen BedsIt was great! Nice big room, comfortable beds, free WiFi, full bathroom with tub. Excellent service. Five star! Highly recommend. Walking distance to Times Square, St. Patrick's Cathedral, Rockefeller Center and much, much more.

Excellent location. Very nice , clean and comfortable rooms. Very friendly front desk people. Love little details like the umbrellas at the entrance for a rainy day and that they let me leave my suitcase for few more hours after the checkout.

I've stayed at San Carlos numerous times.They have the best staff. Best front desk personnel. Very helpful. Very polite. Will go out of there way to accommodate you. Very clean rooms. I think this is the best hotel in new york city. Also located in walking distance to central park, time square, Rockefeller center, and more... I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting NEW YORK CITY.

My daughter & I stayed at the San Carlos for Columbus Day weekend. It was a birthday trip for her, and the hotel was very conveniently located to the American Girl store and other things she wanted to do. I would say the location was the selling point for us, and the price was decent for a Midtown hotel. Other than that, I'd say the accommodations were adequate but nothing spectacular. The room was well appointed with a large bathroom. It seemed clean enough, although I'll never understand why some hotels don't have full platform beds that don't allow anything to go under then. I couldn't bring myself to look under the bed, but my daughter said they were pretty dusty underneath and the carpet didn't smell great. The room showed some wear (slightly peeling wallpaper, hole in the duvet). The continental breakfast was also ok, with cereal, yogurt, pastries, juice & coffee. All in all, nothing spectacular, but adequate for our needs and our price point.

I have visited and stayed in the hotel many times . For business trips as well as for weeks while visiting Manhattan.The rooms are big ! Clean and very comfortable. The hotel crew is very friendly and supportive , excellent door service . WiFi connection is also available. The locations is Best due to the very close ( 200m) subway stations as well as nice collection of restaurants from fast east to high quality and expensive! Mostly recommended!

We stayed here the last week of September this year, fantastic stay! The staff are so friendly and very helpful when we needed to get around. They also made us reservations for dinner, and hailed taxis when needed as well. The room was great, we stayed in the 1BR Suite for the extra room. The beds were super comfy, the rooms was very clean, and we loved the extra space of the suite. The continental breakfast is just that, with rolls, yogurt, coffee and juice. Nothing fancy, but enough to get you started for the day. The hotel it self is right in the middle of everything, and within walking distance of several attractions, and the subway (which we felt quite safe on, even with my 8 yr. old daughter!) I would highly recommend a stay here, and we look forward to staying here again.

From the moment we pulled up I loved this place! Everyone greeted us warmly and we loved the doorman and the gentleman that checked us in. Room was very clean. Wifi and continental breakfast was a plus. Great hotel, great people and great location. Would stay again, and again.

Stayed in the Penthouse suite over Labor Day weekend. This room is spectacular with huge private terrace space and great views of the city. The bed was incredibly comfortable and room was fully equipped and immaculate. Beautiful large flat screen TV in the LR. The hotel is perfectly situated in midtown and the staff is friendly and helpful in every way. Couldn't have had a more enjoyable weekend!
user_name:
genels1109
New York City, New York

review_body: I have had the pleasure of sending friends and colleagues to the San Carlos Hotel for over 10 years. It is a quiet, lovely boutique hotel in mid-town. The moment you step in the lobby, you feel at home. The staff is welcoming, the rooms are beautifully kept. The halls are quiet, room service is excellent--location is great--near wonderful restaurants. I highly recommend it. In addition, the management is superb. A little gem tucked away in busy Manhattan.
user_name:
laura992017
New York City, New York

review_body: Most friendly and helpful receptionist ever, so lovely and great first impression of hotel. Couldn't have been more sweet, giving me directions to a function I was attending along with a helpful map, ensuring parking in car park and facilitating an early check in. If nothing else had gone right with hotel this lady ensured I would have left with a good impression. Fortunately everything about the hotel was exceptional, and I don't give praise lightly. It was clean, stylish, roomy with excellent service in both bar where we had lunch and restaurant where we had dinner. Food was beyond good and great value for money and service in both places attentive and efficient. Room itself was well equipped and comfortable. I could go on but suffice it to say I was very pleased with my stay, and although short and sweet this time, I hope to be back for a longer visit in the future.

The San Carlos Hotel is literally my home away from home! I travel frequently to New York and the San Carlos' location in Midtown Manhattan is perfect. Close to multiple subway stops and within walking distance to many of NYC's best attractions, including Rockefeller Plaza, Grand Central Terminal, shopping on Madison Ave to name a few. From the moment you arrive, the bellmen welcome you and whisk you inside to the front desk where you get checked-in expeditiously and answer any questions you have about the hotel or city, in general. The lobby has beautiful marble and appointments that extend to the guest rooms. The rooms and suites are large and very comfortable. All come with a microwave and refrigerator, an added amenity for the business traveler or family alike. There is a delicious continental breakfast every morning free of charge. The housekeeping staff does a wonderful job of keeping the rooms and public areas of the hotel clean and fresh looking at all times. The bathrooms and amenities are very clean and modern. Overall, I'm glad I discovered this gem! I will be bringing family and friends here with me to stay this holiday season. Thank you, again, San Carlos staff for making me feel like a member of the family!

I was required to go on a business trip to NYC. I thought to take the wife along and after a quick look at online reviews, I decided to give the San Carlos a try. It is was central to where I needed to be and its a short walk to Times Square or central Park. The greeting we received by the staff when checking in was second to none and we were quickly shown to our room. The bathroom was squeaky clean. It looked brand new. The towels had a nice floral scent which my girl commented on. The front desk folk were nice enough to suggest a few great restaurants nearby. We ended up getting dynamite Mexican food. There is a very comfortable room on the 2nd fl where you can get a little computer work done outside of the room. During the checkout the lady at the front desk sincerely asked if we enjoyed our stay. I can say we certainly did. Next time in the Big Apple I'll make it a point to stay again.

It was early morning on the 26th of September. I worked a 16 hour shift and wanted to crash somewhere nearby. I took a gander into the San Carlos hotel. People were raving about the service on Trip Advisor..... but then I arrived and asked for availability. I don't ever recall being as tired after a 16 hour shift and I thought the San Carlos hotel could b my new home for the night. Boy was I wrong. The person on duty. A male who was working the desk on September 26th early morning refused to tell me the rate. Actually leaned into me and said he didn't like my attitude. All I did was ask for availability and the rate. This is the worst experience in hospitality history. I am a hospitality professional. I cannot believe this man leaned into me and refueled my business. I needed a home for the evening and this man refused to give me a rate. And even a total price. I as looking for somewhere to stay until the need of the week. This man refused to tell me the p ice and yelled at me that it will be 514 plus change. Either you like it or leave it. I cannot believe the San Carlos hotel allows for this behavior. I thought this was a luxury hotel. But it wasn't. In fact it was the worst experience I've ever had In all my life.

My wife and I travel to New York City at least once a year. Since 2007 we have stayed at the San Carlos Hotel on each of those visits. Sometimes we stay for a week as we vacation in NYC. Sometimes we stay for a few days in conjunction with a trip to Europe. We live in California and a stop in New York is a great way to break up the trip. During our most recent stay we had just returned to the U.S., having started our day in Amsterdam. When we checked into the hotel, in the evening, we were quite tired. We received a complimentary upgrade to a suite. The especially large and very quiet room allowed us to get a good nights sleep and completely recharge our batteries.The staff at this hotel is second to none. They always make us feel as though they really appreciate our business. Since we have visited the hotel so frequently, some of the staff actually recall us by name. I want to make a special shout-out to Andy. Go Yankees!

Staying at the san carlos was just the best hotel ive stayed in and i have been to new york many times..rooms very beautiful and have everything you could desire including fully stocked mini bar, however for me it has to be said that the entire reception staff were amazing and made it feel almost like home from home,in particular gabriel who was super amazing..with friendly and professional staff as the san carlos has then who needs friends, goes without saying i will be returning in the very near future,if you happen to have as i did the pleasure of meeting janet then this experience will go to prove not only at reception level but even the very top level management are just as proffessional in welcoming you to there beautiful hotel.

We stayed at the San Carlos in New York for a week, travelling as a couple and then being joined by a family member later on. The hotel is right in the city centre, brilliantly located for 5th Avenue, Times Square, Central Park and the Chrysler Building. Taxi in from the airport was $70 plus a tip. The hotel is typical modern city centre hotel, lovely clean and spacious foyer. Check-in was fast, friendly and efficient - the staff were really helpful, especially about places to visit in NY - WELL DONE!The room was excellent - spacious, well furnished, clean, and well laid out, two double bed! TV was a good size and plenty of channels. Free Wi-Fi, a bit slow but adequate. Bathroom a decent size, bit of an odd mechanism to switch between taps and shower but once sorted everything was fine - everything clean, everything working! Beds were excellent, no noise from other guests. Point deducted for the aircon, which was noisy. Continental breakfast was included for our stay - a bonus upgrade! - so can't com plain too much - basically bread, bagels, pastries, very limited choice of cereals and fruit, yoghurt, juice, hot chocolate and coffee. All self service, and the breakfast room did get very crowded - but can't complain about free food. Directly opposite the hotel is a diner/luncheonette, and they do terrific breakfasts at a reasonable price, along with some really nice restaurants.Staff were incredibly helpful and friendly, even managing to find an extra room at short notice. WELL DONE!This is a really good hotel right in the centre of NY, and it is ideal for visiting the city. I would strongly recommend this hotel.PROS- great staff and service- great room and bathroom- free wifi- good bed- free continental breakfast- terrific for central NY visitingCONS- wifi a bit slow- aircon a bit noisy(but we were so tired from sight seeing we didn't really notice :))

Location and price make the San Carlos a good choice. Don't expect luxury...nice with no frills and close to Times Square, Rockefeller Plaza and the shows. Continental breakfast that is pretty much standard.

Just stayed in the San Carlos September 2017. What a fabulous hotel. The rooms are spacious and clean. Beds really comfortable.The staff were really helpful and recommended a great restaurant for us to try on our first night as we arrived late.You will not be disappointed staying here.

Our family stayed at the San Carlos over Labor Day Weekend. The hotel itself was clean and in a great location. However the best part was the fabulous staff!!!!! They were helpful, kind and took the time to make sure our stay was fabulous! Here is a big shout out to Handsome Handy Andy, Bobby in the Lobby and Angel Gabriel!!! All of you brightened our day! This will be our hotel location for all future NYC trips!!!!! FIVE STARS⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

We stayed in the hotel for 8 nights and had a great time. The staff were more than helpful, nothing was too much for them. They helped us arrive at places, went out of their way to assist and even collected my laundry at the hotel when I didn't have enough money to pay at the shop. The breakfast was more than adequate, it had free wifi, printing facilities. This hotel helped make my first trip to NY most memorable. Would certainly return to the hotel again.Debbie and David, Israel

This hotel is in a great location. Just minutes away from downtown manhattan or uptown manhattan. Friendly staff. Clean and well kept hotel. The rooms are spacious and comfy. Stood here for a weekend and I must say it was a great stay. I would recommend this hotel and yes I would stay here again.
user_name:
BrendaB815
New York City, New York

review_body: Large clean room and bathroom. Quiet location. Good breakfast. Staff very friendly .Given late check out which was really good as we had teatime flight. Able to do last minute things and then freshen up ready for journey home..

The San Carlos Hotel is very well located. The staff is amazing - very helpful and always happy to help their guest with accurate recommendations. The double rooms are very spacious and very nice - very clean as well. You really get your money for value. Highly recommended.

The staff here are indeed extremely friendly and helpful. Front desk and concierge get 6 stars. All requests dealt with first time on time. First class. The room is nice and had we not stayed at The Kimberly across the street previously we would have agreed with what others have said. However the room is smaller, has no balcony and the air con units stick out from the windows eating up more space. Fittings in our room were tired, especially the bathroom. The hotel is indeed quiet and the night we stayed we rested well. The problem is the price, we paid double the rate almost of a newly rennovated luxury suite in the Kimberly!..and I'm afraid it is not as good. Maybe we just got a poor deal. Breakfast was included but we were genuinely shocked by the poor quality of this. Continental fair that was all dry and mostly inedible. No choice of cereals or juices (1 of each). Also situated in a small room where you feel you are tripping over other guests. Several had to lift hot coffee over the heads of my children to get through the tables for example. Not safe and not comfortable. So value on that was negligible. So overall a tired building and poor breakfast are letting down what clearly are superb staff. Pricing needs to be adjusted to reflect the real standard, not the photos you see online.

This was our first trip to NYC and had no notion of where to stay. After reading many reviews we decided to stay at the San Carlos. We were there 10 days and it was perfect. The rooms are immaculately clean and the service is superb. The staff is friendly, accommodating and knowledgeable. They always had a smile. The breakfast is good. It is typical continental breakfast. It was good enough for us when we were in a rush. The location is perfect. Quiet area but very central. Just a few blocks from 5th avenue and the Waldorf Astoria. If you are like us and like to do your research about a place before you book, don't look any further. This is absolutely the best. We will be back in December and already looked at availability before we checked out. That's how much we liked it!

Had a delightful 4 nights at the San Carlos in Manhatten. The rooms were lovely, clean and comfortable. The staff was very accommodating and good to work with. The location is close to many attractions and the subway. I wished for a bit more extensive breakfast with more choices. The bread products were not as fresh as they. Old have been. I did enjoy that they offered Hot Chocolate as well as coffee, milk and juices.

This hotel has very good position on the quiet street, close to the main attractions. We came to this hotel late night, but staff was very polite and my 7 old year daughter got the Teddy bear. Room and air condition was perfect. The only, but main problem was small breakfast room worth limited offer compared to other 4 star U.S. hotels, where we stayed.

Stayed here for the 2nd time again for 2 weeks. Room had 2 queen beds, with separate living area with sofa bed, small dining table and kitchen with fridge etc. Lots of space for hubby and I with 2 young kids and my mum. Even had a welcome basket full of goodies for when we arrived which the kids loved. All staff are absolutely wonderful there and they always made sure they had time to speak to my autistic son and made him feel so welcome each time. My son felt comfortable and relaxed staying there. They have umbrellas for you to barrow if it was raining. Breakfast area can be crowded at peak times but didn't have to wait long for a table. It is self service but sometimes people failed to clear the tables after which was annoying. There's only one member of staff there to restock the food etc and it's not her job to clear the tables for next guests. Shes got a lot to do already and is always aware when things are low so she's always in and out to restock things as fast as she can. I don't think there's enough room to have another member of staff there. The food I found plenty to fill you up before your day-bagels, toasts, muffins, yoghurts, cereals along with coffee, tea, orange juice. Location is fab and central to go anywhere. Mcds, cvs round corner. Chinese, Indians, pizza places etc for takeaways not far.Would definitely recommend and only really want to stay there each time we come. Couldn't get a room last year but glad we got a room again this year

We really enjoyed this hotel. We were only there for one night but found it to be a really friendly place. The staff are so friendly and helpful - Gabriel on the main desk was a real character and took the time to talk to us and the children, who found him fascinating.We had a spacious one bedroom apartment which slept the 5 of us well. The breakfast was plentiful, but very crowded, so if you visit be prepared to grab a trayful and take it out of the breakfast area. When we checked out they were happy to take care of our luggage until we flew - Gabriel said 'of course, this is your home'. Thanks!

My two friends and I stayed in their Jr. Suite with a king bed and a pull out sofa bed. I slept on the sofa and was pleasantly surprised at how comfortable it was. We stayed on the 10th floor and it was very quiet. No view--but who cares? I wasn't there for a view of the city from my hotel room! The room was very clean with Aveda amenities (which are very nice.) We loved having the mini-kitchenette with the microwave and fridge. Convenient for holding our Junior's cheesecake left-overs! The staff was very pleasant and helpful. San Carlos is also very well located with an easy walk to Rockefeller Center and Times Square. Also, it's one block from the 6 line and 3 blocks from the 4 line. Overall a wonderful stay and I would definitely stay here again!

Very reasonably priced roomy double queen room with mini kitchen amenities. Short walk to subway and buses. Staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Continental breakfast included which would be a bonus except for the plastic plates and cutlery and the emphasis on pastries and buns. Would definitely recommend staying there.

TThe staff at the front desk is very helpful fulfilling requests. Very important to me because I have stayed at the hotel multiple times is that the front desk staff has been consistent for all of my recent visits. They have been friendly and quick to answer my questions. When I have returned, they have remembered my preferences. Their consistency and attention to my requests has made this hotel a "go to" location in New York City.

San Carlos Hotel is a great place to rest if you go to NYC. It is near the Subway (51st Street, 5,6,E) the rooms are comfy...However the breakfast doesn't give a lot of choices (it's a continental breakfast). The staff is really cool and here if you have any questions !

One of the only places in NYC for affordable 2 queen rooms! Very good location for sightseeing. The room had a microwave and mini fridge and a free breakfast, which was packed if you went anytime after 7:30. Good value for the product. Very nice staff, clean room. Our room view was a brick wall but we didn't care because it was quiet. We were on 10th floor. 1 mile from Central Park, a few blocks to the Subway, Great bagel place on 3rd/50th across the street, half a mile to Rockefeller Center, .9 mile to Times Square. I would definitely stay here again! Restaurant tips: Refinery Hotel Rooftop Restaurant was awesome and so unexpected! It is at 38th. Plenty of great Italian food nearby, Walgreens for groceries, nice steakhouses, McDonald's for $1 sodas. TKTS booth at Times Square for 50% off day of Broadway shows. Use the TKTS App so you know shows they have that day before you venture down there. We went to Carlo's Bakery in Hoboken and loved that town! Took the subway to 42nd street and got off to take the PATH bus to Hoboken. Loved that trip! Lots of Italian Restaurants there as well and good shopping on the street that Carlo's is on. Loved NYC!

Stayed for four nights in elite room. Very well equipped and reasonable rates. Breakfast ok free with room but exceptional good value as New York is very expensive,would recommend to walk round 3rd and 2nd avenue for deals on restaurants just a few minutes walk from the hotel.Very convenient for metro and on good connections for downtown attractions,but convenient to walk to most attractions in ten to fifteen minutes.Hotel staff very attentive and very clean in all areas,handy business centre to book online and print tickets(also very good wifi in room)I suppose only downfall was the building works next door but didn't worry me too much and quite interesting walking by everyday.Well done I will be back to stay thanks

The San Carlos did a great job taking care of me. The rooms were nothing fancy but they got the job done. Great customer service! Clean and very attentive. I would certainly go back! I felt safe and taken care of at the San Carlos

This hotel was a great find! A few blocks from Times Square, in a less crowded and more quiet area. Not far from a subway station making travel around the city easy. The rooms were clean, staff was friendly, and the attached Indian restaurant was delicious! The continental breakfast is essentially pastries, yogurt, cereal, apples, and coffee/juice. Not the greatest selection but good enough to get you going for the day. It was very convenient having a fridge and microwave in the room. The rooms are comparable in size to hotels I've stayed in in other parts of the country. The only downfalls were our window faced an alley/brick wall (but I imagine if you pay for a more deluxe suite you would get a better view, we had a basic 2 queen bed room), and the construction of the Waldorf-Astoria next door which could be noisy at times. Overall, I would definitely stay here again!!

Perfect location, very clean, very well maintained and lovely stuff providing friendly, efficient and professional service.Rooms are shiny clean, beds are comfortable.Small but well equipped and well maintained gym.Breakfast is sufficient.The San Carlos is home away from home in the midst of crazy midtown manhattan.Very good choice for both business trips and family city vacation.Great value for money.Love the San Carlos!

The San Carlos is a wonderful hotel with a very courteous and friendly staff. Our trip in June with our granddaughter had been planned for some time and we let her choose which hotel we would stay in (from a screened list, of course). She chose the San Carlos based on its proximity to Ess-A-Bagel (see my next review for that). What we hadn't realized was that it sits smack on the crosstown bus route. What a deal! While our granddaughter but 10 years old, she is a seasoned traveler and we don't spend our money on taxis or Uber'ing. There are too many other places to leave your money.But enough background. If you're reading this, you want to know about the hotel. I will repeat that the staff is fantastic! From the front desk to the doorman to the housekeepers, you are made to feel welcome from the start. We stayed in a junior suite that offered a king bed in one area with a sofa bed in the sitting area. The room was a nice size but we did have to move the coffee table into the eating area to open up the bed. There is a very functional kitchenette with a refrigerator, microwave, coffeemaker and sink that was very convenient. It was nice to be able to bring leftovers back to the room.There was only one television, which makes sense since the sound of two would have conflicted but it is well situated and could be easily angled so that it could be viewed from both bed. The only conflict was which channel it was set to (remember the part about the granddaughter).The room safe was not operational but we didn't mention it to housekeeping or the front desk until we left as we really didn't need it. I suspect they resolved the matter.The bed was very comfortable, the linens were of good quality and the bathroom was well appointed but had little room to put shave kits or makeup bags. The shower uses a curtain rather than glass but that is likely a matter of age. The hotel has been there a while and little things like that make that obvious but most everything has been updated. Comfort is key to us and we were all happy with the San Carlos.The San Carlos is right across the street from the Kimberly, which is about 25% more and is probably more upscale but unless you intend on spending a lot of time in your hotel, why would you pay the difference? We were there on vacation and the inside of any hotel isn't what we came to see.Need to sleep? This place is very quiet. It was unusual to even hear police sirens and being on 50th between 3rd and Lexington puts it in a high traffic area.We like our room a little chilly and our first two days were greeted by mid-90s, deadly hot, but the room was comfortable the entire time and the housekeeping staff did not take it upon themselves to reset our air conditioner setting when they did the room. Nothing is more irritating than a housekeeper (or hotel policy) that resets the thermostat as a part of making up the room. When you've worn yourself out in blistering heat, you don't want to come back to a stuffy room regardless of the time.As for the continental breakfast, I'm not sure what continent they were thinking of. It is pretty dismal. This is my only detracting statement about the San Carlos. They would be better off disarming their clients of deadly disks that are supposed to be pastries. Yesterday's grocery store Danish that was used for display the day before isn't appetizing ... and you could break a tooth. The coffee is good enough (a positive thing) but overall, not so much on that score.In summary, we'll stay there again and again. Being able to catch the crosstown from Time Square and getting dropped on either Lexington and 50th or 3rd and 50th makes this place too convenient. Going the other direction, the 49th St stop is just steps away. Of course, uptown/downtown busses run both Lexington and 3rd and the Lexington/53 subway station is just a few short blocks north.Traveler note concerning the subway. If you come from the airport using the subway go out the Lexington exit versus the 3rd Ave exit. The 3rd Ave exit is about a million stairs with no elevator ... hauling luggage up those stairs is a real workout.Last word ... stay at the San Carlos ... you won't be sorry.

Hotel San Carlos is a great hotel with a great central location in New York. We stayed for a family visit and this was perfect for what we needed with continental breakfast. The rooms were spacious and comfortably slept three. As well as this, they were clean and had a great cleaning rota.Overall, this was a good, functional hotel. Location alone this is well worth paying for.

Stayed at the hotel for a long weekend with my daughter and her friends. As there is so much choice and some well know chains to pick from in New York, I had been a little worried after booking. I shouldn't have been. When we arrived the staff were so welcoming and friendly. We were offered the choice of room and picked one on the third floor as it had one and half bathrooms. We had a one bedroom apartment. The room was large, very clean and comfortable. We had lovely soft fresh towels each day, and as there were 4 of us just after check in the maid came with a large bag of toiletries and extra towels. Each morning breakfast is served between 7am and 10am - there is very limited seating but you can take it back to your room so not really an issue. The breakfast choice is limited but adequate. The location of the hotel could not have been any better to explore all the main sites and we got to see everything during the weekend. On the Saturday we woke up to find the next street closed as there was a market which was lovely and also meant that the hotel was quiet that morning which was a bonus as some of the streets can be very noisy but this one wasn't. Would definitely return and highly recommend Trip - we had book airport transfer's via the hotel but found out that all taxis have a fix fee to the airport which was half the price of the one offered by the hotel. About $60! We did have to go out and flag one down but this is very easy in New York.

I booked San Carlos via Hotel Tonight for myself and my colleague. Normally I stay in Hells Kitchen, Midtown and TriBeCa for work - about 80 nights per year in NYC. This hotel deserves this review first on outstanding customer service, especially Evelyn at the front desk. We were orginally booked in a smaller room but given our situation Evelyn was patient and committed to finding us a more suitable room. We ended up in gorgeous suite with kitchenette and little living room. Very classy, updated finishes and beautiful bathroom. After the customer service, excellent room I would say the convenience of the location to me by surprise. The E, M and 6 train are around the corner which was perfect to getting easily to our all destinations including Penn Station. So all the transportation convenience of Hells Kitchen Midtown West but without the frenetic chaos. Lots of nearby restaurants as well. I highly recommend this location. 5 stars.

From the bellman who met us with a smile at the door when we checked in until he helped us out with our bags 24 hours later our stay at the San Carlos was Terrific! If we had not had non-refundable reservations, we would have extended our stay at the San Carlos. Such a stand-out for NYC because of the large-sized room, in-room refrigerator, and in-room coffee maker. Friendly, helpful staff. Stored our luggage after checkout while we went on a tour and until we were able to check into our next hotel. Close to so many restaurants and sights. Parking is a couple of blocks away and the price is very reasonable. Continental breakfast included--unheard of in NYC! A gem!

We really enjoyed our stay at the San Carlos Hotel. It is on the east side, in a nice area with lots of good restaurants. The staff was so nice and accommodating --- they let us check in early, held our bag after we checked out, validated our parking for a discount, and the best part --- they upgraded us to a suite when I told them it was our anniversary! The bed was very comfortable, the bathroom was a good size and we didn't hear any street noise.

We had an great price by calling the hotel for a reservation. Loved the space in the room (large room with comfortable beds including linens and towels, and mini-fridge), the front staff were friendly and helpful. Held our luggage before check-in and check-out which was fabulous. It was a great location with subway, restaurants, and even a pharmacy nearby! Would not hesitate to stay there again!!!!!

The service was curteous and delivered with a small. The room was small and the window gave out on to another wall. But I slept well, and the shower worked fine. It was rather loud because of the building work next door. All the staff are constantly smiling and wishing you a great day. Welcome to New York.

Just returned from a 5 day trip to NYC with our family and we can't say enough great things about this hotel! From the minute we checked in we were amazed. Upon arrival the OWNER of the hotel greeted us in the lobby and brought us back to his office area where he presented my 6 year old with a stuffed bear. Everyone we encountered at this hotel went out of their way to make us feel welcome and well cared for. The rooms were huge for any city but for NYC were unbelievable. The free breakfast was a nice perk. The location is hard to beat--walking distance to big attractions but away enough to be quite. 51st street station is half a block away with easy connections to everywhere in the city. Wifi was great, coffee makers in the rooms with fridge and microwave. Pull out couch and 1.5 bathrooms. Perfect space for families visiting the city! This hotel set our family up for such a nice vacation, and we'll choose it every time we return. Thanks!

At the suggestion of a family member, my wife and I stayed here on a Saturday & Sunday in June 2017. We took Amtrak to NY from Virginia and the hotel was easily accessible via the E Train from Penn Station. Check-in (and continental breakfasts the next couple of days) were handled very efficiently by a personable and attentive staff. We liked our room (1206) because it was on the back side of the hotel and very quiet. Particularly noteworthy is that the room was large by New York standards, extremely clean and very well furnished, including a mini-kitchen complete with eating utensils. There are plenty of restaurants nearby. Consider the one right next door, Spice Symphony for an Indian/Asian experience. The San Carlos will be our hotel of choice in Manhattan.

Hotel room gorgeous. 9th floor twin room. Very spacious, nice & quiet despite building works going on next door. Staff very friendly& helpful. The only disappointment was the 'free breakfast'. As I am milk intolerant there was only breads, toast, spread cheese & jam. My friend likes cereal but they were mostly sugar coated which she didn't like

We stayed from Friday to Tuesday.... A family of 4 and couldn't fault one thing about our stay.Room was on the 9th floor and at the rear of the property so very little noise. Beds were comfortable and the room was well equipped.The continental breakfast is complimentary regardless of who you make the booking through. Some external booking engines quote a higher price for breakfast inclusive so don't be fooled by this. All residents of the hotel get the complimentary breakfast which was absolutely enjoyed by us each morning of our stay. Staff are really great and in particular those at reception. Check in and check out were seamless. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone. It's well located with access to JFK by way of the E train from the subway at 53rd and Lexington and then a change at Jamaica for the airport.

Great hotel. Spacious room by NYC standards. Hotel was very responsive to all our needs. At one point we needed extra towels-they arrived within 10 minutes! Great to have breakfast and go on our way for the day. About a mile from Time Square so it was in a nice quiet part of the city!

We have recently stayed for twelve days at the San Carlos Hotel (May 2017), as we have been doing for the last nine or ten years. Besides having excellent accomodations and amenities, breakfast included, the staff is extremely attentive and helpful, making our overall experience a memorable one. The San Carlos has also an excellent location, near very good restaurants and stores, also very near subway and bus stations which takes us anywhere in the city. It is at an easy walking distance to most important places. It is also located in a not so busy part of the city, so it is nicer when we return to rest. In short we love to stay there and feel very much at home always.
user_name:
Glaucia V
Rio de Janeiro, RJ

review_body: We were warmly greeted AND upgraded by Gabriel and his staff. Our one bedroom suite was roomy and had everything we needed. It was nice having the kitchenette with fridge, microwave, sink and dishes/cutlery. There was little noise and the temperature of the room was perfect. The beds were comfortable with down, and the pillows as well. On our first morning upon leaving to sightsee, it was our friends' birthday, and we were asked to stop by front desk. She was presented with a bag of goodies including wine, and the Birthday song sung by the desk staff. We felt very comfortable staying here and the easy access to other dining, coffee shops, shopping and subway. Shout out to the San Carlos staff! We would definitely stay here again!

Great hotel for family of 5 - plenty of space in a suite. Good location with lots to do within walking distance and subway just a block away. Continental breakfast a bonus. Staff all really helpful. Great recommendation of local restaurant from doorman Andy.

Traveled to NY with 2 girlfriends and needed a room with 2 quuen beds. Not easy to find! The San Carlos fit our needs and by NY standards, the standard guest room was HUGE! Staff very friendly, great location and contintental breakfast an added bonus. Highly recommend!

Good size room for a Manhattan hotel. The staff is very nice and friendly. The location is superb. One block from a subway station and 5 minute walk to Central Station, Radio Music City Hall, Rockefeller Center, Central Park and many more attractions. The complimentary breakfast has limited variety but for a Continental breakfast is enough. Normally you have to have breakfast early because the dining room is small so it's very probably that you can't get a table.

We took a suite in the San Carlos and loved it! The excellent service, the appointments in the room -- everything was really really nice. We will only stay at the San Carlos from now on!The rooms were lovely and so accommodating. The bed was incredibly comfortable -- we hated to leave! The staff is 100% excellent and were sincere about the care they gave to insure all our needs were met beyond satisfactorily. We highly recommend this hotel!Breakfast was included in the stay but it was more just rolls and fruit and yogurts, juice and coffee -- but enough to get your day on! There was not a restaurant in the hotel outside of the breakfast room -- but this is NY! Not necessary!

This is a fantastic upscale boutique hotel on the east side in midtown. Stayed here for a quick weekened getaway and found the rooms spacious and clean...and the service absolutely impeccable. The front desk staff was polite, friendlly, engaging and extremely helpful. Loved the location. It was an easy walk to 5th Avenue...and we found our way to the Theatre District and Times Square quite easily. Very nice continental breakfast. Would stay here again in a New York minute!

This is a good hotel, rooms are clean, beds are comfortable, staff are courteous. The lobby is relatively simple compared to a lot of hotels in New York. There are many good restaurants in the area. A relatively short walk from Grand Central Station.Our room faced another building that seemed close enough to touch, but we did not have the city noise had we been facing the street front. Short comings include you have to go down to the lobby to get ice, and the complementary breakfast has a carb focus that leaves you a bit bloated. Of course I didn't have to eat the extra corn muffin on top of the sweet rolls... Went across the street for a normal breakfast the next morning, but can't really say it was any healthier, and I spent $30 (three of us) that I could have saved had I only been able to stomach the danish. I'm not sure we would stay there again, through no fault of the hotel. Most of what we wanted to see was further west in the city, so lots more walking than we would have liked. If that's not an issue than overall this is a good hotel.

I attended a meeting in NYC and my wife found this hotel, where she stayed about 1 month before. We got a junior suite and for the price and space, it was a very good deal. The hotel has been updated from an older building, not extravagant, but clean and nice. The check-in staff was very helpful and fun when we arrived, he even entertained our son with a slick magic trick with some coins. Would stay again in the future.

This hotel has much to offer: good location, quiet rooms, good service, and a breakfast (of sorts). The decor is dated but certainly good enough. We had a two room suite which gave us lots of space and a little kitchenette area that was very convenient. It's nice to have a refrigerator for snacks, wine, cheese, etc. I hate to complain about the breakfast as it's a real plus to have one available at all but it was the same every day. A different fruit each day would have been welcome and maybe more varieties of cereal. We ended up paying $500 a night after all the taxes and fees were added on but I suppose that's common for New York. All in all we'd stay there again.

Neg- Rooms are dated, room booking said with view, but view of brick wall. Front desk at check-in didn't seem to care even after I politely explained the room view was part of my decision process to go with them. No on premise parking. Self parking 2 avenues away, not that convenient for a 4+ star hotel. Bellman got upset with me for using a luggage cart to bring my luggage to lobby from the room, stating I shouldn't be using that, only hotel staff. Breakfast was average and overly crowded, no space to move around. Pros - room size, allow rollaway, location is nice, beds are comfy, restaurant next door is really good, old gentleman at front desk very hospitable, hotel president very nice, free internet, pricey for weekend stay ($375/night) and given amenities.

I took a redeye and arrived exhausted and too early to check in. At the front desk was a young man named Michael who was so cordial and gracious and helpful that I knew before I left the premises I would have to let you know how valuable an employee he is. I am sorry you don't have a more direct way for me to give you feedback about your staff, but when I checked out I asked and this is apparently the way you get feedback.
user_name:
asalwaysalice
New York City, New York

review_body: We were here for 4 nights and were very happy with our stay. Our room was very quiet-quite a surprise in NYC. The room was clean and comfortable and the staff was very friendly and helpful. I do wish there were a few gluten free, healthy options for breakfast other then apples...but aside from that, I would definitely stay here again.

So close to 5th Ave, Park Ave. Hop on Buses and a short walking distance to Central Park Attentive staff and c to so much of what NY has to offer. A must stay for anyone that wishes to be close to the action, Restaurants, clubs and especially shopping. I agree with another review that the Continental can be better but with great coffee shops across and down the street not much of a loss there.

Premium rooms are spacious and completely furnished. They include suite style additional living room, small breakfast kitchen area and walk in closet. Very clean and well maintained, always great for a treat. Like home away from home.

We have been trying several of the boutique hotels on this street. The San Carlos is tied for first place with its only shortcoming being the continental breakfast - its just that and in our opinion could be improved upon. In every other way it was flawless - the room was meticulously clean which is extremely important to me. The staff were friendly and helpful, the business center (we didn't use) looked lovely and so did the gym (which we didn't use). We booked a 1 BR suite and it was quiet, roomy and perfect for our needs with a fridge, microwave, sink and all one needs for an extended stay in NYC. We asked them to make up the sofa bed while we went out for dinner because one of use caught a cold and when we returned it was done as requested - with a chocolate! Prices are close on these hotels but one of them has slightly more in "extras". Is that a tie breaker? Not sure.

This place is just perfect. We stayed here for 5 nights in May based on a recommendation that we had gotten fromOthers who had stayed there. It is so central to everywhere, it is lovely and clean and the major surprise for the location is the amount of space you get in the rooms. The breakfast Is small but given the price of the hotel it is great value. Would absolutely recommend staying here when you are visiting New York.

Always looking for small boutique type hotels in cities. The San Carlos fit the bill. Check in was easy and staff helpful. Room was not ready but they offered storage of bags. When we arrived to the room we found a gift basket from Sales Manager Johanna Vargas nice touch and much appreciated as it was my husbands birthday. The room was clean average size and well appointed. All staff that we interacted with where very nice and friendly. The complimentary breakfast had a nice selection of items and is a nice bonus for families staying in NYC. I also appreciated the discounted parking at local garage that the hotel offers. I would definitely stay again as this was a great location for exploring Manhattan.Thanks for a pleasant weekend.

This hotel has large rooms, friendly and helpful staff, free breakfast and internet. We stayed 4 days. Our suite had a large bedroom and livingroom with two TV's. The hotel is a short walk to Times Square and Central Park. It was a delightful place to stay in New York.

I booked this hotel for our party of 5 people and were not disappointed. The location is unbeatable, the room unusually very large (it had 2 separate big areas, bedroom with 2 queen beds and a very large living room with a sofa bed and a nice kitchen) and with all comforts (good quality amenities). It was also very clean and the staff nice. The heater did not work in our room and we were moved to another room very quickly and were also offered a basket with wine, water, cookies etc. The only thing which disappointed us was the breakfast, because it had very few items and of low quality (really bad Danish pastry) and no hot food...even only a waffle machine will do here! Come on manager, guests will appreciate that! :-) We highly recommend it, as you'll be in the middle of everything at a very good rate!

We stayed for three nights over spring break with our 12 and 14 year old sons and the hotel was fantastic. The room was spacious and clean, the staff are very friendly, and it was perfectly located as an easy walk to Central Park and the theater district, while avoiding the madness of Times Square area. Also, the restaurant next door is fantastic, an Indian/Chinese fusion- we had one of our best meals there. Only cons I would say are minimalist fitness room (but about what you would expect in the city) and breakfast was typical continental fare although it suited by sons fine.The staff really did go above and beyond. We had left my son's school ipad charger in the room and the hotel mailed it to us at home!Recommend highly!

This was our second stay at San Carlos Hotel. This is a very nice boutique hotel and everyone pays a lot of attention to detail. Great room and great stay. The only negative and reason for 4 stars instead of 5 would be the lack of a nice hotel bar and restaurant.

SPACIOUS room! Sleeping area (with the bed and side tables), comfortable chair sitting area, eating area (with table, 2 chairs, small refrigerator, microwave, dishes, silverware), large desk, and bathroom (with tub/shower and sink with counter to keep stuff on). Staff was very friendly and helpful. High-rise construction next door, but they put us in the opposite side of the hotel and construction stops at night. Free wifi in public spaces and room. Also had a computers and business area available. Would definitely go back. Elevator at NE corner of 52nd and Lexington down to metro.

But not a 4,5 star. We had booked three executive jr suites. On got an upgrade to a suit, one were placed at the sixth floor in a nice room and one got a dungeon on the fourth. Luckily we managed to change and got a similar room as the one on the sixth. This was a big room with light and a kitchenette shaped like a bar. So far so good. But the bar and the restaurant is not in the hotel. It's just next door but not the "lobby bar" and in house restaurant we were expecting. The complimentary breakfast was complimentary, but not continental. The only healthy thing to choose was an apple and yogurt. They could have made an effort to at least have some ham or cheese and one healthy cereal. The gym were as expected. Not big, but with the equipment you need. Only thing I missed was some music or a tv to watch without earplugs. As I started, the staff saved the stay. I would have given three, but comparing to my other visitation to NYC and my expectations this was poor.

Great place to stay in midtown. Walking distance to many attractions including Times Square and Central Park. Room spacious for 5 of us and clean. Staff very helpful and complimentary breakfast. Would stay again and recommend.

Cozy, charming and very clean. The San Carlos offers a refuge after a hectic day in New York. One can walk everywhere and there are plenty of little restaurants and shops in the area . Very good value for money.

Stayed here when I went over for Paddys Day 2017. Nice clean hotel, would definitely come back to stay here. Good location and decently priced considering the location. I referred friends and family & got positive feedback.

When visiting NYC I usually stay on the west side to be in Times Square and near the Broadway theaters.I bought a stay at the San Carlos at a charity auction and was rewarded beyond my wildest dreams. Hotel is lovely, charming, immaculate and has the most delightful staff. The location is fabulous. I was traveling with my granddaughter. It was an easy walk to the UN Building for a tour. The East river practically at our doorstep. We walked to all the avenues (5th , Madison, 7th) and the Broadway theaters.Our room had the most comfortable queen beds with elegant linens and comforters. I will definitely return. It was a lovely experience. Loved meeting Janet and Gabriel. The San Carlos gave our New York adventure an extra plus.

I have been working with the San Carlos both personally and for business events for some time now. It's a great hotel for a great value but my favorite thing about it is the sense of hospitality they provide their guests. When you step in there is refreshing sense of class. The Penthouse is available to rent for events (corporate in my case) and is spectacular. The garden terrace features views of midtown that you can't find anywhere else. The gardening, finishes, and touches provide a sense of delicacy that is often lost in modern hospitality. The service is impeccable. I personally work with Janet to organize the events and never have to worry about peace of mind. I have referred friends and family and always gotten positive feedback. Would highly recommend for a stay in midtown.
user_name:
karstadtdan
New York City, New York

review_body: i stayed in this hotel for a week during a work seminar. We started the day at 8 and finished at 8 in the evening - coming back to the room that was clean and cozy! a nice refrigerator , coffee etc.. just what one needs to rejuvenate after a long day

I have to review the San Carlos for the benefit of those searching g for the perfect NYV hotel. I booked probably 5 hotels (with cancellations possible) before I settled on San Carlos. We could not have been happier with our accommodations! The room we had slept 6 comfortably. A sleeper sofa in the living area was most comfortable, unlike most sleeper sofas this one ( y Flexsteele) was cushioned and very comfortable. Two queen size beds in the bedroom were excellent. Kitchenette, included table for two, small fridge , sink, microwave, coffee pot, tableware, wine glasses, etc. Staff extremely courteous and helpful in giving directions! Breakfast included. Do t expect eggs, sausage gravy and waffles, but most adequate. Toast, muffins, sweet rolls, yogurt, apples, orange juice, coffee. More than enough to get you goi g for the day. Also milk and cereal available. I highly recommend San Carlos. Subways close by and within walking distance of many top tourist attractions. Starbucks half block away.

Family of five stayed in a Suite for five nights during March. Hotel was clean and a very good place to stay. We found the people at the San Carlos to be very welcoming and helpful. It was nice to see the same faces working in the lobby each morning and evening as we came and went. The location was good as we could easily walk most places we wanted to visit - Rockefeller Center, Times Square, Grand Central Station. Subway was nearby also. The room had a mid size refrigerator, microwave and coffee pot. We got some some food/drink supplies at a nearby Duane Reed drugstore. Very convenient. The breakfast each morning was good and helped with the expense of feeding 5 people each morning. I would most definitely stay at this hotel again.

This was my 4th visit to this hotel - but my first time in winter, and my first time with my husband and 18yo son. I adore the consistency of service here AND the amazing location. You are within walking distance of Central Park, Grand Central Station, Broadway shows, 5th Avenue, Rockefeller Centre, Times Square and many amazing restaurants!! There a is a subway station at 51st & Lexington (literally around the corner) and another at 53rd & Lexington (only one block further!) - so you have easy access to everywhere in Manhattan. The reception staff, doorman and porters are friendly, helpful and informative. Breakfast is included, and while  M g basic it is more than adequate. The rooms are a great size - and the suites even better with REALLY comfortable beds and great water pressure!! PLUS they have an empty bar fridge, microwave, sink, crockery, cutlery, tea and coffee making facilities, TOILETTRIES,

How can such an efficient, beautiful, centrally located with wonderful staff hotel be holding such a reasonable prices? Coming here is like winning the jackpot. There are Allways minor things to make better, but they are redundant to the wonderful experience the hotel and staff makes. Will definitely makes this my prime location in NYC. Don't bother with any other hotel. Thank you, San carlos hotel...

I've been on "hiatus" from TripAdvisor for some time. I've had several vacations/trips and stayed in many hotels, but they have been marginal or average, so I declined to review them via TripAdvisor. But our last short trip to New York changed that, as we stayed at the San Carlos Hotel. I'll take you from start to finish:Arrival inside hotel....Updated high end decor. Tile/marble entry and lobby area, with ample sitting/lounge areas.Check in...Lightning fast. Booked through Expedia, so just provided them with credit card information for incidentals. Done in less than three minutes.Room 905...Large and appeared to have been recently updated. Desk area, large chair with ottoman, iron and ironing board, trouser/pant press, microwave, refrigerator and coffee maker. Bathroom was average in size but clean, no lack of hot water issues. The noise level of the room from outside resources was almost silent. Not sure if it was due the height (ninth floor) or upgrades via soundproofing. Continental breakfast. FREE. Plenty of yogurt, pastries, bagels, breads, coffee, orange juice, etc. PLENTY of tables and seats, which is very uncommon for New York City hotels.Location. Perfect Midtown area, walk to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Theater District and Central Park. Checkout. Faster than check in.Value for the Money. Absolutely. We visit New York City yearly and the San Carlos Hotel, by far, has been the best.

Made an account specifically to give this place the review it deserves. My family of three kids, all 6 or under, has stayed there several times now. It's friendly, offers great service, and the rooms are fantastic.* The owner sometimes invites families with kids back to his office. He chats about whatever - history, New York, his family - and gives the kids little gifts. Reminds you of the way airlines used to treat little kids, inviting them up to the cockpit and giving them pilot wings.* The suites with the two queen beds are HUGE by Manhattan standards. Dining alcove, kitchenette, an almost too-large living room, bedroom with two queens and still plenty of room for a full size desk, large bathroom. Nothing comparable in this price range in this location with this level of service. A true gem.* Did I mention it's friendly? The maids adore our kids, play with the baby, joke with the older kids. The turn-down service pretty much includes them wanting to sing your kids a lullaby.* Nothing has ever gone wrong. Never too cold, too hot, too noisy, too anything. Everything just is what it's supposed to be. I think experienced travelers know how rare that is.* Some things to consider: the king bed suites are pretty tight when you unfold the couch in the living room. There is a high-rise going up next door - we never heard a thing but maybe if you're in exactly the wrong room you could hear it? Honestly though we've never heard any sounds. The breakfast is good, but there isn't anything like hot sausage or omelets. Mostly things like bagels, toast, cereal, fruit, juice, yogurt, even hot cocoa for the kids - and it's all kosher, as a bonus.So, like I said, this place is just so good that I would feel guilty not creating an account to give them a plug. Stay there.

You don't think of New York hotels for warm, outgoing service or big rooms, but the San Carlos Hotel has both. We were initially given a 2-queen room, which was large but had no view at all. The person at the front desk kindly upgraded us for free to a junior suite. Our 6-year-old loved the magic penny trick performed for her by Gabriel at the front desk the next day. While the rooms were styled a bit less luxuriously than one might expect for a 4+ star hotel and the breakfast, while free, was only adequate, overall we had an excellent stay.

Over the years I have stayed in numerous hotels on and around Lexington Ave. Following three nights at the San Carols I decided to make this my permanent place. It's a very comfortable privately owned hotel, very different from the big chain hotels. Almost European atmosphere. Friendly (I got a bottle of wine at check in) Clean, good continental breakfast and great location.

According to NY standards the room is HUGE! I stayed for 5 days in a king size bed in single room and it was one of the best hotel experiences I had. The room was so warm and quiet, elegant and clean. Very big space to fit luggage, working desk, it had all the equipment to make a quick meal: microwave, mini-bar, dishes and plates, wine opener and wine glasses and coffee machine.
