The hotel is in a nice location in mid-town Manhattan although a bit of a walk to the subway but close enough to many great restaurants and shops. I would totally recommend it for any purpose of traveling.

Recently stayed in the San Carlos hotel and got a pretty big room. It could have easily accommodated 4 people. Had a kitchen, large seating area with a large bedroom in a separate room and a walk in closet. You get the sense it was an apartment building in a prior life and it could use some updating. The bathroom had a window in the shower that was open and had no curtain even though there was hardware for it and the tiled shelf below the window was cracked which all seemed kind of 2star-ish. Once I closed and locked the window it was fine.. well warmer anyway. The beds were comfortable and the staff that I ran into were all friendly. My rate for the night was $345. Slightly less than 4 star but I'll round up.

I stayed here for a week and i got a quiet room toward the back, so no noise from the streets at the room. The room has a good size. Be aware there are construction going on next door, but i did not notice it much when i was there.

Excellent value for money and visitor experience. Location is central. Ideal to visit NYC. The indian restautant inside the hotel is among the top 10 in town. Rooms are very comfortable and quiet. Breakfast is continental, nothing special but included.

Late review but still worth mentioning that all the staff in this hotel made our first family visit to New York a lovely one. Great location as it is close to Grand Central Station and lots of restaurants around the block. Time square within walking distance. Will definitely come back to this hotel again.

Just a great experience. Huge rooms for NY. Excellent location. Friendliest staff. Breakfast a bit boring but lots of great restaurants in area. Walked to MOMA, St. Peter's, Rockefeller, and Central Park Zoo.

This is our second time staying here. Superior service, clean and large room, very nice complimentary breakfast. Easy walking distance to the UN, Rockefeller Center, Time Square, etc... Tons of good eats in the area.

A quiet little gem in mid town. The hotel is conveniently located on E50th street between Lexington and 3rd. If you chose a room at the back of the hotel you will be amazed at how quiet it is. Not much of a view but who cares if you can get a nice quiet sleep. Many of the rooms have a separate living room area and kitchenette/refrigerator, Good for those traveling with kids and needing a small kitchen/microwave. They also include breakfast and have an acceptable gym. The hotel is in a great location, close to restaurants, shopping and transportation. It's not super high end but comfortable and clean and a good place to call home for a few days or longer in NYC.

This Hotel was amazing! Excellent service, suite was so comfortable and homely, staff friendly and helpful. Close to everything!Good value. Brilliant complementary breakfast, always replenished, lots of choice. Loved it! Can't go wrong.

Spent a long weekend in New York and stayed at the San Carlos. For the price I would say this was a great choice. It is more moderately priced than many other NYC hotels, and the rooms are probably more spacious than most. However if you're looking for sleek, new, upscale you will be disappointed. The hotel is a bit older, tho that did not bother us. Rooms were very clean, and the staff did their jobs. The only criticism I have is that their continental breakfast, included in the room rate, was pretty weak. But if what you need to start your day is a cup of coffee, it's fine. I will definitely stay at the San Carlos again.

Incredible price for a junior suite in a great location! Our family of five was wowed by the staff, services, location and comfort. Being greeted most mornings by Bobby, Yolanda and Gabrielle with smiles and humor made every day great. Beds were very comfortable with small kitchen perfect for bringing food in after a long day of touring the city. Location is ideal as it's close to subway, shops, Rockefeller Ctr, but just far enough from Time's Square to avoid the overcrowded tourist traffic. Excellent food options: Spice Symphony (attached to the hotel) and a remarkable Thai restaurant 'Sukhumvit 51' just around the corner on 51st. Excellent taste and super affordable... plus great Italian, Mexican and steak house across the way. Will certainly choose The San Carlos for all future getaways. Thank you for making our stay wonderful!!! The Simoncic Gang

My family had a lovely stay at this hotel for our overnight in NYC. We had a great rate for a junior suite, and the size of the room was incredible for NYC standards. Plenty of room for a couple and two little kids (who had an absolute blast.) The staff was so kind and accommodating, and the location cannot be beat. Fabulous. Now the only reason I am withholding that last star is because of the fold-out sofa bed. Eek. Fortunately it was just the kids on this (and they ended up with us in the King after some hours anyway), but if adults had tried to sleep on that for a full night, my guess is that a chiropractor visit would follow. :/ However, the rest of the room and stay was so lovely, I don't really want to complain... We will return. We'll just get a room with two queens instead!

My husband and I stayed at the San Carlos Hotel in mid-December 2016. What a nice place - large rooms with a fridge and microwave and an excellent location. We will definitely book this property again.

Hotel was as good as expected and reviewed by others. Externally it is unassuming but internally it is nicely decorated and has some quality features. Front desk staff were very polite and helpful and took the time to make you feel at home. We were on the 16th floor and the room was well laid out and had everything you would need incl things we didn't expect like an iron and free safe. Only thing that you could say needed improvement is the breakfast area, it seemed sometimes too small and people were sitting in the reception area to have breakfast. Although it wasn't a major problem it did appear to be Insufficient for the size of the hotel. Location was excellent close to Rockefeller Centre and local subway stations.

This was my first time staying at the San Carlos and it will not be my last. I was there for a business trip and the location is amazing. it is a block away from one of the many Subway lines that take you all around Manhattan. The room was clean, comfortable and bigger than what you may find at your regular NYC hotel. A simple and satisfying continental breakfast is included so your first meal of the day is taken care of every day. My check in was painless and friendly, the doorman are great when giving directions and giving advice about what to do. Rockefeller center is a 10-12 min walk away so that was awesome for visiting NBC studios after done with work. My only issue was maybe the sound insulation in my room was not the greatest as I could hear my neighbors getting "busy" but maybe they were just really loud. It did not bother me as it was actually amusing since it was my first night there, they were gone the next day. My wife joined me on my last two days so we could enjoy the city and she was delighted by the value and quality of the hotel. This hotel is a great little gem and I am recommending it to my friends.

Our family had a 9 night stay over Xmas . We had a deluxe Double Queen room on the 3rd floor. Absolutely no view but we were in our room so little it didn't matter.Good to have a fridge and microwave in our room, which we put to use.Location was fantastic with a subway metro close. Also we could easily walk to 5th Ave & Rockefeller Plaza.Breakfast, it was fine not exciting but still a great start to our day. We of course took our own vegemite... Other Aussies and Nz people will understand! It started to get crazy busy from about the 27 Dec onwards but the whole city seemed to get crazy busy....Loved the maids on our floor, we got great service and loved the aveda products. Chocolates in the evening and at the front desk which we enjoyed.We locked in our hotel in April 2016 and got a good cancellable rate, bearing in mind any hotel in NYC will be $$ but so glad we stayed here at the San Carlos vs Times Square hotels. Would stay here again

Visit was over a month ago, but it was my first chance to do a review. Myself, my daughter and granddaughter decided to visit NYC to see a Broadway show and the Radio City Christmas Spectacular. It was only about 3 weeks prior to our trip that I started trying to make a reservation. After many calls, not finding a room that would accommodate all 3 of us in one, I booked the San Carlos. We arrived earlier in the day and wanted to leave our bags until check-in. The young man at the reception desk offered us a suite at no extra charge, since our room was not ready, but it would have been a pull-out for the 3rd person, so we decided to wait. The staff was very helpful, giving us recommendations for a couple of meals. The location was perfect for us, just a few blocks down on the same street as Radio City, the prices were fair in comparison to many hotels, and the continental breakfast was included. As others have stated, it is minimal but we were all able to find something and we did not go away hungry. It was also helpful since we had a 9am show to get to. The room itself was very nice, very clean and the amenities in the bathroom were wonderful. They even had turn down service with a chocolate left on the pillow! I would not hesitate to book at the San Carlos again and even recommended it to a friend making the trip after us!!
user_name:
shorebett
Egg Harbor Township, New Jersey

review_body: recently spent 4 days here on a business trip. Gabriel the concierge was extremely helpful and friendly. the room was comfortable and clean and the hotel's location was extremely convenient. the breakfast was adequate but the choices didn't change once- exact same breakfast four days in a row

My husband, 9 year old daughter and I visited NYC on 12/28-12/29/2016. The price of the small suite was comparable to a standard room in larger NYC hotels. I have been traveling to NYC for years and this room was by far the largest hotel room I have ever seen in NYC. We were allowed to check-in early around 1 PM. The hotel itself is small, but that makes things easier with checking in and out, and most importantly, short waits for the elevator. The location is super convenient....just down the street from Rockefeller Center, Radio City, shops on 5th Ave. Also very close to subway station. Great little cafe type restaurant across the street perfect for a quick sandwich. The room itself was spotless, and as I said, HUGE by New York standards. I would highly recommend this hotel!

Paid a reasonable amount of money by NYC standards and was shocked at how big the room was. Staff was very friendly whenever encountered. They do have free breakfast but it is minimal - don't expect something epic. But anyone travelling, particularly a family of four, this is an outstanding option. Will definitely be back.

We had to last minute change our hotel and someone suggested this place. Our luggage was delayed and they were so helpful in getting it to us and communicating with FedEx. We slept great and breakfast was perfect. Close to everything we needed and we could walk anywhere!!

Service was friendly and prompt. We had 2 rooms for a family of 5. The second room was a suite. The rooms were large for new york. The suite faced the road and was quite noisy especially at night. Our other room was quiet. The breakfast was free and basic with apples yogurt some pastries and toast. Few minutes walk to the station and several restuarants nearby. Also turtle bay laundry on 2nd st was great.only 12 dollars for a large bag of laundry.

The staff was great! They all made us laugh while we were checking in and out. A lady was very helpful with helping us decide where to eat. Room was prepared well, the only thing was that it was smaller than pictured. Mini bar is too pricey to use. And lastly, the breakfast was very limited, even right when they started serving. Just some bagels and muffins and bread. A few yogurts as well. It is convenient though. We would stay again!

We stayed for 6 nights in a family suite of a small kitchen, 2 queen beds in a separate room ensuite main bathroom and a sofa bed in the loungeroom that my teenage son slept on.We booked ahead 8 months so got a great room rate as we were visiting New York at Christmastime which is magical and both very busy and very expensive Great value for a family of 5Great quiet safe location at 150 50th st Manhattan midtown...ready to explore this city...We were able to buy a weekly Metro subway ticket at Lexington st just around the corner and easily negotiated the subway system which gets you round town quickly..this city is huge Our suite also came with free daily breakfast served downstairs in a designated area off the lobby..great start for the day with choice of cereals/milks, breads/toasts,yoghurts and orange and grapefruit juice and coffee/tea of course Loved this hotel for its personal friendly service, daily room service and the little touches not usually in a corporate hotel like umbrellas available when it rained

Convenient location for east midtown activities, Rockefeller Center, etc. Friendly staff is welcoming. Free breakfast a definite benefit. Room was clean and updated. Bathroom small. Parking, with a cooperating garage, is a good three blocks away but the saving worth it. The building itself is older. The attached restaurant/coffee shop was under construction, a fact which I would have liked to know when I made the reservation. Major construction is taking place on the west side of the hotel.
user_name:
Judith G
Upper Montclair, New Jersey

review_body: My wife and I recently stayed here for a quick weekend getaway into the city. We chose to stay here because of the great Midtown East location, affordable price, and 4+ star rating on many sites. The location is superb but unfortunately, that's it. The rooms are tiny with incredibly small beds and uncomfortable pillows. The two elevators managing 18 floors of guests will always make you wait. The lobby is dated and sad...almost messy compared to the professionally decorated lobbies of other "same in class" hotels nearby. The complimentary continental breakfast is a unique touch; but it's truly everything you would expect from a 'free' continental breakfast (we went to Ess-a-Bagel across the street). In the future, we will certainly return to this neighborhood, but will not stay at the San Carlos again.

My father, brother and I spent 3-days in NYC, and it was very hard to find a place where we could get 3 beds and would be big enough for us not to be right on top of each other. Well, Hotel San Carlos fit the bill - we had a 1 BR suite which had a sofa bed and we ordered a roll-away which fit comfortably in the living room area. The room was spacious, nicely appointed and clean. The staff was friendly and helpful. The location was great - East Side of Midtown and it was easy to access the subway, and was centrally located in terms of getting around to various neighborhoods in Manhattan. They offer continental breakfast, which was nothing special, but still definitely a nice touch in NYC, where you wouldn't normally find that. We will definitely plan to stay at San Carlos Hotel again.

Stayed at the San Carlos for one night for business. Excellent smallish hotel, a boutique, with plenty of amenities: WiFi, breakfast, business center, fitness center, paper in the morning...all free. In a high demand area on 50th between 3rd and Lex so reservations are going to be needed. Restaurant is newly refurbished this year..done well and located right next door.Fine location for shows in midtown plus access to subways. This hotel should meet or exceed your needs, no problem.

We just came back from spending a week in New York City. The staff of the hotel was always friendly and helpful. When we had questions about where to eat or how to get somewhere, someone always gave a helpful answer. One of the doormen even noticed that my husband had left his wallet in a taxi.The hotel is about 4 blocks from Rockefeller Center which meant that we could walk to a lot of the places that we wanted to visit.The bed was comfortable and the room was large and arranged well with enough chairs and lighting.We were allowed to delay our check-out time when we had a late flight.Our only complaint was that the breakfast was mediocre and even the coffee maker in the room didn't make very good coffee; but that was minor especially since the breakfast was complimentary.We would definitely stay here again.

I was expecting a decent-sized room given the online reviews that I saw, but the room was very small. (It was a room with one queen bed for me and my child.) I should have measured the room, but my guess is that it's about 150 sq. ft (not including the bathroom and the entry area). Other than this, everything else was fine. The staff was very, very friendly and the hotel is clean, well decorated and with sufficient amenities. The mid-town location is very convenient.

I just returned from a girls trip and we stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. We were able to check in earlier than expected, so that was a big plus! We had a suite and it had two queen beds and a living room with a pull-out sofa bed. There were 6 of us. It was very roomy. There was a microwave and a mini-frig & sink. There isn't an ice machine to get ice from so you had to have it brought to your room. The breakfast was okay and we enjoyed it. They had bagels, muffins, toast, sweet rolls. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and joked around with us. If I went back to NYC, I would definitely consider this hotel.

We stayed here with 4 kids in August. The suite is large and a great size for a big family. There was a small kitchenette that came in handy.Rooms were very clean and modern. Staff were extremely helpful at all times. The free breakfast really helped us a lot.The only negatives: There should be 24hrs room service. We arrived at 2am and my kids were hungry. We also flew from Australia so our body clock thought it was dinner at this time too.The construction noise was awful. I'm not sure how long that will go on for but the jackhammering was very loud. They are building something next door.Overall a great stay and I would stay there again and recommend to friends.

We didn't get into our room until almost 3 AM but we enjoyed our brief and sleepless stay!Very clean and comfortable room.Lovely robes.Nice staff.OK free breakfast--very few hotels in NY even have such a courtesy.And a perfect location for our Trump needs!

Great hotel with a lot to offer. Room was 600 sq ft and was glad I moved from a hotel a few blocks away. Had a living area space and a bar area. Fridge was well stocked with all sorts of drinks. Very spacious. Great fitness area. Breakfast area was good but food was limited on options.

Fantastic stay for four nights while in town for the NY marathon. Lovely mini suite with microwave and fridge. The room was spotless, king sized bed very comfortable, heaps of wardrobe space and although we rarely watched TV there seemed to be a plenty to chose from.The complimentary continental breakfast is also included, but if that isn't for you there is a diner opposite and loads more places in the vicinity.Lifts are super fast and we never waited more than about 30 seconds despite the hotel being busy with Marathon runners.Some people have mentioned noise and there is a 65 story building being constructed next year, but we were not bothered by it even though we were on that side.The staff there was fabulous, and on the final day had our checkout extended to 2pm without asking.We have to return to New York City in two weeks and have cancelled our booking around the corner and booked at the San Carlos instead.Time Square and Central Park 15-20 mins walk, Grand Central Station 5-10 min walk, 51st subway 2 min walk.

Loved this place! Wonderful, welcoming and friendly staff. Room and public areas were scrupulously clean and warmly decorated. We felt immediately at home in our room, which consisted of a sitting room/efficiency kitchen and a separate bedroom. Great location for exploring; we walked to the Gershwin for the evening Broadway show of Wicked; a nice walk in a safe neighborhood. Highly recommend the San Carlos Hotel, and will DEFINITELY plan to visit again!

Perfect location, great value, spacious rooms. This place is right near Rockefeller and all the great shopping in NYC. On a beautiful day you can walk just about anywhere from this location. The rooms were so spacious. We've found the hotel we will frequent whenever we are in town.

Great spacious room for 2 adults and 2 children 10 and 6. Kids shared sofa bed. 1 bedroom was spacious clean and well maintained. Great location close to Central Park. Breakfast could do with an upgrade, pastries were terrible however we only needed yoghurt and toast which were available. Would definitely come back when the construction next door stops.

Great sized room, my son had the sofa bed in the lounge area and myself, my daughter and my mother had a separate bedroom with two queen size beds. Also a handy kitchenette and two TV's. All staff very friendly and helpful, the continental breakfast kept us going until lunch, get down there before 8 am much less busy.The location was perfect, close enough to walk to lots of the major attractions but not right in the middle of Times Square. All in all couldn't fault it, just a little noisy at times from the construction work next door.

My first visit to New York and can highly recommend the San Carlos hotel. The location is perfect, the room was large and had every convenience you could want. Super comfy beds and very clean and quiet. Free breakfast was a bonus. Would recommend this hotel to anyone - you won't be disappointed. Thank you for the complimentary birthday hamper it was a lovely surprise.

The staff is super friendly and helpful. The rooms are beautiful and immaculate and the pricing is amazing. I'll definitely stay there again on my next trip to NYC. Close to many good restaurants and delis.

Loved it!! Super nice staff and explained everything how the hotel works. Not a really placed location due to constructions sites next to it but is real central and close to Times Square .. but in my experience it was a pleasant stay at San Carlos Hotel

Clean, Spacious Rooms. Good pricing. Very convenient to all of Manhattan. Business center, conference rooms. Very knowledgeable and helpful staff. Continental breakfast buffet every day is included. Many regular guests continue to frequent this hotel,

From our arrival to the moment we left, San Carlos Hotel and their staff were wonderful! Bobby was a joy and SO helpful as well as the staff when checking us in or directing us to different adventures. The room was quite, clean and cleaning staff goes above and beyond as well.

Fantastic hotel close to all the attractions. You can walk everywhere to workoff some of that lovely food. One of the best steak house in New YorkIs just around the corner. Smith and Wollensky they gave us some free champagnefor our anniversary loved it. The staff very friendly and helpful.The restaurant next door was very good nice chicken burger and fries. The drinks where a bit expensive but can'tcomplain. Nice big tv in the room everything in the room wasexcellent

The hotel itself is really well located and easily accessible. Free wifi, very large rooms as well which are comfortable and so are the beds. The only thing is about the breakfast: the continental breakfast is included but is very poor really. For a 4 star hotel, you would expect a bit more.

What a pleasant surprise! Only stayed one night; trusted Trip Advisor reviews for booking. Very large room & bathroom with nice amenities. Very clean; everyone friendly and helpful. Special thanks to Bobby (bellman); he answered all our questions and was extremely courteous and professional. Excellent value for price paid. The Kitchen restaurant attached was excellent - nice respite from the noise and high prices elsewhere. Do not hesitate to stay here & say "hi" to Bobby.

I've been staying at the San Carlos for over 10 years for both business and pleasure. It's location is unbeatable and the service and staff make you feel like home. Bagels across the street, subway station on the corner, shopping and restaurants steps away. My first choice in NY always.

Gotta love the city and the action BUT want to come "home" to a quiet spot, clean, great location, front desk, concierge, and other staff ever so helpful? Check in at the San Carlos's Hotel. The location is good, there is a breakfast which is sufficient (if not fabulous) and in addition there is a restaurant which is a wonderfully relaxing and delicious place to end the evening. The rooms are clean, the service is exacting and I don't think you can go wrong here.

I stayed at San Carlos hotel in September. We were three and we got a suite that was perfect for us. The size of the rooms is way bigger than NY standards. The hotel is not luxury but it is extremely confortable, clean and with very good service. The continental breakfast was great for us. Everything is walking distance, nice location in mid town but not so crowded. Metro station is two blocks from there.

Spent a long-weekend with our adult children in a junior suite that was very clean and so spacious. The kids weren't thrilled about sleeping on a sofa bed but made do. The trip to and from Laguardia to this hotel was amazingly short, less than 30 minutes, so convenient. Loved the walking distance to many of our favourite spots. Enjoyed the continental breakfast and really appreciated the complimentary wifi.

Stayed one night and was very impressed. The room was very nice and very clean, bed very comfy. Great location, easy walking distance to various attractions. There is construction nearby, hence some noise, but I was not bothered by it.

this hotel is a joke, far from everything, terrible staff and dirty. Better off staying at a Howard Johnston! I payed a 5 start price for a 2 star hotel, which i terribly regret. Nothing great nearby and rooms are awfully old.

We have stayed here many times...sometimes with our 2 teens and others with just ourselves and everytime we come, we feel like we are staying in our very own home. The hotel is well placed in midtown. Excellent service as well as a great breakfast to start your day. The beds are large and comfortable. The rooms are probably some of the biggest you will get in New York. We'll be back!

Just spend 4 nights at the San Carlos Hotel and it outweighed all our expectations of a NY affordable hotel. The Rooms were a good size and the small one bed room suite we had was just perfect for the 3 of us. I have been in some fantastic hotels in the world and I would have to say I was just as happy if not happier with the service I received here as some of the 5 star places I have stayed. The Continental breakfast was an added bonus and more than adequate to get you going in the the morning. It was extremely clean, 10 out of 10 to who ever serviced room 1208. Bobby and the rest of the doorman were fun and extremely helpful. This hotel made a great trip to NYC just perfect. If I had to comment about one thing it would be that they could do with mattress toppers on the sofa beds. Thank you Guys. Elaine, Janette and Sarah

excellent : hotel, cleanliness, staff, location. everything excellent ! not one complaint ! within walking distance to subway. simple check in and check out . loved it loved it loved it loved it loved it !!!!!! and it was our first time to nyc and our 50th anniversary.......

The hotel was a lovely 3-4 star hotel with friendly staff, good sized rooms and really comfy beds and pillows. The breakfast was included but it was only a very limited continental breakfast so we ate elsewhere.

Lovely hotel, very friendly staff who looked after us well and helped with whatever queries we had. I did expect the room for 6 to be bigger but it was fine. Good location! Breakfast was just really bread and pastries and the coffee not so great. Be wary of laundry costs, I wanted a few items laundered but they dry cleaned and charged $74, I refused to pay this hefty bill and found the Manager on duty rude when I disputed this cost, all other staff as I said were very friendly.

Great front desk, best value in midtown at $400 a night. Great place will go there again if its close to the conference I attended. They upgraded me to a suite, really nice all the way around. Crisp and clean, great water pressure in the shower.

Loved our stay at the San Carlos. Incredibly large room, very very clean and ideal location. Hotel includes continental breakfast but was offered so much more. Just get there early to get a table! Will definitely be my go to Hotel when I'm in the city!

The greeting was friendly every time. The rooms are clean, a good size and bathroom is fine. The free breakfast was good. Plenty of bread options, juices, yogurts etc. The restaurant wasn't the best but there are plenty of options nearby. We had a third floor bedroom at the back so had a brick wall to look at. What do you expect in NY. Business centre let me print tickets very easily. A good hotel for a short break in the Big Apple.

The hotel is located in a nice, safe location (only about 3 blocks from subway). The room was huge for New York City - a half bath and full bath, a little kitchenette with fridge. It was quiet and clean. Only drawbacks were the wallpaper was starting to coming off the wall in the bedroom and the Continental breakfast is not worth your time - spend the money at Morningside Cafe on 2nd Ave. And we learned about this restaurant and others from Mr. Baramee Phanaronke who provided us with great dining suggestions for breakfast & dinner. It was nice to enjoy good, local restaurants (as opposed to a national chains) after being out all day at the US Open. Kudos to Baramee!! Also, the other staff was wonderful - my sister forgot the key to her luggage lock and they popped it off shortly after we arrived. So they help us avert a crisis at the beginning of the trip. Many thanks! We will be back.

We were impressed with this hotel the moment we stepped in. We arrived early in the morning after an overnight flight from LA, tired and hungry. The check in time was 4 pm, but as we had big luggage with us, we decided to go and drop off our luggage at the hotel so we can go explore as soon as possible. We were greeted by Gabriel, a lovely older gentleman, that we learned throughout our stay, is the heart and soul of this hotel. To our surprise Gabriel told us that we didn't have to wait, our room was ready and he invited us to have breakfast in the dining room after we have freshened up. The breakfast was included with our stay and consisted of scrumptious freshly baked pastries and bagels, cereal, fruit, coffee, tea.The hotel is situated within a short walk to the Rockefeller Centre and Empire State Building. There are subway stations close by, but walking is so much more fun and you can see much more. The hotel room was clean and spacious and the hotel overall was presented really well, the only downside was the construction site next door. The work started early in the morning, but it didn't affect us, as we were getting up really early to have breakfast and be out exploring, as we only had 3 days in NY.We were a bit disappointed on the last day when we went down to have breakfast and because there was a Jewish holiday, the breakfast consisted of fruit and some super sweet pastries, which we couldn't eat. We were lucky to leave that day, as the entire week from then on the breakfast would have been the same.All in all this a great hotel. If we ever visit New York again, we will definitely stay here again. If you decide to stay at this hotel I hope you get to meet Gabriel.

We traveled together with my wife and younger brother (so kinda family group). We wanted to book a room with a separate bedroom and after long search we decided to try San Carlos. Because of the photos we assumed there would be 1,5 bathrooms (one with only toilet and second with shower), but there was only bathroom and it was next to bedroom. Luckily it didn't disturb us when brother used the bathroom in the middle of the night (that's maybe because of the good night sleep in the comfy bed).The hotel breakfast is really traditional; there's nothing really special. We skipped the breakfast few mornings because of the late sleep. There are few Starbucks near buy if you need to get some coffeine and something to bite.There was construction site right next to hotel, so if you are a light sleeper, ask a room from another side of the construction.Staff was very friendly at the view from introvert finnish people. Hotel is clean, kinda updated and there are many outlets at the room for your eletronics. Rooms are spacious and also sofa bed was comfortable. Kitchenette was cool extra and fridge didn't froze our waters, like in many other hotels.We highly recommend this hotel!

always stay at this hotel when visiting NYC. As has been mentioned clean...usually well priced and nice staff. Everyone at the front desk is there to help you. It is NYC so expect some noise for sure but right now on the west side of the building there is a major construction project going on and will be for years I think....so request a room high floor east side unless you enjoy waking up before 7am to construction. For some reason they gave me a room on that side despite request for quiet and it was a short stay so I did not ask to move. Otherwise this hotel is great.

Booked this property thru Hotwire, arrived to find that our hotwire reservation didn't exist. After over 2 hours on hold with Hotwire with no help the front desk of the hotel (Evelyn Torro) found us accommodations. I can't review the hotel, or the room but I can review the people and they were amazing!!

I have stayed at this hotel three times and each time we have received great service from very friendly staff. the hotel is in a great location just minutes from all the tourist hot spots and with 51st and Lexington on the six line only a three minute walk away getting about is no problem at all also the free breakfast and wi fi are a welcome bonus

We stayed here for 4 nights in late August, and were upgraded to a big room with a sitting area, which made it very comfortable to move around. Our room was on the11th floor on the front street side of the hotel. Had no problem with noise from traffic or nearby construction. There was free wifi in the room, as well as a microwave, mini fridge, safe and coffee maker. There are no vending machines for snacks or drinks, and if you need ice, you can use the ice trays in the mini fridge/freezer, or the front desk will bring ice to your room. We found the bed to be a little too firm for us, so housekeeping added a mattress topper, which made the bed really comfy. Window coverings were roman shades and allowed light to come in on the sides, so if light wakes you in the morning, this doesn't work well. Elevators are super fast! Breakfast was just sweet pastries and cereal, no hot items. New York Luncheonette is right across the street and it's a wonderful alternative for tasty, reasonably priced breakfast, lunch and dinner. The front desk employees are very nice and most helpful. Overall, the hotel is in a great location and is clean and updated, but in no way elegant or luxurious.

The staff was helpful and went out of their way to make our experience special. Great location near Time Square, rooms were spacious. We would stay there again. Double bed rooms have plenty of room for four people.

I stay at the San Carlos every Sept. during UNGA. It is a smaller but immaculate hotel. The staff is exceptionally pleasant and professional. What really stands out is the loyalty of the staff. The rooms(suites) are very large and spacious. I highly recommend this hotel as a must stay .It is on the east side but still close enough to Nyc attractions!Enjoy!!!
user_name:
Michael F
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Have stayed in this hotel 3 times now and will definitely be going back. I went this time with 3 girlfriends from Australia and we took a one bedroom suite. It had 2 Queen beds in the bedroom and a very comfortable sofa bed in the living room. We could have had a rollout bed too but they charge $US30pn for that - so we managed. The staff were helpful and friendly as usual and my friends were equally impressed with the location - as I was, the first time I stayed there. It is a magical location. The breakfast is adequate but we always go to the deli in 3rd Ave and grab our own granola and use their yoghurt and fruit.We all felt safe, centrally located, helped when needed and happy here again. It is a great find.

I booked a room for three nights at the San Carlos Hotel in NYC. I booked this room via the hotels solicitation via Jetsetter/Secret Escapes on-line. I was very much looking forward to my stay at this hotel. My reservation was confirmed and I called the hotel directly as a courtesy to inform them that I had a registered and certified by a healthcare professional small, well-behaved support dog that I was bringing with me. I spoke to a manager at the hotel who assured me all was okay with my reservation. One week later I received an email stating that my reservation had been cancelled "due to unavailability of rooms at the hotel". I checked on-line at the hotel's website and it did show room availability for the dates I had booked, but at a much higher room rate price due to a busy event week in NYC. My room was cancelled most likely for mercenary reasons to get top dollar for the room - or for discrimination against my bringing a support animal. When I called the hotel directly they said it was an error made by Jetsetter/Secret Escapes for overbooking (even though the manager had confirmed my reservation when I called to let them know about my support dog). I then called Jetsetter/Secret Escapes and they said it was the hotel's fault and that they only book based on room availability given to them by the hotel. Very little to no remorse or understanding of the difficult situation I was placed in losing a full week at a busy time to find another accommodation in the area. It was unconscionable to automatically cancel my reservation that had been confirmed by both parties. Obviously the hotel does not care about their prospective guests. I would not recommend trusting your reservation at this hotel!!!
user_name:
Susan G
San Diego, California, United States

review_body: We stayed at the San Carlos Hotel during a recent trip to the East Coast and absolutely loved it! The location is very central - minutes from the subway, blocks from Central Park, Broadway, Times Sq & Grand Central. Its also surrounded by nice places to eat. The rooms are very spacious by NY standards and very well maintained and the staff are very helpful and courteous. It also helped that we got upgraded to their penthouse suite during our second leg, the room was probably bigger than most apartments in Manhattan. Cannot recommend it enough, we will be back!

Set in busiy midtown and near a construction site - our room was really quiet. A light breakfast and daily newspapers are included. The staff were helpful and friendly. We had a couple of minor issues on arrival and they were fixed instantly. Suites aren't huge but appropriate for the price and the room was thoroughly cleaned each day. There are 2 TVs in the suites and a coffee maker. Bathroom even had a small bath as well as shower. Only downside: Air conditioners are window mounted and a bit noisy but it was not enough to keep me from sleeping. Good location.

A great hotel to spend a few days in Manhattan. Location wise, walking distance to Times Square and Broadway, while only minutes from shopping on Park avenue. The subway is very close to go up to Central Park in only a few stops and also direct to downtown for Staten Island ferry and the 9-11 memorial area, all worth the trip.Hotel itself is not too big and impersonal, it is calm, rooms quiet, beds very comfortable and rooms quite ok.To be recommended.

We recently stayed for 5 nights and I cannot fault the hotel. We experienced a quick and friendly check in and our room was superb, spacious and clean. The breakfast is adequate and a good start to your day.I would highly recommend and we will return to the San Carlos when visiting New York in the future.

I was worried about staying in an order hotel in NY however, the San Carlos is a gem! Great location close to everything and the subway. There was 10 of us and having 4 rooms was perfect. The rooms were clean and comfortable, the staff was excellent and very friendly. We would stay again and again at the San Carlos hotel!

Friendly staff, Free WiFi and Continental Breakfast, great location, clean, very confortable rooms. We have stayed here in three ocations and will return! Good value, family friendly. We had a great time and after very busy days we were happy to return to a comfy comfy bed!

I stayed here with my husband for a week on our first trip to New York. I spent hours researching accommodation, wanting something that was good value for money and big enough, in a good location. San Carlos ticked all these boxes and we were pleasantly surprised when we arrived. The room was massive with a king sized bed (possibly super-king sized in fact) which was very comfortable, writing desk and sitting area. The bathroom was also large, with a makeup/shaving mirror and powerful hair dryer included. The breakfast was a traditionally American continental breakfast - sickly sweet pastries and some bread with sugar-laiden jams plus yoghurts. We weren't taken by it so bought some cereal and milk to keep in our room. The room had a microwave and mini fridge, so it was no problem to cater for a light breakfast ourselves. The room was incredibly quiet with the most noise we heard in the mornings when nearby construction would kick off around 7am - really not a problem. We used the subway system a lot and there was a station about 1.5 blocks away. I would highly recommend San Carlos Hotel for anyone staying in New York.

We stayed here on our recent family holiday to NYC. After much searching we decided on the San Carlos for its positive trip advisor comments and also the location. We were not disappointed with anything here. Staff were welcoming and helpful on arrival and throughout our stay. We stayed in a family suite which was perfect for 5 of us. Very spacious and immaculate. Everything you needed was there, but we could have done with a kettle to boil water..thats being picky. Our room was cleaned every day, fresh towels delivered and you could request anything extra you needed.Theres a lot of negative comments on here regarding the breakfast so we were apprehensive on the first morning but decided to give it a try. I am not sure what the negative comments were for. Breakfast was great, although the room is on th small side if the hotel is fully booked however get there early and all is fine. The hotel receives a fresh delivery of breads, muffins, bagels and pastries every single morning. Also on offer are yogurts, fruit, fresh juices and tea and coffee, what more could you ask for? It was great. The location is great, within walking distance to many attractions and shopping areas. Its also close to the subway if you want to go further away. The building work which is going on next to the hotel is at times lous, but we were out during the day and they finish working at around 5 so it doesnt disturb you at night. The gym is well equipped yet small but all equipment is new and enough for using when on holiday.I would absolutley recommend this fabulous hotel and would stay here again. Thankyou everyone at The San Carlos Hotel.

Hotel was clean, centrally located in Midtown, and comfortable. When I first arrived, I was given a small room overlooking a construction site. Within minutes, I had to call and request a transfer. The noise was completely unbearable. They were very gracious, and moved me to a larger room facing away from the construction. Much better. In general, there is quite a bit of noise. Street noise, hallway noise, slamming doors, voices in the next room. They can't completely eliminate noise - it's Manhattan. That said - this older hotel has very little soundproofing. You can hear everything outside and in. If you're okay with noise, this hotel is a great find. Cozy bed, modern bathroom. Exceptionally clean. Free, reliable wifi. I would probably stay again.

We stayed at the San Carlos for a night on our way home from an overseas trip, booking within a couple of days of our stay through a third-party site after seeing great reviews and a decent comparable price. Our total cost (including tax) was just under $400, which (scarily) is pretty good for a weeknight in midtown Manhattan. Pros:- Really spacious room - we were upgraded without request to a junior suite, which had a kitchen area and a very spacious bedroom with couch / sitting area. Decor was traditional, with some nice architectural features, and the bathroom was modernized. - Free wifi- Great location- Quiet hotel (even with area construction going on outside)- Free breakfast included (not seen too often in NYC)- Friendly, helpful service from all folks we encounteredCons (or things to be aware of): - If you're looking for a nice restaurant, expansive lobby, or fancy bar area, particularly for business, this hotel doesn't have that- The breakfast area is pretty minimalist, and the breakfast itself (which we checked out but didn't end up eating) is VERY minimal, with no hot foods, even a waffle maker. I'd expect this to at least match up to a Hampton Suites if they are going to bother offering it.The hotel was very nice about keeping our luggage for a few hours, as we had an evening flight home, and they got it right away when we pulled up in an Uber on our way to the airport. Would I stay here again? Absolutely. But if you're thinking about a 4-star hotel, just make sure you know what amenities you need and want.

We booked San Carlo because of the spacious rooms as we are a family with 2 grown up childeren. The room was indeed very big, 2 queen beds and 1 sofa bed plus kitchen facilities (we only used tge refrigirator). Hotel is nearby metro station and in walking distance of Bryant Park, Grand Central, Time Square, ...The only minor minor was the bathroom: old, just a bath with curtains, ... bathroom needs to be renewed.Noisy because of the construction area next door for the moment.

Stayed at the San Carlos hotel. Very friendly and helpful staff, nothing to much trouble. Room was clean and comfortable with mini bar and good coffee making facilities. Situated near subway so easy links to all the tourist areas. Will stay there again.

We've stayed three times at the San Carlos, and will continue to make it our home base in NYC. The location is excellent with multiple subway stops within short walking distance as well as short walks to popular shopping and tourist attractions. The staff is helpful and courteous. Rooms are large for a Manhattan hotel. Breakfast is provided. The best choice we've found in Manhattan lodging.

Very good hotel! Great service and cleanliness, beds good but i am not sure if they are really queen size. Good place! Near almost everything you must see in NY. Breakfast nearly average (just bread and coffee, well some yogurt)The staff is very nice and you have excellent restaurant attached to lobby.

We (a family of 5) stayed at the San Carlos Hotel for 3 nights early July. The family suite has two double beds and a pull-out sofa, which worked well for us. The location is very good - 10 min to Rockefeller Center and 20 to Times Square. Breakfast was included in the rate and was actually quite decent (I had read so many reviews about the disappointing breakfast that we went to ess-a-bagel on the first morning instead of the hotel). Would definitely recommend this hotel.

The rooms tend to be pretty big, good for families. The hotel is clean and reasonably modern, staff are welcoming. A basic breakfast is included in the nightly rate, it is pretty basic but still good to take advantage of.

Checked in on Saturday evening and checked out on Wednesday (thank you front desk for giving us an extra hour to check out). During our stay the hotel staff was polite, professional and helpful. The room was clean and had more than the basics...the microwave and fridge really helped us cut down a bit on food-related expenses. The hotel is located close to everything...really can't beat the location. The room where the free breakfast is served can get crowded. Nothing hot is served but free is free and the selection of breads/danish/yogurt/cereal/coffee/tea/juice selection is good enough for the majority of people. My wife and kids tried the roomservice and they said the food was good. Business Center on the second floor is a great place to surf online and to print out boarding passes. The free wifi was excellent (we stayed on the 9th floor). If you're a normal middle class family looking for a safe, clean and really convenient place to stay, this is it. If you are looking for the ultimate experience in luxury, this is not it. We plan on staying here again in the future.

Where do I start. The service and treatment you get from this hotel is equal to any hotel I have ever stayed in and that includes the Ritz Carlton and the Grand Waliea in Maui Hawaii. From the owner of the hotel who I was lucky to meet on the day of departure to the handyman I rode the elevator with their attention to my happiness was second to none. This hotel is in a fantastic location. Three blocks from the hustle and bustle of Madison Avenue and Time Square, walking distance to Central Park and yet go three blocks in the other direction and you're in Midtown East where it's quiet and lots of local places to have a drink or a fantastic dinner. The rooms are absolutely fantastic. Junior executive suites, 400+ square feet, for the price of two twin beds at a Hilton Garden Inn or a Holiday Inn. Our junior suite had a queen size bed a living area with a pullout couch and a kitchenette with a refrigerator, microwave and coffee maker. They're even dishes and flatware if you decide you want to eat in some carry out from any of the 25 places that deliver to this hotel. If your vacation or business travel is focused around Times Square, Central Park, shopping on Madison Avenue and some of the best dining in Manhattan there is no better place to stay for the price. Bravo, bravo for the staff and management of the San Carlos hotel

The San Carlos has changed my belief that all New York hotel rooms are too small and too expensive. We had a 600 sq. foot Elite Junior Suite for three adults and enjoyed plenty of space. I know it was half the price and twice the size of many, many other NY hotel rooms. The staff did their jobs splendidly and the Bellmen were especially helpful. The second floor business center is small but quiet and very comfortable. Buses and the Subway are nearby as are Radio City Music Hall, Rockefeller Center, St. Patrick's Cathedral and the Waldorf Astoria. This is a Big Value in the Big Apple.

Stayed for 5 nights with family! Two teenagers! The hotel is super located on Lexington and 50th. Metro 6 station on the corner... Super comfy queen beds, In room minifridge and microwave. Breakfast mostly tosted bread, orangen juice and cereal but nice anyway! Fast free internet wifi, friendly personel... Roberto the bell boy is really a nice guy! We were really happy staying here! There is a pharmacy-grocery store one block north by Lexington, I bought smoked ham and items to compliment the breakfast! Super nice hotel!!! I would stay again without a doubt!

I attended an overnight business meeting and the San Carlos was the recommended hotel. I was pleased with the location, 50th street and 3rd avenue, the warm staff as well as the size of the room. I was on the 3rd floor and had what amounted to a double NYC room, the left was a living room with a couch, mini-kitchen and a table, the right a bedroom, bath room and a closet. Clearly an older building, but kept up to date and very clean. I was greeted warmly upon my arrival at 3:00 pm and was given a room immediately. My meeting was a half a block away, very convenient. I had a 6:00 am train and had no issues finding a cab at 5:30 am. The bell staff works 24/7 and hailed the cab for me.  I will consider this hotel the next time I visit NYC on a personal adventure.

We truly enjoyed our week at the San Carlos. It's convenient location, courteous professional staff and spacious rooms offered an excellent experience for our family.It's mid-town location makes it an easy walk to Radio City, 5th Avenue, St. Patrick's Cathedral, Rock Center, subway entrances and several local eateries. Also a quick ride from LaGuardia via the mid-town tunnel. It's location is crucial as a spot you can return to easily between journeys to refresh and relax. Hotel has a wonderful second floor lounge for guests with comfy sofas, clean restrooms and several desk top computers in a relaxing atmosphere. Recharge yourself here or just ride up to your room if you like. Hotel also offers a free continental breakfast which is nice especially when you consider nothing in NY is usually free. It might be just juice, coffee and pastries to some, but we enjoyed it a few mornings when we didn't have to dash out early for activities.

I really shouldn't complain. The San Carlos, for a 3 star ( ish) hotel is exceptional and everything it should be. The staff was pleasant. Room suite was large and clean with a kitchenette and fridge. Great location. Good value ( booked on Expedia with a coupon plus points). Especially for Nyc. Coffee and bagels are complimentary too!It is not a 4.5 star hotel. No matter how hard they strive, it's just not. The facility and age of property won't let it be what it isn't. I couldn't resist the bargain for my purposes. But if paying cash and you can afford it, more upscale, name brand hotels are nearby that are preferred

We were so happy we made the choice to stay at the San Carlos. It is a warm, extremely friendly, small boutique hotel in the middle of bustling Manhattan.We were impressed with all the staff and cleanliness of the hotel.Of course, having breakfast included and not having find a breakfast place before starting out the day was perfect.An excellent selection to stay in the Big Apple

Just returned from my fourth visit to this outstanding hotel. From the helpfulreservationist Johanna to the desk clerks, bell staff and chambermaids, theSan Carlos consistently meets my highest standards of hospitality andservice. What's really impressive however, is their rate. Beats anythingin Manhattan.

I was most pleased with the front desk. They had a sense of humor and they were quick. It is a small hotel so you don't have to wait for scores of people to get attention. The doorman/bellhop was particularly helpful. He remembered our names and greeted us when we needed something. We got a better room than I expected. How many times does that happen. NOT much. It was a suite with a separate living room and comfy chairs to watch TV.The tub did have a draining issue, but hey, if that's the only problem. They served a good basic breakfast in a room off the lobby. I could have sworn it was all the fresh squeezed orange juice you wanted. The final great thing about the hotel is location. We walked to virtually everything we wanted to see. Good pubs and restaurants in the area along with good shopping. Little grocery across the street for supplies. Oh yeah, there was a kitchenette in the room. Very helpful. Overall, when I go back to New York, I will stay at the San Carlos.

The location is good, but there is construction going on next door. We arrived around 9pm (flight from the west) and they had "upgraded" us to a room on the 2nd floor next to the construction. We asked if they had a room on a higher floor, but were told that our room was the only one available. Construction noise started well before we were ready to get up- perhaps 7:30. That said, the room was large and the bed was comfortable.Breakfast was VERY busy. I you want anything, best to collect it and take it back to your room, Better yet, head out for breakfast. There are lots of places nearby, including a Whole Foods store with an upstairs eating area.

We recently spent a week here with family. It's a really nice hotel - clean, large well equipped rooms, friendly staff and the kids loved the magic tricks from front desk staff! Breakfast decent and set us up for the day, although a bit small dining room so difficult to always get a table. Great location in midtown, just bad timing for us as they've started excavating next door for a huge new building and drilling started at 7am... Having said that we weren't in NYC for quiet relaxation so were out most of the time.Overall would highly recommend.

Great location for us as we had everything we needed nearby! Came to the hotel for a birthday trip with my mum and the staff were absolutely delightful! Only issue we had was one morning, the shower did not have any hot water but the staff sorted that out straight away :)

The San Carlos Hotel is conveniently located within walking distance of Times Square, Rockefeller Center, St. Patrick's Church to name a few. Subway is also an easy walk from the hotel. We were there for 6 nights. I usually have a hard time sleeping - not here. The beds and pillows were so comfortable. Plush robes for relaxing except we didn't have a lot of time to relax ! Enjoyed the breakfast of pastries, bagels, cereals, different breads for toast with butter, jelly and cream cheese available. Teas, coffee and orange juice to drink. Staff was pleasant, answered our questions satisfactorily. One night after being caught in a storm, our shoes were soaked (as we were). We asked if there was any way to dry them. We were able to take them to the front desk and the next AM, we received dry shoes ! Definitely would stay again and recommend.

En old hotel but well maintained, location very good. Front Desk- Proffesional, friendly staff, special Mr. Gabriel, we enjoyed the talk with him, a very kind and humble man. Room- Cleaned, comfortable beds huge suit, toilet in good size with shower and bath, we stayed 1204 noisy, next to a construction building, Air Conditioner very noisy each time when motor recycling. No complimentary drinking bottle water supply, one liter Fuji bottle water cost used 9.50 plus tax. Breakfast- Continental style, very little room, congestion, one waiter was working, not managed to clean the table before the next new comers, guests cleaned their table and removed the waste self. We met the owner he is very senior in his age still working efficiently, he is kind and sincerely, we enjoyed the talk with him. We booked two nights in this hotel in February the first night booked with booking.com the second night booked with Hotel.com just to compare, Hotel.com is cheaper but the room standard was not as good as booking.com that we purchased, we were upgraded by the Front Desk staff he was so kind to us so we do not need to move on the second day to another room, we had a very nice suit for both nights. On the booking.com it was stated on our voucher that we pay to the hotel on arrival at check in, but booking.com collected the payment from our credit card immediately did not keep their agreement, our credit card is suppose for form of guarantee, we were disappointed, we contacted booking.com their service team replies were unexpected with so poor excuses.

We spent 6 nights at San Carlos this last week. Room is spacious, clean, really comfortable beds, large flat screen tv, minifrdge & microwave, plush white robes, Aveda toiletries replenished each day, turndown service at night with chocolate on pillow. Two each of wine glasses, plates, cups, saucers, bowls & silverware in small kitchenette counter for two queens room. Additional expensive minifridge with candy, water, etc to buy. Rooms with two queen beds are all on back side of building with no view but also zero noise. Out front in daytime was very noisy with construction but don't know if could be heard in rooms facing front.Staff is friendly to a degree. Arrived about 7:30 at night, easy check in. No offer of help to our room but elevator was easy. Just expected it in "luxury boutique hotel". Never saw a doorman until possibly last morning as we were going out. He didn't open the door for us so don't know. Owner is friendly but wants to sell tickets to attractions which we had already purchased and states that he's not making any money off us. (!)I had called ahead and arranged for a basket to be in room for my graduating hs daughter with some wine for the adults. It was there and more than met my expectations...congratulatory card, candy, cookies, Voss bottled water, and even a teddy bear for her with white wine for us. Was expecting red wine but Johanna went out of her way to get the requested white wine for us! Thank you! Breakfast in morning consisting of toasted breads, flaky fresh bagels, cream cheese, 3 choices of pastries, muffins, coffee, tea, orange juice, whole & 2% milk, cold cereal (generic fruit loops, generic frosted flakes - daughter said weren't good), yogurt, apples. Can take up to room but seating was also available mornings we were down there. Skipped breakfast one morning to go to Ess-A-Bagel just across the street but wasn't impressed with it.Location is perfect for walking to Times Square, Rockefeller Plaza, and Central Park. Subway terminals are 2 - 4 blocks away & very convenient. We only used subway, bus a couple of times. Never used taxis once! Take the Airtrain & E train to and from JFK...it is SO easy! Subway at night was totally fine. NYC is so cleaned up we couldn't even find a counterfeit Rolex! :) Felt totally safe everywhere we went. Very few panhandlers. There is construction on the E line on weekends but it tells you workaround trains to take. We did get on the wrong way a time or two but people on subway were good to help. Leave some extra time on weekends to figure things out if on a schedule.

We were able to check in already at 11:00 on the day of arrival, which was highly aprreciated. The room was a good size, for a family of 3 persons. Great with a fridge and microwave when travelling with children. AC was loud and noisy, and could therefore not be used during night. The decor was classic, and a bit dull. The room looked in a bit of some TLC, there were stains on walls, carpet was loose in some places, skirting boards, walls, and furniture had some knicks and dens. Cleaning could improve; the bed had dirty and broken linen and the carpet was very dusty and in need of a good clean.Breakfastbuffét had everything served in plastic containers and everything was thrown in one bin afterwards, not much of thought in regards to being friendly to the environment.Nothing organic or with less sugar was served. All in all, okey for a complimentary breakfastbuffét, but a bit of a cultural difference for a Scandinavian guest.Staff was friendly, especially Bobby.Location was great.I could come back, but would most probably search for something different for my next visit.

Have been returning to San Carlos every year for its wonderful housekeeping, friendliness and attention. The hotel is perfectly located and quiet.There is always staff at the front door and desk watching everyone who enters and departs. This is a very comforting feeling.

Recently, we spent 4 nights here. It is a clean, well run hotel. The rooms are spacious and staff helpful on most occasions. Bobby who handled our luggage was very customer-oriented and went out of his way to be helpful. The breakfast items provided were fresh and adequate to start the day off with. It was a nice location in many respects. It was close to subways, shopping and restaurants. The walk to the theater district is at least a mile which is okay in daylight. However, it is unpleasant to walk back after an evening theater performance in which it is difficult to impossible to get a cab. One night we walked back in the rain the entire distance to the hotel unable to find a cab that wasn't already occupied. Generally, the hotel staff was helpful. But in the beginning no doorman was available to assist in transportation. We unwittingly got into a service car,in which the driver charged an exhorbitant rate. We came to appreciate the value of the presence of a good doorman following this experience. Some of the hotel desk clerks seemed preoccupied when we registered and asked a few questions. In retrospect,we feel they could have been more generous in providing information and traveler tips. My advice to anyone needing transportation is to stick with yellow cabs and the subways. Another traveler alert: The Blue Line subway was closed from Friday nights to Monday mornings due to construction and will be for months. This caused a need for taking cabs more often. I would still recommend this hotel because our overall experience was favorable. As far as returning to the hotel again in the future....it would greatly depend on our itinerary.

We spent 6 nights at the San Carlos and I can thoroughly recommend it to anyone looking for a great NY hotel in a great location. The rooms are very spacious and clean and all the staff are really friendly and helpful, free wifi in all the rooms and free continental breakfast. Great location only short walks to Times Square, Central Park and 5th Ave. Some really nice restaurants just round the corner on 2nd and 3rd Avenues. Overall I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough, we really enjoyed our time there.

A well managed hotel in a convenient location on the east side with some nice amenities such as free WiFi and continental breakfast, albeit a limited selection. The room was large and the furnishings in good shape but somewhat dated. The staff was very accommodating. We would stay here again. The fitness room was small with limited equipment.

Great location right on the 6 line and short walk from Rockefeller Centre. Staff were friendly, double room was OK, nothing special but certainly fine for our 6 night stay. Included breakfast was plentiful. Did discover by accident some old packaged food left under the bedside table which suggested quick previous cleaning but room as a whole was good. Would definitely consider booking again if returning to NY.

Our two families stayed in a suite and a deluxe room for three nights. The location was amazing, walkable to many restaurants and even Times Square. The rooms were oversized for New York hotels. Service was with a smile and the boutique nature of the house gives it a special warmth. All that and a free breakfast also. Great choice for business or pleasure travel

Stayed at this Hotel for a 6 night city break to New York and cannot fault it. The location is fantastic as it is close to the main sites but not right in the center of it. Breakfast here was a much appreciated start to the day. Staff very helpful and friendly. Rooms very clean. All in all we had a brilliant stay here in New York!! Would recommend to anyone thinking of staying here!!

If you like small hotels, I highly suggest this one. The rooms are nicely decorated and staff incredible friendly. Free wi-fi and the nice breakfast set up made my trip easier and more enjoyable. So many other hotels, if you order pot of coffee, ends up with all the taxes, service charges...to be about $16. This was very easy and relaxing even though in the middle of midtown madness!
user_name:
patriciab473
New York City, New York

review_body: Spent a week here in a very spacious one bedroom suite with two double beds plus a sofa bed in the living room. Also had a kitchen area and place to sit for meals, though we ate out.Staff were all excellent from the moment we arrived and were great with the children.Location is very good and central, and complimentary breakfast is okay considering there is no extra cost. For more than a couple of days, you'll want breakfast out though.Hotel and room were always spotlessly clean.Very pleasant stay, and would (and will) certainly return.

I saw a great deal on the hotels website and booked it. We arrived on a Sat and stayed 4 nights. Husband and I stayed in a one bedroom suite. It looked like it had been recently renovated. The bathroom looked new. It was spotless. Nice large counter, plenty of room to place your cosmetics and a separate mirror for makeup. Plenty of hot water and great water pressure in the shower. There was a small fridge ,microwave, coffee and small sink. However there is not a toaster. I rearranged the dishes in the cabinets to make storage room for our snacks. . Lots of closet space and hangers and 3 small drawers to store socks and other articles. Small safe held our I pad . There was an air conditioner in the bedroom and living area with separate thermostats. The air conditioners are on the wall under the windows which gives the room an odd look and makes the windows really small. However the air conditioners work very well and are quiet. I much prefer function over form. The bed was okay- we slept well after walking all over NYC each day. The mini bar was in the bedroom- and had a tray of snacks for purchase on top. I moved this tray to another area because I was afraid it would knock it off if I got up at night. Continental breakfast is included and was adequate. OJ, yogurt , apples, bananas, breads , coffee, tea ,and 2 non brand cereals available. Much better to go to Ess a Bagel for breakfast. The staff at the hotel is wonderful. They are friendly , polite and very very helpful. The concierge gave us great directions on where to catch the cross town bus (Lexington and 2nd ave. ). They have umbellas at the front door to borrow if it is raining. I was really impressed with housekeeping who were friendly and did a fantastic job. The hotel arranged a very nice car service at a reasonable rate to go back to the airport. Now for the bad- There is major major construction next door. It starts around 7 or 7:30am and went until about 6pm. You can hear this noise even on the opposite street( on 2nd Ave). We were lucky - there was no noise until Tues morning. If you are in NYC to sight see and plan to be up early and not back until after 6 pm this will not bother you. However, we like to sleep late and often take a rest in the afternoon before going out at night. If this had happened on Sat or Sun we would have changed hotels. I really love this hotel, and its location and staff are wonderful but the noise from construction ( which is not the hotel's fault.) is very disturbing. Hopefully when we plan our next visit the construction will be further along.

Well, I don't know where to begin. We stayed in this hotel back on February of 2016 for almost 3 weeks. We had to bring our mother for her newly diagnosed cancer to New York so she can get her treatment in Sloan Kettering Hospital that was very close to San Carlos HOME. Every single employee of the hotel including the President had welcome us and made us feel like home. The Rooms are very spacious and easily accommodated us 4 very comfortably. The room service is outstanding, Beautiful loving, kind ladies attend your room twice a day and every single time they do a phenomenal job. The hotel offers Breakfast free of charge every morning and free WiFi. Many hotels in the area does not offer this much amenities free of charge. New York is a very expensive town and if you travel with family, Breakfast alone will cost you over $50 to $80 per day. The hotel is in the heart of Manhattan and you simply walk to Broadway in less than 8 minutes.We were told that many hotels in the area are offering a better discounted rate for Sloan Kettering Patients. However after many days of searching, we found out that Not only " San Carlos Hotel's rate was lower than participated hotels, they offer more. They truly make you feel like home. After 3 weeks of stay we returned back to New York on May 16th to get our mother ready for her surgery. Of course we returned back to San Carlos Home again. Mother had her surgery on Monday and us sisters take turn to stay with her in hospital. Every day, we are greeted by staff members and they give us their prayer for our mother We will be staying there until my mother discharges from hospital. The hotel always accommodated us if we needed to stay longer. I am recommending this hotel to EVERY one who wants to travel to New York for visit or if you are bringing your loved ones for Cancer treatment in Sloan Kettering Cancer center.
user_name:
Jazmin2015
Miami Beach, Florida, United States

review_body: The front desk people were helpful, the room was very comfortable - we had a suite - and the continental breakfast was acceptable. The hotel was convenient for us in mid-town. There is intermittent construction that starts early in the morning for the building next door.

I loved staying at the San Carlos hotel!Beds were super comfy, staff always greeted us with a smile.The hotel offers a good breakfast, different types of yogurt, breads, cakes, coffee, tea basically all you need to start your day right!The location is perfect, in the middle of Manhattan, close to everything yet far enough from all the noise. There's a subway station close by and really great restaurants.Would definitely stay there again!

We had an executive suite - 610 square feet: living room and separate bedroom with an additional powder room - huge by Manhattan standards. The rate included continental breakfast (fresh fruit/ orange juice/ sweet rolls/ toast/ yoghurt & cottage cheese/ cereals) which was convenient and adequate. Staff is very friendly, knowledgeable and multilingual. The elevators are so fast, we never waited longer than 2-3 minutes (16 floors). We will definitely return.

The staff was very helpful and friendly the entire stay. We received great dinner recommendations, and they even helped fix a suitcase damaged during travel!! We loved our large corner room with plenty of space for a family of four. Would definitely stay again.

The staff in every department are very friendly and helpful. Early check-ins, late check outs were no problem. The rooms are large and well fitted out. The building site next door is noisy during the day but we had no trouble sleeping. Having a kitchenette plus table and chairs made it very comfortable. The business lounge is excellent.

Recently I took a red eye from the West Coast to NYC and arrived at the San Carlos Hotel early in the morning. They were able to accommodate me with an early check-in, which was a lifesaver. I was able to put away my luggage and take a shower before my meetings. The room was a suite, so it had a living room with work space, a bedroom, and a large bathroom. The furnishings were very nice. The lobby is beautiful and the service was fantastic. The free breakfast buffet had standard fare and there is a restaurant if you want a more elaborate meal. This is a terrific option if you want to stay in mid-town.

We are a family of 3, the hotel was amazing for our needs! They gave us early check in and late check out for free, the staff was super nice, they gave my baby a cute teddy bear :)I will definitely come back on my next visit to NYC

We had read some reviews giving negative feedback on their breakfast and the noise from the construction site. I would say that the room for breakfast is small, however their selection is good and as someone stated; you can take it back to your room. Good tasty pastries and coffee to start the day. I did this once as we didn't come to NYC for a continental breakfast. The noise didn't bother is once as they start at 8am and if you are up any later, you miss the day in NY. Due to the time difference, I found myself waking at 3am and going for a walk at 6am. There's a lovely walk towards the river and the city is already busy at this time. The room was great and everywhere was extremely clean. When we returned to the room, there had been a turn down service leaving chocolates. They have tea, coffee & microwave in the room along with an iron and board hidden in the cupboard. There a safe and mini bar but I would suggest looking at the mini bar prices before using it. The bed was great and we were told it was a king size, it was larger then our king size at home (everything here is larger). Very comfortable bed with a iPod docking alarm clock and an excellent range of film on the hotel tv. As everyone has said before, it's just a 10mjn walk to Times Square & Central Park. They will also hold your bags if your transfer is after checkout. Helpful tip, if you use your Debit Card here; press the Credit Card button on the machine or the transaction won't go through. The subway is a great way to get round the city. We would definitely return here as the staff are very pleasant and helpful.

The San Carlos hotel is in the perfect location, close enough to a lot of popular locations, 2 min walk to The Rock. 10 min walk to Times Square, 10 mins to Central Park, and far enough away to avoid all the noise. Metro was at end of the road, perfect for going further. Ex Jr suite was a lovely room. Plenty of space to spread out. Not much of a view, but then didn't spend much time in the room.Breakfast was ok, not brilliant. Coffee, pastries, toast etc. It started the day off well enough. Would I stay again, definitely! Would I recommend, again definitely. My wife received a lovely birthday gift from the hotel. Car service back to JFK was perfect, if you need a car, book it with the concierge. Overall, we had a excellent time at the San Carlos.Thank you :-D

This is a small hotel with nice, personal service. Rooms are very large by New York standards, and they are well kept if not luxurious. The hotel's location is great and convenient. The hotel strives to make their guests happy-the adjacent restaurant is no longer a seedy Indian restaurant, and is now a pretty good place that provides better room service.The gym is small and has been clean; the bell service is outstanding, and the hotel is a nice little secret.

We visited NYC for the first time last week, and were so glad to have chosen San Carlos for our break. Amazing service, HUGE room with living room area and kitchen, spotlessly clean, HUGE bed which was really comfortable, and as we celebrated our 3rd wedding anniversary we also had a lovely welcome basket filled with goodies. All the staff were charming and helpful.Location is fantastic, there is a subway (well a couple of different subways) 2 minute walk away, which are on good lines well located to the rest of the island and to Brooklyn, it is a short walk (15 mins) to - Times Square, Central Park. It is an even shorter walk (5 mins) to grand central station and Chrysler building. There are some great restaurants just 3-4 minutes down the road behind the hotel, such as The Smith and Dos Caminos Mexican, and a good breakfast restaurant called Morning star cafe, also a cafe opposite serving quick breakfast (bit like a greasy spoon, cheap and cheerful), if on some mornings/evenings you are too tired from sightseeing to go too far!
