There is a cafetière in the room to make coffee in the morning and hotel generous with refilling the coffee sachets to make a fresh pot or a couple of fresh pots a day, which is nice. Toiletries are given which are aveda, again, a nice touch. Only one negative but it wasn't really a negative for us, we only ventured to breakfast once at the free buffet and it was awful. Just sweet dry pastries, sugary cereal and yogurts didn't look appetising -just not to our taste. We ate out for breakfast other days or just bought some bread from the boulangerie and cheese/ fruit/yogurt from the supermarket down a couple of blocks, and had that in our kitchen as there is a fridge and cutlery and crockery so that's all great. I would highly recommend this as a base for travellers in NYC, it's well priced compared with others, spacious, clean, friendly, and has all the amenities you would need. Thank you San Carlos, we hope to see you again soon.

The 2 double bed room we had in the San Carlo Hotel was very big in NYC standards. It even comes with a mini frig and microwave. The location is a little far from major tourist attractions such as Time Square and Theater District. There was no view from the windows of our room since it was facing a the backstreet. The plus side was that it was very quite and we didn't hear any street noise which would normally wake us up at a crack of dawn. Good value in this area.

My friend and I were in town for a reunion and had the pleasure of staying at the San Carlos. The room was BIG by NYC standards, meaning that it was the size of a normal hotel room with two queen beds, a chair and ottoman, desk, mini bar, fridge and microwave. The bathroom was small but perfectly fine. One thing I noticed was that the interior door to the bathroom was quite solid - impressive construction overall. The staff at the desk were very helpful and friendly. The location is superb and I would definitely stay there again!

Just spent 4 days in New York and stayed at San Carlos hotel. The hotel was very nice, the staff were very helpful and the rooms were very clean. The hotel also includes a continental breakfast in the price which was a good start to the day. We were only a 5 minute walk from the Rockefeller center and about 15 minutes from Broadway and the theatres and Time square. Transfer from airport by super shuttle and return pick up 3.15am was on time, just ring them the night before from hotel to confirm.

We recently took five rooms at the San Carlos while attending a conference in NY. We chose the hotel because of its excellent location and fair pricing. We were thrilled - the hotel staff is wonderful- they bent over backwards to meet our needs, rooms very clean, well appointed and luxurious! The location can't be beat - you're in the center of everything. The construction next door didn't disturb us- its NYC and there's always someone building somewhere. The San Carlos will be our hotel of choice for all our future corporate trips.
user_name:
andrew G
New York City, New York

review_body: Stayed at the San Carlos for six nights (April 13-19) and once again had an unparalleled stay. I have been staying at the San Carlos Hotel repeatedly for about ten years whenever I visit Manhattan. Its location on fiftieth street between Third Avenue and Lexington cannot be beat for its easy access to all the tourist locations in New York City. The best thing about the hotel is its loyal staff which constantly goes out of its way to be friendly and helpful. The same staff whom I first encountered ten years ago are still at the hotel which is indicative to why this hotel functions so smoothly. No words I can write could adequately explain how helpful the staff is other than to suggest you stay at the hotel yourself and be amazed by their friendliness, courteousness, and helpfulness. The hotel rooms themselves are significantly larger than the usual hotel room in Manhattan, gives very good heat in the winter and air conditioning in the summer. The rooms are spotless and the beds very comfortable. The maid service is incomparable. I have never seen a hotel staff be more prompt in cleaning the room each day. There is a fine breakfast offered each morning as part of your room rate consisting of bagels, juice, coffee, and dessert rolls. And best of all the room rates are so satisfactory that one would have to call the San Carlos the best bang for the buck of any hotel in Manhattan. I could not recommend this hotel more highly.

I have been a guest at the San Carlos many times over the years, ever since the hotel was completely renovated.The location is very convenient in an upscale area yet on relatively (for Manhattan) a quiet street. It is down the block from the Waldorf Astoria but does not does not have any of the commotion.The check in is fast and simple and the front desk makes an effort to to recognize and welcome the guests. They are knowledgeable and helpful in the needs of the guests.I have found them to welcome us with warmth which is really pleasant after a flight.The rooms are large, especially for Manhattan and they are very well appointed with everything to be expected in a first-class hotel. The bathrooms are large as well and very well maintained.My rooms have had a kitchenette which has a refeigerator, sink, microwave, eating utensils etc. If I want to stay in for a meal, it is easy to do so.The concierge staff is always very accommodating and polite and does not give the impression of needing to rush off.The wi-fi in the rooms works very well, I never had a problem with it. there is also a business center which I use for printing and copying which is open 24/7.One of the things i enjoy very much is the continental breakfast. The dining room for the breakfast is large and attractive and it is a comfortable experience in which to start the day. The food there is always fresh and good and I can take out my coffee and whatever else to my room.In the many times I have stayed there, I never had a problem with a bill.In summary, I would say that this is a first class boutique-style hotel which specializes in personal service and recognizing its guests. This is a very welcome change from staying in a large hotel where they don’t know you or care too much.

The San Carlos provides us with a convenient midtown location, spacious, well appointed rooms, and a wonderful continental breakfast. Staff is unfailingly courteous and helpful. Ambience is one of quiet elegance, yet relaxed informality. It is our go-to New York City choice of Hotel, one which we recommend to our friends without hesitation

We booked three junior suites, that were on sale on Expedia, for six of us . Huge rooms by NYC standards with a small kitchen area as well as a couch and a couple of chairs. Very clean hotel and generally quiet inside the hotel itself with the standard NYC street noise at night. The major noise issue is the Monday to Friday 8-5 construction next door which is loud and persistent. If you are out all day then it won't be an issue for you. Beds are very comfortable. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Wifi is fast and reliable. Breakfast room is very busy but the basics are there to get the day going. Convenient to major subway lines and within walking distance of the major midtown attractions. Overall, a very good midtown option.

Great location, great rooms.Really nice staffContinental Breakfast is really busy so you will probably never get a table, but you can take as much as you want back to your room.Very good Gym has 2 treadmills, weights etc. Only issue was on checkout. I had pre- paid for my stay in full about 9 months earlier. I asked for a copy of my bill and was shocked to see I was charged over $340 for an extra night.To be fair - as soon as I pointed this out, it was sorted immediately and the money was refunded to my card.Overall everything was great, but just check your bill.

Last week I stayed at San Carlos Hotel, and I would definitely stay again! The hotel is perfectly located ( walking distance to St Patrick's , 5 th Ave, Rockefeller Center, Central Park, Bryant Park, Broadway etc)The rooms are big, very neat and clean, and have a microwave / fridge and coffeemaker . Rates include wifi and breakfast which is very convenient and difficult to find in NY.All the staff was beyond friendly ! I highly recommend a stay at San Carlos. You won't be disappointed !!

fantastic hotel. Suites were warm, welcoming and meticulously clean. Staff was beyond friendly and helpful. Highly recommend. They offer a great breakfast buffet and free wifi. Staff caters to every request you may have.

If you are looking for a great night sleep with great amenities and clean rooms you should book this hotel. My husband and I had a weekend get a way last week and the bed was so comfortable!!! The rooms are bigger than the normal NYC size and the location is key!

As a business traveler I have stayed at many different hotels. The SanCarlos by far has offered the most exceptional personal service I've experienced. I held a business meeting in the 2nd floor conference room. My staff & I stayed the entire week. We were impressed as to how clean the rooms, restrooms and business center were maintained daily. The conference room was restocked daily with beverages & a Keurig coffee maker was also available. What a great convenience! The Front Desk staff was always professional, friendly & ready to assist you with dining or entertainment ideas. After having the pleasure of meeting the General Manager Mr. Rivera & the Director of Sales,Ms Materi it is no surprise why the staff is friendly/professional & gives you that extra personal service so that you feel like you are home. I have returned for additional conferences & have not been disappointed. As a result, members of my staff & I have returned with our Families for leisure. It is very rare to find a hotel in NYC with the spacious rooms and amenities offered by the San Carlos. Thank you for making my stay feel as comfortable as being at home.

I was traveling into NYC and was lucky enough to have a few days before leaving so the wife and I thought of making it a long weekend. We were greeted at the door as though we were personally expected and were kindly run through the check in progress which went quickly (the desk staff seem very organized). We were shown up to our room where the bed was crisp, bathroom clean as a whistle and it was just the right room temperature. There was no skimping on the toiletries, everything looked top notch. We went downstairs to go to dinner and the desk attendant asked if we needed a taxi. We prefer subways when we travel which brings up another point, the San Carlos is convenient to many of the most useful subway lines. We really enjoyed ourselves and when we get back one of these days we'll make sure to get a room there again. Kudos San Carlos!

Recently stayed at the San Carlos and was really impressed with the top notch establishment they run. My exspectations were exceeded beyond belief. The Hotel is centrally located to many places in New York that you cant pass up.The hotel staff were so polite and hepful with answering questions and giving suggestions as to places to visit, entertainment and getting a full feel of what New York City is all about. The San Carlos Hotel was imaculate from the front door of the lobby to the window sills in our room. The decor of the hotel is up beat, fun and really thought out. We had the pleasure of meeting the General Manger Ben River, he was a standout gentleman. He definitely is an asset to the San Carlos and reflects qualities of a true professional and representative of the hotel. Its no surprise after meeting Mr.Rivera that the staff is as helful and professional as they are beacuse he not only sets the example but he leads by it as well. I would highly reccomend staying at the San Carlos you won't be disappointed.

The San Carlos exceeded our expectations! My husband and I wanted a weekend in the city after doing some research we came upon the San Carlos. Our suite was immaculate and so beautifully decorated. The staff were so informative offering us great advice on restaurants and entertainment. It is in walking distance to Time Square, Rockefeller Center and to the best shopping. We would highly recommend the San Carlos!

We stayed at the San Carlos for 6 nights in a junior suite. Lovely comfortable, spacious room with a king bed and bed settee. As our children are 18 and 22 we opted to hire a roll away single (at $30 per night) as bed settee not big enough for adult children. Reception responded quickly to requests and housekeeping was very efficient. We really enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay there again as in a good position. As mentioned in an earlier review there is construction noise (we were at the front on the 4th floor) but the hotel can't be held responsible for this. Perhaps we could have asked for a room higher and at the back but didn't occur to us, a good tip though if you are visiting in the next few months
user_name:
Ginford
New York City, New York

review_body: Last week I spent 5 nights at this fabulous hotel because my apartment required some necessary renovation. I was pleased to find that my room was exceedingly large, yet cozy with charming decor and incredibly clean and neat. My bed could not have been more comfortable, and I slept like a baby each night waking up rejuvenated and refreshed. In addition, as someone who is constantly using elevators throughout the day, I was quite taken and surprised with the great speed of the hotel's elevators. Even more is the complimentary breakfast served every morning saving me time, money and energy.I also made use of the additional lobby area on the second floor (called the business center) which had six computers and two printers with free wifi - very unusual for a small boutique hotel.Another amenity I made use of was the fitness room, which was conveniently located on the 3rd floor with windows all around (unlike other city buildings that stick the exercise room in the basement). The staff was especially nice from the doorman to the house-keeper, everyone was just so polite and helpful - always with smile and friendly greeting.Lastly, the location could not be better - it is close to anything one would want to see in NYC! I highly recommend the San Carlos Hotel to anyone, be it for business or pleasure.
user_name:
Abraham A
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed at the San Carlos hotel for several day in early April 2016. The front desk was great, very efficient and friendly. The room was large for a city hotel with plenty of room. The windows opened a little, which allowed in a light breeze. The bed was comfortable, though a touch soft. The wifi worked well. Yes, there was some construction noise when the window was opened, but it was not too terrible. The hotel is close to many good restaurants and is only a few blocks from the Lexington/53rd subway station. So getting a 4 or 6 train uptown or downtown was easy. There is a tiny grocer on 50th who sells the basics which should save you from attacking the mini bar. The free breakfast is very basic. Rolls, muffins, yogurt, all of which is serviceable but none of which is exciting. It will be fine if you have a large family or are exhausted from traveling the day before but this is New York so there is better food available.

We had the pleasure of staying at the San Carlos last week (April 2016). We were in 1508, a small studio apartment suite. The room was large particularly by NYC standards with small kitchen area with table, living room and bedroom with two queen beds. Very clean, comfortable beds and nice linens. Staff was friendly and even remembered our names. Close to Central Park and Rockefeller Center. There is construction nearby with noise from 7:15 to 5:15 each day. Breakfast included was okay but would have liked something hot added. All in all a very nice stay.

Stayed in a suite. 2 adults and 2 kids. Not cheap but then NYC isn't. The free continental breakfast is a good start to the day. Clean. Noise outside hotel as there is work going on next door at the minute which they should perhaps have stated. Good location. Plenty of room

Think jackhammers at 7am. There is major construction going on next door. Even if you get a room on the opposite side, you will not escape the noise. It's just a large hole in the ground right now, so it will probably be going on for quite a while. The hotel can't do much about it, but they won't warn you in advance either.Too bad. It's a nice hotel otherwise.

There are not enough words to express how happy our family was with our stay at the San Carlos. We were a family of 6 (4 adults 2 children) in the one bedroom suite w/ 2 queens. It was, without a doubt, the best hotel experience I've had in the city. From check in to check out, the staff could not have been friendlier or more accommodating. Spacious rooms and NYC are not usually words that you say together.......unless you stay here!!! Loved it. Will most certainly be back.

staff was GREAT! Front desk was very helpful and booking directly was actually a better price than the online/third-party sites! they even had an agreement with a local garage that took 33% off the parking rate. Rooms were very spacious. We will absolutely stay here again!

Location - perfect!!! Walkable to many many restaurants, famous sites, etc... Subway entrance very close by. Easy to catch cab or Uber right out front. Staff at the hotel are extremely friendly and accommodating!!! I asked for ice every evening when returning to the hotel and after a couple of days the staff remembered and took care of it immediately!! So special!! Free Breakfast is a nice bonus considering that it is not offered at very many hotels in that neck of the woods. No eggs, but otherwise pretty good. Bobbie, one of the bellman, did a fantastic service for us on our last day. As we were a party of 7 leaving very early for LaGuardia, he arranged for a very roomy Mercedes passanger van which accommodated all of our luggage with room to spare!! AND at a very decent price. Be sure to try the restaurant attached - Kb50!! Great food and very friendly staff. Made special homemade potato chips for my finicky daughter!! She loved them!! They couldn't charge the room for our meal, but they were working on getting that up and running! Very much enjoyed our stay!! P.S. Try to find the owner, Mr. Hye. He may give your kids a little surprise.

We had posted an earlier not-so- favorable review of the San Carlos Hotel because of some house-keeping issues that were not attended to in time. However, after management took several measures to make things right, we have changed our view. We are currently at the San Carlos - staying until the end of this week, and can say that without the swift and efficient action of the manager, Evelyn Toro, our earlier view of the place would have remained unhappy. She made it her personal mission to see that we were made comfortable and happy in new upgraded rooms. Her pleasant, apologetic and helpful approach is the only thing that calmed our annoyance. The San Carlos is lucky to have professional staff like Evelyn attending to their guests. She deserves a bonus for changing our minds to the extent that we will consider coming back to the San Carlos and even will recommend it to other people on TripAdvisor and other sites!! The issues: Leaky toilet, broken blinds, faulty shower head are things that happen without warning. Unclean rooms or grungy rooms are never acceptable, but a swift acting management makes all the difference in keeping the guests happy. The night manager - Canute and the Bellhop Roberto were also very helpful. On the whole - spacious rooms for a NYC hotel - suites are recommended - housekeeping may need better supervision to avoid things getting lax - Breakfast is OK - no cut fruit or hot food, but there are good breakfast places around the corner - good overall service - especially if Evelyn is on duty:-) Thank you for making sure our stay was pleasant!

We had the penthouse suite which was great for 3 of us as there was a double bedroom and a bed settee. The staff were very friendly and we were able to leave our case there on the final day which was great as our flight was late in the day. Great views too across the skyline from the balcony of the penthouse.

The hotel itself it very impressive, they organised a car to pick us up from the airport and took us straight to the hotel, the lobby is grand and the staff very helpful the rooms were huge with a kitchen area, and as it was my 21st I was greeted with a hamper in my room with wine in! the location was brilliant for access to rockerfeller and radio city only a 10 minute walk. the hotel had aircon to as it was 33 degrees one day (in june) the hotel provided breakfast which was helpful in the long run before a busy day (breakfast being pastries and cereal)

Went on a Girls' weekend trip to NYC and stayed in the One Bedroom Suite (Elite 2 Queens). There were 5 women and we had plenty of space for all of us and our stuff without tripping over one another. I have stayed in NYC before and this was definitely the nicest hotel at this price point. The room was a true suite with a door that closed between the living space and bedroom which allowed the late night ladies a place to stay up without disrupting the rest of the group. The living space had a small fridge, sink and cupboards with cups, plates, etc. There is also a mini bar that we threatened one another not to touch late at night. The room was very clean. Housekeeping brought us lots of extra towels when requested. The staff at the hotel were extremely friendly and helpful. We even met the owner but he wouldn't upgrade us to the penthouse ; )The hotel is convenient to many areas and we walked to most Midtown locations.

Our family stayed in San Carlos for four nights during a city break to NYC. The reviews I had read before staying at the hotel did not disappoint. Staff were extremely helpful and friendly, from our welcome at reception, to the front desk porters and housekeeping ladies. The hotel is so central to midtown and uptown attractions, and in a really nice area of NYC. Our junior suite had plenty of space for 2 adults and 2 children, there were two king sized beds and a pullout sofa bed. The kitchenette and small dining area were very useful for nights we were just too tired to go out. There are plenty of restaurants on E50th St.and around 2nd and 3rd Ave to suit all tastes and budgets. There is no bar in the hotel but plenty in the area. The complimentary continental breakfast in the hotel is basic, but it did the trick, as most places serve pastries and coffee for breakfast anyway. If you're looking for something more adventurous, like fresh green juices or a traditional hot breakfast, there is plenty of choice around. One morning we were there it started to rain. The hotel had umbrellas ready to suppy to guests who would need one. The hotel has wifi in its bedrooms. There is also a business centre which can be freely accessed by guests and has stronger wifi. The gym is small but perfectly sufficient for a good workout if jogging the streets of New York is not your thing.I would recommend the San Carlos hotel for a stay in New York city, whether business or pleasure and I would definitely stay at this hotel on a future return trip to the city.

Hotel was clean, modern and the staff were very helpful and friendly. There's not much more to say. The complimentary breakfast was a cold buffet with fruit, yogurt, pastries and tea/coffee. There was a hot breakfast available at an extra cost but there was enough in the cold buffet. We were on the 3rd floor with our room facing onto the street, it got a bit noisy during the mornings with traffic as the windows weren't the most sound proof.

Very nice hotel just 5 minutes from Grand Central. No restaurant or bar but who needs it. Great room. "Buffet" breakfast free but not great, OK to grab a coffee. Really nice restaurant opposite worth going to. Despite so many choices in NY I will add this to my list of "would stay again". Rate fair value

This hotel is right in the middle of midtown and as with NYC, around the corner from everything. I was able to make it into Queens for a meeting in about 15 mins via train. The room was huge for NYC standards and the staff was very friendly and accommodating. It rained one night and there were a ton of ready and available umbrellas. The breakfast was also a great perk with fresh coffee, fruit, cereal and pastries.

I would like to thank all of the staff at the San Carlos Hotel, E 50th, New York. From Fabio in reservations, to James when we checked in and to everyone else we interacted with. I love the informal breakfast set-up which is ideal for when you just need to grab something before a meeting. Wifi and the business centre were also great. Ideal hotel for business and the hotel is clearly popular with tourists too.
user_name:
angela16062016
New York City, New York

review_body: Stayed in this property for long weekend in the city with my family. Cannot beat the midtown location, with plenty within walking distance, and the subway a couple of blocks away. Service was very good (with the exception of the ordering of a car to get us to the airport, which would have taken us to JFK instead of Newark if I hadn't spoken up). The room, a suite with two queen beds and a separate living area, was large, quiet, and comfortable, and also had a little kitchenette, which came in handy. The bathroom was smallish, but ultimately fine, with plenty of hot water and good water pressure. All in all, a terrific New York hotel for the money.

My daughter and I spent a winter weekend at the San Carlos. The junior suite was very spacious and the location was great. The hotel was spotless although older. We had a great weekend in the city with the San Carlos as our home base.

We spent three nights at the San Carlos and enjoyed our stay. The hotel and rooms are very clean and the staff is friendly and welcoming. There is major construction a few doors down the street making it louder than normal. I would stay here again next time I'm in NYC.

This was our 3rd visit to this well located boutique hotel. We chose this hotel for its convenient location and its reasonable rates compared to others in this general area. We were booked for six nights in a deluxe room and were pleased to receive an upgrade. The front desk staff and bellman are exceptionally friendly and seem genuinely interested in your experience. The beds are very comfortable and the bathrooms very adequate. They offer a free continental breakfast which is a nice bonus. The only minor negative is that they do not have a garage and you need to walk a few blocks to park. However, on the good side, the hotel offers you a voucher so parking is only $30 per night, a real new York bargain. I am sure we will continue to patronize this hotel.

A girls trip of 5 from Arkansas...from the location being close to so many things we wanted to see and do, to the amazing and helpful staff, to the small and warm boutique feel of the hotel, it was the perfect place for our long weekend getaway.

I have been staying at this hotel for 25 years. Recently after staying at a famous mid-town "luxury hotel" I returned to the San Carlos. Well located, great free breakfast, free wi-fi and a staff that recognizes you when you come through the lobby. And the "bell hop" is of the old fashion kind. Gives you an umbrella when its raining, hails you a cab when you need one.
user_name:
Dudley H
Santa Fe, New Mexico

review_body: Me and my wife & our princes went to New York for valentines weekend. It's was so nice 5 nights the hotel was nice and close to everywhere in the city . Very clean & the staff are very helpful & we have meet the owner . He was a very nice man and Andy was Thank you I will back in August for my birthday

upon entering the hotel with my wife, we were warmly greeted by Andy, of the concierge,a total gentlemen and very helpful. three other gentmen, KORAN, JAMES AND BARAMEE were exceptionally professional, helpful and acknowledgable. they made us feel at home, safe, and like family. I would highly recommend this fabulous hotel to any and everyone planning to visit or stay in manhattan.

Large rooms (by NYC standards), reasonable rate, free breakfast (pastry and carb-centric) and good location. Clean room, although the carpeting may be ready for a refresh. Nice bedding, reasonable mattress, decent pillows. Overall, a very safe bet for NYC.

We stayed here a few years back the second week of December. The place was gorgeous, clean and the staff couldn't do more to help. I'm from the UK and I went over for an audition and they were so lovely helping me with directions, letting me use their phone and they also got me a cupcake for my birthday! The beds are also SO comfortable!! I can't wait to go back there!

I'm really surprised by the rave reviews, to be honest. I didn't see the value here. For a four-star hotel, this was a huge let down. Rooms are very outdated, with peeling wall paper and what may have been some mold on the ceiling. No fan in the bathroom. No insulation from the street noise, so our party didn't sleep well. Weird odor in the room, and seemed like it was cleaned in a hurry, so not 100%. Breakfast was disappointing. I wouldn't go back.

I've stayed on E. 50th St or close by for years, and recently finding my most frequent hotel down the block getting quite dog-eared while maintaining or raising prices I spotted and tried the San Carlos. Am I impressed! Everything was spacious and very clean. For the same cost of the dog-eared room down the block I had a junior suite, with kitchen area, seating area, large bathroom, and set back from the street a bit. Staff were welcoming and helpful. When the blizzard struck and first my flight then a backup train booking were canceled, I had to leave a day early. Staff was gracious and no hassle for that too. Free Wi-Fi--in NYC! Now if you are coming for the breakfast, forget it. It is really just coffee, bread/danish, and yogurt...but in Manhattan that saves you $8-9 a day. If you want more, there is a local luncheonette across the street that has all the eggs and bacon you could want, and a Starbucks within one short block. I travel a lot, and as you see, I'm sold on the San Carlos and will be very happy to return. Give them a try!

This was a perfectly good hotel. Staff helpful when asked. Rooms comfortable. Nice to have a complimentary breakfast which was more than adequate Though we often went to Ess--bagel round the corner to bring back some of their delicious bagels to eat with the breakfast laid on.

When traveling with young kids you must do a research before arriving to a hotel where your little ones will pass the night, after reading all the reviews my husband and I decided to go for this one, price is not high, location worked for us, we did not need to be close to any specific location, we walked from the hotel to Central Park, times squares and Rockefeller plaza everyday. We arrived very late at night due to a our flight delay, every one we meet from the hotel staff make us feel like home. The continental breakfast is a really good continental breakfast, pastries many types, bagels, toast, apples and bananas, Greek and regular yogurt, natural orange juice, teas (more than one kind) coffee - it worked perfect for us! We meet the owner and he take his time to say hello to his guests, he even gave a teddy bear to my daughter. The arrange our car service to the airport and let us have a check out at 2pm. Thanks god we have the chance to travel with the kids and this hotel was one of the best! We recommend it.

Excellent staff,fab rooms made to feel very comfortable second time there will definitely be back stayed over New year it was brilliant we can not to go again cleanliness was exceptionally good breakfast was included thank you x

Outstanding service and great location for midtown Manhatten no matter what time day or night.My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay.We were impressed by everyone's friendlyness and helpfullnes toward us..

We spent 5 nights at the San Carlos the week before Christmas. The rooms were beyond large. In fact the one bedroom was larger than most one bedroom apartments in New York. This is not an over the top elegant hotel. It's a very clean, functional, comfortable, extremely well located, reasonably priced hotel in midtown. I would highly recommend it to anyone visiting New York. Also, visit the New York Lunchonette across the street. Excellent breakfast and a great price.

I stood one week with a friend and it was a really good experience, it was really easy to find and since we arrive the service at the front desk was really good, the bedroom was really big and the bed really comfortable.The location is excellence we could walk from there anywhere we want or there is a subway really close than can take you anywhere.I really recommend San Carlos Hotel and I definitely would come back

We were staying in West Point with our cousins since 12/30/2015 and they surprised us with reservations for New Years Eve in New York City. We wanted to stay outside the craziness of Time Square and this location was great since we had reservations in Little Italy for dinner on 12/31/2015. The hotel was Excellent!!! Everyone from the front desk, to the bellman and even the ladies that brought us the roll away bed for our son, were all friendly and very courteous and helpful!!! They even had a complimentary breakfast the next morning for all hotel guests. We ended staying a little past our time and our key card was no longer working so we went downstairs and they reactivated it for us. Extremely Helpful and very Customer Service oriented. Not to mention everything was clean and as it should be in a hotel. I would stay there again!!!! Thank you for a great stay!!!

The San Carlos suited our purpose, the rooms are comfortable, clean and provided a microwave and fridge., it is close to attractions for both walking and catching the Subway. It is not on the busiest of streets but this is New York A Continental breakfast is included which is very sufficient to set you up for the day. There is free WIFI in the bedrooms and a amenity for using a PC and printer.

I've been to NYC many times and stayed in many hotels, usually in the 4 star category. Just returned from another family trip and based on TripAdvisor reviews decided to try The San Carlos. Most big city hotel rooms are small so we like to stay in a "junior suite" or "mini suite" accommodation. In nyc, that's pricey, around $500/night when we stayed at the Marriott, Omni, and others in midtown. Found a great deal for $325/night at The San Carlos for their 600 sq ft. junior suite. I was nervous because I believe if it's too good to be true...... you know the rest. Well, everything was as advertised and as other reviewers have posted. At least this larger room was excellent. Didn't have some of the high end accents, but you would hardly notice. It was clean, bed was great, free basic continental breakfast. Other reviewers complain that there isn't much selection for breakfast, but it is your basics to grab and start the day. The staff couldn't have been more friendly and made us feel very welcomed. Dinner reservations, arranging car service... the big chains have nothing on this place except a bigger price tag. Location wise was still great...a couple blocks east of the other hotels we usually stay at, but still close to everything. Right next to the Waldorf Astoria. Take advantage of their lower prices while you can because the only reason they aren't as expensive as the others is lack of brand recognition, which is only a matter of time until the word is out.

I stayed at the San Carlos with my 3 granddaughters as a preChristmas holiday. From the time we arrived to when we checked out, each and every staff member was polite, helpful and went out of their way to make our experience a pleasant on.When checking out, I asked for a late check out as our flight was not leaving until 9pm that night. The gentleman at the desk (without my asking) granted us a 4pm time. Having stayed in NYC at this time of year for the past 20 years, that is totally is never the case.Upon our departure, our bellman arranged for us to get a car and driver used by the hotel. A great ride to the airport by a very nice man.As we entered the airport, my granddaughter realized her wallet dropped out of her pocket and was in that car.We called the hotel who in turn was able to contact the driver who returned to the airport, sought us out and gave my granddaughter her missing wallet with everything in tact. There never was a happier young woman.This is just one example of all the courtesies we enjoyed. This is a GREAT PLACE.

The good things about the hotel are that it has a really good location for midtown manhattan. The beds are also very comfy and I must admit I slept very well. Unfortunately I wouldn't stay here again though. Considering what seemed like an extortionate price, the unprofessional and non-genuine experience with the front desk, the absolutely terrible breakfast, in my mind this hotel doesn't come any near expectations.

This hotel is: Super Clean. Very Friendly, Great Value & with a Super Location....Cant say enough... As an extra, the President of the hotel even talked to us, and even gave my children the extra attention. We will be back.The free WIFI and breakfast that was included is an added bonus. Hotel is very kid friendly. In fact one of the employees who worked the check-in area...an older gentleman was showing my fids magic tricks. .

We loved it!!!! Everything about it was perfect!!!! We had 5 girlfriends traveling on a fun NY trip. We needed a room for 5 that was reasonably priced. The San Carlos was the answer! We booked a LARGE suite with 2 queen beds, a large bath, a sitting room with a pull out couch, and a small kitchen complete with table for 2! Clean, comfortable, updated, and SAFE! It was within walking distance to Radio City, St. Patrick's, 5th Avenue, and great restaurants. We even walked to the Empire from here. The staff was exceptional! Polite and helpful every time we had a question. They suggested restaurants that were excellent. They helped with directions and maneuvering around the city. They arranged a car from the airport and back again - very reasonable price! We even met the owner! Polite, charming, and delightful gentleman. The hotel reflected his personality and genuineness!! The San Carlos made our trip to New York the best!!!!!!!!!! It was like a family away from home! Don't hesitate to book here. Tell them the ladies from South Carolina sent you!

The staff was very nice! The room was clean and quiet! We stayed in a one bedroom suite. It was a perfect location to get the Christmas sights easily and quickly. It was definitely a hidden gem in NY!

I travel to the City for an annual event the 2 weeked of December. This year I was pleased to book a one bedroom queen suite at this hotel. The room and bathroom were very large by New York standards. As there are many suites in this hotel; therefore fewer rooms and less foot traffic through the hotel. A simple but varied contintenal breakfast is included which makes starting the day very convenient. The hotel's restaurt, Mint, is a very good Indian reastaurant and worth is visit.

This was a really nice hotel! The property was like new and modern, having been extensively upgraded. The rooms was larger than many NYC locations. Staff was helpful and friendly. I will seek this out again next time. In addition, the location is perfect for midtown activities.

Really enjoyed this hidden gem in NYC. Comfortable, clean, continental breakfast and very welcoming staff. Will definitely use this as our hotel of choice in the city. Convenient to To Rock Center, radio city, museums and 5th Ave shops. Will refer friends and relatives

Loved this hotel. Room size is unmatched in any other New York City double room. Queen beds a great plus. Beds and bedding extremely comfortable. Very quiet rooms....never hear ANYTHING from outside in the hall or on the street. Only used the breakfast one day. It was a typical continental breakfast which is all you need because you want to save your appetite for all the fine dining anyway. Staff was extremely professional, courteous and helpful. There was a bar but we never made it in there because we were on the go. Great section of the city...only four blocks from Rock Center but on the quiet side. This will be my go to place in New York from now on!

Took my granddaughter for her first trip to NYC. Chose the hotel because it was close to everything she wanted to do. Got a junior suite and was so happy with the rooms. Front desk staff was amazing. Enjoyed the free breakfast! Will definitely be back!

A medium sized hotel in an older building has nicely appointed rooms. Ours had a microwave and a fridge, robes, Aveda products. We asked for a quiet room and got it (on an air shaft). Close to subway, restaurants, and shopping. If you bring a car, you have to park in a separate garage-- they give you a discount at one three blocks away.

Perfect location, big comfortable rooms with mini-fridge and microwave, friendly and personal service from the terrific staff. Free breakfast and wifi are an added bonus. Best experience I've ever had in NY.

We stayed at San Carlos Hotel for a weekend getaway and we loved it. Safe area, close to shopping and good restaurants. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was clean, up-to-date, and spacious. We were located on the 17th floor, and on the backside away from all the street noise. It was quiet each night and we woke each morning feeling rested. My only suggestion for the ladies is bring your own hair dryer. The ones here are not very good - it took forever to dry my hair. Will definitely consider this hotel for future visits to NYC. Oh..and a shout out to Gabriel who was so helpful during our check-in and check-out.

Good, clean, simple hotel, conveniently located a block from the 6-line subway, and and 7 blocks north of Grand Central Station. It's also just a few blocks from Central Park. A good value at $280 for a double queen room during the weekend of the Word Series and NY Marathon.

A very good hotel in the middle of Manhattan, very close to Upper East Side, Central Park and 5th Avenue. The staff is very nice and helpful. Breakfast included is appreciated, especially when you are in the States.

The San Carlos is a good and affordable option in Midtown Manhattan. Good service, clean and spacious rooms (enormous for NYC pattern...). The subway line 6 is in a less than 1 minute-walk from the front desk.Excellent option for couples and families going to NYC

They allowed me to check in just after 1 p.m. and then upgraded my TripAdvisor room free of charge. They allowed a late check-out of 1 p.m. the next day which was a tremendous help to me with the sales calls I was conducting. Staff could not be friendlier. Very conveniently located near the Metro. This is a beautiful hotel and I hope to get to stay here again soon!

We booked this hotel never having been to New York. We didn't know where to go or where to stay, and I kept hearing how small all rooms everywhere were. We found s deal on line and booked a double room. The staff was amazing! The hotel was beautiful and they could not have been any better. Our room was super spacious, with a fridge, the bathroom is a little small. They have coffee and breakfast everyday! And right around the corner there is a amazing bagel shop ( long long lines on the weekend )Overall close to the subway and a great place to stay in New York!

Comfortable hotel. Not too large. Friendly and gracious staff made our stay a real pleasure. Beds are very comfortable and the suites have a small kitchenette which makes it much easier for long or short stays

you can not beat the San Carlos.no way..no how!great staff, great location, great roomsstayed there many times................why stay anywhere else?You fell welcomed, Bobby the valet does a fabulous job welcoming you as does the front desk

We stayed at the San Carlos Hotel for 3 nights. What a super hotel. The staff were more than helpful to answer any questions and help out when needed. We stayed on the 7th floor room 709 which was at the back of hotel and found our room to be unbelievably quite with no outside noise. The bed linen was crisp, white and clean and the beds supremely comfortable. The location was great, only 15 mins walk to Times Square, and short walk to major shops on 5th and 6th Avenues and subways. Not really got a negative comment to make about this hotel and I would highly recommend the San Carlos to anyone visiting NYC. Looking forward to a swift return next year!.

So close to everything. 15 mins walk to Central Park, Times Square. Hotel has continental breakfast friendly staff and Andy who was a great concierge great local knowledge he helped us a lot. Heaps of room in the hotel as we where 5, 2adults 3 children. Would not hesitate to go back.

Both myself and the wife stayed in the San Carlos in december for a short xmas shopping trip. What a wonderfull hotel. My wifes dream was to see new york especially at xmas. When i mentioned this the staff at the san carlos upgraded us to a elite suite what a great gesture. Great hotel great staff great location. We loved our stay so much we have just re booked for a weeks stay in july 2016 and we can not wait. Looking forward to seeing the hotel and staff again next year.We can not reccomend this hotel highly enough.

Four of us ladies shared a room for a long weekend stay. First thing we noticed when entering the room was the snowy white bed linens and overall cleanliness. We found the beds to be very comfortable and being on the 9th floor we heard nothing. The location was excellent. We came from Newark Airport into Penn Station then subway to station close to Hotel. Very short walk to Grand Central and 10 mins to Times Sq. The staff were super friendly and efficient. Can't think of anything negative to say at all!Would certainly have no problem recommending this hotel to anyone...

This hotel came as a recommendation from some friends. Not having stayed in NY before, we didn't really know where to stay and have nothing to compare it to. Overall, it was a great location, clean, and professional. The room was very adequate, king size bed comfortable and quiet. The bathroom was small; in particular the sink vanity.Based on other reviews, I knew the continental breakfast was nothing to right home about and they weren't. They have the basic breads, pastries, yogurt, apples, bananas etc. Good for a morning, but a bit tiresome after four.Overall, very good.

We enjoyed a week's stay at San Carlos. The staff was friendly and efficient---helpful and kind! We were very pleased with the large room. We took advantage of a flash sale! Hope very much to be able to stay there again!

The San Carlos is a little dated. However the rooms are spacious, the beds comfortable and the bathrooms are surprisingly large for NYC. The staff are exceedingly friendly and helpful. There continental breakfast which is included is somewhat limited but ut's not important. One does not stay for the free frozen bagel. Would absolutely stay again

I had the chance to stay at the San Carlos Hotel while on a job assignment in New Yrork. I was in a delux room, which by New York standards was nice, very clean, comfortable and rather large. The bed was a queen size, very comfortable, good air conditioning, mini fridge, coffee maker, continental breakfast. The hotel staff was outstanding, helpful. I asked for a recommendations for eating, and received a couple of great places. The staff was so friendly and engaging. The location of the hotel is good also. You can walk in any direction and find someth No to do. The Harley-Davidson store is just a few blocks away, I also used the hotel laundry service. I can not recommend using it for your trip, there is a cleaners around the corner. The hotel laundry service was not good, my clothes actually came back a it wrinkled, and a white shirt returned with a black smudge that I had to wash again when I got home. Over all, I was pleased and recommend the San Carlos Hotel.

I got this room for myself and 4 friends for a bachelorette party in the city. The 6 of us hung in our room for a few hours, which was the One Bedroom Suite elite with 2 queens and it was awesome. Great front desk staff. You could hear noise from the street from our 4th floor room so low levels are probably noisy, but it is NYC....I'll definitely look to stay here again if in the area and recommend it to others. We walked to everything including them to the train at grand central and I even walked back to my bus at port authority on the lady day (took a quick subway on arrival day)Ps - check out Demarco coffee around the corner .. Awesome coffee!

I have been staying at the San Carlos for many years. It is by far the best value I have experienced in NYC, and the location is as convenient as can be for business and pleasure visits to NYC, with many great restaurants only a short walk from the hotel, including Essa Bagel - the best bagels in the city. The entire staff is highly profession and extremely friendly and courteous. The rooms are well-appointed with comfortable beds and pillows and down comforters.

We stayed here last week and very much enjoyed it. Clean, great location and attentive staff. Nice to have breakfast included to start the day. Would have given five stars if the decor was just a notch up.Simple furnishings.

Perfect location. Friendly and helpful staff.“Continental” breakfast very disappointing -- definitely not what is usually known as buffet breakfast. One wouldn't expect plastiic cups and cutlery in a four-star hotel. No hand-held shower. Shower debit cannot be regulated. Wi-fi disconnects every hour or so. Bed linen not changed for a whole week.For $400+ a night one would expect better than this.

We stayed in the San Carlos for a week. From the moment we entered the Hotel we were met by very friendly staff who could not do enough to help. Our room (1002), a great size was excellent; comfortable bed, lots of closet space, lovely sitting area with mini kitchen and finally a large bathroom. The hotel was just 80 or so yards from the subway for travelling up and downtown, plus many sights were walkable to. ie: The Rockerfeller Centre was about 10 minutes walk. The other bonus was that continental breakfast was included in the room price. Overall I cannot recommend this Hotel highly enough.

Have stayed here the last 3 years with my sister and two daughters while on a xmas shopping trip. Staff have always been very helpful and friendly. Rooms spacious and clean. Breakfast is supplied and consist of cereals, breads, Danish pastries, yougurts, fruit, juice, tea and coffee. This is more than sufficient for our group as we do not want to be eating a big breakfast every morning. The hotel is also central for everything you want to do in NYC. We have previously stayed in the Waldorf Astoria twice but prefer the San Carlos any day. We hope to return to NYC again this year and will book San Carlos.

We stayed in the San Carlos for two nights and found it to be a very pleasant hotel with great staff. The rooms were a good size , very clean and comfortable . The free breakfast was good and plenty of choice. Overall a very nice , clean hotel with very helpful staff .

Location was very good. Room was comfortable. We were quickly moved to a new room after we learned that the air conditioning in our first room was completely broken. We chose the hotel for two primary reasons: location, and because we didn't look closely enough at the advertisement in regard to "in room" "kitchenette." We had hoped for a burner. No such luck - just a refrigerator and a microwave. Not terrible, and their advertising was not deceptive. We simply misread, but it was not what we had expected. Breakfast was worth about $17 per day, by NYC standards: orange juice, coffee, and slightly below average pastries. The fitness center left much to be desired: Universal was broken, and the only other machines were treadmills (and I think one stair machine/climber). There was no restaurant in the hotel, but there were dozens of very good restaurants nearby. Our room was adjacent to an elevator, and we were never bothered by elevator noise, or people entering or exiting the elevator. If there were a way to give 3.5 stars, I would have.

Fantastic Hotel, clean and near the main locations of NY (Rockefeller Center & The Rock, Central Park, Grand Central, ONU, MOMA, Central Park. You have the subway near the hotel. We have been in another hotel the first time in NY amb our friends recomended San Carlos Hotel,
user_name:
jose antonio s
Palma de Mallorca, Spain

review_body: Brilliant location roughly 500 meters away from Rockefeller center and 5th avenue. Staff are excellent and always eager to help. Rooms are big (we were a family of five so maybe we had a bigger room) bedrooms in a separate area , kitchen and tv room. Only complaint was the wifi, there were times when nothing would work thankfully is wasn't a major problem as you would want to out and about exploring new York.Overall would ( i have already btw) highly recommend.

Recently, my friends and I spent the weekend in New York and stayed at the San Carlos Hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful. We had three rooms and the person checking us in made sure our rooms were all in the same vicinity. The rooms were spacious, clean and comfortable. They have refrigerators, microwaves and dishes. The Junior suites were very spacious, but so was the Double room. The beds were comfortable, too. A continental breakfast was included and was served from 7-10. We all agreed that the hotel was absolutely wonderful. We even had a chance to meet the owner who was a very charming gentleman. I would absolutely stay there again!

Visited with my husband and 2 children (6&10) in May 2015 and loved this hotel- very clean and spacious rooms and staff were so helpful. Location is excellent as handy for sights and subway however not in the 'thick of it' like hotels closer to Times Square.I have stayed in several other hotels in NYC on other trips however would only return to San Carlos now.

We stayed here three nights. We took a suite for our family of four. It had two separate toilets (one in the shower room) which was handy. There was a bedroom with a comfortable bed and a living space with kitchenette and dining table, plus sofa bed and space for a rollaway bed. The gym was good (and empty whenever we tried it). Everything worked efficiently. We didn't bother with the very basic looking breakfast (but try Treehaus around the block - it was excellent, and I've reviewed that separately). For its class of hotel, this could not be faulted.

Spacious room for 2 adults, 2 teenagers and an 8 year old. we had the one bedroom suite which was good value considering the location. Clean, good quality furnishings with nice bathroom and kitchenette area. Free breakfast offered a good selection but not enough seating in breakfast room (not a big deal, you can take it back to your room). One aspect of hotel reservation in New York to be aware of is the parking. The hotel has a voucher system for use with a nearby Central Parking garage but the car park attendant mislead me in the use of the voucher so I ended up with a bill for $390 for 5 days parking. My complaint to Central Parking is still unanswered so please beware of their tactics that rip off the uninitiated. Aside form the parking issue I would highly recommend the San Carlos Hotel for anyone visiting New York.

5 girls for girls weekend and we couldn't pick a better place. The one bedroom suite was perfect for us! The room was very nice. The breakfast is adequate although there is a delicious bagel place a half block away. We loved the rooftop bar at hotel across the street. I would stay again and highly recommend.

We stayed at the San Carlos on a weekend visit with friends to the city. The rate we paid was quite reasonable for a mid-town Manhattan hotel. The staff was courteous and helpful. The room was comfortable and when we noticed a problem with the drain in the bathroom, it was promptly addressed. The complimentary breakfast was appreciated.

We are fortunate to be able to travel for pleasure fairly frequently, but this trip was for six appointments over two days at the Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Centers. We chose this hotel for its proximity to the MSKCC 53rd St. location. The cancer center was a quick, manageable walk away. The front desk staff were incredibly accommodating of my appointments, allowing us to check in early in order to have a moment to freshen up before my first visits, then giving us breathing room on our check out in case my doctors were running behind schedule, which they were. The room was immaculately clean, comfortable, and surprisingly quiet. Housekeeping delivered chocolates in the evening. Breakfast was standard fare, but nicely included in the room price. The front desk was very concerned that we eat before going to see the doctors! I would highly recommend this hotel for business, pleasure, or medical travel.

Great hotel to stay in a very central location. Very large, clean and quiet room, friendly staff and good service. The breakfast was good, only the room where breakfast was served is way too small and seats are rare!

I chose this hotel as it was the best price for a suite that would accommodate a family of 5 in a central location. (Not many about) It was brilliant. The reception staff were really helpful, nothing was too much trouble with a welcoming smile on your return from a busy day of sight seeing. The suite was large big comfy beds and everything needed hairdryer, iron, ironing board, microwave, toiletries. The location was really good, just a short walk down the street to Rockefeller, St Patricks cathedral, a few blocks to Central Park. Brilliant!! The underground just on the corner. The housekeeper a lovely lady and was truely amazing, on our return our suite was sooo clean and tidy, so really appreciate that. Contintental breakfast was available every morning which was more than sufficient to keep us going.A bit of noise is heard from the street but this is the City that never sleeps so will not grumble about that.If you want a good clean hotel in a great location, I would highly recommend and will definitley stay again.

We are a party of seven and stayed for 6 nights.The hotel was clean and lots of facilities.Room was large and staff friendly. The location is very good for access to all places of interest and the subway etc...We had breakfast early so had no problems with the dining room...Whilst there we had bad news from home on the Sunday and the overseas lines were not working and the receptionist let us use his own cell phone..AMAZING CUSTOMER SERVICE...Would highly recommend this hotel...It was my niece's birthday and the hotel sent up some birthday goodies......Thank You for a lovely stay-we had a great time...

A great hotel for families, the staff was wonderful and very helpful.. A great location.The room was very good and clean. The continental breakfast was nice for the children and us. we would go to this hotel every time in new york.

We have stayed at the San Carlos at the beginning and end of our current holiday and I cannot recommend it enough. The staff are very caring and courteous we found the hotel was in a great location for us, just around the corner from a subway station to go downtown and within walking distance of the Empire State and Rockefeller Centre.The breakfast buffet was fine for what we wanted but if you are looking for a blowout cooked breakfast then this may not suit you.The rooms are very big we stayed in 909 and 609 and the front desk staff were more than willing to organise a rollout bed which fitted without any problems.

We stayed here for 5 nights in Feb.We are family of 4 (two grown up children) and this was perfect, we had a suite and adjoining double room which provided all the space and comfort we needed. Breakfast was great and we never had to wait for a table. All staff friendly and helpful. Nice sports bar very near which did nice meals when it was freezing cold to venture too far in the evening. Would def return.

Excellent lobby and room, central facilities (exercise room, business center) centrally located in Manhattan midtown east, just five blocks from Grand Central and ten from Central Park, fair price.Continental breakfast is complimentary, but facility too small in peak time and selection could improve.

We are native NYers now living elsewhere but we visit often. Usually stay downtown but also enjoy a more uptown location too. The San Carlos was fantastic. This is one of those reviews where you hesitate to recommend a place for fear that everyone else will go there and swamp it. But it really was great. Quiet street. The room is very large for NYC standards. Totally updated, modern bathroom, upscale (Aveda) bath products. Very conscientious and inobstrusive housekeeping service. Great greeting at front desk upon arrival by Evelyn (sorry--I think that was her name) and great farewell by older, totally charming gentleman. We will most definitely be back.

Great boutique hotel that is close to everything. Very friendly staff. The Lobby is always bustling with excitement. The Mint Lounge is a great place to grab a quick cocktail or dinner. I will return on my next trip to nyc.

I stayed in San Carlos Hotel for four days during July 2015 and it was great. First of all, the location of SC is amazing, few minutes from every important point in NY. Second, the people and service are really good.

What a pleasant surprise! I booked a junior suite for a work related conference but extended my stay for a total of 5 nights. I also had my mother and mother in law along on the trip ( yes they get along!) which is why I got the suite. The staff was amazing, the room was large for NY and the location was great. I try to get to NY at least once a year and try a new location/ hotel to expand my experience but I will certainly be tempted to book a room at The San Carlos again!

We have been visiting the hotel twice. Great location, great service :) Spacious room, very clean. Our flight got cancelled just hours before our departure - the hotel was able to extend our stay for one night. One hour after the reservation was made, our airline reopened the flight. San Carlos was able to cancel our extra reservation without any additional fees - great service.The breakfast could have been better - but overall we are very satisfied.

This is my 7th consecutive years staying at the San Carlos. That should say enough but I'm compelled to write more. I'm a hotel junkie - whenever I have a trip (often) I scour tirpadvisor, read the most recent review on the top 10% hotels and narrow it down from there. I think I'm pretty picky. Location, cleanliness, ammenities, room size, look and feel, etc. are all factored in. Ties are broken by price. Every year I review the NYC hotels and absolutely nothing comes close to what the San Carlos offers me. First of all, I feel very safe in the area and the hotel. I'm recognized by the staff that never seems to leave (another excellent sign) and treated with the utmost friendliness and courtesy. The rooms are HUGE and extremely clean. What's so remarkable is that they smell clean - not like the last guest OR deodorizer...just very clean. The breakfast, while continental, offers something for everyone, from hot chocolate to cottage cheese and fresh fruit. I've read other review about the hotel being a bit outdated and I can tell you, nothing is further from the truth. I visited this time with that in mind and just shook my head. The furniture is in pristine condition and luxury-modern, walls are clean and tastefully decorated...having been there so many consecutive years, I think I'd be a good judge of changes but it's as fresh as the first year I visited.The hotel is close enough to walk every where yet far enough away to be out of the crowds. It's a nice easy walk to Central Park, Times Square, Dylans Candy Bar, 5th Avenue shopping and a subway station.So once again, I give this hotel a 5 star rating. See you next year San Carlos!

This was my third time at the San Carlos and each time it has been delightful! I would highly recommend this hotel to others because we were able to walk everywhere- the theatre district, Bryant Park, Central Park and more. Great shopping and restaurants close by and proximate to Grand Central Station and lots of subways. I will definitely stay at the San Carlos on my next trip to New York.

This hotel truly is a hidden gem. One bedroom suite very comfortable with plenty of room to relax at end of day, with chilled bottle of wine in room fridge! Staff are exceptionally helpful, nothing is a problem. The complimentary breakfast is a real bonus for NY, more than adequate to see you through the first part of your day sight seeing/shopping. Excellent location, plenty of bars, restaurants in the immediate area, walking distance to many attractions and subway round the corner. Been to NY many times, 1st time at this hotel but would definitely return and recommend to anyone.

The San Carlos Hotel is just a wonderful place to stay in NY! Not surprsingly, I am doing that already for the last 15 years when I am in NY....Everything is just perfect. The location which is walking distance to the vibrant key areas of all mid-towm NY + the subway right next block that will take you in mns to the village/world trade center; the hotel and its remarkable rooms and cleanliness....and even an included great breakfeast..!...And on top of all this..all the people running this hotel are so nice and friendly, that you will just feel like home! Thanks Gabriel and all the team for always making (even what could appear as impossible....!...) a stay at your place a truly enjoyable one.

Everything was perfect We enjoyed having breakfast on site The staff were really helpful. The location was also ideal as we missed out on all that 'close to Times Square' noise We also recommend the Treehaus for eats to take back to the room to eat.

Expensive but ok considering how close you are to many things such as Time sq, central park etc. 15 min walking distance. Breakfast is very limited choise wise, but with friendly service.Small windows, so a quite dark living room in the suite. View is not good, but probably not important when visiting NY.Liked the fitness room.

I traveled with my husband and 2 kids. The room was spacious. There was a separate bedroom with a full size bed and a TV, a living room with a full size sofa bed, a TV and a small kitchen. There is only one bathroom but with a bath tub and a decent size. Service is excellent at all times. There is always someone with a smile! Breakfast was included (7-10am) and "self-service". It was simple, not American buffet style, which we prefer. You serve yourself and clean-up afterwards. However the breakfast salon gets crowded from 8:30 on so you have to be patient and on vacation mood. Good location, not where noise is unbearable, but walking distance from many sites and a block away from metro. We will definitely stay at San Carlos Hotel when we return to NY.

Great Hotel well positioned in the centre of all the attractions and stations. Very clean spacious room.Friendly staff and a reasonable continental breakfast. Only downside would be that the room for breakfast is not big enough for the amount of people staying in the Hotel. Only sits about 50 - 60 people.

I took my daughter and a friend to NYC in May for my daughter's 16th birthday. From the moment we arrived Koran (sp) at the front desk warmly welcomed us. We had a basket of snacks with a lovely card for my daughter waiting in our room. The staff were incredibly nice and accommadating.Our room was spotless, great wifi, very nice breakfast buffet, basket of umbrellas to borrow when it rained! Great mid-town location - we walked to UN, 5th Ave, Rockefeller Center, Central Park. On check out Gabriel did some magic tricks for my daughter and her friend. What a great place!! Can't wait to visit again in the fall!

The location of the hotel is convenient, the rooms are relatively spacious & clean.Unfortunately, the view is terrible.The staff are helpful but there is not much to offer.The breakfast menu is very limited.Value for money, in my opinion, accommodations in the big apple is expensive.Overall, it's a good place to stay.

On our family’s first trip to New York, we were worried about where to stay, so we took a shoot with the San Carlos hotel, and it was awesome!!! The staff was very friendly, even providing us with umbrellas and tips on how to get around the city, when we asked for dinner suggestions the young man at the desk was more than willing to give us several suggestions, and every morning when heading out, the older gentleman working the front desk (Sorry can’t remember his name) would do a small magic trick for the kids and ask us where we were headed and give us some great advice on how to get there. Being that the hotel was built a while back the rooms were way bigger than we thought they would be, and the hotel was located close enough to Times Square that you walk there in about 10 min, but not so close that you felt the stress of the area, it was funny how we ended every day with “we love this hotel”.

I was plesant surprised when I entered this hotel. It looks much nicer irl than it did on the pictures. It smelle good, the room was clean. Housekeeper came by twise a day, and left a chocolat on the pillow. I slept like a log in a very comfortable bed. Every morning I user the bathrobe wich was provided for me. I will higly recomend this hotel.

Some friends and family and I stayed at the San Carlos Hotel at the recommendation of a friend who travels to NYC often. We were so happy with our decision to stay here! The staff was incredibly helpful and accommodating. You could tell they have a lot of regulars who come there because many people were on a first name basis. We loved the location. The rooms were large for NYC and the beds were so comfortable. Breakfast was great. It was by far my favorite place to stay in NYC and I will definitely return!

The San Carlos Hotel made our party of four very comfortable in a unit that had two, separate sleeping rooms, a bath and a half, and a tiny but well equipped kitchen. The location was good, the atmosphere lively, the staff helpful.

We had such a great stay! The hotel employee's had the best attitude and always so helpful! Each one had a smile and answered lots of questions for us. The room itself was spacious and clean. We were on the 8th floor and had very little outside noise. The hotel was clean and was within 20 minutes walking to Times Square, Empire state building, Grand Central,St. Patrick's, and Herald Square. Could not have asked for a better experience! Breakfast was very nice - just enough to get you started on your day! I would definitely recommend this lovely hotel!

Would stay here again! Great location. Helpful service. Free breakfast in am. Could not hear outside noises for sleeping. Close to subway. Discount parking as we drove there. Liked that room had frig and comfortable beds. Did not give excellent review was due to towels. We had 4 guests but had to call a couple of times to get that 4rth towel. Not a big deal but didn't think I should have to call 2 separate times about it. They delivered the extra towels always in timely manner. Would recommend this hotel.

Stayed at the San Carlos for one night after a late afternoon doctor appointment. We had a large deluxe double on the 10th floor which was very quiet. The bed and linens were first class and the bathroom sizeable and well appointed. The doorman and the reception staff were exceptionally friendly and greeted us by name each time they saw us. The rate was much more reasonable than several other hotels nearby. They do offer a free continental breakfast with an adequate selection of juice, bread and breakfasts. The use of plastic knives and forks and paper plates, however, didn't match the quality of the hotels. The other negative is that there is no garage or valet parking. The garage is about a 5 minute walk and the hotel gives you a voucher for discounted parking which is about half of what you would pay otherwise.We will return.

I specifically booked this hotel because their web site says their rooms are 350 sq ft, which is larger than average for NYC. I was not disappointed. There was plenty of space to walk around plus the room had a small refrigerator and microwave. Overall, the room was clean and nicely outfitted. The rest of the hotel was also quite good. It's a great location near a few subway stations, and you can walk there easily from Grand Central if you are coming in by train. The free breakfast was a nice touch but it'd be better with a few more selections or some hot stuff. Overall no complaints really.

I stayed here for a three day business trip. The hotel is very nice. The rooms are good size for NY. My view was nice. The service has been great. The staff is very friendly. The location is great and very convenient for the Rockefeller center area of NYC. I would definitely stay here again. The rate was very competitive, especially for what you get.

We were very happy with our choice of the San Carlos Hotel. The location is mid-town and convenient to many tourist destinations and the train (subway). Our room was very nice, and the bathrobes were a plus for me! Breakfast was good, including fruit and yogurt, cereals and breads. The breakfast room was a little busy a couple times, so we took food back to our rooms rather than wait for a table. Staff was professional while friendly, and very helpful. They were able to accommodate our request for side by side rooms even though our party checked in on two separate dates. The layout of the hotel floors offers a cozier feel than some places.

Just returned after seven days here .On arrival received basket of goodies for my wife and daughters birthdays ,nice touch.Stayed at the back side of hotel ,nice and quiet.The room was very clean and housekeeping good.Breakfast was decent ,saved time and money as not having to walk round looking for places to eat.I agree with other posters about people leaving plates and food on the tables,it,s not hard to put it in the bins provided.Also the room card didn't,t work a couple of times which happens ,but they never asked my name for proof when giving a new one.Apart from that ,the hotel is faultless friendly staff ,nice rooms ,great location.They also kept the room on till two with no extra charge .I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here again

We arrived late in the evening and was pleasantly treated. Our room was wonderful, nice size, with tea / coffee maker. Lovely soft dressing gowns were cozy. Aveda toiletries were a lovely touch. Staff were always polite and helpful. Downside was the small breakfast room. It wasn't too bad, but some other guests were disappointing, the kind who piled their plates, then left lots, leaving everything in the table and walking away!!! One is expected to put there plates (plastic) in the waste bins.... What a mess and waste!!!! When busy, its not for sitting reading the paper when you've finished your breakfast!! There was a decent choice, mostly breads and pastries, fruit and yogurts. It was fresh and suffice.On our last day an elderly gentleman came to speak with us, asked how we found the hotel and our stay. We found he was the owner!! Lovely gentleman whose pride and joy was parked outside. A Buick. Restored and beautiful.Fabulous hotel within walking distance to subway and Times Square.

This independent hotel made our first trip to NYC complete! Clean, friendly, and with great beds. A special shout out to Andy the bell cap; great advice and directions, even if he is a Yankees fan. :)

Our family of 4 stayed at the San Carlos for 2 nights of sightseeing. It was the perfect location to explore the city, and the staff went out of their way to help. The rooms are large by NY standards and clean, plus our room was extremely quiet and comfortable. After we departed and got five hours outside of NYC, I realized I had cleared the in-room safe and left it open but forgot my diamond ring. I called the hotel with slim hopes of ever seeing the ring again. Fortunately, housekeeping did find the ring, turned it in and the hotel Fed Exed it safely back to me. I am so grateful!

Excellent hotel, very clean, lovely big bedroom (2 double beds), excellent bathroom. Staff very friendly. The room for the continental breakfast is a good idea, could be a little bigger, particularly as guests tended to descend all at the same time (well, they did during my 4 night stay). Breakfast items replenished frequently throughout breakfast time. Would definitely stay here again.

Very enjoyable stay. The staff treats you like family. They want to know that you are happy and comfortable. They upgraded our room with no extra charge. It was a blessing considering there were 5 of us. This hotel is family owned and it shows. Even the housekeeping talked to us on the elevators and would say good morning. The beds are very comfortable and the rooms are exceptionally large for NY. They even come in at night and close the blinds and leave chocolate on your pillow (hope I didn't spoil that surprise for any of you). The hotel is also off of the main drag but still close enough to walk to things. So you don't have to be in the hustle and bustle. I would highly recommend this hotel over a "chain" hotel. Very reasonably priced.

Our family of 4 adults and 1 child shared the queen/queen suite. As my parents and daughter shared the beds we had the fold out sofa - let's say it was a place to sleep for the 9 nights we were in NY. However the room was sufficiently roomy, clean with a kitchenette (no cooker) and mini fridge which suited us to store our drinks and other food purchases. Our room on the 4th floor faced 50th St and apart from some early noise in the evening from the building works next door it was relatively quiet considering we faced the main street. The bathroom window was able to be opened which was good for fresh air. Wifi was good although you needed to log back in after a period of time. Over the 9 days of our stay it was nice to see the same staff (on a rotational basis) and they were helpful and friendly.Daily Continental breakfast included in rate (various mini rolls, breads, packaged yoghurt, apples and bananas, OJ, coffee and tea) was continually replenished, kudos to the lady and gentleman that were serving each day. The room could get full at times but it varied during the 7-10am timeframe.The hotel is in an excellent location - around the corner from the 6 Subway on 51st (straight downtown to Brooklyn Bridge & Chinatown or uptown to 86th and the MET) or the D-E on 53rd (to 5th, 7th, 42nd and 34th Ave). It is also close to various restaurants on 2nd and 3rd, shopping (Bloomingales) and various food marts (eg.
