Safeway), a 15min stroll to Grand Central and a 20-30min stroll to 7th Ave/42nd St passing St Patricks and the Rockefeller.We did have issues with our room key a number of times and needed to get them reset - as has been mentioned previously the front desk easily reset these (or you could call them up to your floor using the floor phone as we were advised so this must happen regularly) but no check was done on ID except to ask which room.Compared to other big brand hotel chains this hotel is excellent value for families and I highly recommend it.

A last minute business function. What a perfect choice. From the front desk staff, to the housekeeping service. Just stellar. Room was clean , comfortable, quiet. Small gym was perfect for a quick work out. The included continental breakfast looked substantial although I just grabbed a cup of coffee. I will certainly return to the San Carlos Hotel.Location was perfect, walking distance to my meetings . Rooms come equipped with microwave, refrigerator, coffee pot and place settings although I did not use them it is nice to know. Bed was super comfortable and I enjoyed a wonderful nights sleep. WIFI was speedy.

We stayed at the San Carlos for 7 days earlier this month and were pleased. The rooms were a nice size and very clean. Ours was on the back of the hotel, so we had a view of the building behind us but it was ok. It was enough to be able to look out and check the sky for weather. Unlike some other reviews, we did not find there was a lot of noise. Our room had a strong smell of Clorex when we arrived. Strong enough that when our bags were delivered, he suggested we call to have someone come and remove the pane of glass from our window which would allow us to open the window and ventilate the room. We took his advice and had to leave the window open for several hours. Unfortunately, there was no screen on the window. At one point I noticed a massive spider crawling along our ceiling!!!!!!!!!! We closed the window immediately. I did keep wondering if there were any other bugs or spiders that had gotten in, but eventually I relaxed. The staff were great! There is a man at the front desk that has a great way with children, he performed magic tricks for my kids and then disclosed his secrets before our week was up. Our last day there, one of the guys in the lobby went well out of his way to find us a cab. (Sorry I wish I knew his name)The free breakfast was sufficient. An assortment of breads, pastries, yogurt, cereal and fruit. I agree perhaps some sort of protein would be appreciated by some. The breakfast room was definitely a little crowded at times. Location wise? I loved it. Very close to many main attractions and subway stations, tons of restaurants nearby... Head over to 2nd Avenue and you'll discover endless restaurants.Unfortunately, we did have one incident that would probably keep me from returning. One day we returned to the hotel and discovered that our key card for the room was not working. We went to the front desk and the girl offered to make two new cards for us. Once we were on our way and in the elevator, my husband questioned the room number that I gave the front desk. He wasn't certain but thought I gave the wrong number, and I did!!!!!!! I gave her room 10-10 but we were staying in 10-06. I went back to the front desk and the young girl fixed it for me. But I have to say it was I very unsettled by the fact that someone could so easily gain access to a room that wasn't theirs. It's a major glitch in security in my mind. So

A GEM of a hotel.Great location and close to all public transportation. .Staff very helpfull. Roomslarge,well kept and very clean.Continental breakfast one of best in my travels in states and abroad.I would highly recommend this hotel to travelers looking for a great NYC experience .Its great value!

Just wrapped up a five night stay at the San Carlos, our first. This is a terrific spot and highly recommended. Location is great, within walking distance of so much. Staff is friendly and accommodating. We found our room to be a great value for NYC- far larger than one would expect. Even though we were on the 'street side' of the hotel, we never heard much noise at all. Room was clean, ac worked well. Nice little exercise room which was well maintained with updated equipment. Nice continental breakfast in the morning as well. Lots of outstanding little fast serve restaurants within a block.

A friend and I wanted to meet for a weekend. NYC was the perfect place, but neither of us wanted to blow a fortune on a hotel room. Since we preferred a room with two beds, it seemed to narrow the choices. Deals often seem to limit you to a king bed. Many overpriced NY hotel rooms are small and cramped. What a nice surprise to find a pretty spacious hotel room with 2 queen beds, a decent size bathroom, fridge, microwave, room safe, free and strong internet - all in a great location. The staff was very friendly, the room was clean and we paid what I considered to be a modest price in the city. I look forward to returning for another stay soon!

Great place to stay for 3 ladies room was spacious staff all friendly and helpful close to subway. walked to Rockefeller sq and central park.could have walked easily to grand central or to Times sq lots of local places to eat. 2 blocks to grocery,pharmacy and wine store

I've been meaning to sign up with trip advisor and write this review since last summer.We had a fantastic weekend.Beautiful renovated suite with kitchen, spacious, great friendly staff and perfect location...We had a certificate from a nearby school's fundraiser but were treated like we had paid top dollar.Highly recommended.

I was dubious about staying at San Carlos Hotel because when you see not expensive prices for a 4* hotel with good reviews, something is strange.And after staying there, I would say ... go ! I was surprised to see how good is this place.Staff always try to help you. They are friendly and helpful. In this case you are happy to give them their tip because they care of you. We were with two kids, they provide us two teddy bears for free for both. Not a big deal for them but appreciated.The position is very good, in the middle of the east part of manhattan. 1 block from subway line 6.The only thing that can be better is the breakfast (not many thing to eat). However iyou don't except for hotels in Manhattan to offer you the breakfast and many don't.Room is clean with a standard size for a double queen bed (maybe a bit bigger than usual) with fridge and microvawe.I've been in NYC many times in differents Hotels and this was the first time in San Carlos. I would definitely recommand to anyone.

Large room, great amenities, great fitness center. The one downside was room service -- the food was fine, but the server knew nothing. Needs training. Also, the actual restaurant and bar aren't good, but there are so many choices even across the street. Extremely convenient.

I stayed here last week with 2 of my friends while in New York to watch the khan v Algherie fight. The hotel is in the perfect location on E 50th street, between Lexington and 3rd. It's 5 minutes from a couple of stations. 15mins walk to Central Park, Bloomingdales, Macy's and Time Square, it's a great location. There are loads of diners and restaurants, banks and convenience stores around the hotel so you stock up on a few drinks and nibbles so as not to use the very expensive minibar drinks & snacks. The hotel itself is very nice. The lobby is not huge but it does the job. We had a very nice welcome from the staff who were very efficient and friendly. The room we had was an executive jr. suite which was a decent size and had a kitchen zone, a sitting zone and a bedroom area. It was plenty big enough for the 3 of us. The only complaint I would have is that there was no extra toilet/WC in the suite apart from the one in the bathroom. With 3 people it would have been much appreciated to have an additional WC as there are in other large suites in other 4* hotels I have stayed in. But that's a small issue. The cost was £350 per night including breakfast which was a good deal for 4* midtown NYC. The hotel was modern and clean and quite plush, although the decor in the rooms (see pics) was more traditional modern. I was happy with the standard. There is a gym on site and a breakfast restaurant. I can't comment on the room service food as we ate out at the many fantastic eateries in Mahattan. There is free wifi througout the hotel which is always handy. All the staff were really pleasant. There is no issue with noise. This is not the cheapest way to stay in Manhattan but if you want 4* quality accommodation and a central locale then IMO this is a reasonable price to pay in midtown Manhattan, approximately £115 per person per night is a cheap.... relatively. I would stay here again and recommend it to a friend.

I stayed at this hotel for two nights. It's located in a central place, but far from the hassle of the city. The hotel is not new or modern, but my room was a good size and extremely clean. The bed was super comfortable and the bath had all I needed. The bonus is the continental breakfast served- it includes variety of pastries, bread, yogurt and fruit, just sufficient to help you start your day. My main problem was the noise from the street- although I stayed on the 14 th floor- there was plenty of noise.

Had a very lovely stay for 7 days at San Carlos. We had a very spacious Executive Jr. Suite---clean, large and comfy! The bed was outstanding! The desk was helpful with directions, suggestions etc. Will certainly stay at again.

Best hotel I've stayed at in NYC in the last 15 years or so that I've been visiting. It isn't the Ritz, but for the price - it is a fantastic option. The location is quite convenient with the subway is just around the corner, although for most attractions there is going to be some walking or public transport required. The staff were without exception outstanding - they were helpful, polite, and constantly looking for ways to help make our trip more pleasant.For directions, booking a car, helping with luggage, business services - changing rooms and bookings, everything was met with polite attention.The room was very spacious for the price we paid and in general for Manhattan we hadn't expected so much space. The aircon worked, the shower had plenty of pressure, and whilst you can never have a silent space in NYC, the hotel room was well shielded from the ambient noise of the street and the other rooms,I had a fantastic experience, and would highly recommend this hotel to others,

Friendly staff throughout our stay. Little touches like bears for our young daughters on arrival and help with getting a picture home at the end of our stay. Room great and ideal for getting to all the sites. Would recommend booking.

We loved this hotel. All staff were extremely friendly and welcoming, especially Bobby who really went above and beyond. The hotel itself was clean, neat and perfectly located for our needs. The room was absolutely beautiful and we were extremely comfortable during our recent stay. There wasn't much of a view from our room but we didn't expect there to be and to be honest the room was so nice and comfortable that we didn't care. Overall we were more than pleased and will definitely be staying here again when we return to NY.

Rooms very good size for NY. A little tired but clean, nice comfortable bed, good wifi, good value for money. Staff very helpful and friendly. We had room 313 which was very quiet. This hotel is not 5 star luxury but never claimed it is. Good value for money

Our room had a bedroom and a room. Although two queen beds were not available for the bedroom, they put two extra beds in the room to accomodate the children. They also had a separte bathroom (no shower) but it gave us confort and Independence at night.

First time in NYC and first time at San carlos and what a place to stay, staff, friendly, courteous, couldn't do enough for you, from opening doors to pressing buttons in lifts, to helping with shopping bags and cases. Had booked a twin room. Plenty of hanging space, hangers and drawers too, but the beds were so comfy we slept like babies after a busy day sightseeing and shopping. Tea/coffee making facilities were well used along with fridge. Breakfast was continental but loads of options and was all fresh and tasty and enough to set you up for the day, without having to leave the hotel. Would definately go back to New York and Definately stay at this hotel again. Location is central to most major attraction and was walking distance to Central station, Times Square, the top of the rock centre, and most bus stops (hop on hop off) and was far enough away from the hussle and bussle of the city. Thanks for a lovely stay.

Had a junior suite. Room was so comfortable and cozy. Extra clean, with evening turn downs. Staff was professional. Excellent location for me and hubby because we wanted to be close to everything, but not totally in the mix. We were able to walk to everywhere we wanted to go, but were glad for a slightly quieter side. Other hotels and restaurants in our block, and around every corner. Again not the excess of other areas. 5th Avenue shopping. Even had a street festival around the corner. Great food there too. Be alert to bed sizes. I thought I was getting King, only to get a small Queen. They said bed size was not guaranteed. Free WiFI and continental breakfast was a win! 100 percent will stay again.

My niece and I just stayed a week at San Carlos. The room (Executive Suite) was spacious, clean and comfortable. The staff was very helpful with suggestions, directions and taking care of our baggage. We didn't have a "view" really, but when in NY ---- who stays in their room very much?? The bed was great-----very comfortable! Thanks San Carlos----would absolutely stay again if I have the opportunity!

San Carlos was a great boutique hotel with very competent and friendly staff. Request for a roll away bed was accommodated at no added cost. It has great amenities: very clean, free and reliable wifi, microwave oven and good-sized empty refrigerator in room (aside from the minibar). The location is nice and quiet (great for sleep) while still allowing you to walk just a few easy blocks to get to Midtown. The free continental breakfast was a bit underwhelming and lacking in protein choices but that's not such a big deal as there are several restaurants nearby. Also, the floor-mounted air conditioner could be a bit loud at times but again does not retract from the overall experience. Highly recommended!

excellent hotel, clean spacious rooms and very quiet. friendly and helpful staff, nothing too much trouble and always smiling! great location easy to get anywhere in new York. my friend and I would choose this hotel on any future visit and would definitely recommend.
user_name:
Mo N Mills S
Winchester, United Kingdom

review_body: My family has stayed at this wonderful family owned hotel many times over the past several years. One cannot beat the location to visit all the New York sights. Once you enter the beautiful lobby you are greeted and treated like family. The rooms are large, always clean and the beds are heavenly. The front desk and the housekeeping staff attend to your every need with a huge smile. A special shout out to Janet, Ben, Bobby and Gabe for always being so attentive and kind. My daughter lives a few blocks away and we would not think of staying anywhere else. We even feel if she ever needed anything, we could call Janet or Bobby and they would take care of her as is she were their own. This hotel is a true gem and the best kept secret in New York!!!!

Very clean rooms. Helpful staff. Close to everything in Mid-town. Comfy bed in a nice-sized room. Would highly recommend. Only drawback that I experienced was the free continental breakfast, however there are two excellent places to have a good hearty breakfast two blocks walk away.
user_name:
Tina W
Albany, New York, United States

review_body: Great location, quiet room. No restaurant, but staff were extremely helpful in getting me a table at the National nearby at 10 minutes notice on a Thursday evening. They also got me off to JFK at 5 am the next morning.On another occasion, I had the free breakfast and there is free wifi which actually works, which is more than I can say for some better known 5 star hotels I have stayed in. Above all, the staff try hard to be helpful.

This hotel is exceptional. Great location and staff. Love that it's quiet and close to everything. The suite was amazing, super clean and spacious. The staff is always there to help and offer recommendations. Great complimentary breakfast in the morning. I would recommend this hotel 100%.

This was a great place to stay for families. The location was perfect. The rooms were perfect. The staff was perfect. Perfect!The staff went out of their way. Great places for eating nearby (Especially the Press Box a few streets away and the Luncheonette across the road).Will definitely be back.

Only stayed one night but a great location in Midtown.Close to all the midtown sites.They up graded me to a larger suite because I could not check in early .They were very accommodating with holding my luggage while we were siteseeing even when we checked out the next day.CLEAN! FRIENDLY ! I would stay there again.

Everyone who works there was wonderful to us during our 2 week stay. Rooms are good size (we had a 1BR with a separate LR) especially for NYC. Very clean, well stocked. Basic continental breakfast, good coffee. Wish they would add boiled eggs for some more basic protein (there is cottage cheese and yogurt). Extremely well located on the East Side. Good wifi other than having to repeatedly log in. We walked almost everywhere, subway stations are close and there are always tons of UBER drivers nearby if needed. We'll definitely stay again.

We were greeted by friendly smiling staff who immediately upgraded for free to a suite. The hotel is attractive, clean, modern and in a great midtown location. The price includes wifi throughout, a good continental breakfast, bathrobes and a daily newspaper.Perfectly located for sightseeing, shopping, eating and Broadway, and only a couple of minutes to the nearest Subway station.

The San Carlos is a boutique hotel that makes each guest feel at home. The rooms are spacious and clean. They are equipped with small kitchens and mini friges. The staff is friendly and quick to answer questions and help you. The breakfast included in the morning will get you on your way saving time and money. I would highly recommend it for you and your family

I have been trying to stay at this Hotel for several years and finally the opportunity arose in that we were not travelling with Grand Children, and thus did not require the proximity of Times Square and such Tourist locations.We were in no way disappointed. Arriving after midnight, we were met by cheerful doorman and reception. Happy to assist and chat. As we had slightly sore throats they even provided a packets of lozengers. The Suite was extremely roomy. Loved the bed, clean and whilst little dated, the furnishings match the decore and atmosphere in and around the Hotel. The location was excellent. Being what l called in New York, and not Times Square was indeed a pleasure. The variety of shops nearby, laundries and transport were second to none. The First Ave bus goes directly to The Staten Island Ferry, and co-located sights.We will return to this hotel. We felt at home, comfortable and not just like another tourist.I would be remiss of me to mention that we went looking for Victoria's Secret's just a short walk away, were doubly impressed by The Harley Davidson Shop a few steps away.I have noted others had mentioned the breakfast in the adjoining restaurant. To be honest on our final morning it had changed to this location and it is indeed very dark. This change l understood to be due to in house renovations. However, the Hotel advertises a simple breakfast and to us was indeed more than sufficient.

The hotel is in a great location a couple minute walk away from the Rockafeller centre,near tube station and plenty of shops and restaurant near by.The communal areas of the hotel were nice.Reception staff were nice and happy to help out with questions.Free wifi and computers with printers on the second floor which was handy.The room was a good sized and nice and clean.Dated decor and the bed was really really soft abit to soft for my liking.Our room had no view and looked out to another building and a massive air con unit.breakfast was served in some bar next door which was dark and gloomy and had dance music playing really loud at 8am.The breakfast itself was poor and basic.Cereal and toast with only jam available,apple,banana,yogurt and horrible dry bagels.The breakfast was so horrible we decided to walk around to ess a bagel ( amazing bagels,you can get everything on a bagel highly recommended ).This hotel lacked the newyork feeling and that why I was disappointed.Maybe my gran would have liked it but it wasn't what I was expecting.Not the cheapest hotel either,I wouldn't stay here again not for young people wanting the real NY experience.

We have been staying at the San Carlos Hotel every year. It has always been an excellent experience. Good location, very comfortable rooms and overall facilities, very friendly, helpful and courteous staff. Very convenient in all aspects.
user_name:
Glaucia V
Rio de Janeiro, RJ

review_body: Booked the San Carlos based on trip advisor reviews and recommended location by relatives who live in New York. Great place to stay. The hotel was in a brilliant location two minutes walk from St Patricks, Rockafella Centre, Radio City. The area is very safe to walk around late at night. The rooms are very clean and well equipped. We are a family of five, two adults and three teenagers and our room, which was a family suite, was fantastic. We had a big bathroom, bedroom with two queen sized beds and flat screen tv. Then we had a living area which was huge with queen sofa bed and two armchairs and another flat screen tv. This was great when the girls were so tried and went to bed and could watch their tv and me and my husband could sit in the living room with a bottle of wine and relax while watching something else. Then we had a kitchen area with sink and microwave, coffee machine and fridge. We also had some crockery and cutlery and a table and chairs too. We love our tea first thing but there was no kettle so just rang housekeeping and they sent one up so we could enjoy a cuppa in bed when we woke up. The only downside to this hotel was the view, or lack of it! Our rooms actually looked out to a brick wall! But to be fair we were only in the room to sleep. Also noise was not an issue as we have seen in other reviews. With the windows closed there was hardly any noise and we all got a great sleep, especially as the beds were so comfy. The hotel also provided a free continential breakfast which we went down for the first day. Its offered in a tiny room and it was very chaotic to say the least. Tea, coffee, juice, pastries and bagels were on offer. We didn't bother after the first day as not what we wanted. Just across the street from the hotel was a place called the New York Luncheonette, which we used most days for breakfast, very good. See my review for this. The hotel also has free fast Wifi. The staff at San Carlos were lovely, very friendly and helpful while we were there. Just to mention, we emailed the hotel before hand about airport transfers. We received a reply saying it would be $200.00 one way. Because of this we got two cabs from JFK which cost $58.00 for each cab to the hotel. When we were leaving, the hotel said they could do the airport run for $120.00 one way. They couldn't explain the earlier email. Not sure what that was all about. Decided to give them the benefit of the doubt and took up their offer for airport transfer. They arrived with a massive car which seated eight and had enough room for all our bags. Would definitely stay here again if back in NewYork.

We stayed for 5 nights at the San Carlos, it's a nice hotel, very comfy beds, spacious bedrooms, the view we had out the back was shocking and windows were very dirty, complimentary breakfast isn't very exciting but it's enough to start the day off with, staff all lovely and helpful, Gabriel on the front desk was friendly at first, but asking for a tip on our last day was out of order! Telling us "everyone has to make a living" he hadn't done anything for us! Saying good morning does not warrant a tip! I've stayed in NYC on 4 occasions and never once been asked by a receptionist for a tip! But besides that incident it's a great location, we found it nice and quiet, a few good restaurants locally too.

Had 4 nights in The San Carlos Hotel New York with a friend. From the moment we went to the Check in to the moment we left we found absolutely everybody friendly and helpful,especially with the guys on reception helping us with our Mobile phones ! Also, Paul was a gem helping us with the Internet, the 2nd Floor had a few computers there, all free to use.We were two ladies of 'a certain age' having a NY break and needed help there! Our room was large for New York, and was exceptionally clean. The bathroom had nice toiletries in. There was also a good sized fridge and mini bar and a coffee/tea machine in the room too, excellent. All the maids were friendly too when we saw them. The buffet breakfast was good with cereals,rolls, pastries and a selection of breads for toast, plus coffee, tea, juice etc. The Roof top Bar wasn't open in April and there's no Bar inside the Hotel, which would have been nice to enjoy a drink in the evening. The location was great, within walking distance of Grand Central ,Rockerfeller Centre, Times Square etc. we would most definitely stay there on our next visit to New York, a nice experience.

My wife and I stayed at the San Carlos this week. The location is convenient to all mid-town attractions, Times Square, theater district, Rockefeller Center, Radio City Music Hall, museums and Grand Central Station. Also nearby are several subway stations to downtown and the outer boroughs. The hotel is clean and well maintained, the staff is helpful and courteous. There's a daily continental breakfast, coffee, juice and various breads and danish. We had a two room "suite" which was generous by Manhattan standards.One down side is the noise and regular sirens, a firehouse and police station are located on the next street, but this is common for Manhattan.

Great location, friendly and helpful staff, free breakfast, and most importantly...neat and clean! We got in earlier than expected. There is discounted parking. We will most certainly stay there every time we are in New York City!

The hotel is lovely, clean, and well located if you want to walk to Central Park or Broadway. The staff was responsive to requests and very helpful. We were comfortable and would definitely stay there again. We did hear some loud sirens at night but I wouldn't say it bothered our sleep.

San Carlos Hotel is one of the greatest locations in NY. Midtown very safe neighborhood on 50th Street between Lexington and Third Avenue. Close to Subway 6-E-M. Close to several bus lines on Lexington going downtown and on Third Avenue going Uptown. Moreover, you can go to Broadway and west side taking the bus on 49th Street, and come back from Broadway and west side taking the bus on 50th Street. Plenty of restaurants, Super Market and pharmacies 24/7 two blocks away...That said, the rooms are huge, service in general is wonderful, and you can even have free breakfast!Gabriel at front desk is one of the nicest men I've ever met. Always funny and willing to help you in everything. Also Bobby helps u getting a cab, helping with addresses and many other things.I truly believe San Carlos Hotel is the best Price/Quality/Service decision you can make.

We were so well taken care of at this hotel! Our Grandchildren were entertained with a magic trick, and Bobby was always ready and willing to help with our plans for the day. This has become my favorite hotel in NYC. It even serves a Continental breakfast , FREE, in this very pricey town.

This is our second time staying here with young kids. The suites are enormous and very reasonably priced by NYC standards. Our 1 bedroom suite had 1.5 baths, very convenient for a family of four. There was a kitchenette with fridge and microwave, pullout sofa, and they brought a crib. The hotel is immaculate. The location is very convenient to Midtown activities and walkable to Central Park, Fifth Ave, Times Square, Rockefeller, etc but not right in the crowds. And Essa bagel is around the corner! I suppose the reason this hotel is more reasonably priced than others is that there isn't a grand lobby or many bellmen, etc to help you, but the service that there is was great and I don't need all the frills, I'd rather have a large, nice room in a great location at a great price!

I stayed in San Carlos NY for 3 nights in last week for business purpose. The hotel is located in a good location near to Central Park (1-2km) and 53rd/Lexington subway, it is cafe and shops when you step out from the hotel.The hotel room is sizable, but I have a room facing the window of adjacent building and nothing to see. I have problem with the room ventilation that is unable to provide fresh air. I ask the staff to open the window (a big glass window must be removed) for having the fresh air, but then I heard the noise from the main road.The staff service is good and breakfast is bread and cake with coffee and cold drink, it is not good as we have in Asia, but it is ok for me.

1st time in New York. Chose this hotel because of its rating on tripadvisor. We were not disappointed. Friendly staff. Large, comfortable and well maintained rooms. Free wifi. Complimentary breakfast. Only once we got used to the geography of the city did we realise what a great location the hotel has. It is a hotel you can feel very comfortable in and very deserving of its high tripadvisor rating.

Quiet, big family room, extremely clean and well maintained. Short walk to two subway stations. excellent restaurants closeby. Excellent staff. Very welcoming to our children. Comfy beds and the best shower! Highly recommended and would stay there again.

I just spent a week at the San Carlos with my daughter and we had a great stay. We had a wonderful, very comfortable suite room with a king bed for me and a new pullout bed in the other room. The small kitchen was very nice and useful. The bathroom was a comfortable size, very clean with lovely Aveda products. It was perfect.The midtown location couldn't be better. We spent time all over the city and I loved having grocery stores, coffee shops, restaurants etc. right outside our door.The staff was fantastic. Everyone was very kind and helpful. The only small weakness is the breakfast. It is quite spare. There is very little selection. It wasn't a problem for us since I just walked to a Food Emporium and bought cereal, yogurt and milk and put it in the fridge.San Carlos is a warm refuge amidst the wonderful chaos of NYC.

Excellent hotel. Friendly staff. Great location. Lovely clean rooms. Super breakfast. Free wifi. The San Carlos is an absolute gem of a hotel one which we would recommend and definitely go back. Great stay in NYC.

My wife and I wanted to be tourists for a change, and spend the evening in the city, and stay, rather than head back to jersey. Came across the San Carlos hotel via Groupon, and it was a great choice for my family and I. Close enough to all the tourist attractions, far enough from the hustle and bustle of Times Square. The free breakfast was OK, for the kids it was fine, but the entire selection was pastries, cereal or fruit. A little protein would have been nice, but it was complimentary, so I'm not that upset by it. When we arrived, it was raining, and the doormen at the front offered us complimentary umbrellas too, which was a very nice touch. Would definitely stay here again, based on the service we received, the cleanliness of the room, and the rate for a suite.

Excellent location - within walking distance to most things.Ffriendly staff, great breakfast (included in the price) and immaculate! Would suit couples, family, business trip...anything really. Defo worth a visit :0)

What a lovely time we had at this Friendly clean and smart hotel Right in the centre of Manhattan Ideally located to visit all the sites New York has to offer The concierge offered very helpful advice on how to get around this amazing city I came with my wife and two teenage girls

The San Carlos was a perfect spot for our boys' first trip to NYC. The staff was friendly and everything was clean and comfortable. We stayed in the junior executive suite, which had a King bed and a pull-out full (?) sofa. Since our boys are tall at ages 10 and 12, we requested a cot in addition, and that worked out very well to have the boys in separate beds. The executive suite is a great size, 410 sq ft, with a living area and separate kitchen and eating area... plenty of space for us all to spread out when we came back from sightseeing. It was good having free Wifi too, and the TV was a nice size. All so much better than a standard hotel room! Although we didn't use it much, there was a kitchenette with a coffee maker, fridge, sink and microwave. We used the fridge for storing some drinks and fruit, and there were dishes in the kitchen so you could have made a simple meal if needed. We enjoyed the free breakfast both days as it was great to get a quick bite and not have to worry about finding breakfast and spending a lot of time/money doing so. The breakfast is pretty good. They have 3 types of cereals, fresh apples, great OJ, coffee/tea/hot chocolate, an assortment of yogurts and pastries/bagels/toast. Our only complaint about breakfast is that the room is very small and congested. The staff needs to come in and out repeatedly to replenish all the items and they have to bypass the tables with people standing in their way as they tried to carry in big baskets of pastries. It was a little chaotic! The room needs to be bigger and there also weren't enough tables so people had to wait. The pastries and bagels are also not great quality....for a city that is known for its bagels, they could do a lot better! However, it's free and quick, so that was a big plus. As far as location is concerned, you would be hard pressed to do better! If you head toward 2nd avenue, there is a large variety of restaurants and a grocery store within a few blocks of the hotel. There is a small convenience store across the road from the hotel. The subway entrances are within a couple of blocks of the hotel, and of course the famous 5th avenue with all its great stores etc is a short walk. On our last day, we left our luggage and picked it up in the evening before departing. As we headed out in the morning, we were mentioning the incoming rainy weather, and the front desk staff offered us free umbrellas that they keep by the front door! They turned out to be very handy as it drizzled all day. Overall, we had a fabulous stay and thought the amenities, location and staff were all excellent. Combine that with a great rate that we found on the internet, and we would definitely stay here again!

What a OUTSTANDING find in Manhattan. The hotel is great. Clean, polite, friendly and accomodating staff. The room size is insane for the price. Same price as a tiny room at a Doubletree or a Holiday Inn for the same price. Free Wi-fi and walking distance to Times Sq. Broadway, 30 rock etc... make it the hands down the best hidden secret in NYC. I do not think I will stay anywhere else when I come to NY. Bravo to the staff, Bravo!!If there is one negative (if you can even call it that but it is worth mentioning for older people/handicapped) there is no onsite parking. It is 2 blocks away. So if you drive be forewarned. Other than that this hotel is 4 stars+++ all the way. Can't say enough about the room, the staff, the location and the cleanliness.

We feel like we found a real gem of a hotel in midtown/east side. For the price of what most nice, comparable midtown hotels charge for a 300 sq ft room with a King or 2 full beds - we got a 600 sq ft 2 rm suite with 2 queens and a full pull out couch AND a great kitchenette area with fridge, sink and microwave. This was perfect for our family of 2 adults /2 children. Major bonus - a very decent continental breakfast that was worth at least another $40 in NYC. Add in the fantastic location, 2 blocks from subway, super nice front desk staff and extremely clean, updated room/bath (great shower) and we felt the San Carlos was the best deal in town. Really enjoyed our 3 night stay. Will definitely go back.

We stayed here during March 2015 and were pleased with this hotel. It was only 1-2 blocks from the subway station which was a positive as we used the subway all week to travel between sites. The room was nice. We booked a suite with 2 queens and a sofa pullout bed for our family five (3 teens). We liked the microwave, small refrigerator, and dishes provided. The beds were comfortable and clean. We did not have much of a view but this was not really an issue. The bathroom was standard and fine but a bit small for a family of 5 adults. The continental breakfast was nothing special but we had no complaints. In summary, we would stay here again.

If you are looking for a super posh, impersonable hotel then this isn't it. What it is though is a super clean, super comfortable, super friendly and extremely peaceful place to relax after a hectic day of visiting New York. Our family of 5 stayed in the family suite. 600 sq ft of space meant we weren't on top of each other. The teenagers loved the free wifi. The location meant that we could easily walk to most of our destinations, so we weren't spending those dollars on cabs but rather visiting more attractions. From the moment we arrived the staff was super nice and attentive to any of our requests. This is my new home on my next visit to New York.

Our first impression of this hotel was being greeted by name when we checked in. What a great way to feel welcome on our first family trip to New York City! We had a room with two queen beds that was perfect for our family of 4 and we were very comfortable during our stay. The hotel is very conveniently located with great places to eat within just a couple of blocks walking distance. Each morning the staff greeted us and were very friendly and accommodating throughout our stay. There is a light continental breakfast, but if you are wanting something more substantial there are a couple of great cafes nearby that were good. I would highly recommend this hotel and we plan to stay here again on our next trip.

My friends and I had a girls night out in NYC and booked 2 rooms next to each other at this hotel. The hotel was great, nice staff, beautiful rooms, comfortable beds. Even though the hotel is in the heart of manhattan the rooms were quiet from the street noise. We were on the 9th floor which may have helped with the noise, not sure. I would highly recommend staying at this hotel. They also had a free buffet breakfast downstairs off the lobby which was convenient. Had nice cozy robes in the closet to use which was convenient since I didn't bring one.

My employer has a negotiated rate with the hotel and I stayed here two nights. Everything was fine, the Aveda amenities are a great perk, the WiFi was solid, and I overall have no complaints. The room was very spacious, and the fitness center down the hall was adequate and clean. The continental breakfast is very basic (cereal, toast, yogurt, cottage cheese, fresh fruit, coffee, juice), and I don't believe there is a restaurant, so I ended up eating out. I was happy with my stay and would come again.
user_name:
Yamster
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Very comfortable, clean, reasonably priced hotel with good facilities.Two of us shared a very large, well decorated room with two (very comfortable) queen sized beds. Hotel is ideally positioned to explore Manhattan. It is also midway down a street so avoids the incessant horn honking heard on the Avenues!

This hotel is the epitome of what you should look for. Great service, amazing breakfast choices to appeal to varying diversities in tastes, and rooms that will blow your mind with artsy decorations and super comfortable furniture. The hotel rooms are much to my surprise, large enough to accommodate for the suggested occupancy size. I have found that because of the need to reserve and make fine use of the limited space in the city, some hotels wish to make their rooms small and cramped. The San Carlos is the complete opposite;They have chosen comfort over room amount, for which I highly applaud them. To add, it's hard to describe how brilliantly placed the hotel is. It is in the center of NYC, leaving you close the Rockefeller Center (which is a great tourist attraction with an amazing observation deck I might add), Radio City, 5th Avenue, and many others. I couldn't suggest this hotel any more!

This visit is indeed my second to the San Carlos. Their staff is congenial and consistently eager to help. The room created both a clean and peaceful atmosphere amidst the buzz of NYC. I have stayed on both the 3rd and 11th floors now and as the floor number increases the view becomes prettier and the nighttime noise diminishes as well. The San Carlos is a hotel tastefully furnished, excellently staffed, and above all strives and succeeds in providing a relaxing atmosphere amongst the hustle and bustle of Manhattan, allowing you the rare moment in "the city that never sleeps" to step back, take a deep breath, and receive an excellent nights sleep.

In summary, I've stayed here a few times for work and would return - not just because it is my company's preferred hotel, but because staff are genuinely helpful, the rooms are mostly decent-sized and the free breakfast, free WiFi and midtown location are reliably decent (yes, I grant you, a hotel's location -of all the adjectives it might not be - tends to be 'reliable'). PROS 1. Location - mid-town east, very walkable to touristy and business locations. 2. Staff - have always met the requests I've made.3. Rooms - clean, quiet with nice toiletries 4. Candy dish at reception - I don't know why it makes a difference, but it does. Even though I usually don't eat it upon arriving back, I like knowing it's there.

This hotel has generous sized rooms at fair prices. The location is excellent with lots of great restaurants nearby. Many of the staff have been here over 10 years and it feels good to see familiar faces every time I visit. Since my first of many stays at this hotel, I do not even take the time to see if I can find a better "deal" elsewhere. I tell everyone I know going to NYC that this is THE place to stay.

Best hotel for the money in midtown Manhattan. A hidden gem that's convenient with great staff and ample sized rooms. I've stayed there for business (and pleasure) for 15 years and it's as good as ever!

Stayed here several times and was never disappointed - very accommodating, friendly, helpful and clean. Highly recommended. The breakfast is nothing special, but its very nice to have something complimentary in the morning, esp in that neighborhood. Hotel also was generous with early check in/late check out requests.

Had no regrets whatsoever with my stay at the San Carlos Hotel. Our flight coming into JFK was very early. When we arrived at the hotel we were able to check in before time and our room was ready. We had an Executive Junior Suite which had great space for our family of four, inclusive of 2 and 9 year old boys. The room came with a kitchenette which was great, with utensils as well. The bed was very comfortable, also had a sofa bed. Chocolates every night with turn down service. Bathroom was very spacious with large countertop. Temperature control in room worked very well. Great hot water too, esp with the winter temperature outside. We had a view of the street below, a little noise in the morning with the garbage truck but nothing to complain about. Room was furnished quite nicely, with enough space to unpack all of our clothes and belongings and stow our luggage out of sight. Safe in room as well. Wifi in room was great, no problems in service. Rooms were always very well cleaned every day.On the 2nd floor is the business centre, was able to book trips and print out boarding passes right there. Free continental breakfast is provided, goes a long way during winter when you don't want to run outside to get breakfast in freezing temperatures. Same breakfast every morning but it didn't bother us. For lunch and dinner you can dine at The Mint restaurant attached to the hotel, very tasty food and good service.I must mention the hotel staff, exceptional service and always a smile on their faces as you enter the lobby. I cannot forget Bobby, always so very helpful, providing assistance in any way he can, definitely an asset to the hotel. Always very friendly and courteous. Also thankful to Baramee who was able to provide us with a later check out time as our flight was a little late. He always had a welcoming smile as you entered the lobby. All of the reception staff were always very friendly and pleasant. When we were leaving, the person I assume is the owner of the hotel was in the lobby, he entertained the boys for a few mins with some magic, much to their delight. Only strange thing...he asked if we took any water from the room. Yes we did use the minibar, we knew it had to be paid for but that is why you leave your credit card on file with the hotel so they can deduct those charges. Didn't think I needed to report to hotel what I took from mini-bar, assumed we would automatically be charged for these items (as my experience with other hotels). But that was my only negative on my stay there. If ever in NYC again I would definitely consider staying here again. The location is great as it's within walking distance to almost everything, otherwise that's what the subway, buses and taxis are for. Great overall stay at The San Carlos Hotel

Am delighted to have found this hotel in New York!! Normally stay at the w just a block away from the San Carlos but will now make this hotel our future choice for stays in New York!! Space is normally a premium for hotels in cities but we were delighted with our one bedroomed suite giving three adults ample space with the added bonus of a kitchenette. The free continental breakfast was plentiful - if I have one suggestion better coffee!! Bagels fruit yoghurt juice muffins all available. Gabriel and bobby were so incredibly helpful with reservations and suggestions and super friendly!! We even got to meet the owner to express our thanks for such a lovely stay and a lovely birthday chocolate hamper for my daughters 18th!

My sister and two nieces spent Valentine's weekend at this hotel. I read tripadvisor reviews on so many NY hotels and chose this one because of the good reviews. I was not disappointed. Check in was smooth and we were pleasantly surprised with the spacious 2 queen room. The room was nicely appointed and very clean. Aveda products were a nice touch. Anything we called and asked for such as towels were brought to our room within minutes. The only slight negative was that the breakfast was not very substantial but certainly was enough to get us started for the day. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend this hotel to friends and family.

I have stayed at San Carlos three times and i have enjoyed my stay. The rooms are very clean, airy and spacious and have full amenities for a very comfortable stay. The staff is very friendly and always with a smile.

I will start by providing some context to my review of this property: I wanted to celebrate Valentine's Day in NYC with my fiancee. I perused the usual search engines and websites and all the 5 star and most 4star properties showed no availability. I then went on Priceline.com (which I usually never do because of not having control over where you end up staying) I requested a 4 star property with a max fee of $500. I was surprised that my criteria was accepted and I was set up with San Carlos Hotel. We arrived at the property at 10:30am. Someone very polite answered the phone and provided us with the room early (plus). When asked, he said there wasn't valet parking at the property and they have an "arrangement" with a public garage 3 1/2 blocks away for a $15 discount (from the usual fare of $45) Mind you, it was 16 degrees outside so this was a major disappointment that we had to park ourselves and walk close to 4 blocks in the midst of a frigid day. (minus) We checked in the room. The furniture looked like it was picked up from a Howard Johnson's going out of business garage sale. the decor was very depressing. I sat on one end of the bed and the other end of the bed propped up (minus)I went to the hotel manager right away and explained our situation to them. I explained that I had signed up for a 4 star property and even though everyone has been super nice (very true actually) the property is not even close to being 4 stars in terms of its facilities or amenities. I returned the room keys and found a last minute availability at the Plaza (review to come) I ended up losing the $500 I spent because of Priceline's policies. Let this serve notice that I think Priceline is a scam organization that takes advantage of non-standardized hotel ratings system and can get away with it. So, if travelers enjoy their experiences at this hotel, by all means they should acknowledge it on these review sites. HOWEVER, most often reviewers misrepresent their experiences by artificially elevating the star rating of the hotel (which is meant to represent the facility, amenities and service). Yes in my limited time of 30 minutes at this property, I could tell the staff had a super pleasing attitude. However, in good conscience I cannot rate this hotel higher than 3-31/2 stars TOTAL
user_name:
RezaFa70
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: we had never been to New York so we had no real idea of what to expect but we were pleasantly surprised with what we found.The staff at the San Carlos Hotel were excellent nothing was to much for them and most importantly they always appeared happy and eager to help and nothing seemed to phase them.It was nice to be greeted with a smile when you walked through into the hotel foyer.As for the Hotel the rooms they were very clean well appointed and the beds and the pillows extremely and comfortable the bath and shower were great ( hot water) and the living room was fantastic to chill out in after a big day of sightseeing.The location is good as well only about 10 minutes walk to main shopping district.Would certainly stay again Happy Aussie

I have stayed here 5 or 6 times over the past few years. rooms are a great value. older hotel but very well maintained, although the remodel of a few years back is beginning to show in worn and stained furniture. (but you seem to find that and worse in the major chains like the Hilton properties in NYC ) great linens too. plus you can not beat the location. walking to midtown attractions and you can be on the subway with less than a half block walk.

This hotel is an example of how all hotels should be run. We were a family of four (2 teenagers) who arrived at a very busy time for NY, yet all was tranquil in the hotel lobby. Everyone behind the counter and even the door attendant gave us a big welcoming smile. They checked us in without fuss, even though we were two hours early. The rooms were clean, and the mattresses were firm. Throughout out stay this warm greeting persisted each time we entered and left the lobby.  Our only disappointment was the breakfast room, which was always crowded and at times we had to wait for a table. As it was a continental buffett, customers kept grabbing pastries and fruit and taking them away to eat later, so the poor attendant had to keep filling up the food more than should have been necessary. Of special mention is The door attendant, who was especially friendly and helpful each time we passed him. If you can afford it, stay at this hotel. You won't be disappointed.

I enjoy the San Carlos. I have stayed there on three separate trips. While it is an older property everything is well maintained. The staff is always helpful and eager to be of service. The bell staff is especially helpful providing umbrellas in the rain and arranging transport back to the airport.

clean, spacious room for our family of 4. First time we stayed away from Time Square. Loved the hotel but we all agreed we will go back to Time Square next time. Ended up walking or taking taxis more than we would have liked. All in all it was a nice stay.

Much has been said about this lovely place. Conservative. warm atmosphere, lovely relaxing staff, big rooms, kitchenettes with fridge and microwave, dishes, etc.Great location. Plain straight-forward breakfast.Clean, Maintained, Attentive.The way they used to be. The way they should.

The San Carlos Hotel is a quiet gem in the center of New York City. Excellent location within blocks of Rockefeller Plaza and 5th Avenue. Rooms are LARGE with very comfortable queen beds. Bathroom was much larger than most New York hotels. The staff was incredibly nice and recommended some terrific restaurants including The Smith. The continental breakfast had something to please everyone in our party. They were kind enough to send up a birthday basket with candy and a bottle of wine for the mothers. Overall, I would highly recommend The San Carlos Hotel and look forward to returning soon.

Fabulous stay! We stayed here for my daughter's birthday. They couldn't have been nicer! This hotel is a hidden gem in the heart of the city! The front desk and staff were terrifc, especially Gabriel. He treated my daughter like a princess. The location was convientent to many attractions in the city. It was blocks from the American Girl Store and Rockefeller Center. The room was clean and quiet. They also had a very nice continental breakfast. I really can't say enough! We will definitely be back.

We have stayed here many times, most recently Christmas 2014. The owner is often on site and is very welcoming. The staff is always gracious, friendly and helpful. The rooms are generously sized and the 1-bedroom suite with 2 queen beds is great for a family. Continental breakfast (included in rate) is just enough to start the day -- good coffee, pastries, yogurt, cereals. Location can't be beat -- right in Midtown. Highly recommend!

Excellent location,very close to 5th,.subway,Central Park.Excellent service, and rooms are very quiet.We stayed at this hotel in Chistmas week We love San Carlos Hotel. I recomend it for vacations or bussines trip

My husband and I alone or with family and friends have stayed at this hotel at least 4 times over the last 4 years and have loved it every time. Wonderful staff and great location. Have always been very happy with our rooms. Free wifi and continental breakfast are unusual in NYC. All the rooms we have had have had a small kitchenette with a refrigerator, microwave and coffee pot. Have already booked for next year.

I have been there five times with all my family (one children and one baby), and always I was very well welcomed by the staff of the hotel. This hotel is super children friendly! I recommend stay there!!Note: This hotel is good because wifi and breakfast are included, if you try to stay in others you will have to pay a part those services. It is good cost-benefit. It is near from the metro lines and buses lines, also it is 10 min from Rockfeller Center (walking with stroller), 20 min from Central Park, and 17 min from Times Squares.

My wife had planned a weekend reunion with work friends and spouses. I easily booked lovely, large rooms with great amenities. The hotel staff was friendly and very helpfulis in directing us to midtown venues. They provided great service.

This hotel exceeded our expectations. The room was larger than we had expected, very comfortable. It was also quiet, which was important to me, as I'm a very light sleeper. Having Internet included was a plus, since I needed to work remotely. It was also nice that breakfast was included in the price, although the breakfast selection was, as another reviewer has pointed out, quite minimal. The location was excellent, in walking distance of everywhere we wanted to go. I have already recommended this hotel to others, and we definitely intend to return the next time we're in New York.

I have always loved the hotel for my business trips in NYC .After stays with my wife for five days I can say that it's owsome hotel for any purpose.Great location , very close to the subway and of course great crew .Lovely !!!

I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in January 2015. Service was friendly and efficient. Room was comfortable and quiet.Free continental breakfast had rather minimal selection, but is clean and comfortable.Restaurant adjacent to lobby, Mint, has superb Indian food at reasonable Midtown prices.

We stayed here as a family of 4 for five nights prior to Christmas (Dec. 18-23) & had the time of our life. Perfect location to walk to Rockefeller, Central Park, and all the sights. More than enough room - kids (age 8 & 11) were fine on the pullout sofa. Enjoyed a room towards the back of the hotel so we didn't hear the street noise. Awesome to have breakfast each day waiting for us. Can't say enough about the service. Bobby the doorman went above & beyond to help us plan each day's adventures. . . chocolates in the lobby AND on our bed pillow each night. The owner even came out to greet the kids in our last day & gave them gifts. Was decorated for the holidays too! Perfect spot for a family trip to NYC. (Great Chinese laundry 1 block down too if you need.) definitely recommend this to any families going to see New York City. Thank you San Carlos! ❤️

We have just returned from a fantastic stay at this hotel. It was our first visit to the city and we weren't sure where to go, but this hotel is in a great location. We walked to most major NCY attractions no problem from here and if we were going slightly further afield taxis were very inexpensive. The hotel itself is very clean and comfortable. The staff are polite and helpful apart from one gentleman on reception who will completely ignore the fact your standing there, however this certainly wouldn't prevent me staying again.

We stayed at San Carlos between Boxing Day and New Year and cannot rate it highly enough! We are a family of four and stayed in a Junior Executive suite which had everything we needed. The hotel is in a really central location and within walking distance of many of New York's famous landmarks.From maid service, to the staff on Reception and the exceptionally helpful concierge Bobby, we were looked after from start to finish. We will recommend San Carlos to all friends and family who travel to New York and will definitely be back!Stay here .. you will be glad you did!

Impeccable service and attention to detail. Everything was provided for us before we could think to request. From transportation to dining recommendations. Beautiful suite, fully appointed. Excellent location. Cant say enough about the attentive and thoughtful staff. Our new home away from home in NYC!
user_name:
KathleenMc16
Princeton, New Jersey, United States

review_body: Stayed here at the San Carlos for one night in December with my wife, daughter and grand-daughter from check-in to departure all hotel staff were very friendly, attentive and helpful. The hotels location is great and easy walking distance to Fifth Avenue, Times Square and Central Park. Our room/suite was great and plenty big enough the four of us..a nice touch was the complimentary breakfast....did not feel like a massive big hotel.....enjoyed our stay.

Stayed at San Carlos NYC for 5 days over Christmas. Not too many people knew where it was so we got into the habit of saying it was a block away from the Waldorf (which it is). Great location - minutes away from Radio City Music Hall, Rockefeller Centre and TImes Square. Also close to Central Park and most everything else is not too far away either. We stayed in an Elite One Bedroom suite - room enough for the 3 of us. Good storage with space in each room. The kitchenette was really handy.The hotel staff were very good - friendly and knowledgeable. The hotel provided 'free' umbrellas in bad weather (and we had a few days of that).The hotel was good value - it's hard to find that in NYC, during Christmas.The complimentary breakfast wasn't great but what do you want for free? You can have cereal, toast, croissants/pastries and (I think) apples so it would satisfy most appetites. There is a good diner across the road which can provide protein should you need it (we needed it a few times).Would definitely keep in mind should I be lucky enough to visit NYC again.

This hotel was a great experience from start to finish. The room was spacious with generous storage, a comfortable seating area and kitchenette. We made use of the fitness room and enjoyed the complimentary continental breakfast. The location is very convenient to the city. The staff was professional, warm and helpful. There is a restaurant attached to the hotel for convenience, but there are plenty of excellent restaurants within walking distance as well. We would definitely stay here again.
user_location: Whispering Pines, North Carolina, United States
user_name:
Anita E
Whispering Pines, North Carolina, United States

review_body: What a wonderful, hidden jewel of a hotel in NYC! Beyond clean, staff extremely friendly and complimentary continental breakfast one of the best we ever had! Definitely recommended Location was perfect for various sight seeing activities.
user_name:
Patricia P
Center Moriches, New York

review_body: The San Carlos Hotel in New York was full of friendly staff all willing to help you get what you want and where you would like to go.A very good location , just a few blocks from Times Square and my favourite steak House Ruth Chris.We were up graded to a suite which had masses of room.A comfortable living room , large queen bed and a nice little kitchen area with fridge, microwave and coffee maker.Beautifully clean and there was a turn down each night with chocolates on the bed.There was also a safe and plenty of cupboard space for all your gear.There was a complimentary continental breakfast which was fine , fresh pastries, fruit, toast and cereal. Tea coffee and juices.To be honest we went over the road to a great New York dinner for our breakfast most mornings.Would we come again, you bet, we loved this hotel for every reason.

Our family of four recently stayed at the San Carlos for a short pre-Christmas vacation. We reserved a Queen suite, which was a two room suite with a queen bed in the bedroom, and a pull-out sleeper sofa in the living room. We also requested an additional roll-a-way bed, which was comfortable, and was provided at no extra charge. The room price included a free continental breakfast (hard to find at New York hotels) which was quite good, and free internet. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The location of the hotel is great, and only a short walk to Rockefeller Center and Times Square. Also, there is a subway stop very close to the hotel.Overall, we had a great stay at the San Carlos, and would not hesitate to stay there again.

Huge, clean rooms! Location is good, not great since it is about .4 miles from Rockefeller Center and a little less than a mile from Times Square. With the crowds, getting to those locations can be overwhelming. For the price and quality of the hotel, though, the distance is worth it. Does have a continental breakfast (didn't go to) but as far as I could tell, no bar, which would have been nice.

Since I selected this hotel based on reviews, I wanted to be sure and write one! The San Carlos Hotel far exceeded our expectations in many ways! The rooms are very nicely appointed and quite large by New York standards. The beds were super comfortable as were the pillows. Not only did our room have a mini bar, it had a microwave and refrigerator. The staff is so personable....it truly feels like a boutique hotel. The wi-fi is free as is the use of the business center. It also included a continental breakfast. You can't beat the location! Just a short walk to Rock Center, one block to the subway, numerous restaurants within walking distance. I can't say enough about this hotel and will definitely be coming back!
user_location: Ponte Vedra Beach, Florida, United States
user_name:
Susie M
Ponte Vedra Beach, Florida, United States

review_body: Stayed at this hotel for five nights (11 - 15th December 2014) and was very pleased with the experience. The hotel was ideally situated, close to most attractions.Our room was particularly large which is unusual by New York standards, with a very comfy bed. The staff were very helpful and attentive. The hotel provided a continental breakfast, which was very much the same each day but provided a good start to the day. We didn't need to wait for the lifts throughout our stay which is very much an issue with some of the larger hotels in New York.We would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel and will be staying there again in the future.

Met our daughter and her family for a few nights in NYC. Great location, exceptionally helpful staff so a good time was had. The staff recommended nearby restaurants for the family that turned out to be an excellent choice. Would return on another NY trip for business or pleasure.
user_name:
BobJane4945
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I have just returned from a short break with girlfriends in New York & we stayed at the San Carlos. It was in a good location,with good size rooms & the breakfast was delicious. The staff were very pleasant & helpful. I would recommend the hotel it was quiet, we were never disturbed by any noise or other guests returning which I have experienced in other hotels I have stayed in. There is free Wifi in the rooms & nice Aveda products in the bathroom. The beds were so comfortable, it was the best I had ever slept whilst on holiday. Loved New York, loads to see & do, just make sure you have comfortable walking shoes or boots as we walked almost everywhere. Highly recommended.

Lovely rooms close to all the midtown attractions. We had a quiet room on 8th floor at back of hotel. 10 min walk to Saks, Rockefeller Plaza and 5th Ave. Breakfast is a continental affair but nice quality. Highly recommended.

My family of 5 always has a tough time finding a room, especially in NYC. The San Carlos had a large 2 room suite that was terrific...comfortable beds that were welcomed after walking all day long. The price was very reasonable; great location in walking distance to many top sites in the city. Will definitely stay there again.

A good compromise of quality, location and price. Large comfortable rooms, good customer service & continental (ie nothing cooked) buffet breakfast included. Its not the most modern of properties in terms of decor or faclities, but the advantages outweigh that.

Had a little trip away with my mum and sister to this fabulous city. We chose the San Carlos as we liked the location. It was within easy walking distance of 5th avenue with good metro links close by too.The room was great lots of room for the three of us and was immaculately clean.The staff on the front desk were very friendly and helpful. The doorman (I think that's his title) was also great and will hail a taxi of you ask. We had breakfast at the hotel and it was a continental breakfast with self service. There was a good selection ranging from bagels, cereal, pastries, toast etc. There was certainly enough to fill up until lunch.We all thought this was a great hotel and would definitely recommend to others travelling to New York. I know if I next visit New York I will definitely book a reservation at the San Carlos.

Rooms are comfortable, (fridge, coffeemaker, microwave, etc.) location is prime, free continental breakfast. It all adds up to a great stay.But the shining stars at the San Carlos are the staff. Housekeeping ("would you like more coffee in the morning, no decaf?") to the front desk and porters who remember your name and go out of their way to make your stay so much better. This hotel is one of the most welcoming places. I've visited 5 continents. San Carlos and its staff stand out as among the most hospitable and welcoming hotels I've visited. I have been there twice on business and will go back for personal travel as well.

stayed here again in Oct. 2014 and as always it is a great place to stay. Location is convenient whether you are doing business or sightseeing. Large rooms...yes large rooms in a city well known for small rooms...comfortable beds/great service from housekeeping and nicely lit bathrooms. Price of course varies but always reasonable given the season and events going on in the city. If you find a lower price somewhere else just call...reservations will work with you to find the same rate or lower! Front desk staff always greets you and are there to help with any request....once you stay here this will be your spot in NYC. No reason to look elsewhere.

This was my second business-related stay and started off really well. For some reason, during this visit, I was also assigned a handicapped-accessible room. No big deal, however. The positives are that it's very quiet, comfortable bed, Aveda toiletries, free wireless, and you can have the NY Times delivered instead of USA Today. The big con during this stay was the lack of hot water in the morning! When I called the front desk, I was told that it was because a lot of people were taking showers and to wait a few minutes. Didn't really make sense to me because it was 8:30 on a Wednesday. I waited 1/2 hour....and no better. At checkout, I was told that something was broken and was being repaired. So, here's the customer service lesson: most people are reasonable and realize that things happen. Be open and honest --- don't tell guests things that are totally untrue.

This was my first time at the San Carlos and I was really pleased with my stay. The location is central, and the staff was friendly and helpful. As a former NYC resident, it is tough to find a place that checks all the boxes, and he San Carlos certainly did.The room was a decent size by New York standards, and the beds were comfortable. The rooms were clean, up to date, and noise free, which is so important in such a busy city.I had my almost 2 year old son with me on this stay and they were very accommodating to his need of a crib. Overall, ,I would recommend this hotel to any and all families and/or individuals looking to spend a few days in the Big Apple.
user_name:
DominiqueT22
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I stay here on my business trips to NYC. The staff is exceptional and friendly, the rooms are comfortable, and it is in a very convenient location for me. The bed is comfortable, a little soft, but quite nice, the shower water pressure is great, there is turn down service. This is an excellent little boutique hotel.

Perfectly located hotel, with spacious rooms, lovely service, a complimentary breakfast and a free WiFi that actually works (though you have to log in every time you return). All for a very decent price. I'll be back

Spent one week at the San Carlos and really liked it.San Carlos is very well located. close to Grand Central Station a couple of blocks away from Central Park we both really enjoyed the possibilities. We were there to run the NY Marathon so being central was import. Also since the race finishes at the Central Garden it was good to be close. We went jogging a couple of times there....Awesome!The hotel is very nice. Friendly reception, concierge and as well the rest of the staff. We really appreciated the very early breakfast they offered on Race Day...it was 5 AM! but on the otherside they managed to mixed up the time as during that night Daylight Saving Time kicked in and the ended up waking us at 3AM instead of 4AM.....oh well....not a biggy...it made us laugh....Beds are incredibly amazing. we loved them! the rooms are fine and we felt cousy. No amazing view from the window unfortunately...not a very high building.All in all a very nice experience...

This was my second time at this hotel. I have a family of five and finding a hotel to accommodate that is very hard. Our room had two beds and another room with a pullout sofa bed. The room with the sofa bed was large with a kitchenette and small dining table. The bathroom is a nice size and has Aveda bath products. The room and bathroom were very clean. The location is at 50th and Lexington which is a great neighborhood and convenient to subway or walking to Central Park, Rockefeller Center and Grand Central Station. The staff were all very friendly. Our room price came with a continental breakfast which included yogurt, cottage cheese, orange juice, coffee, tea, cereal, muffins, bagels, pastries, apples and bananas. I would definitely stay here again.

We were not long term guests and only there for 2 nights. We nevertheless were treated like royalty. My wife commented that it was like the way the Richard Gere character was treated by the hotel in Pretty Woman.The only semi-drawback was that since the building is not too tall, you will not get the vast view of the city you get at some other places. However, the fact that the cost was a lot less than most other hotels made this not really an issue.The hotel has an arrangement with a parking garage a couple of blocks away where you get a certain price for a 24 hour period. I cannot recall the actual cost but it was reasonable.Good location (in back of the Waldorf, near Times Square). I would definitely go back.

I just spent three nights at The San Carlos with my 14 year old granddaughter - her birthday present!! I cannot fault the hotel in any way (although, to be truthful, the decor really needs modernising)!The staff were all so helpful - especially Marleny on reception and Bobby the doorman. Our one-bedroom suite was so comfortable. The separate lounge area was a bonus, as I could go in there and not wake up my granddaughter! Super-comfy bed.The wifi was very strong and the business centre appreciated to check-in online and print off boarding cards.Although we had two breakfasts across the road at The New York Diner, we had the complimentary breakfast on our last morning - and we wished we had saved our money and had the hotel breakfast every morning.Will definitely return to The San Carlos on our next trip to NYC.

My son arranged four days in New York for my 70th birthday. Hotel was excellent, even to provididng unbrellas when it rained one morning. Room was a good size, with comfy beds and on 4th floor was a quiet location. Not much view but when you are out all day and most of the evening, it did not matter. Bathroom was clean and everything was provided. Hotel location was very good, within walking distance for a lot of the attractions with good subway connections close by. Breakfast was good, enough to set you up for the morning - pastries, fruit, cereals, bread etc and endless supplies of fruit juice, coffee tea ect. All in all I would definitely stay there again. Staff very friendly and helpful.

My family and I ( 5 people) just arrived from NYC. We´ve had a great impression of the hotel. The rooms were very nice and clean. the location is perfect, close to Central Park. Very nice staff. We certainly would stay there again. Wi-fi worked just fine.
user_name:
Clarissa V
Vila Velha, Espirito Santo, Brazil

review_body: We stayed four girls in one big room. Even the bathroom was big. Perfect when four people are sharing one room. One queen size bed and one sofa bed. Clean, nice staff, functioning Wi-Fi, and very well located for excursions on Manhattan. The only less good thing was breakfast which was quite limited - but then on the other hand, so many hotels do not offer breakfast, so we were happy anyway.

Stayed here for a girls weekend and thoroughly enjoyed the hotel. It was very nice and clean. They have 2 queen sized beds in the double rooms which is very unusual for nyc but great and comfortable. Continental breakfast was ok, pastries, yogurt and some fruit. Location was great as well. About 4 blocks from St. Patrick ' s Cathedral and 8 blocks from Rockefeller Center. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Will stay here again.

All 6 of us girls were first timers to NYC and we stayed at the San Carlos recommend by a very good friend and I have to say it was a great place to stay. The rooms we had were perfect, we had a 2Q room and a junior 2Q suite which was a great place to meet up for a drink before our night out. The Hotel was super clean and the staff were very friendly and helpful. The location was perfect close to lots by foot and very nice eating close by. We all had the time's of our lives and all want to come back again one day. In fact I think next year I will be back with my husband. And I can say we will stay at the San Carlos for sure!!!

Won a trip to NY in a bagel competition and this was the hotel selected. Absolutely fabulous, the staff were wonderful. Very clean, gorgeous large room, good location. Couldnt have been happier with this trip!

We travelled to New York on a family vacation..spent 6 nights at the San Carlos. Travelling with two adult children I did my research beforehand looking for larger room ( not easy in NYC) included Wifi & breakfast. This hotel provided all along with decent location within walking distance off most places of interest. This was our second visit to the city, last time we stayed at Doubletree in Times Square. This is also a good suite hotel but this time we wanted to be away from the tourist madness. We booked the elite 1 bedroom suite which gave us a bedroom with two queen beds separate living area with sofa bed & kitchen area with fridge microwave & sink. The room was located on the 6th floor. The space was massive, breakfast ( served between 7 & 10am) although quite basic was sufficient to kick off our day. We ate in hotel 3 of 6 mornings there, the other days went across street to the New York Luncheonette which offered good hot options ( pancakes were yummy) we were able to walk to Times Square in 15 mins & found the area surrounding the hotel really nice, safe & with lots of choice of eating places. Never had any issues with wait times for lifts & although we didn't interact much with reception staff..preferring to do our own thing..they appeared friendly & approachable. It was very hot during our visit & air con although noisy worked efficiently. The only negative for us was noise. Although this is to be expected in centre of any city we felt soundproofing was not very good. We were woken in the early hours every night by bin lorries which came anytime between midnight & 5am. Some reviewers recommend rooms at rear of the hotel as being quieter potential visitors should be aware that there is a construction site adjacent to hotel where they commenced work at 8am.
