Not a problem for us as we were out most of the day but might be an issue if you like to sleep late.On a separate note we travelled to New York via Dublin with Aer Lingus & I would definately recommend this. American immigration is done here & 4 of us were processed within 10 minutes. It meant we were able to sail through JFK when we arrived & not have the usual frustrating 2/3 hours it has taken us in past visits.

Five night stay family holiday. Ideal location for Central Park, good walking distance for grand central then on to all sightseeing venues. The room was at the back of hotel very clean and quiet and peaceful just what u needed after a busy day of sightseeing. The hotel put on continental breakfast lovely but very basic good start for your day. The reception and concierge were very helpful and knowledgeable.

I stayed here for 4 nights with my husband & daughter - a 21st birthday treat for her having booked through Expedia & it being the last available 4 adult deluxe room (booking made in April). There are only a few rooms to each floor & they are set in a horse shoe shape so reducing people traffic & noise. I had read that street noise & lights were a problem for some guests but our room on the 7th floor looked onto the back of a high rise grey building with no pavements below - no view & rendered the room very dark but clearly a small price to pay for the quieter option as neither noise nor street lights were a problem. Had to crane the neck to view the sky to determine weather conditions but that was expected in the city & other than sleeping & showering we were out of the room for the whole day. The complimentary continental breakfast was a bonus as it meant we could shower, eat & go without having to look for a place to eat (the crockery & cutlery were disposable though). The staff were very friendly & helpful, the room was clean & the beds very comfortable. We found it within walking distance of all places of interest ie central park, Times Square, Top of the rock, Empire State Building, 5th Ave, Broadway & Grand Central Station where we took the underground to Battery park for the ferry to the Statue of Liberty. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

We booked this hotel primarily due to the fact its offered a spacious one bed suite and for its central location...(but still a little distance from the madness of Times Square where we had stayed on a previous visit). If you want luxury go to The Chatwall or Waldorf Towers but if you are looking for a great location, a clean and functional family hotel with very friendly staff then The San Carlos is for you. We decided not to eat breakfast in the hotel as we prefer the diner experience. The New York Luncheonette opposite the hotel did great pancakes, and Johnny Rockets around the corner was also good. We ate at Sarabeth's Kitchen on Central Park South one morning which was good but not worth the $100 for the three of us. PJ Clarke's on Third Avenue was our favourite, with fantastic crab cakes and burgers. Dos Caminos also on Third was a good Mexican restaurant with loud music, probably more our 19 year old son's sort of place than ours! Would definitely return to The San Carlos in the future.

I am loathed to write this excellent review because I would like this hotel to be my little secret. If it becomes too popular, I might no be able to get a room in the future! Nearly all the reviews say the same...Great location (10-15 minute walk to Times Square)....friendly welcoming staff who cannot do enough for you......free continental breakfast (where 3 of us always managed to get a table in the morning).......spacious rooms, etc.We had one problem with our bath draining and that was sorted out by the time we returned in the evening.I cannot fault this hotel at all. So HIGHLY RECOMMENDED! But please don't tell anybody else ;)

Great mid price hotel with good rooms, friendly staff and bonus of buffet breakfast.Ideal location for shopping and tourism.Quiet, large rooms equipped with microwave oven and coffee maker. Basic crockery and cutlery provided.

I've just spent 8 days staying at this hotel whilst visiting New York for the 2014 Tennis Open at Flushing Meadows. On arrival we were greeted with a very pleasant member of staff at the front desk. Our room was very clean and comfortable, complete with coffee maker, microwave, fridge, dishes and cutlery. We had a very comfortable bed and our room although it looked out onto the rear of the building, was very quiet, allowing a good nights sleep after a long day. The continental breakfast was perfect with a selection of teas, coffee and an excellent choice of breads, pastries, yogurt,fruit and cereals . The Indian restaurant, Mint, which is attached to the hotel, is also excellent . Our Concierge was very helpful and provided us with accurate directions, maps and travel advice. On our days when we were not at the tennis, we walked from our hotel to all of the major attractions like Central Park, Times Square 5th Avenue and many more. This is really a fantastic location and I would be more than happy to return there and would highly recommend this to anyone looking for a good location in New York.

The San Carlos Hotel is in a great location. You can walk to Central Park ,Times Square, and Grand Central Station easily. It is very close to great shopping and the subway. The hotel is clean and the rooms are spacious (by NY standards). We had absolutely no complaints at all about this hotel. The continental breakfast was also very nice in the morning, if you just wanted a quick coffee, juice and yogurt (and it was complimentary). This hotel is not swanky, so don't expect it to be. However, if your vacation in NYC doesn't include spending too much time in your hotel then this is an ideal place to stay. I would definitely stay here again.

We stayed for 2 nights when we first arrived in New York and were so impressed that we rebooked the hotel after 2 weeks of travelling around the East Coast. The staff were friendly and helpful and when we had a faulty TV, the maintenance man was there to fix it immediately.Our room (x2 Queen beds) was spacious, clean and modern, breakfast had plenty of options for all and the location of the hotel perfect for exploring uptown and downtown. Great stay, would recommend.

We like this hotel and have stayed there before. On this visit, there was a problem with the air conditioning controller (it made a beep every few minutes, including all night). Over the course of a 3 day visit we called 4 different times, someone always came promptly to change the batteries and ponder the problem, but the problem wasn't the batteries and it was never fixed (on the last night they finally "fixed" it by disabling the unit and bringing in a room a/c unit).Nobody actually owned solving this problem, and I didn't enjoy the beeping, or having to keep hassling them about it. They were responsive every time, but "trying to fix it" is not the same as fixing it. The coup de grace - I was asked at checkout if everything had been OK with my stay, I said no, told the person the problem - and was given a $30 credit on an $1100 stay. They would have been better off if they hadn't bothered, I found that kind of insulting. I probably should have complained more, but didn't feel like it, I was tired of complaining. Everything else was fine, it is otherwise a good choice, but I was dissatisfied, and will stay elsewhere next time. There are equally good choices on the same block of 50th street.

My family and I had a wonderful time at the San Carlos hotel. At first we were slightly concerned because of the large amount of construction going on across the street, but once you are inside the hotel it is very peaceful and quiet. The lobby is not overwhelming, but it is tastefully decorated and has everything you would need (small sitting area, breakfast nook, etc). I enjoyed both the exterior and interior of the San Carlos. The outside has been left intact and looks very old and regal. The inside has been updated and remodeled over the years, but still looks very classy and carries the regal qualities of the exterior inside. My favorite part of the San Carlos were the employees. All the employees were extremely helpful and seemed happy to be working there. From the bell hop to the front desk all were very hospitable and ready to assist my family and I in anything we may need. The location is unbeatable. All in all the San Carlos is a wonderful hotel I would recommend time and time again.

The San Carlos hotel is like a home away from home. The staff are kind, personable and always remember your name. The hotel rooms are beautiful, spacious and have a mini kitchen. The front desk staff members are the best, they will draw you maps and give you very explicit directions so you won't get lost. They know all the best restaurants and will help you with getting your Broadway show tickets. I love staying at this hotel.

We take an annual girls trip to the US Open. This is our 4th stay at the San Carlos. Each visit, we are treated like family coming home to visit. Bobby, greets us at the door like a long lost cousin. Gabriel, behind the desk, has a magic trick for us each time. We would never stay any place else. It is one of the cleanest hotels I have stayed in. The housekeeping staff is very attentive and friendly. We stay in one of the suites, which is nice and roomy for 4 women. The bathroom is nice and big with a long counter top. The beds are very comfortable. They have a nice, free continental breakfast each morning...try finding that at the other New York hotels. The San Carlos is close to subway stops, which makes it easy to get anywhere on the 4, 5, 6 green line. It is two stops from Grand Central, which makes it easy to get anywhere in Manhattan. I cannot recommend this hotel high enough!

Have always used the Best Western Hospitality House on 49th, but they were booked and suggested the San Carlos. Using their advance purchase, non-refundable option, I saved the equivalent of a night's rent on. 4-day stay. Spacious living room w/mini kitchen (only complaint there is no ice except from concierge). Free breakfast (bagels, muffins, pastries, cereal, yogurt, fruit, coffee, tea, milk-I bought a giqnt mug and filled it downstairs every morning to bring back to my suite); free wi-fi (the Pimberly Suites across the street charges $13/day for wi-fi!). Bedroom with queen bed, sleeper sofa in the living room. Bonus: half bath off the living area! I have NEVER seen this in any NYC hotel - suites or not. The staff is superb and so friendly and helpful. My trip was to introduce my 5 and 9 year old granddaughters to NYC, and they were welcomed from our first walk through the revolving door (which they loved). By our 2nd day, the girls were going down To bring back breakfast on their own in the morning; knowing that the front desk would be watching out for them. I cannot recommend this hotel too highly; it will now always be my 'go-to' hotel in NYC.

We stayed here for one night to attend a family event in NYC. The suite was very clean and spacious for 4 adults and a 2 year old. The beds were very comfortable. The staff was very helpful with great recommendations for child-friendly restaurants and nearby parks. Everyone from the desk clerk to the doorman were very friendly and welcoming. It is a nice neighborhood with lots of attractions, such as Central Park and 5th Avenue, in easy walking distance.

Trying to book a hotel in New York is an absolute minefield, price, location, cleanliness, space, breakfast all important. well the San Carlos Hotel met all of the above.On our early arrival we were greeted by smiling courteous staff our room was ready so we went straight up. We had booked a 1 bedroom suite for a family of 4, it wasn't the biggest suite but it was comfortable for bedtime! The hotel was absolutely spotless with staff available all the time for any questions that we had about restaurants etc.The breakfast room is very small which can be a bit of a struggle if you get your timing wrong but very welcoming once you find a table or as we did one morning grab what you want and eat in your room not a problem. I would recommend this hotel for your hectic stay in Manhattan its great value.........

As a travel agent , I send clients all over the world. This is the review my client CG sent to me following their stay at the San Carlos Hotel in New York. "Our stay there was awesome, our suite was lovely, rooms well equipped and sparkling clean. The staff were great, particularly the doorman Bobby who was ready at any moment to help with anything. The kids loved him and still talk about him. The continental breakfast was the best that I have seen, always lots of choices and freshly topped up continuously.All in all it was a very successful stay and we would certainly recommend the San Carlos

Only stayed for a couple of nights but was wonderful. Had always wanted to visit New York and spent weeks looking into places to stay with 2 young children (2 and 5). Very well priced for what we wanted in a perfect locationStaff were wonderful and so helpful, giving us great information on getting around with children. Room was upgraded which suited much better for us. Would highly recommend to anyone wanting a nice place in a fantastic location.
user_name:
Anna C
Christchurch, Canterbury, New Zealand

review_body: All in all, it's a great hotel to stay at in NYC. The location is great, a few minutes away from Central Park and Times Square, the most visited places by tourists. As well, it's a few blocks away from several Subway Stations, allowing you to go anywhere in NYC. The acomodations are great, also the personal and the cleanliness of the room and common areas.The only "downpoint", was that the room where my family stayed (bedroom + livingroom with foldable bed) had 1 bathroom for all 4 of us, without any windows or ventilation.

Just returned from a great stay at the San Carlos. First of all the location is very convenient for the subway being only a couple of hundred metres from two different stations. We got the subway from JFK via Jamaica station in around 50 minutes which was probably quicker than a cab given how busy the traffic was. We then used the metro cards for the rest of the week as it was so convenient to get from the hotel to all the sights via Subway.The room was great for a family of five with two double beds in the bedroom and a sofa bed in the living room (which was ultra easy to make up!). Wifi wasn't the fasted in the world but was very reliable and was never once unavailable. The breakfast room is fairly small but everything is set up to take away if necessary - coffee cups with lids and disposable plates. We were still on UK time so were up at 7 when it wasn't busy anyway. The neighbourhood is quite pricey but there are a couple of decent food places nearby for a quick family dinner.

We were a family of five, 3 children ages 10 years old (twin) and a 7 year old. We had stayed there on August 3rd - 8th. We had booked the 600 square feet suite and was truly happy with its size and upkeep. We had two bathrooms, which was a huge plus. The Staff from the front desk to the room service attendant was as pleasant as ever, the doormen were very knowledgeable and most helpful . The Location is great, not far from the subways, Rockefeller Center and restaurants. The continental breakfast was excellent, everything was fresh and every request was met. Loved our time in NYC,felt at home , because of the courtesies , show by every staff we met. On a side note ,the kids were even entertained with magic tricks at the Front Desk.

Found San Carlos after quite a bit of research. It was our first time in NYC as a family, having individually stayed at the Roosevelt and in NJ before. We had a very pleasant stay.The room was always taken care of. The attention to detail such as keeping the breakfast supplies filled up, bathroom supplies, helping with directions, or a 'good morning' from the staff - small touches that made all the difference. We thought from reading some reviews that breakfast could be a lower point, however there were good enough protein choices such as yogurt and cottage cheese and we never felt hungry until lunch time. Location was great - get yourself acquainted with the subway system as soon as possible, be prepared to walk a lot and feel the energy of this beautiful city.

We just came back from a 4 day stay at the San Carlos (our first). What a wonderful hotel! We knew it would be a great experience when the gentleman at the front desk did a magic trick for our son as we checked in! The entire staff was friendly and helpful. The room was spacious and clean and the beds were very comfortable. We also found the room to be very quiet. I was suprised to be impressed by the elevators---they were very fast! The continental breakfast was very nice. I was very impressed that they even had two different kinds of cottage cheese (4% and 2% milkfat) in addition to Stoneyfield (not just Dannon) yogurts. Loved the Aveda bath products that were provided in the room. Our housekeeper was so sweet to offer us fresh towels and more bath products the morning we were checking out (even though she would be cleaning the room again in a matter of hours) just in case we wanted to shower again before we got on the plane. The location is absolutely perfect. We were all over from Yankee Stadium to the Statue of Liberty to the Circle Line boats and this location was central for everything. I have already recommended this hotel to friends coming to NYC in the fall.

For the first time in many trips to NYC, I had a room that didn't feel like a shoe-box. The overall room and the bathroom were really a nice change. The hotel is an older hotel, but it was very clean, the staff friendly, and overall very comfortable. If I had to pick on anything it would be that the floors creaked a bit (consider it character)and the water could have been a bit hotter for shaving, but that's being picky. I would stay again.

Very comfortable bed, centrally located for the subway, good sized room and bathroom... and most importantly for this time of year in New York, powerful air conditioning! Also good as wifi is included in the rate, as opposed to many hotels where it costs extra. There is a free breakfast included, although this is very basic.

My husband and I and our three children recently spent three nights at the San Carlos Hotel in the Executive Queen Suite. It was very large and comfortable for all of us, which is often very difficult with a family of five. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was very clean and they provided us plenty of towels and blankets. We travel frequently and it is not often I take the time to write a review but the comfort and value offered at this hotel is excellent. We will definitely return next time we are in NYC.

When we visit NYC we always stay at the San Carlos Hotel. Great location, extra clean and very comfortable accommodations and common areas with everything you need at your disposable, and most important, the entire staff is super courteous, efficient, always in excellent spirits and ready to assist in a way possible. I just spent two weeks there with my family and as always, we had a most wonderful time!

Reservations: easily made on line.Check-in: fast efficient and professional. No line.Room: quiet, large, spotlessly clean, well maintained furniture and rug. Nice sized bathroom and shower. Excellent linens, towels, and bath products. Also had a large refrigerator and microwave!!!Check-out: fast efficient and professional.Location: excellent midtown business location.

This is the second time staying here at this cozy location. Staff are cheery and rooms are very spacious. WIFI and continental breakfast are included but give your self time for the breakfast. Seating is limited and many take advantage of the free breakfast. No valet parking and recommended discounted parking garage is on 53rd street. Doorman gladly provided location but not the discounted rate so I parked on 51st.

I just stayed for 15 days in this hotel, and everything was wonderful. Perfect for the price (you´re not going to find super luxury), but everything is super clean, comfortable, and spacious. I stayed in a two room bedroom with my two kids and we fit perfectly, small kitchenette, TWO cosets, two TVs. I think the best part was the staff, the people in the front desk, the bellmen, everyone... almost didn't feel like I was in NY!! the location is good, a block away from the subway. I hope this review helps you make up your mind to stay here...

This is the second time I have stayed at this hotel and will use San Marcos for future trips to the area.The hotel is very well located in Midtown East with easy access to the subway. The rooms are quite large (especially by NYC standards) and very well maintained. Service is good and there is a complimentary breakfast which has good offerings.

This is our favorite NYC hotel. The rooms are a good size with a small kitchenette and are well appointed and spotless as is all of the hotel. The staff are friendly and make you feel like an old friend on arrival. There is a very nice complementary continental breakfast. There is no valet parking and the recommended lot is 2 (short) blocks away , but there is a special hotel rate of 30$ which is a remarkable bargain for the city. I love to recommend this hotel to friends because the feedback is always good.

Travelled in July 2014 with family of four. We had the two queens/standard room and the beds were excellent. The room was clean and very comfortable and the free morning breakfast was good - not extensive but fine. One complaint was how loud the air conditioner was, but I never asked to be moved since I assumed that they were the same in all the rooms. The rooms come with a fridge that was nice to use for sodas and waters. Overall I would say it was just as we expected - very nice and the staff was quite helpful. I asked for a quiet room, and we were in the back on the 7th floor, and it was very quiet. No street noise at all! If the AC had been quieter, I would have rated it 5 stars!

I have just retuned from my NY vacation with my three kids. We spent 8 nights at the hotel San Carlos and could not have been happier with the service and location. Located a few blocks from everything interesting, the San Carlos provides a lot of the amenities needed for a perfect NY trip like free WI-FI, free breakfast (really plentiful), free business center, free umbrellas went it rains. They always had our rooms clean by 12:00 and their turndown service never failed. They are located in a safe and quiet part if town, so at night we did not have the loud noise of the streets or other guests. I highly recommend this hotel for families that want large and comfortable rooms, yet want to find a helpful and courteous staff and an elegant ambiance.

The entire staff at the San Carlos hotel were wonderful. We arrived around 10:00 pm and were shown to our room. Because our room was located right next to the elevator we requested another room and without hesitation they showed us two other rooms to choose from. We stayed in a suite which was extremely roomy. We were able to grab a late dinner at the small Indian restaurant next door, called the Mint which was delicious and they too were very accomodating considering they were closing at 11:00 am. The rooms were clean and serviced daily. The location is very good, quiet yet close enough to walk to many places. The only negative would be that their rooms could use some redecorating. Oh and the free continental breakfast was also wonderful! This was our second stay at the San Carlos Hotel and we would definitely recommend it and stay there again ourselves.

We stayed at the San Carlos for 3 days in June 2014, in a junior suite.The hotel location is excellent, staff is great and courteous but the room has a weird smell of old and dirt and so was the room furniture like the sofa chairs. A small improvement on the rooms furniture is must..

The people at the San Carlos hotel are unbelivable, friendly, helpul and caring. The location is excellent and the rooms are perfect. We are a famility of 5 and we had all we needed. I would recommend it highly to anyone visiting New York.Thanks a lot

Staff is very friendly and welcoming. We arrived early and the room was ready, in just a few minutes we we up in our room (706). This was a double room and we had four in our party. Plenty spacious for us 4, especially considering it's in NYC. There is a refrigerator, microwave and coffee maker in the room. Also a drawer with dishes, utensils , and a wine bottle opener. These items came in handy when we bought several cheeses back to the room from Eataly (gourmet market and restaurant). Anything you need, the staff will attend to without hesitation. A++ in my book. Thanks for a memorable stay.

We have stayed in the San Carlos a couple of times and what we like about it are the rooms we have had are a good size, the service is very good, and the location is great. Plus it includes a breakfast. We have always stayed for business, but this is also somewhere I would bring my family.

I stayed in June 2014 and was very pleased to have chosen the San Carlos. The rooms were clean and spacious, and the staff very helpful. The location is good, within reasonable walking distance (for my family, anyway!) of quite a few attractions such as Times Square, Central Park and Bloomingdales. We chose not to have the complimentary continental breakfast because we love diners and there is a great one directly across the street, so I cannot comment on the breakfast but judging by everything else about the San Carlos I'm pretty confident it would be good! One special mention: the Bell Captain was especially helpful in connection with checking out, leaving bags at the hotel for the day and getting a limo to JFK - great service all round but his service stood out particularly!

Nice boutique hotel for family of four. We wanted the extra space and privacy. Front desk and bellhop, maids were very helpful and pleasant. This is not an upscale hotel - our rooms did not have a view and the furnishing was very basic, but the beds were comfortable, everything was very clean, and by New York standards it was reasonably priced. We would come back.

My wife and I had a wonderful 4-night stay at San Calos Hotel, NY. The location is good for me, the room was very clean and comfortable. All employees were kind and helpful. The property offers a complimentary continental breakfast, which is very good. WiFi is also complimentary and works perfectly well. The rates charged are absolutely compatible with the services offered. Nice choice for a break in Manhattan. We´ll definitely stay there again next time in the city that never sleeps.

this was a really nice hotel and in a good area. it was a quiet road and we had a back room which was a nice room but no view, spacious for the 4 of us, with microwave and fridge. breakfast was ok and it filled us up. we would take fruit and danish pasties with us to eat later on. there was nice restaurants in the area epecially if you turn right when coming out of the hotel. Staff were very polite and kept our luggage for us as we had a late flight and even orgnaised us a private taxi to the airport which cost $60. not bad between the 4 of us and we left this hotel at 3.30pm and arrived exactly at 4.30 at JFK. as there were 4 of us we used the yellow cabs to get about and that cost around $10 and we would give $2 tip. still very cheap. the hotel provided umbrellas which was good as we didnt bring ours.

Just back from a 5 day stay here and cannot praise it too highly. Conveniently placed about 5 minutes walk from Lexington Avenue subway on either E 51st or 53rd Street. Everything you could want in a hotel room is there - tea/coffee making facilities, microwave (together with crockery and cutlery), iron and ironing board, trouser press, hair dryer. TV, clock radio and - a big bonus - lots of sockets so you can charge all your gadgets at the same time! Free wi-fi as well. The room was large, with two queen beds and the most comfortable mattress I have ever had in a hotel. It was at the back of the hotel and therefore had no view, but also had NO traffic noise. In fact, once in the room there was no noise at all. Plenty of pastries, muffins, yoghurt etc. for breakfast. If I return to New York in the future I would have no hesitation in staying at the San Carlos again.

While the hotel itself is in good condition, the front-desk service is among the poorest I have ever experienced. When I arrived at 3:30 PM on Wednesday, June 4, the young male clerk was unwilling to accommodate my previous request for a room on a high-floor overlooking 50th Street. I had made my reservation on the hotel's website - and prepaid ( a big mistake)! Finally, he did offer me a smoking room; but, since I have never smoked, I didn't think I should begin that night. My experience went from bad to worse: Once inside the room, my phone had no connection to the internet!!! The clerk offered to send up an engineer, but not to change my room. At 9:00 PM I received a call from the hotel: Seems they had located a front-facing room! AVOID!
user_location: West Warwick, Rhode Island, United States
user_name:
jeanne2400
West Warwick, Rhode Island, United States

review_body: I booked a suite with a king size bed and a sofa bed for my two boys. The room was huge! It included a little kitchenette, a desk, and the sofa space. I felt I was not cramped with my two boys in one room. Service is awesome. For example, the clerk at the desk did a magic trick for my boys. Also when I called for help with the safe and they came literally within one minute of my putting the phone headset down. They don't have an ice machine on the floor but as soon as you call, you can expect a knock on the door with an ice bucket within minutes. Wow! A definite come back with the family,

We loved staying at the San Carlos. The location was great, staff were always so friendly and it was a lovely, quiet base to come back to after a long day of sightseeing. Breakfast was fine, and even though it was busy most mornings, we still managed to get a table each time. The rooms were great for our family of five, and very affordable for New York City. Would stay here again when in New York.

Only good things I have to say about this hotel - great location, courteous and professional service, room very large and comfortable, very comfortable beds, and a very good shower. What bothered me most in this hotel was the breakfast which included hot and cold drinks and carbohydrates. There were not eggs and vegetables at breakfast, but I guess it's some kind of standard in the city hotels. Really bothered me that submitted the breakfast for disposables ..... it's very environmentally unfriendly.If you want a small and comfortable hotel, excellent environment in the city, close to almost anywhere a small distance from the subway, then this is for you.

We stayed in this hotel based on the Tripadvisor comments and were not dissapointed. Room and bathroom were nice and clean with a good continental breakfast included. Service was excellent from all the staff beeing Bobby an outstanding help.We recommend strongly this hotel.

This hotel was a little more expensive then i normally prefer, but it definitely provided more for the money! It was in a very nice part of Midtown (but can be a 20 minute walk to most theatres as it is on the West Side. The Staff were absolutely wonderful, and the continental breakfast was always stocked well with fruit, bread/bakery items, yogurt, cottage cheese, cereal and lots of other goodies. Great place for a group get away...the suites are very spacious!

Great hotel. Nice comfortable rooms and staff is very friendly and helpful. The gym is not very extensive, but has a few machine and treadmills. Since its on the east side it can be a 15-20 minute walk to some of the theatres, but overall a great location.

This is a brilliant hotel the rooms are fantastic the staff are really helpfully . Great that you get a breakfast as you will need it to get you on your way to a day of walking and sight seeing I am coming back soon and will defiantly choose this hotel again . I love New York and will be back at the San Carlos very soon .

A great hotel in Midtown Manhatten. Its the little things that make it particularly attractive. The breakfast is great, choclates on your pillow at night, wi fi is free and the staff is always happy to assist with every request.Will definitely return there on my next visit to NYC.
user_name:
Alongr
New York City, New York

review_body: Wonderful location, close to subway, St Patricks, shopping and good restaurants. Staff is very nice and alway helpful. Very clean, modern, good light. When traveling to NYC we love to stay at the San Carlos, always a good experience.

I stayed here with my family in December 2013 for a night. We usually stay across the street at The Benjamin, but wanted to try a different hotel in the same area. Upon check-in, we were brought to our One Bedroom Suite and found it had two double beds that could not be pushed together. My confirmation (booked 2 months earlier DIRECTLY at the hotel website) specified the room type as "One Bedroom Suite- Elite, One King or Queen Bed.) I called the front desk and asked to be changed into the correct room. However I was told that no suites with king beds were available and that the hotel does not guarantee bed size. This is contrary to the fact that they actually specify bed size in their room confirmation email. I went down to the front desk to ask for a manager and was referred to an "assistant manager" who told me the same thing. My response was that this was unacceptable to me and that I expected to be compensated, or moved to a different room. After disappearing for five minutes, the "assistant manager" came back and said very begrudgingly that he would put us in the penthouse suite for the night- but only since we were staying just that one night. He was not friendly or apologetic in the least. He sulked the entire time. Also to note is that there is no valet parking. You must park in the garage next door and tell them you are parking for your stay at the San Carlos hotel, or you could be turned away since they fill up quickly. If you stay more than 24 hours, you'll pay for an extra day at the discounted hotel rate, regardless of how many hours you're over. With the negative aspect of the trip out of the way, allow me to state the positive ones. The penthouse suite was beautiful! There are two of them on the top floor, and we had the smaller of the two. There was a dining room area, kitchenette, living room, and a separate bedroom. The other had a fireplace, but ours did not. Both rooms shared an outdoor terrace facing the Waldorf and the RCA building, with a table, chairs, etc. We were extremely lucky that it was an unusually warm day in December. So we got to enjoy this beautiful terrace in the midst of December in NYC! It made up for the original debacle with the reservation. I'm giving the hotel three stars solely due to the customer service I received at the front desk. The room I ended up in was beautiful and I would highly recommend it. However, you should be careful when making reservations and not assume that you'll get what's actually stated in your email confirmation. The one other positive to note is that the bellman, Michael, was the nicest, most helpful person I met at this hotel.

Good location, clean and modern rooms, free wifi that is dependable, free continental breakfast...what's not to like. It's not as glamorous as a few of the hotels next door, but if you are here on business, who cares about ball gowns in the lobby?

Excellent location to start with. St. Patrick' s Church, Rockefeller Centre and Time square are just 2-3 blocks away. All the people who work at the hotel are very kind- one of them- Bobby- was extremely friendly and helpful. Our double room with two Queen size beds was very comfortable and clean. We were at the third floor and had almost never daylight, but I guess it's not uncommon for NY. We were lacking some variety at breakfast, at least some eggs (in any form) or ham or cheese would have been appreciated on our side. All in all: very happy with our stay at the SC hotel.

Excellent location in midtown Manhattan, 2 blocks from St Patrick’s. The room was very comfortable, spacious and clean rooms and the staff was first rate. The hotel provides a breakfast and the WIFI worked well. I would definitely come back.

Location was ideal. Staff were ALL friendly and helpful. We stayed on 6th floor on the street, and the street was very noisy all night with construction going on.This may be a one-time only construction street project. Windows did not seem to be soundproofed. Will definitely return but ask for a room on a higher floor and in rear of the building. Not an updated hotel, but clean, spacious rooms and close to everything. Priced right. We stayed in a queen suite--5 adults with a roll-away bed added. Plenty of room. Continental breakfast included was a plus.

I had the pleasure of staying at the San Carlos Hotel for 2 nights and it was just superb! The staff were so friendly, nothing was ever a big deal. They were more than happy to help with anything. The location of this hotel is perfect, it was quiet at night, and yet in either direction its easy to get a cab, everything from the touristy sites to going to a business meeting. I would highly recommend staying here. The room I stayed in was very spacious, I had everything from a mini fridge to microwave, so those evenings when you dont feel like dealing with the crowds you can get some peace and quiet in your room. Free internet is always a plus specially when travelling on business. I loved the way the hotel left chocolates on your pillow and drew the blinds every evening for you. That was a very nice touch and something not expected. Love, love that!Great value for money and service!

The San Carlos really is superb. Excellent location about a mile from Central Park, a mile from Empire State, half a mile from Rockerfeller Centre. staff are very friendly and helpful.The room really was excellent. The separate lounge with kitchenette, fridge, microwave, sink and crockery. There was a pull out sofa bed and a table and chairs.the other bedroom was separate with bathroom through. Showers and toiletries superb. Really very very clean throughout.The reason we only gave 4 stars was because of the breakfast. It was Easter weekend and the hotel was full, so breakfast was served in the Indian restaurant adjoining.The coffee was poor, orange juice was from a dubious looking orange plastic container, there were green apples and red apples, yogurts if you knew who to ask, Rice Krispies, presliced bread, bagels, croissants etc all served in the Indian restaurant on plastic plates with plastic cutlery and paper cups. The lighting and music were poor and service nowhere near as attentive and friendly as the staff in the main hotel. We resorted to going out and finding our own breakfasts after 3 days of this, only to find that on the last day the hotels breakfast area was open and serving breakfast. What a difference, great coffee, real orange juice, lovely choice of bagels, pastries, yogurts, bananas and apples.So my question is why was it ok to serve inferior breakfast in adjoining restaurant when busy? Surely it should have been to the same std then this would have been 5 stars!

I travel to NYC once a year for business and every year I scour Trip Advisor for hotel ratings and reviews. While on my latest trip I toured a hotel with a higher review rating than the San Carlos and all I can imagine is that none of these reviewers have stayed at the San Carlos. There was no comparision. I've yet to find something to write negatively about. The rooms are spotless and very classy and tastefully decorated (I read a prior review that the hotel needs upgrading but not sure why). The hotel staff is undeniably the best (backed up by the fact that the same bellmen and front desk personnel have been the same people ever since I've been staying there).The location is perfect, a nice walk to every corner of NYC, 10 minutes to Times Square, 10 minutes to Central Park. The street feels very safe and, if you get a room at the back, it's very quiet.This is where I will be staying next year, and the year after that, etc.

Stayed here for six days in April. Service was good, and mini suite with extra room was brilliant with boys, who we could leave to go to sleep whilst we watched a bit more telly of an evening. Great to have the extra room. Service was good, and concierge was great, helping out with bookings etc. Very good position, walkable to some sights, and 3 minute walk to subway station. Hotel owner great - and even did a magic trick for the boys! Not cheap by any means, but would thoroughly recommend.Only regret is that the Knicks lost the night we went to see them at the Garden!!

My girlfriends and I stayed one night for a quick visit. Besides being close to subways and the bustle of midtown, both staff members that we dealt with were charming and very helpful. Beds were comfy, showers hot, and complimentary breakfast was decent.

We stayed at this hotel March 27-April 4 and loved the experience. The lobby, though not large, is quite attractive, and the two elevators are most efficient and surprisingly fast. We were on the tenth floor in a junior executive suite. The suite was very spacious, and though the furnishings weren't especially glamorous, they were nice and not worn. The chest had a few nicks in it, but other than that, everything was in great shape. We had a nice sofa, two easy chairs, a large desk and desk chair, a small table with two chairs in the kitchenette area. The bed --with five pillows--was most comfortable, and the blackout shades really did keep out the sun in the early morning. The carpet was clean. We had two small closets as well as the chest for clothes storage. There were ample electrical outlets on all the lamps. We were surprised also at how quiet the room was even though we faced E. 50th. The bathrooms often tell the tale in hotels, and this bathroom tells a good one! The granite vanity was large enough for cosmetics, etc.--and the whole bath was clean, clean. The floor is white tile with white grout--pristine white grout. I was most impressed.The last time we were in NYC we stayed on 57th between 6th and 7th Avenues. We were a little leery about this location because we had read how "corporate" it was. We actually loved the location--close to subways and with many restaurants within a short walking distance. I did a menupages.com search before the trip and went armed with a whole list of close restaurants. There were too many on the list to try! We also found that the location was good for walking to any number of sites. We walked to and from Broadway theaters twice.The staff members are wonderful--so friendly and helpful, and the complimentary breakfast is certainly adequate--breads, pastries, fresh orange juice, two kinds of cereal, yogurt, bananas and apples. The tables were cleaned almost immediately following someone leaving. The complimentary wifi worked well for us also.Would we recommend this hotel? Absolutely!

My family just stayed at the San Carlos Hotel for the third time. Wonderful central location, close to sites and transportation. The rooms are spotless, staff is helpful and most professional. Highly recommended!

I have just spent a whole week at this fabulous hotel with my friend, as we celebrated our 50th birthdays. We could not have chosen a better hotel. It was a delight from start to finish. It is in tip top condition, no peeling wallpaper here. The staff were really helpful, polite, but not stuffy. When our TV didn't work the maintenance man arrived within minutes! They even left umbrellas by the entrance for guests to take with them on rainy days. We had a room with two queen beds which was really spacious and comfortable. Lovely Aveda toiletries too. Great breakfast with plenty of variety. There are plenty of computers and and a printer for guests to use in the business centre, in case you are there without your own. If you have your own device then the free wifi is very handy.I have already recommended this hotel to friends and hope to stay here again one day.

I recently stayed at the San Carlos Hotel and LOVED IT! The room was extremely clean and beautiful. The location was great as we were able to walk to dinner. The entire staff was wonderful. They were extremely helpful, friendly and professional. As soon as we pulled up to the hotel, we were immediately greeted and our bags were taken directly to our room. Throughout our stay the staff was always accommodating and so very friendly. My stay at the San Carlos Hotel was wonderful and I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to NYC.

I stayed here as a surprise trip for my 21st! Hotel is in perfect location 2 minute walk to 5th avenue with all the shops!!! Close to subway which takes you to see all of New York! The staff were so friendly from the minute we arrived couldn't of done anymore! Carried our cases to our room for us and acknowledged us every time we walked by! Breakfast was done! Good selection from toast to pastries and cereal with fresh orange juice! Rooms were cleaned everyday and even got chocolates on our pillow on the evenings! Loved my trip and this hotel made it even better!! Highly recommend it for anyone coming to New York!

My first visit to NYC, and this hotel was wonderful. We were within walking distance to Times Square, Central Park and the Empire State Building. One of the few hotels to offer free breakfast. Your basic cereal, coffee, juice and bagels but good enough to get your day started and be on your way. Our room was very clean and the staff was super friendly.Would definitely stay here again.

My family of 4 spent a week in NYC and thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the San Carlos Hotel. Our room was spacious, clean and quiet. We saved a lot of time and money on breakfast as it is included at the hotel. I can't say enough about the wonderful staff who bent over backwards to accommodate. We were allowed to check in early as we arrived at 10:30 a.m. and on our way back home, we were able to stay past check out as our flight didn't leave until late at night. Great location and within walking distance to many sights. Close to bus and train transportation. Thank you for making our first visit to the big apple a very pleasant and enjoyable experience. We highly recommend this hotel.

Our stay at the San Carlos could not have been better! From the moment we arrived, we received nothing less than first class service, greeting us by name, smooth, quick check-in (love the reception staff!), large, clean room, well- appointed bathroom and to our surprise, a basket filled with treats for our stay! (I had mentioned we were celebrating a birthday!- how kind and thoughtful!). Our beds were super comfy, the rooms were quiet and restful and the location couldn't be better! Down the street from the Waldorf Astoria and steps to the Metra station. We will be back- thank you to all who made our stay so great!

We travelled here with our 2 children in 2007 but have only reviewed this now and it was and has always been one of the best holidays we have had as a family.We were in NY for a friends wedding which took place on Brooklyn Bridge....which was a beautiful location for such a special occasion.We all loved the hotel and the room/suite was fantastic and was massive even for the four of us.The breakfast had a great variety and the kids loved all that was offered.Cant fault the hotel or our experience of NY, loved every minute and cant wait to go back one day.

We searched for a place to stay during our vacation to NYC. We were pleasantly surprised at how large the rooms were and how nice the staff was. We stayed in a one bedroom suite and compared to suites in Dallas, these were very roomy for New York. The location is great. Minutes from Grand Central, times square, and the subway. The staff was also very accommodating. We will be staying here in the future.

I only stayed in the city for a day, but the San Carlos' staff was so helpful in finding me a town car and offering great advice on obtaining broadway tickets! It's not too close to time square... About 10-20 blocks. The bell hop, Matthew, was the most helpful- he actually chased down a driver who could take me to JFK! All around, the best hotel I've stayed at in the USA!

We ordered a junior suite for 3 people with king sized bed, we received a small room with very small bath with a queen size bed. The room not renovated for a long time and the view was of the brick wall of the next building, certainly not convenient for 43 people. The staff was very responsive and polite, breakfast was average and the exercise room small and not welcoming. The location is good, RSTMN 6/10

We stayed in San Carlos for 3 nights and had a really good sized quad room. The hotel is in a great location close to popular subway lines and within walking distance of the Rock and Gran Central. We had breakfast with our package which was basic but all good. Staff were great too and let us have our room for an extra hour or so on the last day.

stayed in the hotel for 6 days on a family special birthday trip with wife and daughters (18th and 21st)free upgrade to large adjoining rooms 3 tv's two kitchens two bathrooms and a lounge.very central for visiting major sites rockefeller 7 min walk.rooms very clean and quite spacious.excellent free complimentary continental break fast.excellent diner straight across from hotelwould recommend and would return.

This is my second visit to the San Carlos and I di request the same room at the back in order to have a quiet room. Staff were attentive, efficient and friendly again, I did sleep well. The room was very spacious ( king size bedrooms are bigger)- no view as it was at the back but that was not an issue for me , though next time I will request a room on a higher floor for more light.The room has the usual coffee machine etc and I request a kettle so I could make tea, which was delivered very quickly. Breakfast is OK - nothing to write home about but a selection of breads and pasties, yoghurt etc. A bowl of large apples is provided but to be honest, some other fruit would be a good addition. I can recommend the hotel for good value, good night's sleep and service.

I ended up staying at the San Carlos by accident. I had stayed at the Affinia 50 for a few days and I wanted to extend my stay in NYC. I booked a room at the San Carlos and OMG what a difference!! Wifi and unlimited Breakfast were included (Very happy). Also, the rooms were extremely clean with lots of amenities...bathrobe, microwave, wine glasses, water bottles; it sounds silly to mention those items, but where I was staying previously had NONE of them. I had a deluxe room with a king size bed; it was absolutely beautiful/luxurious and the pictures don't make it justice. Also, since I bought my departure ticket during my last day in NYC, I was able to print my tickets free at the Business Center (2nd floor). I've stayed at many hotels in NYC, and I'm definitely planning to come to the San Carlos. The Staff were very friendly and helpful; they let me checked-in at 7am WITHOUT having to pay any extras fees (the Affinia made me pay $100 for checking in at 1pm!). I love the San Carlos and I highly recommend them. I'm definitely coming back.

We stayed at this hotel many years ago and had a great experience then, we returned this week to find it was a good as ever. The location is perfect, 3 blocks from 5th Avenue. The room clean, quiet and comfortable, a real haven in a busy trip. Breakfast good and plentiful. The staff were, without exception, helpful, charming and friendly. Very happy to recommend

We stayed here for four nights including New Year's Eve. There was free wifi which was a decent speed, the room was clean and spacious and it was at a good location. The weather was freezing and below freezing on a couple of days there so we caught a taxi to and from the hotel some days as walking in minus 16 degrees Celsius wasn't pleasant, in warmer weather this wouldn't have been an issue. The staff at the from desk were lovely but some staff were more helpful than others. I wanted to get my dress dry cleaned and was told by night staff I had to take it down the road but in the morning when I brought it downstairs front desk said they'd do it for me; a very small matter but the hotel organising it saved me time! All in all, a good experience :)

We stayed at the San Carlos during Christmas which is probably one of the busiest times of the year in NYC. The first impression of the hotel was the warmth and friendliness of the staff, from the bell hop to front desk! Check in quick and easy. Walking distance to Rockefeller plaza, subway and more. The maid service was wonderful and the hotel (not just our room) was impeccably clean at all times. there were a couple of times when we requested extra soap or towels, within 3-4 minutes of calling down to front desk, we had what we requested. The rooms are a bit larger than a standard hotel room and two queen beds makingit feel a little more roomy. Fridge and microwave in room and everything in good working order and very clean. Breakfast was continental and included mostly breads, and breakfast pastries, cereals, apple or bananas and yogurt. Also bagels on just a couple of days, simple and quick breakfast option. My favorite was the hot milk in the carafe each morning. I put a lot of milk in my coffee and tea and most hotels only have the chilled milk for cereals, not hot milk so this was a pleasant bonus. A couple of days the breakfast room was full, but you didnt have to wait more than a few minutes for a table we usually got there befor 8 and no wait, but after 8:30-9, it got very busy. There is also a nice breakfast diner directly across the hotel, but it is a bit pricey as is most everything in the city! But convenient if you want to have eggs or pancakes or more substantial breakfast. Did I mention how nice and courteous the staff were? The Aveda shampoo and conditioner were sooo nice and shower was very hot and wonderful in the cold weather. The hotel car service is convenient and prompt in picking up and dropping at airport. Overall excellent service, great location and very very clean!! Definitely would stay here again!!!

Decided to try the hotel based on tripadvisor reviews and a very good price. Stayed for five nights the week before Christmas in one of the one bedroom suites--which was larger than most New York apts. The small kitchen actually had usable utensils, plates and wine glasses with a small refrigerator. The bed was comfortable and the bathrooms well appointed. The free breakfast was not extensive but had juice, yogurt, fruit, coffee and breads. If you wanted someplace more there was a great diner across the street. The lobby is well appointed and there is a nice, free, business center. The staff were all friendly and helpful. The only downside, and the reason I did not give a "five" was because the in room wifi was totally unreliable. You could get a signal only about half the time and even then you would get bumped off. I had work I needed to do and I lost quite a bit one night because the wifi went down. The signals from the surrounding hotels were much stronger and always available (if of course you had the access code which you don't). The front desk didn't do anything or seem concerned when I twice raised the issue.The location is perfect. Easy walking distance to everything but off the main drags so you don't have the noise etc. There is a subway station a block away and it's only about 4 blocks to Grand Central. There are a number of close by restaurants ranging from a diner to high end--including several with takeout. There is a Duane Reade around the corner and a Starbucks a block away. I will definitely stay here again--as long as I can figure out a different option for wifi.

I just stayed at the San Carlos several weeks ago, and I decided on this location based on location and price point. I got an extra low rate by going on their hotel website and booking a non-refundable room, which was fine b/c it was only a few days before my trip. The recommended parking lot was full upon our arrival, but we said we were staying at the San Carlos, and they happily let us into the lot. The front desk staff was so friendly and made us feel very welcome. They held a key for my friend who was arriving later that evening, and he told us he felt like a VIP by the way they greeted him upon arrival. We had a spacious suite which was clean, modern and very comfortable. When we checked out in the morning, they happily held our bags behind the desk while we got lunch and watched a football game at a nearby restaurant. The experience was just wonderful, and this is my new go-to spot when in the city.

We stayed here for one night the week before Christmas. The hotel immediately exceeded my expectations. The rooms were large, beds comfortable, bathrooms appointed with Aveda products. The room was exceptionally clean. Special kudos for the staff, especially Fabio in reservations and Yadim on the desk. These two were outstanding, but there was a young woman on the desk who made recommendations and was really helpful, as well the doorman. Our room was on a higher floor, so there was minimal street noise and no sound from adjoining rooms. Location an easy walk to Rockefeller Center and Central Park, as well as 5th Ave shopping. The free continental breakfast was ok--nothing great, but ok. That and so-so towels were my only (and small) complaints. If you're looking for a reasonably priced hotel in NY, you can't go wrong with the San Carlos. I will stay here again and have already let my friends know about it.

Reservations: easily made over the internet.Check-in: professional and efficient but less warm than on previous visits.Room: very large and well appointed. Furniture in excellent condition. Nice sized bathroom. Flatscreen TV. Excellent bath products and bed linens. Towels were OK.Internet: FREE!!!!!!!!!Check-out: fast efficient but somewhat impersonal.No gym in hotel.Good diner across the street for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Location: easy walk to Central Park, restaurants, shopping, and lots of bank machines in the area. There is a subway stop at 52nd and Lexington to go down to SoHo or Union Square.

I stayed at this hotel from the 4th of December to the 8th of December 2013 with a friend on a city break.The hotel was clean & the staff were attentive & helpful. The best thing about this hotel was the location. It's in midtown Manhattan & very central to everywhere. The free breakfast in the morning was acceptable & the wi-fi wasn't bad. The bedrooms were adequate & the beds were comfortable. The hotel is in desperate need of a updating & this is the main problem with it. The other hotels on the same road were in much better condition & the Affina 50 had renovation work going on whilst we were there.If the hotel were to have some renovations it would certainly warrant a better review from me. After having read previous reviews on this hotel I am surprised more people who have stayed there haven't noticed the need for renovations.There are better hotels in NY for the same money than The San Carlos. Again if they were to improve their appearance this wouldn't be the case.I can't rate the swimming pool or the spa as the hotel didn't have one.

Hotel is close to good shopping and restaurants. Staff is pleasant and professional. Our room was large, clean but needs updating. Hotel is starting to really show its age. Continental breakfast was okay, nothing special. Overall good value for dollar.

Clean spacious room; good sized bathrooms. Complimentary breakfast - not a lot of food options but good quality; great OJ! The staff is warm and personable; definitely a hotel to put at the top of the list!
user_name:
Lauri K
Orchard Park, New York

review_body: I stayed here again for the third time in November of 2013. In my last review, I indicated that the bed mattress was too soft for my liking. However, I cannot voice that complaint this time. Also, the attentive staff was excellent, and the San Carlos is in a great location in Midtown East, basically on the corner of 50th and Third Avenue.

Stayed at this magnificently located Manhattan hotel for the sixth time on November 21-26, 2013 and cannot give it anything less than five stars. This sixteen floor hotel is located strategically at East 50th street between Third and Lexington Avenues, so conveniently situated close to the many wonderful tourist sites and stores that New York City has to offer. The greatest thing this hotel offers is service. The staff goes out of its way to fulfill the every want of its guests wherever possible. It all starts with the friendly and efficient bellboys and the magnificent staff at the registration desk who never fail to greet the customer effusively and are glad to oblige whenever their assistance is needed. Repeat guests are always recognized because there is rarely any turnover of staff at this hotel and the staff is amazingly able to recognize return guests, often even remembering the guests name even a year later. The rooms are very spacious (I always choose the room with two queen beds), offers great heat in the winter and superb air conditioning in the summer, has fine bathroom amenities including (thank goodness) more than enough towels, and very comfortable beds. The rooms are spotlessly clean and the maids very quickly clean the rooms so you can return to your room at any time of the day you choose and the beds will be remade and the bathroom supplies replenished. On the floor above the lobby there are six computers for your free use (wi-fi is also free) and these computers are always very well maintained. Free breakfast is also supplied to guests (continental type breakfast with bread, rolls, fruit, coffee, tea, juice, and yogurt available). While the view from some rooms is not spectacular you will never notice for you will be bowled over by the friendliness of the staff. I am perhaps a little reluctant to write this great review for fear that every Tom, Dick, and Harry will learn this best kept secret in New York and some day I will find it difficult to obtain a reservation when I want but all kidding aside, this is a magnificent place to stay whether you are in New York on business or for pleasure.

Went to New York City for a girls weekend to see some plays, shop and sightsee. Found the San Carlos Hotel on Trip Advisor and liked it so much that I wanted to return the favor to others seeking a hotel in the Theater District. Everything was great. We had a suite with 2 queen size beds that were very comfortable. The bathroom was very nice. Our suite also had a large sitting room with sofa and chairs and a kitchenette. A Continental Breakfast was included. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Walked to the Theater and dinner. Would definitely stay here again!

I am loath to recommend this hotel as I don't want many people to know how great it is so its not booked up with no rooms for me. Beautiful lobby, with helpful and friendly doormen. Reception staff friendly and chatty. Breakfast is spare/- bagels, cereals and pastries but is all you need when in NYC. Fantastic rooms with lovely decor, mini kitchen and roomy for NYC. Great location- a short walk to St Patricks, and to Rockefeller. Close to shops to pick up essentials. Starbucks nearby if interested in their coffee. Highly recommended

Stayed here for business for 2 nights. Good sized rooms for NYC and good value for the price. Breakfast was a bit lacking but thats probably because theres a great bagel place around the corner! There was a bit of water work going on outso d e the building but overall a great stay.

Stayed at the San Carlos for three nights while in town for meetings staff very pleasant While perfectly adequate and comfortable, I was in a lower level inner view room and it was quite dark. Breakfast in lobby ok continental Appreciated refrigerator and microwave but would have much more appreciated wi fi that work. While I called a few times and they sent someone to "reset" it ever got better in my room. Beware some rooms get it better than others. If you need it for work check before you unpack.

spent 10 nights family of 5 - plenty of space in the 1 room suite. Room neat & tidy, friendly staff, continental breakfast OK and saved us heaps but we did have a couple of hot breakfasts elsewhere just to break it up a bit. Not much more I can say just an all round good experience.

Third time here, and each time has been great. Rooms large by city standards, close to any kind of food you'd want, and quiet. Good work space with stong wifi. Bathrooms are standard size but more than adequate. Will continue to come back.

How do i love thee? Let me count the ways:Fabulous staff We needed a cab and we happened to be staying there during the UN General Session, with Obama and others around the corner at the Waldorf. The bell hop was out in the road attempting to hail a cab. They all wanted airport runs and we were just going to the theater. He snagged a town car and negotiated a reduced price for us. Beyond the call of duty I would say. Every time we came in and out we were greeted warmly, with a sincere desire to help out in any way they could.Great location A couple of blocks from major subway lines, around the corner from a bus line. Away from the mania of Times square, and yet accessible to wherever you want to go.Fabulous suites We splurged on a two queen bed suite. The bedroom was roomy by NYC standards, with space to move around. There were three of us, and we had two closets to hang things, as well as drawers. (in the interest of clarity, we all could not have unpacked our suitcases into drawers, but there was a very generous number of "normal" hangers, not the secure ones that are such a pain to get in and out.) Loved having the sitting area and small kitchenette. We were out and about, didn't spend a lot of time in the room, but if we had had bad weather we would have been very comfortable inside. Our bathroom felt spacious, with room for the three of us to spread our stuff out. We enjoyed having a window in the shower to open for fresh air, but the fan seemed to take care of steam needs. The room was very quiet, and even the air conditioner noise was not a bother. I really enjoyed the bed, with a variety of coverings, to fit the warmth needs of any guest. I truly look forward to using the San Carlos Hotel in the future, whenever I have the pleasure of visiting NYC. An added tip, if you plan to use the bus/subway system I strongly recommend getting the $30/7 day pass. You get unlimited rides. We were only in the city for 4 days and would have paid significantly more had we purchased regular tickets.

We made reservations 6 months ago and pre-paid at another hotel. Upon check-in we were told we were being re-located for one night at the San Carlos. I wish I'd made reservations here originally! Beautifully appointed rooms, sitting up on the 10th floor, above the noise, continental breakfast included, small kitchenette (microwave/fridge), --- but best of all in our one bedroom suite -- two, yes TWO bathrooms. This is perfect for family of four with two college age kids. Hotel stays in new york are expensive enough. the luxury of two bathrooms between four people doesn't need to be explained!

2nd visit to the San Carlos in a year - I reviewed it earlier in the year but just wanted to write again after my 2nd visit - the quality is consistent, the rooms very quiet, the service is impeccable and friendly, the rooms are big, clean and nicely appointed and the rates are very reasonable for what you are getting in a prime location in NYC.Walking distance to Rockerfellar square and Madison Avenue - on a quiet side street between Lexington and 3rd so you do not hear a lot of street noise

We had a king bed room on the 7th floor. The room was spacious, the bed was very comfortable with nice linens, and no noise whatsoever. The bathroom is small, without much counter space, standard tub/shower, but very clean and new. The hotel had a very international feel, perhaps the continental breakfast is a draw for Europeans who often expect breakfast to be included. A nice mix in September of families, couples, business people. The breakfast is quite adequate, not luxurious though. The hotel appears well cared for. We paid in advance and got the discount which made it a good deal for NYC. Also love that location, near enough to the theatres, shopping, etc. but away from the tourist areas. All in all a well recommended stay.

My wife and I recently stayed at the San Carlos for the third time in three years. The hotel is still in my opinion one of the greatest in NYC and the staff especially Gabriel and Bobby have become like family and certainly treated us as such.The hotel is Ina great location with transport both bus and subway within half a block as well as many good restaurants in the vicinity. This hotel is definitely one of our favorites.

This is a charming small hotel, reasonably priced with friendly and helpful staff. It is well worth a visit as it is conveniently located, clean and well kept. It is between 3rd and Lexington so close to many of the main attractions. I would definitely stay there again.

NYC Spring Break 2013...Not The least bit Disappointing!! Starting with our check in at the San Carlos Hotel...Although we were early to arrive the hotel graciously allowed an early check in. The staff provided outstanding service during our 4 night stay. The room was surprisingly spacious for NYC. It was modern and very clean. I truly cannot say enough about the perfect accommodations provided by the hotel and its central location was the cherry on top. Highly recommended...

Great NY location, very clean, friendly & attentive staff, free Wifi, complimentary breakfast reasonable. Room 506 is located towards the back of the hotel and thus quiet, you cannot hear any traffic at all. A/C and complimentary fridge were humming at night but you quickly get used to it. Spacious room for 4 people compared to other hotels in this category. Comfortable beds. We will definately book again. Thank you.

Stayed there for a week in an Elite suite.It was a very good choice and a very good value for the price. There was a little fridge and micro wave ,they could be handy for a family.All the personnel were really nice and helpful from arrival to departure.Breakfast was fine with a choice of pastries,cereals,fruits and yogourt. Wi-Fi is free and works well.Location is great: close to restaurants and Times Square.On a down note the AC in our room was a bit noisy.I would have no problem recommending this hotel.

Stayed in a suite for three nights with three kids - very comfortable with plenty of room. Very nice hotel with friendly and helpful staff. About 15-20 minute walk to Times Square. Breakfast was breads, cereal, and yogurt - no eggs or breakfast meat. No swimming pool. Would definitely stay again.

My husband, my kids and I stayed at the San Carlos hotel in July for 9 days. The staff is corteous, the location is good (4 blocks from 5th ave). The complimentary breakfast (a good differential in NY) is ok: basket of breads/toasts, cereal,coffee, milk, yogurt, orange juice. No eggs, no ham, no cheese, only 1 type of fruit. After 4 days you will get tired of this...#factThe room was clean and although it is not so spacious, has a closet, a mini fridge and a microwave oven. Two small windows facing only brick walls (like all double rooms in the hotel) and a tiny bathroom. The courtains broke on our second day and were promptly fixed without asking (!!!). Beds are comfy and the street is calm.Free wifi in the room and computers with printers (!!!) on the second floor. Great to print out e-tickets and etc during the trip.

Excellent hotel located in midtown. I love the location, the rooms are super big, they have complimentary breakfast, the have free WiFi. Excellent for couples or families!!The staff is very friendly and the rates are great for New York.

I stayed at the San Carlos hotel in June for a short business trip, nice hotel in a good location, but my suite was definitely due for a facelift. It was spacious and overall clean, but the carpet was quite stained and the decor pretty dated. Would stay there again because of the location, not sure about the 4 star rating though.

I booked this hotel because of all good reviews here, and therefore I had great expectations. However, my experience was nothing like all reviews indicates. Were was the lovely personell, the great cleaning of the rooms, the wonderful breakfast, the great location? The persons working there was ok, but they were not friendly and talking with us. No one asked if they could bring our huge luggage up to our room. The view was terrible. The only window we had was facing a brick wall. The breakfast was ok. The location was ok. My summary is that the hotel is an ok one, and nothing more than that. Next time we will look for another hotel. Do not believe all good reviews of this one!!!!

We spent 9 nights at the San Carlos in a one bedroom suite and highly recommend it.The good?Location. Subways were less than 5 mins walk away, places like the Rockefeller were within walking distance. The m50 crosstown bus left on the San Carlos' block corner and took us straight to the Intrepid museum. Room was huge! Separate bedroom, two closet spaces, a small kitchen with enough cutlery/appliances to tide you over each day.Breakfast was well stocked and good quality (eg. Pastries looked appetising/apples weren't damaged unlike some places we have stayed). Members of our family often missed breakfast due to ill health/jet lag, and it was nice that staff were happy for me to take breakfast for them back to our room.Wi fi was good, no problems with speed or dropping out. Also liked the free newspapers.Premises were very clean and staff were lovely.We requested a quiet room and that's what we got. A whisper quiet room on level 16 facing away from the street, we didn't hear any other guests.The less good?As previous posters have mentioned, the AC is loud and the box is big. The size of the machine doesn't matter (aesthetics aside), but we did find it too noisy in our bedroom at night but having two rooms, we just left the door open, turned the AC off in the bedroom and cranked the living room AC up a little to compensate.Again as previous posters have said, the curtains are not block out. Our 2 year old was exhausted and lacking in sleep, but still woke up at the crack of dawn because of light in our room.A email before we arrived asking a question was never responded to, this is very poor customer service but is in stark contrast to all the staff we encountered once we arrived.Overall though, we really enjoyed our stay. the san carlos is not trendy but it's very clean, comfortable and and it felt like leaving an old friend when we left.

Stayed for a quick business trip. The hotel is a good location and the staff was very pleasant. However, the hotel is a bit tired. It could be updated. The room was a very good size but not very well apportioned. The air conditioner was noisy. The microwave was filthy and non operational. My lock box was not working and it took themj an hour to fix.It has potential. It is more suited for foreign travelers than business travelers.

Just returned home today from a 5 night stay at the San Carlos and I must say we were very pleased, from the time we checked in until we checked out. All the front desk staff were very pleasant, and one gentleman even did some magic tricks for us. Our room was a standard double room with 2 Queen size beds, and lots of room to move around. For NY it was a very large room. Having the fridge and microwave came in very handy, and of course the free Wi-Fi was also appreciated. We were on the 9th floor at the back and never heard a sound from the outside. Not much of a view, but we really did spend much time there looking out the window. The free continental breakfast was also nice, but I agree with another reader maybe mix it up a bit and offer a couple of choices for fruit. I would not hesitate to stay here again or to recommend this place to anyone.

My husband and I stayed at the San Carlos Hotel in late April. I was in NYC for business and needed to stay in mid town.The hotel was a great choice. It is in a great location in mid town, yet it is away from the noise, and the rooms are very spacious. We had suite 504, which was very well appointed and clean, with a comfortable living area, a kitchenette, a good size bedroom and bathroom. Free Wi-Fi was a great feature too. The continental breakfast was simple, but did the job. Overall we had an excellent stay at the San Carlos, and would definitely stay again.
user_name:
Alessandra M
Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

review_body: The most important thing in a hotel for us is cleanliness and we were not disappointed here. Double Queen rooms were big for NY standards. Very nice staff. . Elevators are quiet. Breakfast was not as good as hoped and had a limited selection. Beds were very comfortable. I booked here due to high Trip Advisor rating and was very pleased. Price was around $260 which I guess is good for NY. I would definitely stay again. Side note: Never take a cab unless it is yellow in NY. They don't have meters and will charge you triple. Cab is the only way to travel in NY, subways are ok but takes a little longer.

My business partner and I stayed at the San Carlos for a week in the beginning of July. We both found the hotel a place to obtain a quiet night's sleep, and refuge from the City noise around us. We used the hotel as a place for small business meetings, and were happy to take advantage of the business center offering free internet and printer. We enjoyed the continental breakfast each morning, and constantly used the free internet IN THE ROOMS. We found the location ideal to many of our outside business meetings, and were able to get around to all points surprisingly easily. The staff were very gracious and offered their service and advice. Reception staff were outgoing and helped in arranging matters. I loved the AVEDA bathroom products - which gave a hint of luxury. For this money in central Manhattan, I found this hotel a great value, and perhaps more importantly, a great base for a quiet nights sleep and platform from which to get things done in Manhattan.

Let’s talk hotels. In New York City.Oy vey.In doing my research before our trip, I probably spent more time in hotel research than anything else. There’s SO many things to consider when choosing a hotel – such as location, price, size, quality, etc – and this is especially true when choosing a hotel in Manhattan.Take location, for instance…do you want to stay in the heart of Times Square? That’s great if you want to be within walking distance of a lot of the “touristy” stuff – but it could be horrible when it comes to noise…or cost.
