So – if having a quiet, peaceful night’s sleep is important to you – you may choose to NOT be in the heart of Times Square.So…I researched. And researched. And researched again. I like my sleep. I like peace and quiet. I also like space – and we had three people to fit into a room. A lot of hotel rooms in Manhattan are about the size of a person’s closet – so this was disconcerting to someone who is a bit claustrophobic. I finally discovered the San Carlos Hotel – located at 150 East 50th Street…in the Midtown East location in Manhattan. Tripadvisor.com had it ranked #32 out of 435 hotels in New York City – which is pretty darn good. As far as location, it was excellent…it was one block away from a subway line, and it was just a few blocks away from Times Square and Broadway. However – it was FAR enough away to afford us a bit of peace and quiet when we retired for the night. We were in Room #701 - a corner suite - that was high enough to give us some cushion from street noise. The price…was adequate. It wasn’t the cheapest – nor the most expensive – but for what we got (a suite), it was reasonable. Speaking of a suite, we had plenty of space. We had a small kitchen area, a dining table with two chairs, a pull-out sofa bed that Daughter used, and two good-sized closets. And quality? Wow. It was always clean; the concierge and doorman were always attentive; we had turn-down service every night (including chocolates on our pillows); free internet; and free continental breakfast. On a rainy day, the staff kindly lent us each an umbrella to use throughout the day - which was very much appreciated. Again, the staff were always attentive and helpful. On our last morning, we weren't getting picked up until 1:00 pm, and management kindly let us stay in our room until our car arrived.I will recommend this hotel to any family and friends who are visiting Manhattan, and will be sure to use it again myself when visiting. A true gem!

We stayed June 20th. - 23rd. This was our first visit to NYC, we didn't know what to expect.Our Flight arrived 5 hours prior to check-in. But this was not a problem for the Staff. They found us a room right away. The front desk staff were quite friendly, helpful, and made us feel like VIP's. They chatted with us about where we were from, what we planned to do, and offered advice on exploring the city. What a wonderful 'first impression' of the City!The room was nice and clean, with a microwave, coffee maker, mini fridge, and place settings for 2. The beds were luxurious.The room was on the 5th floor with an alley view but this was small price to pay for the luxury of not hearing traffic noise at night. After all, we spent very little time in our room awake. The complimentary breakfast was very much appreciated. The staff greeted us each time we left and returned to the hotel. Since this was our first time in NYC we relied on the staff to help us plan our mode of transportation; subway, taxi or walking; depending an the day's activity.On our last day, our flight wasn't until 5:45. We went ahead and checked out around 10 AM. The staff stored our suitcases while we did our last exploration of the city and suggested using a car service to the airport for little more than a taxi would cost. This removed the task of hailing a taxi, provided a much nicer ride to the airport, and guaranteed we leave the hotel on time and arrive at the airport on time.We will definitely stay at the San Carlos hotel on future visits to the Big Apple.

We visited June 21-26th for a grandmother/daughter/granddaughter trip and upon checking-in were upgraded to a larger room. This is such an amazing hotel with close proximity to all that NYC has to offer. Walking distance to all the great attractions. (Broadway, Times Square, MoMA, 5th avenue, Rockefeller, Central Park). The staff was wonderful and made us feel so very welcome, like home. This hotel is definitely a boutique and not a large turn and burn hotel. I would recommend San Carlos to my closest friends and from now on, we will only stay here when visiting the city. My only recommendation: even though breakfast was included, it would have been nice if they changed up the options each day. It was very much a continental breakfast. More fruit would have been appreciated. However, this is a minimal suggestion. The San Carlos was such a wonderful find and after a busy, fast paced day exploring the city, we looked forward to arriving here each night..

Once again I had the honor of staying at this lovely boutique family-owned hotel on a yearly business trip to NYC and it's another year of 'this is the only hotel I will ever stay at in NYC!' What I love is the clean rooms, the attentive and friendly staff, the location, the price and the simple yet ample breakfast choices.Room cleanliness & housekeeping staff: it's rare for a room to not only appear AND be so clean but they must use some special deodorizer because the entire hotel smells fresh yet not overly perfumed - just clean. The towels are thick and luxurious, the bedding is crisp and the bath amenities are Aveda. Even if we didn't need more products, they housekeeping staff stocked us new each day. When we needed extra pillows or towels they were at our door within minutes.Lobby staff: forever and always friendly. We ran into the owner in the breakfast room and he was incredibly gracious and friendly as are the bellhops and front desk staff. Speaking of the breakfast room, there's an assortment of bread items such as pastries and bagels as well as a toaster. Good coffee, hot chocolate, hot milk, juice and teas. There's cold cereal and a fresh fruit every day. What I really love is the cottage cheese and yogurt assortment for those of us who don't want bread for breakfast.Location: why go to NYC if you don't plan on walking? We love where this hotel is - very close yet far enough to Central Park and Times Square. We even take a day to venture by foot to Chinatown, Soho and the village. Very easy and pleasant walk not to mention the area itself is about the safest place I've ever been. We're comfortable walking outside at night to get a bite or do some more shopping.Décor & room: the hotel is luxuriously decorated without being gaudy or old-vintage. The rooms are incredibly large for NYC standards. I always take one of my children with me along with my business partner and there's plenty of room. The staff is VERY welcoming to children, too. Once again, the San Carlos will be booked for my 2014 business trip.

Seven nights in the Big Apple in June 2013 was a fabulous experience made all the better by the friendliness of the staff at the San Carlos Hotel.We were visiting our daughter who is working there for a year and booked the hotel for it's location close to where she is based. The staff kindly let her have access to the room before we arrived to leave some items for us. On arrival registration was speedy and efficient with the guy on duty offering information on things to do and how to get about. In the room was a wonderful surprise 'gift' basket of hotel goodies and wine for my birthday! The room was spacious for a New York hotel and spotlessly clean, a standard that was maintained all through the week. There is a mini fridge,microwave and coffee machine which can be extremely useful in a busy week.They provide a complimentary breakfast which consists of a selection of breads,pastries,cereals,fruit,yoghurts, juices and hot drinks. Whilst no means extensive it is good quality and substantial enough to set anyone up for the day. Whenever we went through Reception the staff asked how our day/evening had gone and were generally really helpful. On leaving they sorted out our airport transfer when there was a delay with the transport. The location is fabulous and only a couple of minutes away from the subway for those needing to use it.Prepayment gets a 20% discount making it good value for money compared to other hotels in that category. All in all the San Carlos is a great place to stay.

Stayed there for 2 nights in October, 2012. Hotel's staff was extremely helpful and nice, hotel itself is nicely furbished & clean. The A/C was a bit loud, though. I was staying on the 16th floor, therefore I had a mini balcony/terrace thing next to my room, so I would climb out and smoke, while enjoying the view of Manhattan. Great memories.

I recently stayed at the San Carlos Hotel and was pleasantly surprised especially given the great rate we received. The hotel is in the heart of Midtown with easy access to subways, shopping, etc. I was there on a guys trip so we booked a suite. It was surprisingly big. I have stayed in other suites in New York, and this was one of the biggest. There was a mini-fridge, microwave, large sitting area, ans even a table and chairs. The rooms were well-appointed and modern. The only downside was that the elevators were small and slow, but I would absolutely stay there again. The 20% discount for pre-paying is also nice.

Stayed with the family for 10 nights. Staff were helpful. Beds were good had no issues getting a good night sleep. Room was fine for our requirements. Free breakfast a bonus. Handy location to mid town and time square, close to subway. 20% discount for prepayment help defer costs of sightseeing. Wifi was just fine. Will be back next time.

The San Carlos is a fantastic boutique hotel in a great location in Manhattan. The rate was much better than other hotels in the vicinity. The staff was all wonderful and very helpful. We had a wonderful room on the 12th floor. Not a great view but a large room with a very comfortable bed with great linens and Aveda products in the bathroom. My husband was in business meetings our first day in NYC so I had the day to myself. The bellman had umbrella's to loan out since it was raining and gave me a great suggestion on a nearby place for lunch. The front desk was very helpful giving me a map and suggestions of all the wonderful sights within walking distance of the property. We will definitely stay there again and highly recommend it.

We had a room with 2 double beds, and it was a normal size hotel room (that is to say, not a teen-tiny New York size hotel room.) Very nice, clean plus a reasonable sized bathroom (with Aveda products!! Score!). Our view was nothing to write home about (air shaft/alley), but on the positive side, there was no traffic noise either. Would definitely stay there again.

The San Carlos is a very impressive boutique hotel, well positioned on 50th St. in Manhattan. We found the service from check-in friendly, efficient and unobstrusive. Indeed when we complained about the T.V. not working at one point, they sent a beautiful gift basket to the room and apologised explaining that the fault was the cable company's, but they were still disturbed that their offering was less than perfect.The room was larger than the average as was the bathroom. The decor was very basic, but functional. The free continental breakfast was well presented and was very welcome. As there was a large selection of restaurants in the area, we did not miss dining facilities at the hotel.It was a wonderful experience overall.

Fabulous staff (Thank you, Santos, Andy & others) , bright cheerful rooms & pleasant lobby. Wonderful beds. We ended up at the San Carlos after a poor experience at another hotel which was under construction. I had special accessibility needs due to a broken leg & the staff did all they could to make me comfortable. We had a suite with a kitchenette and nice couch/chairs - perfect for visiting with other family members staying at the same hotel. We've stayed at many NYC hotels and can state that this will be our future go-to hotel in NYC

I was in this hotel for a week. The room was very clean. We had a lot of space. The internet conection was excelent.The breakfast was really tasty.In the room there was a kitchenette. The hotel location is excelent, we were close to Central Park, 5th Av, and we were walking distance to Time Square and Columbus Circle. There's a subway station around tthe corner.The front desk was very helpful. I will definitly recomend this hotel.

Absolutely wonderful stay for 5 nights - clean, recently updated rooms with top notch service and management. Very friendly staff who take the edge off of being in NYC. We were fortunate to stay in a suite - rooms are very large for NYC - flat screen tv's as well as kitchenette and all with modern, high quality furniture, carpeting and decor. I can't think of a better deal in the city and we have stayed at numerous hotels here.Very kid friendly but Ideal for couples and business - most of the travelers here during this time appeared to be adult and business - many international - which translated into a quiet hotel with very little late night partying and noise.And - a good exercise room. I was worried about finding one in a boutique city hotel but this one has all the standard stuff that is in top notch shape and in a good sized roomAll in all -a fantastic hotel in the eyes of this well traveled recreational and business traveler.

This is like a small suite. We were in Manhattan for 8 nights and this was a brilliant location (10mins to Central Park, 5 mins to 5th Ave shops, 15mins to Time Square) in a safe and pretty part of Midtown East close to gorgeous little restaurants, a great deli, laundromat and everything you could want. Tariff includes FREE WiFi, basic continental breakfast and helpful doormen and concierges. Our room included a lounge room, with small table and chairs, desk, safe and lge flat screen TV. The bedroom also had TV, built-in robe, bar fridge and VERY comfortable bed. Then there is a kitchenette area with microwave, sink, coffee maker, fridge and cupboard space and a modern bathroom with great pressure and hot water, shower in bath , hair dryer and toilettries. We bought some food to supplement the breakfast and used the subway 6 to access Soho and Little Italy. All in all it was a wonderful hotel and we will definitely return here.

I was there with my family one week before Christmas, the city was very full of tourists and the hotel prices very high. We decided for San Carlos Hotel first for its position, then because it was the only one offering breakfast included in price. The receptionist by checking in was very professional and gave us all information we could need. We had no questions, he really told us everything!The room was spacious. We didn't have a room with a view on the main street, but this is NY, you can take a look on a side street and figure you are in a film!Breakfast was a kind of self-service, you could drink cold and hot drinks as much as you wanted. They offered many kinds of bread and sweet breads, fresh cheese, marmalade and honey, butter, yogurt, fresh milk with cereals, fruits. There were no bacon or eggs, but that was for us no matter.The position of San Carlos Hotel is very good, just few steps from the metro station and bus stops. 5 minutes walk and you get to the Rockfeller Center and 10 minutes walk you get to MOMA museum.We would choose this Hotel again, no doubts.

I am just wrapping up a four night stay and have to applaud the San Carlos for a great experience. I am in the one bedroom suite which was like having my own apartment. The entire staff was friendly and helpful, and I mean everybody. The location was great since not right in the heart of Times Square mayhem yet close enough to get wherever you want to go. The little mini-kitchen with microwave, refrigerator and coffee maker was great. I would definitely recommend the San Carlos for its value and comfort. And the windows open, which is a wonderful thing - I love having fresh air (well, Manhatthan air anyway:)

We recently completed a four night stay at the San Carlos and found it to be a wonderful option for family travel to New York. The staff was welcoming and the rooms clean and well appointed. We stayed in a one bedroom suite (two queen beds and a pull-out couch) which worked very well for our family of five. While fairly basic, the continental breakfast was a great and affordable way to start the day. Choices included toast, pastries, yogurt, cottage cheese, apples, coffee, orange juice, hot cocoa and the like. A few blocks from Rockefeller Center and a 15-20 minute walk to Times Square and Central Park, it has a good location, though our 5 year old did find it to be a bit far. Overall, I would say the San Carlos is a great choice for our family vacation.

This was our fourth stay at the San Carlos, and it is really the only place to stay. It is close to everything in Midtown, and one block from a Subway stop enroute to everywhere else. The staff is friendly, the rooms are airy and roomy and comfortable. Breakfast is included, the Wi-Fi is free, there are microwaves, coffee makers and a refrigerator in each room. The sheets and towels and robes are nice, as are the Aveda products. There is an adequate workout room and a business center with printers, so you can print your Theater tickets and boarding passes, for free. We spent 4 nights in April, in room 313. I will ask for this room again, because it is so quiet! No view, but really quiet without street noise. We have had suites before, which are not always bigger than our room, but had a sleeper sofa.People staying at the San Carlos are often foriegn tourists and business people, so there is a fun international buzz. The desk staff is so nice and helpful, "This is your home in New York," I was told and they mean it! There is a sense of dignity versus glitz, genuine helpfulness. We have stayed at the Marriot on Times Square, the Midtown Hilton and the Sofitel, but this is better in so many ways.

I stayed for 3 nights from 3 April with my 2 daughters. Checking in was efficient and the room on the 8th floor was spacious with 2 comfortable and clean double beds,(pillows nice and soft). The bathroom was also clean and the shower hot and powerful. There was a TV, coffee/tea making facilities, mini-bar, fridge and free safe – WI-FI was also free. The batteries needed changing in the TV remote and we couldn’t re-open the safe, but this was resolved within minutes - fantastic service. Breakfast in the dining room included a variety of breads, bagels, cakes, cereals, yoghurts, tea, coffee, hot chocolate and orange juice. Extra appreciative touches included free newspaper in the morning and a square of chocolate on the bed at night. Free use of computers and printer on the 2nd floor was a bonus. What can I say about the staff – amazing: helpful, knowledgeable and really pleasant – they couldn’t do enough for us, especially on the last day when we left our suitcases all day – at no extra charge (some hotels apparently charge)! The position of the hotel was within walking distance to Rockefeller Center, Empire State Building, Times Square, 5th Avenue, Grand Central Station and Central Park (where we enjoyed a glass of wine, soaking up the sun). My only advice would be to take a good map (street signs to attractions are not very good) and a pair of really comfortable walking shoes - together with a can of muscle spray (for the end of the day)!! Also pre-print timed tickets to visit Ground Zero – the queues are very long and ticket holders go in first! The queues to buy tickets to see a Broadway show were also quite long, but once the ticket booths had opened at 3.00 pm, it was quite quick to book tickets. We went to see ‘Nice Work if you can get it’ which was a Gershwin musical comedy (very enjoyable). You can buy tickets for Hop-on, Hop-off bus tours, which take you to the main attractions and there’s also an underground sub-way. There are cafes and restaurants near the hotel (differing in price), as well as bars, although wine seems to be quite expensive. The only negative comment I have of the hotel is the view of another tall brick building from our hotel room, but it didn’t spoil our stay, as we were out all day every day. Also be aware that additional taxes are added on to the hotel bill (14.75% tax and 10.5% City Tax) – otherwise an amazing hotel, visit and experience.

This was our first time to the US and thanks to Tripadvisor we made a perfect choice. This hotel is in an excellent location. The rooms were big and comfortable. Breakfast was included and was a very good buffet arrangement. This hotel represents excellent value for money and we had no complaints. We would definitely stay here again.

I spent 2 nights here over St. Patrick's Day weekend with my sister and niece. Our room was on the 3rd floor and was quite large and comfortable - 2 queen beds. We didnt get to our room until after 7:00 pm and the TV wasn't working properly - the signal was going in out which was only a problem because there was a program on that my niece absolute had to see. I went to the front desk and the maintenance man returned to the room with me. He couldn't get it to work, left the room, and came back with an even bigger TV within about 5 minutes. Very impressive!The hotel was about 3/4 mile from Times Square which was pretty convenient for everything. The breakfast was included and typical - pastries, yogurt, juice, coffee.The staff was very helpful, especially the doorman Friday night - I think, Matthew, maybe? The room was clean and the beds were comfortable. Well worth a return visit.

I can recommend this Hotel where my party of 3 adults stayed for 5 nights. We had room 706 which was large with 2 Queen size beds, nice bath and shower, very clean and good facilities. Room had free safe, free Wi-Fi, free fridge, free tea and coffee making equipment. Not a great view from room but this did not matter as we only slept and dressed in the room.Hotel staff were always friendly and helpful.Free complimentary breakfast was available with fruit juice, rolls, croissants, toast, cereal, jam, apples and cottage cheese, which was fine until a snack at lunch. There was also a small bar with restaurant in the lobby, which looked OK but not used by us.Hotel was approx 3/4 mile from Times Square but close to Rockefeller Centre, St Patricks Cathedral and Grand Central Station. A Metro Station only one block away and one block from the Tour Buses route which went to Times Square and Ground Zero. There are many restaurants in the area which is safe at night and never felt uncomfortable.We did use the Open Top Tour Buses and went on most routes, a fairly fast way to see most areas. We bought our tickets in advance online which may not have been the best idea. Having talked to some of the many Ticket Touts they have room to bargain and give you 4 day passes for the price of 2 days, you also don't have to queue at Madame Tussauds for an hour for your tickets.Be careful in New York, as with all big cities you need to watch your belongings, one of my party lost her purse, pick pocketed on the Staton Island Ferry, which is free by the way and passes close to Liberty Statue. If you find my review helpful I would appreciate the vote, thanks.

I stayed at this lovely hotel in October 2012 and have recommended several others to stay her since then.I found by liking them on Facebook - I would be privy to reduced rates/ upgrades on a regular basis. We arrived after a long red-eye flight from Honolulu at 7:30 a.m. Traveling with my 8 year old daughter, they were very sensitive that I wanted to not only check in early - but that we were both just exhausted. (it was 1:30 a.m. Honolulu time) They held our bags and the amazing doorman directed us to two a great little breakfast place across the street. With this hotel- the location of everything is perfect. Your just a small walk from the subway station on Lexington it is VERY safe.The nice gentleman at the desk permitted us to check in very early (this is only a space available thing) and let us get a little rest before our big night with broadway tickets.The room we had was on the 6th floor. It was clean, very roomy & set up well. It hardly seems like what you would expect in New York after hearing how cramped other hotels are.The staff was very helpful when I needed to book some tours- and directed me to their very useful 2nd floor that had computers and comfortable couches so my daughter could read while I booked reservations.The breakfast that is complimentary is a great way to start the day with coffee and a quick bite. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting New York.

The good:The staff is very friendly and helpful, and the location between 3rd and Lex on 50th is excellent, a block away from the subway and right on the East/West 49th/50th bus line.Housekeeping is excellent, beds are comfortable, and so is the bathroom (unless a very small toilet is a problem for you.) TV is HD with a good selection of channels.The bad:Paper thin walls means you hear everything (and I mean everything!) that goes on in the adjacent rooms. That alone cost this hotel one star in my rating, since unfortunately it impeded my sleep. A poor wireless connection (very slow) which also kicks you off every three hours, forcing you to re-register each time cost this hotel another star.The wireless is free, but I'd rather pay and get an excellent connection than a freebie that sucks. At $300+ (incl. tax) a night I do not consider the hotel a great value and will look for alternatives next time.

What an excellent hotel that made our first family trip to NYC a great success! A fantastic central location. We are a family of 4 and booked one room with two Queen sized beds, we were expecting it to be cramped after reading reviews on NY hotel rooms being small so were nicely surprised to find a room with ample room for us all. All facilities in the room were excellent and we weren't bothered by any outside noise as we had a room at the back of the hotel. We didn't expect wonders with the breakfast but it did the trick and saved us having to eat out every morning. The hotel staff were really pleasant and the Reception staff extremely helpful particularly as our daughter was unwell one evening. We would definitely recommend this hotel, for the price and location we don't think you'd find better.

Many times when you travel to such a popular destination such as New York, the service is lacking. But this was not the case at the San Carlos Hotel , NYC. From the time we arrived to the time we departed, the staff was great. Breakfast was kept up really well despite how busy they were. I am sure can be a nightmare. As a retail manager, I was impressed. Thank you for the great accomodations.

Nice size for a NYC room! 2 adults, 2 teens. Front desk and doormen were always fun and friendly! Spent 3 nights. Short walk to Times Square, safe area, nice local pubs within a block, yet away from the noise, hustle and bustle. Bus loop tours have a stop 2 blocks away! Would stay here again! Thank you San Carlos and staff!

We just returned from a 2 night stay. The San Carlos was perfect for our family of mom, dad, two teenagers and a 6-year-old with 2 queen beds in one room and a pull-out couch in the other, with a living area. Staff was very friendly and helpful at every turn. Room was very clean, although the tub/shower area showed signs of wear. Our room on the twelfth floor was very quiet. It looks like Room 1 on each floor is right next to the elevators, so avoid that room if possible.The second floor has several PCs and a couple printers which was handy for printing out passes to various sights. Wifi internet is free and we only ran into one short period of time when we could not get on.The location was very convenient, within several blocks of Rockefeller Center, a little further, but still walkable to Times Square and Central Park. Subway is a block away for longer distances.The only tiny disappointment was the breakfast. Pretend they don't offer one and go someplace else for breakfast as it's mainly just bread and mini-muffins. There are several places offering breakfast within 2 blocks, or purchase something you can heat up in the room. There's a small fridge and microwave as well as plates, glasses and flatware in the room.Overall, we were very pleased with our stay at the San Carlos and would definitely stay there again.

My wife and I truly enjoyed our stay at this Hotel!!! From there time we entered the front door, to the time that we left to return home, the room did not disappoint our rest. The sheets were so clean that we could smell the detergent in them as we rested on them, and did we mention how CLEAN the room, bathroom, and hallway was?!?!?!? All fabulous and spotless! NO BUGS, Rodents, or any other insects here, just good clean visiting. Staying here give one the opportunity to be CLOSE TO EVERYTHING in Manhattan, with the ability to walk to TIME SQUARE, CENTRAL PARK, etc. The only reason we could not give this Hotel an excellent, is due to the daily cleaning crew on the 10th floor entering our room when we CLEARLY held the Do Not Disturb sign on the door... Twice!!!! But, dispite that, the management team handled our COMPLAINT like champions, and the cleaning crew apologized for they actions. We will stay here again on our NEXT TRIP... No Doubt!

After a devastating medical diagnosis, we were looking for a hotel close to a hospital in NYC for an emergency surgery. We stumbled upon the San Carlos and saw that it was extremely close. We attempted to book online, but decided that calling the hotel directly would be quicker. We spoke to someone named Fabio and explained our situation and he was extremely accommodating to us and our needs, especially booking on such short notice. Fabio and the rest of the staff was really helpful with all of the little details, especially organizing taxi service that made such a difficult time a little easier. I would definitely recommend the San Carlos to everyone looking for a more personal touch.

Stayed five nights in a deluxe room with two queen beds.Pros- location; about five blocks east of Rockefeller Centre- close to bakeries, restaurants, pharmacies, subways, parking, banks, Grand Central Station, United Nations, grocery stores (2nd Avenue)- large rooms- firm mattress- free, reliable and strong wi-fi- large, cool refrigerator/freezer for guest use; separate mini-bar insuite- powerful microwave- plates, bowls, glasses, wine glasses and cutlery provided in the room- great water pressure for the shower- friendly, helpful staff- on the 2nd floor, there were 2 printers and 6-7 PCs in the business centre- efficient elevators- accessible- breakfast room is on the ground floor, south west corner. Seats about 50? Modest quality offerings include bagels, yogurt, apples, hot chocolate, orange juice, mini-pastries, cereal, coffee, teas and hot water- loan umbrellas to guests during rain storms- doorman assists with luggage and hailing taxisNeutral- tuck down service offered each night to guests- a shower massage would have been nice- exercise room (but did not use or see it)- not much of view from the roomCons- some stains on the room carpet; I don't believe the room is vacuumed everyday? - one of the beverage glasses was clearly chipped and should have been tossed out by housekeeping- plates/bowls/glasses could have been cleaned a little better by housekeeping- bath tub needs to be reculked- Rooms need to be sound-proofed. Could hear some chatter from our neigbours in the morning.- no mat for the bath tub. Can be slippery- bathroom exhaust fan would have been nice

I have been in NY many times for business reasons and try my best to stay at San Carlos. It's a very good hotel with a relaxed atmosphere and the service you need to feel comfy. A very simple, but good enough continental breakfast is included in the rate. Free wi-fi. All the rooms I have stayed in has had good size with one or two rooms. If I should say something on the down side it must be that some rooms are bothered with noise both from the hallway and the street below. Recommend to ask for a room to the back and on the upper floors.

I stayed at the San Carlos in beginning of February 2013 with my parents and my 9 year old son. We had a a one bedroom queen suite with kitchen. This was perfect for us as we travelled from Europe so because of the jet lag, by 8pm the 9 year-old was sound asleep. Having the living room was a great solution as the adults could enjoy the evening in the living room and we used the kitchen to prepare simply food in the evening (cheese and wine).There is plenty of grocery shops 1 block west.We paid 300 USD/night which we found was a good price compared to other hotels.The room was clean an housekeeping did a fantastic job every day.The living room is large and so is the bedroom.In the bathroom there is only one sink, and this might be an issue for some and there is only one toilet.The biggest issue was the air conditioning which made a horrible sound. We turned it off during the night as nobody could sleep with it on. I can imagine that in the summer, you need to leave the air conditioning on so I'm not sure how this experience will be. As we did not need it, we were not bothered with it.Breakfast in the morning was fine but after 5 nights I got a bit tired of eating toasted bread with jam and cream cheese. But I cannot complain as there was also cereal, fresh fruit and pastry/muffins.The hotel is in walking distance to many attractions (Times Square, Central Park...) and there is a subway 2 min walk from the hotel.The front office staff were friendly and helpful and if I come back during the cooler month were I do not need the air conditioning in the night, I would definitely consider San Carlos for my next trip to New York.

We stay at the San Carlos every time we go to NYC! Typically 6 times a year. Our son is at Columbia and although the hotel is on the east side and we end up spending a bit more on cab fare to get over to Morningside..... we wouldn't dream of staying anywhere else!!!! Great location, amazing staff! Bobby, Matthew and Johan greet us like old friends! Gabriel, Quran and the entire front desk team couldn't be more kind or accommodating! The rooms are just perfect. Suites are lovely as well! Within walking distance of 30 Rock, St. Patricks, Moma, 5th ave shopping!!

We took our 13 year old son to visit NY for his birthday. My husband and I have visited the city several times, but this is the first stay at the San Carlos. The hotel is situated in an ideal location in midtown ... close to EVERYTHING. I can't say enough about the hotel itself. The staff were so accommadating, and eager to make our stay the best it could be. The continental breakfast was delicious and plentiful! It was a great way to start our day. The room we stayed in was a King Suite, which was HUGE! Not just by NYC standards, but by any standard. Not sure very many hotels in the city have rooms this spacious. The couch folded out into a queen bed ( by the way, the mattress was quite thick and comfortable which isn't usually the case ), and it was perfect for our son. The room was very clean, and the kitchen was equipped with a full place setting of dishes and utensils. If you are planning a trip to Manhattan, book this hotel. You will not find a bigger, better hotel at this price in the city. Would definitely stay here again!

This review is a bit overdue, however we stayed as a family of 3 for 12 nights over both Christmas and New Year. We chose this hotel following recommendations on trip advisor - a hotel that provided space and in mid manhattan. I have emailed the hotel twice to confirm our reservation however they did not come back to me which was a little concerning, Checkin was super quick with friendly staff and we were allocated a room on the 8th floor (King Executive Suite). Although on reflection it was a queen bed but too tired to request a different room. The room super clean, housekeeping excellent and attentive and the room was a superb size with a fold down spring action sofa bed. Loads of storage space, large LCD Tv and good size bathroom and kitchenette with microwave and fridge. Some guests comment on the noise from the street. Located on the 8th Floor looking down onto the main street we did hear the odd horn really it wasn't an issue and overnight we were not bothered with street noise. Any noise we did hear were from other guests in the adjoining room. The complimentary wifi was superb. Those who dont bring their own laptop can access the 3 pcs and printer in on the first floor. The hall ways look like there had been re carpeted recently.The location of the hotel was fantastic nice safe neighbourhood with absolutely everything on your door step and easy walk to Time Square, 5th Avenue and we walked back to our hotel from Central Park after the New Year Celebrations. Lots of shops on lexington and close to Bloomingdales and main subway lines. Many people have criticised the breakfast - well sorry I am afraid your really can't complain it is included in the room rate and provides the basics to get you going in the morning (juice, tea, coffee, hot choc, pastries, cheese, bagel, yoghurt, fruit). The hotel between Christmas and New Year as you would expect was full and this did prove a little challenging in the dining room. Guests (including us) took their breakfast back to their suite which worked out fine - the only feedback for the hotel here is provide some trays for use by guest carrying hot liquids. Another tip - there is an indian bar / restaurant next door (actually joined onto the hotel), They do great happy hour - well 3 hrs! try it, it was just fine after a day of sightseeing. We got a take away one night and took it back to our room also ok, this can be delivered also. (see my separate review)The doormen we polite and helpful and gave you an umbrella for the rainy day we had They organised a hotel car to take us back to the airport and it was swift and reasonably priced. All in all an extremely comfortable, family friendly, couple of business hotel would suit all. In a safe located close to everything. Will definitely return here. Thanks San Carlos.

When I travel to NY, always have a little stay in San Carlos Hotel. Its a family hotel well located in midtown , Manhattan. Good prices and attention of first class. The personal is very friendly and do for you everything you need. I love this hotel

This is an excellent boutique hotel, in a great location, with a nice continental breakfast, the staff was very friendly and helpful. I would give a 5 star except that I prefer a firm mattress, and although I could tell the mattress was a good mattress, it was not firm enough for my liking. Other than that, an excellent hotel.

Last week I along a couple of friends stayed at Summin Inn, which is in Richmond Hill,Ontario.The price was very reasonable with a great ,courteous staff.Plus that the location was a great advantage ,nearby plenty of facilities.The room was so clean and comfortable .

The location was great, just blocks away from 5th ave and/or Rockefeller. The staff were extremely nice. The doorman were attentive and polite. The rooms were very spacious for New York standards. Plenty of closet space and complimentary robes! Free wifi is definitely a bonus. Their free continental breakfast was okay but good for them for even offering that to their guest as it is probably not offered at any other hotel for free! Overall great stay loved the hotel and would definitely recommend it as an alternative to high chain name brand hotels.

In New York City, it's often hard to find a spacious room that's extremely clean and quiet. The San Carlos is a terrific hotel for business travel when you're looking for a really good night's sleep. There are no real frills and the decor is quite simple, but it was a great home-base for meetings in the city. The king sized bed in my room was extremely comfortable, and Aveda products were available in the bathroom. Everyone on the staff was helpful and accomodating. It's also a great location at 50th and 3rd. There's a TreeHaus with awesome smoothies/juices right down the road. Dos Caminos (high-end Mexican) is right across the street. Ess-a-Bagel is one block down and across the street. It's easy to walk to Rockefeller Center/Times Square. I will be staying here again on my next business trip. If you want a boutique hotel with funky decor, I might look elsewhere. If you're looking for a good rate and good night's sleep, this will do nicely!

This is an excellent boutique hotel, with a clear European flavour. Our room was spacious and quite. Breakfast was included in the price. Service is excellent! Location is not the best but it is not too far from main attractions. Overall, an excellent hotel.

Spacious rooms,lovely comfortable beds and quiet for New York - well soundproofed compared to other hotels. The staff were amazing - gracious, helpful and efficient.The rooms have a coffee maker and microwave - no kettle for tea but you can boil water in the microwave. My only gripe would be that the breakfast was spoilt for me by the use of paper plates, cups and plastic cutlery - this does seem to be the norm in the US but all the same, I find it tacky in a good hotel. i will certainly choose this hotel for any other trips to New York as it is great value as well as being super comfortable

The stay was very comfortable. Staff was polite and courteous. Location is great. Subway near by is great advantage. The breakfast was okay could be made more attractive. The market places are nearby.

We stayed here for 4 nights over the 2012 Christmas period - great location (if you want to be walking distance to Rockefeller Centre and that general area, and very handy to Metro system - about a 200m walk, or 500m, depending on which line you are getting. We had a family suite, which was a lounge room with a large queen size sofa bed, and then a second room with two double beds - all very comfortable and plenty of space for the 4 of us (two adults and two teenage children). Having a galley kitchen was great (but no stove top, just microwave). Service was good and would highly recommend this as a good family option (not always easy to find hotel accom for a family that is good value for money). There can be a bit of noise coming up from the street, but this is central New York and I suspect that would be the case in most places in the area unless you can get a room on a much higher floor (we were on the 6th floor)
user_name:
dbtripper
Mount Barney National Park, Australia

review_body: The San Carlos is a real home away. The rooms are very well taken care of, the staff are great. The location is very convenient on East 50th, with plenty of resturants in walking distance. The gym is very good for a small hotel
user_name:
Stuart_in_DC
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Okay, I tried to be open minded. I used to nice hotels.. five star, world class hotels. But, I just couldn't bear this hotel and left after a couple hours stay and went to the local Hyatt, which was awesome!! I left because the room was very cold and the air blew right on my bed. It could not be turned off and the heat (which was a water register, fueled by a boiler in the basement) would not come on. After hearing my colleagues complain about the heat or air that could not be regulated in their room and attempting to sleep through street noise, I made a direct departure for a more modern hotel, which work out like a charm and cost no more.

We stayed in the San Carlos from 19 to 23 December 2012. We were coming with my daughter and needed enough room for three and were not disappointed. We had a suite with king bed for about $300/night and it was quite comfortable, a bedroom and fully separate living room with sofa bed, along with a kitchenette and a table. So my wife and I could have privacy and my daughter -- preparing for exams - had room to spread out and study. By New York standards, this suite was large and, if not terribly fancy, completely up-to-snuff and not at all tatty. Quite a decent lobby as well, and a basic but functional gym with a couple of stationary bicycles and treadmills. Its true the breakfast was nothing at all special, but there's a very nice and not unreasonably-priced diner-style breakfast place right across the street. And at two blocks from Rockefeller Center a pretty good location for Christmas. So all around a very good choice if you don't want a huge blowout but you want a nice, clean spacious accommodation in convenient midtown location.

The San Carlos is a good hotel with excellent rooms and central to all you need in NY. There is nothing wrong with rooms, cleanliness, breakfast is adequate even with plastic plates and cutlery, porters are extremely helpful. It is not the cheapest and for the price, I think they had opportunities to do better and didn't. I booked through Booking.com and emailed a few days before arrival just to confirm all was ok. There followed a few emails looking for my credit card details on an unsecure email as booking.com did not appear to have sent them. If that was the case, this should have been taken up with them. I also requested a front facing room - we got a back facing one with no explanation. I had also pointed out it was a 20 year surprise wedding anniversary holiday for my family. EXCELLENT hotels would have handled the booking better, said to me that the requested room was not available and, for the price we paid, a SMALL acknowledgement of the occasion would have been made- it wasn't mentioned. There is nothing wrong with the hotel - our experience was fine but we paid alot of money for our stay. They had chances to shine and didn't. Would we stay again? Possibly, but in a big city like NY, there must be places trying harder to do everything they can for their guests. I think they are too complacent and they need to work a lot harder on the details that make a difference to keep rating of 28th Best Rated Hotel in NY.

This is a wonderful place for families or anyone wanting a New York accommodation larger than the postage-stamp rooms available at the hotel chains. The San Carlos is family owned and we even met the friendly owner himself in the lobby one morning. He went out of his way to ask if we were comfortable and well-cared for at his hotel, and then he gave us some of his personal sightseeing tips. We had a suite with a king size bed and sitting area with fold-out sofa where the kids (ages 10 and 12) slept well, and a small kitchen area. The room was extremely clean, quiet and the A/C worked well -- very much appreciated after long, hot days of summer sightseeing on the streets of NYC. I also really appreciated the computers and printers on the second floor. Use these to book and print advance tickets to the major attractions like the Empire State Building and the Statue of Liberty, and skip the lines. The location was close to several subway stations and an easy walk to Rockefellar Center. The breakfast was OK, nothing to write home about, but the kids liked it and filled up. There were many other choices near the hotel for a quick bite to eat so the breakfast quality didn't concern me. I definitely wouldn't let it affect your choice to stay here, nor will it stop me from booking a room here next time we're in NYC. I highly recommend the San Carlos.

We stayed a total of 11 nights at San Carlos hotel and would thnk about staying here again. We are a family of 4 and we stayed in 2 rooms. For the price you pay, the room is a good size and the location is good. You can take the subway from the left of the hotel or right of the hotel. But there are 2 major cons:- Breakfast buffet - we were shocked by how mediocre the buffet was. Soggy looking pastries that looked old, cereal from packets ... sorry, we ate out after that every single day and did not bother with the buffet. For NYC, i would expect better food but then again, for the price we paid, perhaps that is what was served. - My husband came to join us in NYC after 2 days and i had to book an extra room for him. I spoke to Canute at the front desk and he was really really confused about making a reservation. I spent 30 mins in front of him at the front desk on the 2nd night just to book for 1 more extra room (what was so tough about that) and he lost his temper at me. He asked me why we have to confuse things and not book in the beginning. WELL, IF I KNEW THEN THAT WE NEED AN EXTRA ROOM, WE WOULD HAVE DEFINITELY BOOKED ONLINE INSTEAD OF DEALING WITH YOU!! He definitely could not handle being on his own on the night shift and was very frantic, confused and kept messing the dates up himself. Please consider backing him up with another more experienced staff for nights. All in all, not the best hotel that we could have stayed in but considerably that it is in midtown and within walking distance from rockefeller, grand central terminal etc, might be worth it.

I recently traveled with my mom and two sisters (60 and 30s), and we chose to stay at the San Carlos Hotel after reading recommendations on Trip Advisor. I can say that we were very happy with our choice to stay here, and after staying in other hotels on different trips, this is the only one we would come back to. It isn't a fancy hotel with a huge lobby or restaurants, etc., but the location can't be beat and the room was huge. We had a suite with two queen beds in the bedroom and a pullout sofa. It was by far the largest room I have ever stayed in while visiting NYC. It was perfect for four women to spread out and relax after long days walking the city. We had a very quiet room, and didn't hear any street noise, and although there wasn't much of a view, we didn't really care about that. The beds were a tiny bit hard for me, and the sofa bed was a little thin (to be expected), but some really nice housekeepers brought a mattress topper for that which definitely helped. All of the employees were so friendly and helpful. The breakfast was fine - nothing special and not much of a selection, but it's free, and we weren't picky. We did eat at Ess-A-Bagel around the corner one morning.The location was excellent for our needs. We had a first-time NYC visitor with us, so we wanted to do some of then normal touristy stuff, and this hotel was within easy walking distance to Rockefeller Center, Radio City Music Hall, 5th Avenue shopping, etc. We used the subway for anything that wasn't in walking distance, and the E train is literally one block away (I used the Embark NYC app to navigate the subway). The hotel staff were helpful in confirming directions and helping us get to where we needed to go if we had questions. We have stayed near Penn Station before and near Times Square, but we preferred this location as it is not nearly as crowded, although there aren't really as many restaurants or shops to choose from right outside of the hotel (or at least we didn't find them!). Overall, I would recommend this hotel. If you don't care about bars and restaurants right in your hotel, and if you are looking for a clean, affordable (for NYC!), comfortable, convenient, relaxing place to stay while you enjoy the city, this is a fantastic option. I have never written a review on here before, but I really counted on all of the other reviews to help me make my decision, so I hope my review will help someone else.

Being a very frequent visitor to New York, my last visit was spent at the San Carlos. Overall, the stay was completely hassle-free. I travelled with two friends, staying in a room with a sofa bed in the separate living room. We found the whole property very clean and staff generally friendly (happy to suggest bars - very good ones, at that). Things to note:- Sofa beds are perfectly adequate, but don't expect superior comfort. I was told that the bed provided very good sleep quality however. Sofa beds may be better suited for families with children. Also note that once the sofa bed has been set up as a bed, morning room service will not convert it back into a sofa unless you request it. Since they have evening turndown service, I found this a little surprising.- Breakfast is included, which in itself is rare for NY. It's not spectacular (neither is the breakfast room) but what they do provide is good quality, and it does give you a good start of the day.- Location. Now for us, hell on earth would be living on Times Square and we much prefer this slightly more quiet East Midtown location. There are a number of brilliant wine bars nearby with a more local clientele, and you can still walk to most places. Thumbs up. Overall, this is a very good place to stay. Clean, friendly - I would not hesitate to book here again.

We stayed in a 1-BR suite for one night when we came up to take our daughter to a broadway show. The hotel is very clean, and the rooms are a very good size (for NYC). The beds and furnishings were comfortable. The bathroom was well equipped. Yes, it was small, but it was well done. The staff were uniformly friendly and helpful.This is a great deal in midtown. Terrific place. Would definetely stay again.
user_name:
JolietJakeBlues
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I have been in this Hotel in December 2012 in a suite room.PRO:- The room are very clean and spacious with all the amenities that you expect.- The bed is very comfortable but not King size. It may be too small for an "oversized" couple- The Staff is "genuine" and very helpful- Location is good CONS:- Noisy, all the room facing the main road are very noisy. Too much for a NY hotel and too much for a 4star hotel. A confy bed as no value if you can hear what happen around you all night. The lack of Sound proof Windows was notable.- Breakfast: it's true that it's included in the price. But when you pay 400 USD per day paper plates and plastic forks is not what you expect. A tiny little room, self service with very limited choice. People that choose this hotel may expect a different service and my personal opinion from a marketing point of view you better provide basic service but up to level or leave them out. - Lobby : is nice and clean but here is not a bar whetnice and clean but no Bar or Place where you feel comfortable to stay a relax after a busy day.Overall, it's a good hotel for any deal under the 250 USD. If any of the above is a concern look around for other alternativesforgot to mention a small but important plus. WIFI is free on all the room. Please, note that nearby hotel is under construction if noise is an issue please, check with the hotel . works start at 5 AMPLEASE; IF YOU THINK THIS REVIEW IS USEFUL CLICK YES

We chose this lovely hotel for four days based on Tripadvisor comments and we were not disapointed! Great welcome, really big,comfortable, immaculate room, and central location just down the road from Times Square, Broadway and Grand Central Station. I would like to say thank you to the staff who were very helpful. There is a great diner opposite. P.S. Beware the Tricycle cabs - real rip off- cost us $95 dollars to come back 5 blocks from Broadway, charge per person, they are as bad as Timeshare touts.

Hotel was very very good. High quality finish throughout, very comfortable bed, lovely breakfast. Great location. Hotel is a few minutes walk from Rockefeller center and 5th avenue. The subway is right on your door. Only slight critique would be the night life tends to close around 11pm in the immediate area. Very minor issue as we were not in New York to get drunk. Breakfast was basic but perfectly acceptable, lovely fresh continental breakfast, decent coffee, fruit juices, yoghurts. You can eat as much as you like and grab a coffee before you head into New York. The door staff were great, they found us a taxi at rush hour in the rain which in NYC isn't the easiest thing to do.The only problem we had was that our safe was not working when we arrived, (battery was duff) but this was fixed within 20 mins.Overall, no complaints, would definitely return again.

We chose the San Carlos based on reviews in T.A and were not disappointed. Location was great, rooms large in good condition, well appointed and staff friendly and helpful. San Carlos was a great location for all the mid and uptown events and attractions we had planned. Close enough for an easy walk to Times Square but far enough away from the crowd and noise. Near to subway for added convenience. The guest rooms are quite large, though the bath is smaller, but we would recommend to friends and stay again on our next NYC visit.

My husband and I stayed here with our good friend while visiting NYC for a Broadway show. The San Carlos hotel is conveniently located to many of the common tourist sites, including Times Square and the Theater District. We were able to walk to most of the places we wanted to see while in NYC. The hotel staff was so nice and accommodating. They let us keep our bags there before and after checkout so we weren't burdened with them while walking the streets and doing some sightseeing. The front desk offered great advice for a restaurant that was only a couple of blocks away from the hotel, and they made the reservation for us.We stayed in a room with two Queen-sized beds, and I will say that the size of the room in general was very large compared to many other NYC hotels. It was very clean and orderly. The beds were very comfortable.Overall, this hotel is a great value for the price, great location, wonderful service, and very clean rooms.

I stay in the city each quarter for work and we seem to try a different hotel each time. The San Carlos Hotel had the best rate this time, in the midst of the craziness with the holiday time, and it was a nice place to stay. My initial impression was not positive. I stopped by early to see if I could check in before my meeting and the man at the front desk just seemed to want to chat....and chat....and chat. 10 minutes later, I was able to finally find out a room wasn't ready. No problem, but it didn't need to take that long. When I finally checked in at 5:30, I was given a handicapped room which just had some interesting things in the bathroom. Otherwise, the bed and pillows were very comfortable and I was impressed that the room had a small refrigerator (in addition to the mini bar), microwave, and a drawer that contained plates and silverware. That was a very nice touch. It was quiet and had a comfortable bed so I'd stay again if the price was right!

After alot of trawling for a fab place to stay this was perfect. Location walkable to times square, 5th avenue and close to tube stations. Local people in the area friendly and fab bagel place on 3rd ave and funky rooftop bar directly across the road. The darker style rooms were a blessing for resting and the breakfast is a nice touch that it's free but as been said before don't worry if you miss it. The staff are lovely and helpful and the rooms kept spotless. The beds and pillows were fantastic along with the small bathtub to rest your feet. It was good to have tea/coffee fascilities in the room. We would stay again if we are to come back to NYC. P.S. the Indian restaurant next door is also worth a visit.

I stayed this time only one night at the San Carlos hotel. But it was already my fourth stay here. So it starts with a greeted curb side by the doorman who took my suitcase right to the front desk. The check in at the front desk staff was polite and professional but a little bit "cold" . The room was again really nice, clean, though unfortunately not the "suite size I had experienced last times(was realy an upgrade at that time). It had a small sitting room, with all what you needed in your room, refrigerator, coffee, trousers iron,....Excellent location in mid Manhattan, good breakfast for NY standards(all included). Certainly You'll see me back again for business and leisure

I LOVE the San Carlos! The rooms are exceptionally clean with great amenities. The staff was wonderfully attentive without being overbearing. They went the extra mile to make me feel comfortable and give "idiot proof" directions to this tourist. The quiet elegance of the hotel was comforting against the hustle and bustle of the city!

We stayed at the San Carlos for 5 days over Thanksgiving and it was just perfect. The rooms are large for NYC standards. Very easy access, convenient location, clean and confortable rooms. No luxuries but well kept.

My husband, college-age son and I stayed in the executive suite at the San Carlos hotel for the second time this year. We're ex NYers and appreciate the convenience of the location. The executive suite is perfectly designed for 2 or 3 people. It features a pullout sofa in a sitting area as well as a small kitchen. So handy. The linens and appointments are top notch. The rooms are spotless and comfy. The room includes a buffet breakfast. The staff is the best.

I was surprised when the owner of the hotel, presented to me and my family last january. He said, its good that the boss pay attention to you! Effectively, the attention of the hotel is good, the rooms are clear and clean. You feel confortable in the middle of town, next to the train, the museums and the big avenues of New York.

Due to a lack of electric power from hurricane Sandy and the NY Marathon falling on the same weekend we couldn't get a room at The Plaza, Pierre, Regent, Essex House etc. My wife found a room at the San Carlos Hotel in Midtown with only one night available. We loved it. The room was clean, bright and more than ample.They had a nice buffet breakfast included.Great staff

After 2yrs planning 3 friends and I left the husbands and kids at home in Ireland and headed to NYC for 4 nights of relaxation, sightseeing and shopping. We arrived Sat 27th and Sandy arrived Monday 29th so our NYC adventure became somewhat curtailed. Thanks to all the staff at San Carlos. We ended up staying for 3 extra nights (at standrad rate - no profitering, unlike stories we heard from other weary travellers!!!) and enjoyed all NYC has to offer before we departed. The rooms are very spacious and spotless. The suite was great for 4 ladies. Highly recommended.
user_name:
JMCG41
Belfast, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom

review_body: I enjoyed a two-night stay the San Carlos hotel. I was greeted curb side by the doorman who took my suitcase right to the front desk. The front desk staff was terrific. Check in was easy and they upgraded my room. The room was really more of a suite. It had a large sitting room, with a refrigerator, and wet bar. The bedroom was comfortable with a nice king size bed with soft, comfortable linens. Both rooms had flat screen TVs and a wide selection of channels. The bathrooms were large by NYC standards. Nice appointments including nice fluffy towels. The room was very quiet so I slept well. At $275 for the night, I would definitely stay there again.

We stayed at the San Carlos Hotel for two nights last month. Hotel was in a great location and the subway is around the corner. Room size was great for traveling with two kids. Pleasant front desk and housekeeping staff. Breakfast is fine - pleasantly surprised by the Stoneyfield Farms yogurt...nice perk Ess-A-Bagel is around the corner if you want a true NY bagel. No complaints would definitely consider a return visit when back in NYC.

Girls weekend that included tickets to see Barbra Streisand perform in Brooklyn. We were debating about a vacation rental vs. Hotel. Finally settled on the San Carlos based on a recommendation. What a great choice! Friendly staff and SPACIOUS room! We rented an executive suite which was a living room, bedroom and small kitchen, complete with dishware, mini fridge and microwave.Clean, mostly quiet ( hard not to heat street noise in NYC, right?). Bathrooms were an unexpected luxury.1 1/2 blocks to the subway ... Couldn't have been any more convenient. Close to Times Square and the Theatre District, and, of course, shopping!I would definitely stay at the San Carlos again!

I come to NY regularly and always stay at the San Carlos hotel as it has a rare combination of:1. top rooms that get the highest level of maintenance2. Staff - the nicest staff that never changes and always happy to assist the guests in any way they can.3. small but important things that better anybody's stay, such as breakfast, free internet, biz center and more.During Sandy, the hotel was ran in the most efficient way. needed staff stayed over and was extremely nice to everyone (given the numbers of ppl that walked in...) for me as a frequent traveler, there's only one hotel in NYC - The San Carlos !
user_name:
nadav k
New York City, New York

review_body: My daughter, grandson, and I just spent a long weekend at the SCH. We had a suite that included two rooms, two queen beds and a sofa sleeper, and a kitchenette. It was huge compared to other places I've stayed in NYC. It was also clean. The continental breakfast was perfect for us, convenient with a nice selection of food items and drinks. My only disappointment was that no welcome basket was waiting for my grandson. I had written SCH asking for help in pulling together a little gift to make my 6-year-old grandson's first visit to NYC extra special. I was told they would put together a complimentary one, which would have been perfect. Unfortunately, it didn't happen. I just wish I would have known ahead of time, so I could have done something on my own.

My husband found this hotel on the internet and after reading the Tripadvisor reviews, we booked our stay for 3 nights in Midtown NYC. The hotel is central and in a calm street. We arrived with a rental car at 8am and we were pleasantly surprised to find a parking right next door to the hotel. The person at the reception was very nice and even if we had booked the hotel the night to come, she offered us to go and take the complementary breakfast in the lobby. In the meantime, I asked her to find the address of a pizzeria in Brooklyn and she printed the pizzeria's info and brought it to me.The room was supposed to be ready at 3pm but as it was ready before, we were able to go to our room at midday. It was a one bedroom suite with 2 Queen beds + 1 sofa bed. Perfect for a family of 4 with 2 children who didn't want to sleep in the same bed!We were told that there is no view as it is a small hotel (18 floors) but it was a view for us (see photo below)! The hotel receives a lot of Spanish speaking hosts and it is nice and cosy family hotel. Each and every of the employees we met during our stay were nice and helpful. A man at the reception even did a magic trick to our son who laughed in delight. Complimentary umbrellas were offered to use when it started to rain which was much appreciated.We found restaurants all around and the area is nice and relatively calm which was good as we were able to choose different food depending on our mood.A hotel we will definitely go back to. A very good place to sleep and spend calm and quality time to rest.

I love to visit NYC and usually do so on girlfriend trips. I have researched numerous hotels, looking for those that have the ability to accommodate our needs. San Carlos is one of the very, very few that offers two queen beds in a nice large room. The San Carlos is located across from the Waldorf, and is wonderfully situated for access to public transportation, walking to your favorite big box stores, restaurants, etc., etc. The rooms are very clean, the beds and bedding are very comfortable, free wi-fi, a desk, mini fridge and bar, and lounge chair. The continental breakfast is convenient, not a gourmet set up, mind you, but perfectly suitable for a quick bite to begin your day in the city! I've stayed in rooms that face the back, which has a view of the next building. I've had lovely quiet stays both times. I'm only there to sleep. I actually get a kick out of watching the office building come to life from dark stillness to bright activity, like a scene from a TV show. The front desk is always the best part of my stay, did you know there are two gentlemen there that have quite the set of pipes? Ask to find out who sings Louie Armstrong"s "It's a Wonderful World", and who sounds like Bing Crosby!

Stayed in the hotel for a week. Room was very clean and comf with a little kitchen and fridge. Staff very helpful and friendly. Breakfest good but basic. Very convenient location. Will stay there again for sure.

We booked the weekend getaway to NYC as an add-on for a business trip and stayed at the San Carlos Hotel which came recommended. Initially, we considered staying in another hotel for our "vacation" portion of this trip, but were swayed by the reviews and by the hotel website to extend our stay here. In the end, good marketing is a great tool but buyer be warned. This is not a boutique hotel.The furnishings were standard and while the room was nice and large, words such as "Plush" used on their website are an exaggeration... Spartan comes to my mind. So, this is at best a good business hotel with no frills. It has a comfortable bed, an uncomfortable lounge chair, a good desk and a small unremarkable bathroom. The towels were remarkable... how do they get them to feel so rough? The windows were small and our view toward the back of the hotel was a darkened alley.The staff was great... Very friendly and helpful. I'll thank them for their excellent service. The complimentary breakfast was not great. The pastries were bland in keeping with a theme that included only two cereals - Corn Flakes and Rice Krispies. Yogurt, apples, juice, milk, coffee, toast, and bagels were also offered.I can recommend this hotel - it is clean, the rooms are large, and the location is good. However if you are seeking something special for your NYC stay, you might want to keep searching.

This is a "plain Jane" hotel with few hotel services. It has a fitness room and a business center but no restaurant or bar (there is an adjoining Indian restaurant, separately owned that will run take out up to your room). Despite this the staff is friendly, the hotel is clean and the rooms are huge by NY standards. I stayed in a queen suite which had a kitchen, large living room/bedroom, a wide screen TV and an easy chair. Wifi and continental breakfast with fresh pastries were included in the price. Given the location (down the street from the Waldorf) this hotel is a great bargin, most especially for families.
user_name:
Jimindc2007
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: This hotel is a real gem in NYC. We reserved a one room suite and were truly amazed at the size of the room, given its location. The kitchenette was very convenient, the service was outstanding, the maids did a very good job, and the front desk was friendly. We received great recommendations for dinner. The hotel was very well kept up, the rug was showing a little wear, but during our stay they started coming in and replacing the rugs on our floor.The free breakfast was just OK, and served in a very crowded room. But overall, I would definitely highly recommend this hotel and stay here again.

My wife, two kids, and my mother-in-law stayed in a suite at this hotel. Check in was a breeze, no need to wait in a long line or anything like that. The room was excellent for the price, compared to the normal, puny-sized rooms of New York. There were 2 separate rooms, one with a king bed and one with a sofa bed. The sofa bed was a queen bed, so it was big enough to fit two people, but for our convenience, they brought in an extra roll-in bed for us. One of the best things about this hotel was that its room service almost immediately brought you whatever you wanted. For example, I asked for more towels and shampoo before I showered, and they delivered them in less than two minutes. The breakfast was rather simple, but the quality was still good. Sometimes it got so crowded that you had to wait in a line to get in. The breakwast was also light, hence the name "continental breakfast," with a wide variety of pastries, breads, yogurts, etc. The hotel's location was very good, right next to the Waldorf Astoria and a short walk to Saks Fifth Avenue. One negative of this hotel was that the dining portion of the room service was not 24/7, and it was only Indian food. The staff was also extremely kind and welcoming. The concierge performed magic tricks for my 5 year old son and gave him chocolates, which brightened up his trip a bit. Overall, this hotel was a successful pick, and I would recommend it to both people and families who are looking for quality, not necessarily luxury.

We stayed on the sixth floor facing 50th. The rooms were comfortable, large and clean. However, the noise from the street and the construction across the street would wake us up through out the night. This is a convenient location and the staff is friendly. I will likely stay here on my next visit to NYC, however, I would like to see some improvements...Finding a seat during breakfast was a challenge, regardless of when we came down -- so more seating would be encouraging, possibly in the lobby, which is mostly empty. Or they can provide trays so the guests can make use of their spacious rooms and kitchenette.The selection during breakfast was disappointing, consisting of mostly of white carbs, pastries, soft apples, Corn Flakes, and Rice Crispies. Great if you are two, but not an adult meal. My wife and I are both allergic to milk, and there were no alternatives available -- so more healthy choices would be encouraging, such as soy or almond milk, boiled eggs, cold cuts, granola, Fiber 1, oatmeal etc.Despite these minor details, I feel that this Hotel is a great stay due to the pluses, including, comfy beds, wifi, soft and fluffy pillows & enough of them, Aveda products in the bathroom, kitchenette in the room, coffee machine in the room, spacious rooms and seating, convenient location -- close to Grand Central, cleanness and helpful staff.

My daughter and I recently stayed in an executive king suite. We got a great rate. The hotel is in a perfect location that made walking to Rock Center, Central Park and public transit very easy. The suite was large and clean, the public areas were very nice, business center with plenty of computers/printers for printing boarding passes. Nice continental breakfast in the morning, but the dining area was very busy so we just took our food to our room since it had a kitchenette. Free internet. Service was very good, as well. Only problem was the noise - we were on 12th floor and could hear honking starting very early (and we were on a side street), and the neighbors next door - showering, toddler being loud, etc. I don't think they have soundproofing in walls or windows, so if you're a light sleeper this would be a problem. All in all, I would recommend and would stay here again.

Excellent service, very clean and they returned my ipad that I had left in the room. This kind of personal service is so rare these days and I truly appreciated the attentive staff and immaculate rooms. It was very quiet in the room, almost no street noise and the beds were comfortable.Most importantly, they treat customers very well. The location is ideal for shopping, restaurants and easy access to transportation. The jitney from the Hamptons dropped us off only one block away. Very convenient.

We just returned from our one night mini-vacay from NYC, and I can't wait to write about our experience staying at the San Carlos Hotel. My husband I took our sons, age 3 and 1, to NYC for a weekend trip. We truly enjoyed the hotel from the moment we arrived to the moment we left. There are three main reason why we love it, the room size, hotel amenity and the most important part, staff. My husband and I had stayed in several other hotels in the area in the past, (Affinia, Waldorf Astoria, Hilton New York and Hilton Time Square), but we found this hotel worth returning to. First of all, the size of the room is beyond expected. It felt more like a "home" than a hotel room. For the average price of a mid-town Manhattan hotel, we had a true one-bedroom suite with two queen size beds. The bed room was equipped with a standard size desk and a large flat screen TV. The beds were soft yet supportive. The living room had a sofa bed, two chairs, a large TV, a dining area and a kitchenette. After sitting in the stroller all afternoon waiting for us, my boys were ready for some stretching. The room provided plenty of space for them. If there is any downside to the room, that would be the view out of the window. We didn't care, since we spent most of the time exploring the city. The amenities of the room were great, especially the kitchenette. It has a small refrigerator, sink, microwave, and some basic dinnerware like bowls, plates, glasses and silverware. Don't worry about bringing a cork opener, they got that, too. We brought in dinner for Sat. night, and all the items in the kitchenette made it so much easier. The breakfast was simply, yet every item was delicious. Even coffee was better than Starbucks! Finally, and most importantly, I truly enjoy the people that work at San Carlos. The front desk staff were very helpful and paid special attention to each guest. The captain was very accommodating to our requests. The house keeping staff were very friendly. We truly felt welcomed at the hotel. On Sunday morning, my 3-year-old didn't want to go home and wanted to stay in NYC. The whole family found this experience beyond our expectations. We are looking forward to going back soon!
user_name:
Eve B
Herndon, Virginia, United States

review_body: Terrific, conscientious service by front desk, doormen, housekeeping staff!Comfortable beds - large room with mini kitchen/eating area. Wonderful price/value ratio!Excellent location for transportation, shopping, dining!

We decided to stay at the San Carlos after reading mostly favorable reviews on TripAdvisor. We had a 12th floor executive suite facing 50th avenue, from 13 to 19 September.Hotel location is OK, many restaurants at walking distance, 2 blocks away from subway station, lots of groceries stores nearby, friendly reception staff. Housekeeping is efficient. Free internet access, I could use two devices simultaneously under the same login. No room service.The suite is large is disposes of kitchenette with microwave and fridge, although a toaster would have come in handy. It is quite comfortable for two people, with plenty of drawers and storing space, sofa and a small dining table with two chairs. Beware of the touch-sensitive mini-bar, unless you really want to pick up something. There are 2 large flat screen TV sets, but the program grid is limited to US channels: no French, German or Italian channel, which could add an international flair to the property. The bathroom has magnifying mirror, towels of good standard, satisfactory but not high-end toiletries. Bed is comfortable, there is a good choice of pillows, but sleep quality was greatly disturbed by persistent air-borne noise. The windows are definitely not soundproof (the site call them "double-glazed"), and every kind of street noise seemed to pour into the room, from shouts and whistles late at night, to police and fire sirens all night long and delivery trucks early in the morning.Breakfast was better than I had expected from previous reviews. It is the usual continental type, and one would not pay less than 13 euros for it in a Parisian hotel; we would complement it upstairs with some fresh fruit bought the evening before. The breakfast room is really cramped, although that is a minor problem if you are on vacation and can manage your time schedule avoiding breakfast at peak times.The San Carlos is a nice and affordable hotel in NY, adequate for a short stay and particularly suited for families with children.
user_name:
Gabriel C
Rio de Janeiro, Brazil
