review_body: Had a lovely stay at the San Carlos hotel in NYC from sept. 11th-17th. I stayedwith my mum and my sister and we were catered to in the best way by tentative employees of the hotel. The doormen both were true sweethearts, giving us plenty of attention when we came and left, as well as good tips for dinners etc. The rooms are a bit dated, but they are big and comfortable. We thought we had ordered a 2 bedroom suite, but that was expedia's mistake, and not the hotel. When they found out the misunderstanding, they did everything in their power to assist us, to make our stay comfortable in a one bedroom suite!The breakfast was, as noted by several others, very limited, but it was fresh juice and good coffee, and some bread and cakes to make it through the morning. Should have had some alternative spreading for the lactose intolerant...All in all, the staff at the hotel made our stay that much better. I'm sure our stay would have been great somewhere else as well, but I'm sure it would not have been as personal. When we left they told us not to leave as they had enjoyed our stay sooo much. It may be something that they say to all their guests, but it did make us feel appreciated!

Really enjoyed staying in this hotel. We were recommended it by friends who stayed here last year and we were not disappointed. The Location is relatively quiet and well placed with the subway nearby and central park, Rockefeller centre, times square and Grand Central all within walking distance. We stayed on the 11th floor and had a suite with a Queen Bed and a sofa bed for the kids. The room was certainly big enough for us and had a kitchenette which we used for making the kids snacks. We enjoyed the breakfast which was nice and simple (some cereal, juice, fruit, toast , bagels and some pastries). I could not drink the coffee ( not unusual) but did like the hot chocolate machine.The service we got from the staff at the hotel was excellent and they were very tolerant and good with the kids. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Pleasant experience from the time I checked in until check out. I stayed 2 nights and was there for business. It was during fashion week, so the hotel was full ( I only know this because some of my colleagues were trying unsuccessfully to stay there). It did not feel like there were a lot of people staying there so it is very quiet. The location is great, near the subway and getting cabs were no problem either.I actually had a suite (I guess they upgraded me) and it was very roomy. Maybe all of the room are suites. Needless to say, I was not expecting a large room in a New York “boutique” hotel so I was pleasantly surprised. The bed was comfortable the staff very pleasant and the bathrooms clean, well appointed and roomy. They also offer complimentary breakfast and free WiFi.

This is my 3rd stay in this hotel and the location is fabulous, very central, safe, with the subway and Grand Central Station around the corner . The size of the rooms is the big plus for me, a rarity in New York!The staff are very friendly and attentive.My only negative comment is in relation to breakfast. I was very disappointed and it wasn't like this the last time I stayed at the hotel. Plastic disposable cutlery and plates are not what I expected for a self-described 'boutique hotel'. Plastic picnicware is not something I have ever seen at hotels (maybe hostels?). It's also environmentally very unfriendly! Bins full of plastic plates, cups, knives and forks. Unfortunately it was a deal breaker for me. I understand the owner may be trying to cut costs but it's very offputtingTip: we had a very comfortable room but extremely dark. Never saw any daylight, it was facing another buiding which blocks the light all day. You amy want to ask for a bright roomThe Affinia 50, across the road, is almost identical and the breakfast room much nicer (with proper cutlery and crockery). I've stayed there before too and will return due to better breakfast facilities

We were back again to stay at the San Carlos. It had been a few years since our last stay and apparently it had become more popular since then because of all the good reviews. I guess it is a hidden gem no more! My grown daughters say that they will stay no where else when they are in New York City. Once again, the San Carlos did not disappoint.When we arrived, Gabriel (I think-no name tags) at the desk immediately greeted us with humor. Since it was my husband with me and our two daughters, he referred to my husband as "Charlie" the entire time and we were the "angels". We had booked a standard two queen bed room but Gabriel said that we were in a king room suite with a small kitchen at the same rate. I asked about the bed situation and he said that if my daughters were unhappy with the sofabed that we could switch. He assured them that the matresses were new and comfortable. Our suite was very spacious and we loved the kitchen area. We seemed to be facing out to a street but it was very quiet in our room. Besides the kitchen space, we had a little table and chairs area, two closets, a desk, two comfortable cushy chairs and a big screen TV plus the king bed! So nice for NYC. And my daughters never had a single complaint about the sofabed. I always especially like the real plants in the room and the roman shades. It seems to give such a homey touch. The bathroom was also spacious with robes, toiletries, plenty of towels and a makeup mirror, etc. We couldn't think of anything they didn't provide. Everyone as usual was very pleasant and friendly, always greeting us when we came and went. My husband was especially pleased with how quick the bellman got our luggage up to our room-even before we left the front desk. He had to track him down to give him his tip. We saw the umbrellas lined up as usual on a rainy day but we had our own. Everyone always provided help with our questions when asked. My husband enjoys the fact that he can set up transportation to and from the airport through the San Carlos before our trip. I love the scale in the lobby to weigh your suitcases before your flight-which they do for you if you want! I travel a lot and don't see a scale very often in a hotel lobby. A nice touch since I always want to know what mine weigh before I get to the airport.We love the San Carlos for its amenities and spaciousness but also for its location to 5th Ave. (a few blocks walk straight up) and the subway lines (right on the corner). We also found a great Mexican restaurant on the next block behind the hotel. Yes, the breakfast is a little lacking in variety but that doesn't bother us because we are getting FREE breakfast in NYC!!When we left, Gabriel joked with us once more and gave us free pens to take. We noticed a small boy coming in after us and he immediately started to show him a magic trick. We had to laugh! The San Carlos always makes us feel welcome and like we are part of the family returning for a visit. Until next time- we can't wait!!

I stumbled upon this hotel while searching for a place where more than four people could stay. I was traveling with four older teenagers so space was important. What a gold mine I found. Very roomy rooms, very clean. I cannot say enough great things about the staff. It was so nice to be out and about all day and come back to smiling, welcoming faces. Yes it is their job to care, but they sincerely did. The hotel is in a wonderful quiet neighborhood and easy to walk everywhere. All of us agree that we will always stay at the San Carlos anytime we are in NYC>

If you have reservations at the San Carlos Hotel in NYC, you are about to be VERY pleased!! From the flawless check in, to the tastefully appointed rooms, to the turn down service, to the entire staff (my wife and I were met in the lobby by THE OWNER!, believe it or not), to the whatever...staying at the San Carlos Hotel on E. 50th Street became a treat for us! Total sleep and wonderful rest await you when the lights go out. We loved staying at the San Carlos Hotel. If you find the continental breakfast is a little iffy, (as we did), right across the street is the New York Luncheonette, where they do it right & for the right price. Look at the pictures on the walls! Just about everyone who is anyone has eaten there! So, it's the San Carlos Hotel for everything (but maybe breakfast) next time you're in NYC. You won't be disappointed.

I spent hours researching NYC hotels with suites. We have an 11 and 13 year old and needed two beds plus a sofa bed. We also wanted to be midtown and were hoping for free Wifi. The San Carlos delivered!The location is central to everything; Times Sqaure, Rockefeller Center, Central Park. We arrived early and check in was a breeze. The room is huge and has a mini kitchenette too. Super clean and comfortable. Parking is self park right next door with a discounted rate of $30 per night-even with our SUV! The gym is small but did the trick and there is a Starbucks less then a 5 minute walk away! The free continental breakfast is simple but did the trick. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We had brunch at Madison Restaurant after we arrived-a huge diner that was delicious and the wait staff very nice. We got cupcakes at Buttercup Bakery on the way back to the hotel. We saw Cirque du Soleil our first night and ordered a pizza and salad from Albitino's which is a 5 minute walk. Our last night there we ate at Chop A Steakhouse (a 10 minute walk) and took advantage of their Restaurant Week menu. A fabulous experience.During check out the manager did a magic trick for my daughter! I have stayed at the Affinia chain and much prefer this hotel for traveling with teens/tweens. There is no restaurant or bar so if you're looking for the trendy/nightlife scene this is not for you. My husband and I have stayed at the W right around the corner and I would go there if you are looking for that vibe. But if you're looking for a spacious, clean, nice hotel that welcomes families, has cheap parking, free Wifi and free breakfast, you cannot beat the San Carlos!

The San Carlos is a a nice average midtown hotel. It was quite clean and had good space, a nice sized closet, including a nook with a fridge for my own groceries as well as a mini bar. The bed was comfortable. A clock radio that will charge your iphone with plenty of plugs to recharge your electronics. I liked my room quite a bit. The front desk staff was kind and very helpful. They allowed me to check in early, and store my luggage on the day of departure. The doormen did a wonderful job helping with taxis and offering advice. However, they can not overcome everything.I had 2 significant problems during my stay. One was the noise in the hotel. Two was the lack of any civilized dining, as well as no room service at all.The doors in the hotel slam. So between rowdy guests coming and going at all hours and the morning housekeeping staff hollering down the halls, sleeping at 10 pm or 8 am was just not possible. The walls are thin and I could hear the televisions of neighboring rooms. Believe me, I am accustomed to NYC noise and not much gets to me. The noise at the San Carlos was just overwhelming, not just annoying. I was there 5 nights, and guests cam and went, but the noise level did not change. Such a disappointment.However, the thing I hated more was the breakfast service in a cramped dark hot room. Breakfast, which was limited to bad bagels, toast, a couple of varieties of cereal and coffee was a chaotic mess. Tiny paper plates, cheap plastic knives that break, and tiny coffee cups that are too hot to carry was a horrible way to begin my day. Everything was disposable and unpleasant. Honestly, the airlines do better. I stayed there five days and not one morning could I easily grab a cup of coffee and take a seat. Just a mess. Don't even think about requesting a coffee service to be delivered to your room either. Other midtown hotels have self serve breakfast, and it works. The key is space, good variety, and enough staff to keep the place clean, well stocked, and to provide assistance. Actual glassware, plates, and utensils would be nice. This just is the worst.The San Carlos has the potential to be a good hotel. I wish I wanted to return. I wanted to like it very much. I just can not go back unless they care to provide a vastly better stay.

Our family stayed at the San Carlos for 7 days and found this hotel to be top notch in every way. The customer service from the bellman to the front desk to the maintenance and cleaning staff were all incredible! The rooms are spacious and very clean. Our rooms had refrigerators and microwaves and a small kitchen set up. Awesome Wolfgang Puck coffee too. Beds are extremely comfortable. Large screen TV in the bedroom and family room. The location was fabulous for walking to lots of the city sights. We felt very comfortable walking day and night and the staff greeted us with smiles whether it was 7am or 11pm. We were out shopping one day and were racing down the streets to get to the next store when a tall Irish man across the way was waving and smiling. It was the bellman on his day off, out and about, and in the crazy hustle and bustle of NY street walkers, he recognized us, waved to get our attention and sent a big smile asking if we were enjoying the city. Truly a gem! Recommendations: Move one phone into the sitting area instead of having two phones in the bedroom. Perk up the breakfast selections. We can honestly say that this hotel is top notch on customer service and the rooms are great too. Highly recommend the San Carlos!

Stayed at the San Carlos for 3 nights in a one bedroom suite this July. I chose this hotel after countless hours of Internet searches of NYC hotels and I have to say I am extremely happy that I did! The room that we had was clean and spacious with 1 1/2 baths plus a small kitchenette area. The hotel staff is helpful and friendly. Location is great for midtown. We were able to walk to Times Square, Central Park & Radio City! Plus, breakfast is included with your stay! My only problem was that I had to leave so soon!!!

Our original hotel was over booked and they offered us the San Carlos as a replacement. Did we luck out! Great location - close to all the action but not as busy/loud at night. The room was large and clean. The staff was very helpful and courteous. Free breakfast was another benefit our original hotel did not include - a nice benefit and money saver. I quite enjoyed the coffee - me being a coffee snob this speaks volumes. Go ahead and book this hotel it won't disappoint!

After consulting tripadvisor and a couple of other websites, we selected the San Carlos Hotel for a recent visit to the city. Traveling with seventeen and nineteen year old boys, both over 6 feet tall, we needed all the space we could find. The San Carlos did not disappoint! We were in a spacious two room suite for a fabulous price. The hotel is within walking distance of Times Square, Central Park, Rockefeller Center and just one block from the nearest subway station. We could not have been more pleased. The service and accommodations were top notch. We will be back soon!

The staff were excellent. The location couldn't have been better. We received excellent recommendations on restaurants, etc from the desk staff. Suites are very spacious and very clean. I would definitely stay here again when in NYC.

We stayed in the executive suite in San Carlos in June 2012 with our two kids. The location is very convenient to visit most well known spots of Manhattan. The room was big enough to accomodate four of us while kids slept in the sofa bed. The room was clean and we were satisfied by the housekeeping. The continental breakfast (very basic though) and the wi-fi in the room is included in the price. The reception staff was also very helpful. I think considering all above, the price-quailty balance of this hotel is excellent. I fully recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay in Manhattan.

For those less familiar with Manhattan, the lodging options are overwhelming. With so many choices, it should be easy to find a myriad of properties that suit any number of requirements. But for me, it was a struggle to find the perfect location, level of amenities, and acceptable price point for a recent 4-day trip w/ my hubby. I ruled out the overpriced hipster boutiques, the stuffy landmarks, the dinosaur properties, the tourist-laden chains, and the too-good-to-be true rates in less desirable parts of town. After that, I wasn't left with nearly as many options as you'd think.Then I found the listing for the San Carlos. I loved that they're one of the very last independently owned hotels in NYC, catered to a European clientele (which usually means non-fussy rooms, immaculately clean spaces, and competent staff), and the Manhattan East location; the area was convenient to RCMH where we were seeing 2 nights of concerts. The fact the rooms looked large vs the price and came w/ mini fridges and microwaves (somewhat unusual for Manhattan) sealed the deal. But looking good on paper doesn't mean in reality it will pan out.I'd made my reservation months in advance, over the phone, for a certain room type that the young lady I spoke to had 100% guaranteed. When I called week-of to confirm my reservation, I was told there was a possibility I might not be able to get the room type I'd been promised. Irked, I referenced the original reservation but they explained sometimes these things happen. True, but I hung up the phone and considered rebooking elsewhere; the phone rang back moments later and the young lady I originally spoke to apologized, said they would upgrade me at no fee and get me what I needed no matter what, and really acted as if she valued my business. I'd expect this from a 5 star property, but at a under $300 a night spot, it was refreshing. Customer service is a dying art. The staff at the San Carlos is old school, in the best possible, most refreshing way. Upon arrival, an easy cab ride from Penn Station, the lobby was sparkling, the bellman exceptional, and the check-in flawless. It's not the fanciest place, more suited for the upscale business traveler (though I spied many families too) but the cleanliness, a huge factor for me, absolutely perfect. And my room, a King, was HUGE. Not huge just by NYC standards, huge by any hotel standard. The view from our particular room wasn't much to see, but windows that actually open in both the room and bathroom were a bonus. The amenities were lovely, towels and robe divinely soft, the bed linens super comfy, and a pant press a blast from the past. The room was modern, simple, understated, private, quiet, and cozy. Everything worked too. Which should go without saying but unfortunately is often not the case in any class of hotel. The real silverware, plates, and glasses provided were a great compliment to the microwave and fridge. Did I mention that housekeeping is outstanding? In my years of travel, I've never seen more competent housecleaning. My interaction with the staff was easy peasy. Items I needed were sent up immediately, dinner spots/phone numbers provided, and I was always greeted with a smile. I dreaded check out because it meant our experience was over. I literally had zero complaints during my entire stay except that the Indian restaurant next door (that serves as the San Carlos' complimentary breakfast serving area and then offers their own menu for limited room service too), is simply not up to par with the rest of the hotel.  If 24 hour American cuisine room service is a make it or break it deal for you, that's about the only reason I'd consider finding a different hotel. Seeing as Manhattan has every food conceivable, most of it deliverable, I easily overlook this.Quiet rooms, pleasant interiors/halls, a great business center/overflow lobby, elevators that were kept constantly cleaned (check the Ritz for smudges, lol), and staff that valued my business means that next I'm in NYC I'm making a beeline right back here. Sure, there's more glamorous or hip spots, but for the level of service vs price and comfort, there's a reason this is a hidden gem amongst your hundreds of NYC hotels. Part of me doesn't want the secret to get out.

I stood at the San Carlos for two nights after it being highly recommended by my colleagues. I arrived to a peaceful lobby and greeted by the doorman Bobby who seemed a little too anxious and was in a way breathing down my neck. But after checking in I found my room to be quite comfortable and the bed AMAZING. The view decent but you couldnt expect much from the towering buildings around the venue. Amazing restaurants were just blocks away, clothing stores were also conveniently close. From the friendly front desk agent of Asian decent to the attentive Doorman Steven who chased down taxi's for 25 minutes so I could make it to the theater in time. My only criticism, the bread from the complimentary continental breakfast lacked taste and moisture. But overall, from an individual that vacations a lot I would say this hotel is at the top of the list. I will definitely see you soon San Carlos!

Just spent five nights at this hotel. We booked a one bedroom suite for myself, husband and two grown up kids. When we arrived we were upgraded to a two bed suite. We cannot fault this hotel, rooms are large by city standards. We had kitchen area with microwave and fridge and coffee making facilities. Breakfast is ok usual fare but fresh and just what you need to start your day. Location is great short walk to Rockefeller Centre, close to subway which will get you uptown or downtown. Free fast wifi and use of computers if you need them. Highly recommended.

The San Carlos staff made myself and teenage daughter feel very at home. We were checked in early and given a room upgrade to celebrate my daughter's sweet sixteen. The suite was very large with a kitchen area and gorgeous outside patio. The rooms are well appointed with a bedroom and sitting area with basic kitchen equipment for breakfast and snacks. The hotel was very quiet ( unusual in NYC) and very clean. Access to the subway is a block away and shopping is an easy walk to Madison Ave..We really enjoyed the quiet oasis away from the heat and bustle of midtown. I highly recommend this hotel for couples or business.

I picked this hotel for several reasons. Close to subway, free wifi & breakfast and most importantly... 2 Queen beds AND a sofa bed. I come from the tall family. My husband and & I cannot fit in a double/full size bed and then our boy and girl teenagers wont share. Hence the need for essentially 3 beds. The San Carlos had the above with the most reasonable price. Everything was clean and up to date. Doormen were SUPER helpful. They even let us check out late when our plane was delayed.My only complaint was that the breakfast was just okay- mostly bread items. But I still gave it 5 stars. This is perfect for families otherwise.

We just stayed at the San Carlos for 4 nights last week. This hotel is perfectly situated, in mid-town just a short walk to Lex/53rd subway, Rockefeller Center, Central Park. We stayed in a one-bedroom suite, which includes 2 queen beds, plus a fold-out couch in the adjoining sitting area. The space was perfect for our family of 2 adults and 3 kids. Each morning we were able to go down to the lobby for an included continental breakfast. While the breakfast was nothing fancy, it did include pastries, toast, cereal, as well as yogurt and cottage cheese to go with the coffee, tea, hot chocolate and assorted juice. It was definitely sufficient to get us through to an early lunch.The only draw-back was that the windows are pretty thin, and since our room was overlooking the street, we were able to hear all of the traffic outside. But we just chalked that up to being in a busy city and it did not bother us too much.We'll definitely stay at the San Carlos for any future visits to New York City!

San Carlos did not disappoint! We chose this hotel for our 4 day getaway to NYC based on the reviews and ratings from tripadvisor. First time to New York. Location was perfect for us -- 20 minute walk to Central Park or Time Square. Just a few blocks from Rockafeller Center (try Top of the Rock - spectacular views!!). LOTS of shopping nearby. Very safe neighborhood, felt comfortable going out late. Staff was wonderful at every level. Clean and quiet. Free WiFi. We had one bedroom suite with 2 queen beds plus sofabed, Bedroom was very spacious, lots of pillows, desk and chair and separate A/C controls. Sofabed was fairly comfortable and big enough for my 17 year old son. Tons of storage space incl. 2 closets. Refrig was nice size. Small sitting area with table and two chairs was a plus for eating takeout. Living room was great size with huge TV. Bathroom on small side but not a big deal for us. Breakfast was enough to start the day. Never had to wait for elevator. Parking right next door - get ticket voucher from front desk for $30/day. A 24 hour McDonalds is across the street and a drugstore is only 2 blocks for convenience food/drinks. Had a slight problem with TV the first night - they sent someone within 5 minutes and took care of it. Will absolutely stay here again and again...loved it!
user_name:
Linda D
Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, United States

review_body: Stayed 3 nights this past weekend. Great Hotel...spacious room. Short walk to Lex and 53rd subway with many connections. Short walk to famous PJ Clarkes grill as well. Very attentive and friendly staff. The Doorman was exceptional with his great tips on restaurants. After very hot days spend in the subway and all over Manhattan, it was a pleasure to find the room ice cold to relax and rest before dinner. Will come back for sure.

We had a 2 roomed suite for 3 people. I was surprised by how spacious it was. We had a bathroom with a tub and a shower over it, a small kitchen with a microwave, coffe maker, fridge etc and a sitting area. Big tv in both rooms and plenty storage space. The free wifi worked well. I asked for a high room at the back and we didn't have any traffic noise. Beds were extremely comfortable. Housekeeping was very good and the reception staff were friendly. They lent us umbrellas when we had a wet day. The lifts were fast and we never had to wait. The free breakfast was fine but was very carb-heavy. Coffee, juice, yogurt, cereal, pastries, bread etc. No fruit, so I wouldn't have wanted to eat there for more than a few days. Having said that the quality was very good.

This hotel location worked for us. Walk north to the park and shopping, south to more shopping, close to museums, shows, library, and plenty of restaurants. The staff was courteous,hotel was clean, there is a business center, no need for anything more. This is on our list of favorites hotels in NYC.

This hotel is a very good choice for anyone visiting New York. The staff are very nice and friendly, facilities are clean,and the rooms are a nice size. The only downside is that the continental breakfast dosn't have a good variety of food. The hotel is conveniently located to most venues.
The room was very nice and clean. No view and windows could not open. Breakfast was nothing special and just standard.

For my first trip to NYC I couldn't have picked a better place to stay. The location was perfect. The hotel was clean and quiet. The beds were divine after some busy days. The staff were great especially Steven who was particularly helpful and attentive. This is now my go to hotel for New York and won't hesitate to recommend it to friends.

I recently stayed at the San Carlos Hotel for the first time. I made my selection based on desired location and Trip Advisor reviews (my usual "go-to" hotel in NYC was already booked for the weekend I wished to travel). I couldn't have been more pleased. The staff were friendly and very helpful. The room (two double beds) was large, nicely appointed and very clean. There was a roomy desk with comfortable chair and wi-fi was available free of charge. In addition to the two beds and desk, there was a comfortable upholstered chair with ottoman. A small alcove contained a refrigerator, microwave and coffeepot. The bathroom was roomy and modern. The elevators was very efficient with very little waiting time no matter the time of day. The continental breakfast was complimentary and was served just off the main lobby from 7-10 AM daily. Yogurt, sweet rolls, bagels, toast and cereal as well as coffee, tea and orange juice were available. By NYC standards, the room rates were very reasonable. I think I have found a new "go-to" hotel for my visits to NYC!

Over the last 6 years we have stayed at the San Carlos Hotel at least 4 times. In between we tried a few different hotels which were good but ended up returning to the San Carlos because, as a whole, nothing can beat it. All personnel treat you like royalty and the rooms are beyond clean (I am a germaphobe) and updated. The continental breakfast suffices if you're not a big hot breakfast person (they have yogurts, danishes, cold cereals, apples, cottage cheese and hot drinks as well as juice).The rooms are quite large and well laid out and you can't beat the location with an easy walk to TImes Square and Central Park.We decided to stop trying out other hotels - this will be our destination for our yearly trip to NYC.I accidently rated the spa and pool, both of which I don't know if they have.

Stayed two nights in a very spacious well equipped room in this small hotel right around the corner from the Waldorf Astoria. My room had a kitchen, couch, and comfortable bed. Bathroom was small but functional. Breakfast was included but I didn't try it - looked like the usual continental buffet. My only hesitation in recommending this hotel is a very limited room service menu that comes from the Indian restaurant next door. The food was pedestrian and the delivery person hit me up for a tip in cash- a rather odd exchange. No silverware came with the meal - the idea was to use the silver from the kitchen but then plates and silver stayed until the next morning. Otherwise, my stay was good and I would go back. It is away from the hustle and bustle but very well located.

We just returned from our 5th or 6th stay at the San Carlos Hotel and it was wonderful again. Rooms are spacious and clean and the location is great. The staff are very attentive and you see the same smiling faces as the last visit who seem genuinely happy to see their guests return. You always feel safe and well cared for at this hotel. Don't understand the other Trip Advisor reviews which say the complimentary breakfast leaves anything to be desired-the selection is vast, fresh and presented beautifully. There are plenty of great options and this benefit allows you to start your day early and not have to spend any money. We will be back here again and again and again...

This was an adequate stay for a reasonable price.The hotel is well situated on E 50th; across the street are both the Benjamin and Affinia 50, so others might want to try them for comparison.There's nothing special about the property. The reception lounge is relatively small yet efficient. The executive room I took was ok, decent space, comfortable sofa and chairs, workable kitchen facilities - but not of a quality of a place like the Alex. Bathroom was small yet functional - ok water pressure and Aveda giveaways. Bed quality was fine.Two gripes were the towels and the continental breakfast. The towels were so worn and thin that I thought their sandpaper-like quality might exfoliate my entire body without ever really drying it. Really, it was like a bad summer camp experience. And the continental breakfast was bland, cheap in quality and tasteless. The hotel management must have someone specifically picking up months supplies of huge quantities of nourishment at BJs or Walmart.So, if you want that location (50th and 3rd) for a decent night's sleep, grab a discounted rate and avoid the breakfast. It's a decent enough place for a night or two (p.s. go get a breakfast bagel at Ess-A-Bagel and coffee across the street and don't even try to justify the embedded continental breakfast cost).

I just finished my fifth stay at this best kept secret in Manhattan on April 17-20 and the best thing about this hotel is the friendliness of is staff fom the concierge to the bellman (Bobby) to the check-in staff. They are all amazingly kind and well-informed. The rooms are very spacious with modern furnishings. The beds are ver comfortable. The heat and A/C work very well. The television reception on some of the stations in my room (#1009) could have been better bu this small factor is not severe enough to lower my rating of the hotel. It is in every possible way five star. The continental breakfast provided every morning with the cost of your room is fine. Best of all the location is excellent for every type of sightseeing you could want to do in Manhattan.
Overall a great place to stay, away from the crowd especially at Times Square. Highly recommended for families traveling with children. The only thing lacking is a self service laundry facility.

The first time I stayed at San Carlos Hotel I was 7 years old, in December 1971, almost 41 years ago. Since then I've stayed there for many times. After a complete renovation, it reopened still better, that's why every time I am in NY, my choice is the San Carlos Hotel, a lovely place, with nice and confortable rooms, warm staff and perfect location.

We just spent a few days in New York staying at the San Carlos. From the moment of arrival you could tell this was something different, something out of the ordinary.The receptionist greeted us warmly, took time to ask about our trip and explain the facilities of the hotel. Now this could have been a one off, an employee on a good day, however we found all the staff to be uniformly friendly, informative and very helpful.We had booked a one room suite and were pleased with the size of the room and its practicality. It comes with a microwave, mini fridge and a well proportioned living room. The room also had a good safe, free wifi and two large TV's. The hotel also provides a 'computer suite' on the second floor for guests consisting of 6 PC's and 2 Printers.The hotel is in an excellent location for exploring the city with 2 subway stops within a couple of blacks, plenty of good restaurants in the area and it is within walking distance of Rockefeller and Central Parks.Would definitely stay here on the next visit to New York.

After spending a night in another "big hotel", left there, came here. The staff was wonderful and most accomodating to our needs. I've stayed here 4 times now, and will never stay anywhere else. The front desk staff is phenominal to my wife and I. The place is roomy, quiet, and has all those amenities that make a great hotel. Do yourself a favor, stay here and enjoy NYC.

I have stayed here several times and each time am very pleased to be here. The multi-lingual, efficient and friendly staff is equally comfortable with English and non-English speakers and the number of non-American guests attests to this. Most of the rooms are good size with refrigerators and microwaves and coffee service. Very clean. Decor is subdued - nice calm after being in NYC. Continental breakfast is tasty with good pastries. Be sure to ask for the NY Times. Convenient for mid-town, close to several subways. Easy to get to Broadway.
user_name:
Mary W
Fort Myers Beach, Florida

review_body: I am much more of a "W" Hotel type of gal. But it's hard to justify W prices and comparatively tiny rooms when you can stay just around the corner in a 2-room suite with a kitchenette (we paid $269/nt with our corporate rate in late Feb). Hubby was able to go into the other room and watch TV/recline on the sofa when he woke up at 5AM; I was able to sleep in the bedroom undisturbed. Great to have a fridge to store our bottle of wine. Great to have real wine glasses & corkscrew. Nice to have plates to use for any food we brought back. Nice to have a place to put all of that (countertop, sink, small dining table and two chairs). Bathroom is well appointed (Aveda products), with vanity plenty large for two adults to spread out. Reception staff are charming and helpful. Free breakfast offered each morning off the lobby featuring breads, pastries, cereals, yogurts, cottage cheese w/juice, coffee. Fine if you have kids that need filling with carbs. For a real breakfast or a business breakfast, go to the National (Lex and 50th) or for real NY bagels go to Ess-A Bagels on Third (betw 50 & 51). We even met the OWNER as we were checking out. Where else in NYC do you meet the actual owner of the hotel where you are staying???

Great location in Midtown for sightseeing and getting around via bus or subway. Room size is amazing for New York hotels. Continental breakfast is a great time saver and a tremendous value. The entire staff was amazing! Shhhhhh! (this hotel is a best kept secret)! We'll be back.

I stayed at the San Carlos Hotel on business last spring and was pleasantly surprised. I chose the hotel based on price, location (proximity to by business meeting) and reviews. I found that the hotel, while not the cheapest, was a great value for the money. The room was a decent size and nice condition. Plenty of restaurants within walking distance and short cab/subway ride to a bunch more.No problem recommending this hotel to anyone else looking for a place to stay in this part of the city.

We spent two nights at the lovely San Carlos Hotel, on East 50th Street in NY. The room was luxurious and quiet, and the staff was great. The hotel has a very gracious feeling and is unlike many of the other NY hotels that have a commercial atmosphere. The room rate was inexpensive for New York, because we were there just after the holidays (end of the first week in January). There is a breakfast room just off the lobby, where a complimentary breakfast of pastries, cereals, and yogurt is available, and it is completely kosher for those guests who require it. I recommend this hotel highly and plan to stay there again.

This is an awesome hotel. It is across from the Kimberly Hotel which I also hear is good. But I will never know, because I have no reason to look anywhere else. Everything was excellent from the manager, bell captain to housekeeping. We had reserved the hotel's car to the airport and were a few minutes late getting back to the hotel. They were very gracious and said that they would hold it for us.The rooms were very clean and spacious. the microwave and minifridge was a plus. We had 2 queen beds, a fold out couch and a small table with 2 chairs to have coffee and pastries. The continental breakfast was excellent and much appreciated. If you have tried to grab a meal for some change in NYC, you know that it is very expensive.We had 4 girls and bathroom time is always a challenge with that many women. But we were able to make it work as there was a mirror on the outside of the bathroom door and a large mirror over a table/desk in the living area. We had no problems.A friend sent us a gift basket arranged by the hotel and it was lovely. They did a great job including the I Love NY bear. The snacks were very tasty.You would be hard pressed to find a larger better hotel room for the price. I think we paid $350/nt. I would highly recommend this location and hotel. We will be back.

Location. Lex & 3rd Ave, we could WALK everywhere. Metro 1/2 block to Green 4-5-6- line; 2 blocks to blue E-line; 3 blocks to 5th Avenue and Rockefeller centre; 5 blocks to Plaza.Service. The people are extremely helpful and friendly. Nothing is a problem. Toaster. Kettle. Towels within 5 minutes of request.Spacious. The living room is HUGE. Wide. Spacious. We had 5 people and everyone could find space. Table and kitchenette (well equipped).Value. Well priced. Clean and comfortable. Excellent Service. Suites simple and functional. Housekeeping EXCELLENT, accoomodating for late sleep in and very efficient.There is a good selection of convenience stores and restuarants on Lex and Second Avenue. We really appreciated the spacious room, location and customer service. Highly Recommend, would stay again.

close to 5th avenue, and a lot of subway opportunities, you reach everything smoothly.we had suits which were large and convenient. also had a kitchen if you want to eat in. If you pay before the travel, you can have discount, and it is a good deal. I'm not sure about the regular rooms.breakfast is only bagels and cereals but very good in a busy morning. breakfast room is very small and can be crowded if you don't come early.

We stayed in the San Carlos from Dec 25, 2011 - Jan 1, 2012. We stayed in a 1 bdrm suite which was large by any standards, and extra large by NYC standards. It has a small kitchenette with microwave, frig, sink and storage but no stove. 1 bathroom which was average. Hotel was clean, modern and updated. We have a child in a large wheelchair, and the room was not gigantic but large enough to accomodate the wheelchair and his other items. My other son said the pullout sofabed was comfortable. 2 big flat screen tv's in each room. There is a computer center with internet on the 2nd floor with like 6 computers and a printer. If you have a computer, you can get free wifi throughout the hotel. We have stayed in 3 hotels on E 50 St. The other 2 were The Benjamin and The Kimberly. For the price, quality/size of room and wonderful staff, it is by far the best hotel in the area. The breakfast was perfect since we are not big breakfast eaters. It includes juice, milk, coffee, danishes, muffins, breads, etc. Nothing hot other than coffee. It has a small gym which I used twice. It has 2 treadmills, an elliptical machine, stationary bike, and free weights. Perfect for a decent workout. I ran to and through Central Park. The hotel in centrally located. 2 blocks from a subway station with an elevator which is an issue for us since we travel with a wheelchair. 4 blocks east of Rockerfeller Center and about 8 blocks from Times Square. Blocks in NYC are short so most things are within walking distance if you're a walker, and you can always find a subway near by if you're not. The night staff was wonderful in making restaurant recommendations. The gentlemen made suggestions and each one was better than the next. Chin Chin was probably one of the best Chinese restaurants I've eaten at. The staff was welcoming, courteous and helpful. Evelyn made great New Years' Eve recommendations for a restaurant right off Broadway in Times Square. If you are a young couple looking for a party scene, you may want something trendier. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in NYC especially with children.

Good sized rooms, great location, and helpful staff. Good little breakfast to get you on your way, saves stopping off at other eateries and instead making the most of this amazing place! We went in December and the Christmas themes throughout hotel very tasteful. Already looking to return this year! Special thanks to Matthew the doorman!

Our family of 5 (children aged 12, 10 and 7 yrs) stayed in a suite on the 15th floor for 7 nights over the New Year season. Our suite had 2 Queen beds in the bedroom and a comfortable sofa bed in the living room. We were impressed by the comfortable beds, big size of rooms, kitchenette with microwave and fridge, simple but adequate breakfast facilities, good bathroom size, fantastic shower and high standard of housekeeping. The room was quiet and being on the 15th floor we had plenty of natural light. The lifts were fast and staff were accommodating with allowing us to have a late checkout, and doorman organized a car for us to JFK for $69 + tip which was cheaper than 2 taxis. Highly recommended for families.

The last time my family stayed in a hotel (a Marriott in DC), my husband vowed never to stay in a hotel again. It was that negative of an experience. The San Carlos changed his mind. I booked a 4-day stay right before Christmas based on the Tripadvisor reviews after looking for a suitable hotel and location for months. We're so glad we did. The parking next door was so convenient and reasonably priced, the hotel staff was wonderful, check-in and -out was a breeze, the room was spacious (though it was a suite), and the beds were so incredibly comfortable - even the sofa bed. Great to have a kitchenette in the room, as it saved money not having to eat out every meal. The breakfast was nothing to write home about but I didn't book a room because of the breakfast, it was just an added perk. My only complaint was that most days we could not find anyone working the breakfast and the one day we did, she could not speak fluent English so she had trouble understanding what I was asking for. It was only a concern for my family because my son has food allergies, and I wanted to check ingredients on several items. He was forced to eat only the packaged items, but that is not the first time this has happened while traveling and we bring foods with us for situations like this. We would gladly stay here again when we return to NYC.

I can only add to the positive comments about the rooms, location, and service that I won't bother repeating. Very reasonably priced. As others have said, try and get a room higher up.The included breakfast is poor. I recommend giving it a miss if you're not on an extremely tight budget. I highly recommend treating yourself to breakfast at the National just across the street (cnr 50th and Lexington); more expensive than a diner but worth it for the food and the experience.

I have been staying at the San Carlos Hotel probably for nearly a decade every time I am in NYC. I make 6-8 trips a year for either business or pleasure and my stays have ranged from a week to just a few nights. I was there the week before Christmas this time along with several business associates. Everything about this place is first class. The rooms are spacious as well as extremely clean and comfortable. The staff is enormously friendly and accommodating, courteous and fun. During what is a very hectic time in the City, the staff continued their excellent service, and the prices were entirely reasonable. The location, in midtown East is ideal, near to metro service and within easy walking distance of lots of excellent restaurants, diners, and attractions.In addition to the warmth of the staff, the San Carlos did a great job this year of getting us all into the holiday spirit with their tasteful and clearly upscale decorations throughout the lobby and waiting areas. Whoever was responsible deserves special kudos. I commend the managment and staff for continuing to provide always such a hospitable place in a sometimes cold city!

San Carlos is a find. Located in a quiet neighborhood convenient to Grand Central and subway. Wonderful diner across the street. The staff is well trained and strives to please. Our suite was roomy and comfortable. Only complaint, the free breakfast pastry dry and would like fresh fruit.

We stayed in one of the suite rooms with 2 Queen beds and a Queen sofa bed in a separate room (4 people - 2 adults and 2 teens). We were surprised by the size of the bedroom and the additional room with the sofa bed. Everything was really nice - the bathrooms, the beds, and the kitchenette. There were nice bathroom fixtures and also a good size countertop space in the bathroom for us to share. We asked for a quiet room and got one - you would have never known you were in New York from the lack of street sounds - our room was completely quiet. We were impressed with the staff - when we asked for extra blankets and towels, they were immediately brought to our room. The staff was also helpful with restaurant suggestions. All in all, we could not have asked for more. This is a great hotel in a great spot in the city - blocks from Rockefeller Center and many other attractions and activities. We loved it and will definitely go back!

My family absolutely enjoyed our stay at San Carlos. Cleanliness was supreme and the one bedroom suite was spacious. The mini kitchenette was fabulous especially traveling with an infant and a child who has food allergies. We will be staying there again next year for our December trip.

My new favorite hotel in New York. Will definitely stay there again. Hotels in New York are outrageously priced during the Christmas season. The San Carlos was a bargain. It is older, but nicely furnished. Similiar to a Marriott. Free breakfast in the morning(fresh pastries and bagels, yogurt), refrigerator in room, free wifi, business center and Aveda products in the bathroom. Beds were nice and comfortable and the room was much larger than ones at the W on Lexington. Nice diner across the street for quick meals; breakfast and afternoon snacks. Right near the Waldorf for drinks and easy subway access. Bellman made limo reservations for us to take us to and from the airport; otherwise 2 cabs were needed. Arranged a car service for us at night. Suites were $100 per night higher and had a full living room and kitchenette. Plenty of places nearby to get a drink. Staff was friendly and helpful. Have stayed at the Omni Berkshire and the Kimberly in the past which have more ambience but cost a lot more. Will stay here in the future for the price. Another reviewer complained about the poor lighting, plumbing rattle, view of wall and inadequate breakfast. Yes the backside faces a wall about 25 feet away but you don't hear the horns blasting away in the morning on 50th. If he paid more, he could have had a room that faced the street. The bathroom is small but adequate and no plumbing rattle. Breakfast is better than Hampton Inn or Courtyard, and it is free in NYC. My lighting was fine, not inadequate. If you want luxury, stay across the street at the Benjamin or the New York Palace. This is a nice hotel, just not a fabulous hotel.

Like many hotels in NYC this one is an updated, but an old one with all the issues that would normally accompany one (poor lighting, plumbing tha rattles, small bathroom, etc). While i had a "courtyard" view (really just a brick wall 10 feet away from the window) there was none of the street noise that bothered others on the other side of the hotel. Finally - the 'free' breakfast leaves a lot to be desired, but at least the coffee is okay.

For my four-year-old's first trip to NYC, we stayed in a suite at The San Carlos, and what a treat! An immaculately clean bathroom (w/ a bath tub/shower--not always the case in NYC) and bedroom, plus a separate sitting room w/ a tiny kitchenette (no stove, but a sink, small fridge, coffee maker, microwave, dishes and utensils)--perfect for traveling w/ a small child. We were on the 17th floor w/ not much of a view and some minor street noise, but never anything disruptive. The staff were always smiling, helpful, and competent. And to top it off, the location cannot be beat--close to every thing we wanted to see and do: Rockefeller Center, the 5th Ave shops, hansom cab rides, tea at The Plaza, etc. If you're looking for 24 hour room service and a grand lobby, this is not the place for you. But if you want a nice, clean, convenient place to relax between outings, this place more than fits the bill. Overall, I'd definitely return to this hotel and heartily recommend it to anyone visiting NYC.

After AIRBNB cancelled our apartment reservation at the last minute (4 days prior to arrival) we contacted the San Carlos, a hotel the company has been using for years. We got an extremely reasonable price for a family suite and kept wondering after that why should we ever bother with the unreliable AIRBNB service ever again...We felt so pampered at the hotel!!The suite was spacious. There's a bedroom with very comfortable bed, TV and closet. The living room has a foldout double sofa, with a very thick and comfortable mattress. Since we are 5 people they brought in another single bed, and the room still felt spacious. The living room area also has a TV, two armchairs, a small dining area with 4 chairs and a real kitchenette with microwave, small but real refrigerator and plenty of dishes. For breakfast, though, we used the hotel dining room downstairs. No cooked food, but still enough to get you started in the morning.The only reservation we have about the room is the fact you can't really open the windows for fresh air (2nd floor) because the cooking fumes and odors you get from the restaurant next door. However, ventilation system is rather efficient.Staff were very helpful and kind. They make you feel very much "at home" and as if each visitor is "a regular". Last but not least: Location! Initially we wanted to go for the village, but we actually found this location to be even better: easy access to all parts of the city and important destinations - central park and the museums, the MOMA is within minutes walk, Times Sq is close enough to walk and yet far enough... 5th avenue shopping area is really close. Warmly recommend it.

My friends and I had a great stay at the San Carlos Hotel. We all stayed together in a 1 bedroom queen suite. The bedroom had two queen beds, and we had a generously sized sitting area that included a sleeper sofa, 2 arm chairs, sink and fridge. The bedroom was also a nice size, and we had 2 closets with ample storage space. The room was clean and comfortable. The Aveda products in the bathroom were nice! We could hear a little bit of street noise, but it is NYC after all. The hotel itself was very quiet--I never heard any noise from other rooms. The front desk staff was very nice and helpful. Be sure to pick up a map! We also loved the bowls of fun size candy bars at the front desk. I'm not sure if that was leftover from Halloween or if they're always there, but my friends and I always made a quick stop to pick up a Hershey bar on the way in or out. One guy at the front desk was particularly helpful by arranging for a limo to take the 6 of us to our dinner destination one evening. We saved a bit on cab fare that evening and enjoyed the ride in the limo! The hotel is very convenient (1 block) to the subway on 51st and Lexington. There is also a great bagel place, Ess-A-Bagel on 3rd at about 49th or so. I will definitely stay at the San Carlos again if I ever have the chance to get back to New York.

This hotel is within walking distance of many attractions in Manhattan: the United Nations, Times Square, MOMA, etc. We had a suite and it was very nice. New York is an expensive city and other, more famous hotels were charging much more for the same thing.We did not eat in the restaurant as there was a good deli across the street and, of course, many restaurants nearby, but they do have a breakfast available. All in all, a good find.

Never having been to New York before, we chose the San Carlos after a lot of research. The location was centrally located, within walking to several sites, the subway and restaurants. We found the room to be spacious and clean. We were on the backside of the hotel so there was no view to speak of but that also meant very little street noise. I used the fitness facility, while small, it was adequate for my needs. Breakfast was included which wad a bonus. Just your typical assortment of yogurt, breads and juices it helped us curb costs and get through until late afternoon. The hotel staff was helpful in securing a cab to the airport and in recommending several nearby spots for casual dining. I would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone wanting a home base from which to plan their trip. It's not going to have the spa, or restaurant, or service of some 5 stars but we also didn't have to pay for that.

very nice hotel, quiet, clean, updated rooms with great A/C. The price is good as well, especially for the location - 50th and Lex. Enjoy!However, you may want to skip the free breakfast - too many other choices in NYC.

I had to be in New York on late notice and was priced out of my favorite hotel, the New York Palace. I was able to secure a small suite at the San Carlos for about the same price I would pay for a room at the Palace (a bit more than $400/nt). While the service and amenities are not up to the same standard as a 5 star hotel, I had a very nice stay and would go again. Having two rooms plus a small kitchen counter and sink is a plus. If you are traveling and prefer to buy take-out and eat in your room it is a good set-up. Plus if you are on a business with your spouse one person can work, talk on the phone or watch TV while the other sleeps in the bedroom. There was a free continental breakfast next the lobby but I did not have time to partake, It did rain one of the days I was there and a pile of umbrellas greeted guests as they walked out the door. The location, 50th and 3rd is excellent with great restaurants all around and not far from shopping and the theatre. They do not have the most luxurious furniture but it was more than adequate. The older AC was a bit noisy but these are minor complaints to a very nice stay. I will stay again.

My wife and I stayed here for 5 nights. The hotel was very centrally located with many great restaurants and sights within walking distance. The room was very clean and comfortable. Our room was on the back side of the hotel and we did not hear any street noise. Not much a view, just the back of another building, but we slept great. Staff was friendly and the price was reasonable. We highly recommend this hotel.

We stayed in an executive suite with our baby daughter for week and loved the hotel. It's in a great location, the staff were friendly and really helpful and it's not often you get breakfast (albeit a continental one) and free wifi included in your room rate.Our room was of a decent size, the kitchen area was well stocked, the small dining table and sofa came in handy and the beds extremely comfortable. We found the doorman and reception staff to most helpful and pleasant throughout our stay.The only one thing I could fault was the carpets could have done with a better hoover on our arrival. It’s a small point as all other cleanliness was spot on.

My husband and I picked this hotel for the size of the room as my mom stayed with us a few nights. The room overall was in a good location and big in size (except for the bathroom). However, the housekeeping is a huge disappointment. When we arrived, the sheets were stained. This is a small hotel, so we were left to chg the sheets on our own. Then the next day, I noticed that the hall 1/2 bath had urine underneath the toilet bowl by the floor. I informed the front desk, and again, never got a response. The urine was left on the toilet bowl. When my mom, arrived, she found filthy, stained sheets on her fold out couch. The stains appeared to be blood stained. Also, we asked housekeeping to refill the towels in the 1/2 bath, but again, to no avail. I wd also not recommend this hotel if you are new to nyc. They do not have a real concierge. The doorman was great, however.

We came back to the SC after staying here a year ago. TA will delete my older review so if you look for it it won't be there. Anyway..it's a great deal in Manhattan!! A one-bedroom suite with kitchenette for less than $400!! What a deal!! It's in a great location that's close to great shopping, dining, and the subway. The staff is always helpful and friendly. The rooms are HUGE and most importantly quiet. Sure, there is some siren noise, but not much. The beds are comfortable as well. The breakfast is typical; yogurt, baked goods, toaster items, cereal, etc. This hotel always impresses me as a luxury hotel without the luxury price tag. Expect robes, turn down service, a pants press (??), two flat screen TVs, two closets, etc., etc... We'll be back for third visit for sure.

All the way around, this is a superior hotel. My wife and I spent three nights there over the Columbus Day weekend, with two teenage boys. Everything is superb and we will return if the opportunity arises. Plenty of space in our one-bedroom suite, very clean, thorough room attention each day, perfect bed, more than ample free breakfast food, friendly helpful staff, tasteful wall hangings, better than average fitness room, great location in Manhattan mid-town east right next to 51st and Lexington subway. One final thing -- when we checked out, the man at the front desk did a magic trick for my younger boy. This is a really special place. Kudos to TripAdvisor for bringing it to my attention!

We stayed in an Executive Suite. It had plenty of room for NYC even with 2 young children -- including floor space, a small "kitchen" table, couch, coffee table, kitchenette. The continental breakfast had a good selection and was well supplied. The doorman was friendly and provided us with umbrellas on our way out when it was raining. We were able to borrow a DVD player from the front desk. We all agreed we'd stay here again.

We chose the San Carlos Hotel solely because of the TripAdvisor reviews we read about it. We had an interior room which was quiet and cozy. The rooms have a refrigerator, microwave and coffee-maker. Wi-Fi throughout the hotel and also a wonderful business center with several computers with internet access and connected printers. The workout room was perfect as well - TV's, towels, bathroom, and all the necessary exercise equipment. The Hotel Staff was spectacular... helpful, kind, efficient and quick. We arrived early in the morning on a Tuesday (red-eye flight) and were able to get into our room at 10am to nap and shower. The Aveda shampoos, soaps and lotions were wonderful and the bed was the best hotel bed we have ever slept in. The location could not be better... walking distance to Central Park, Rockefeller Center, Times Square and easy Subway access to everywhere else. Next time we travel to NYC, we will be staying at the San Carlos Hotel.

We found the San Carlos through TripAdvisor and couldn't have been more delighted. It was one of the best hotels I've ever stayed in in NYC. The location was supurb, the front desk very welcoming and our rooms immaculately clean, spacious and away from any street noise. We couldn't believe our great good fortune. The continental breakfast was generous with sweet rolls, patisseries, yogurt, orange juice, coffee, tea, fresh fruit, cottage cheese, etc. The 24/7 internet availability was convenient as were the 24/7 gym facilities. The room was tastefully decorated, the bathroom smacking clean and up-scale modernized, the beds amazingly comfortable with lovely linens, and the staff and personnel couldn't have been more accommodating and gracious. All in all, the San Carlos is a hotel that we can recommend without reservation. Hello to Gabriel and to Bobby...two of the staff members who are excellent representatives of the San Carlos's impeccable hospitality.

I have just returned to London today, having spent five nights at the San Carlos, which I picked out from Trip Advisor reviews. Expedia informed them it would be my birthday when I was staying. Upon arrival I found a beautiful room big enough for three, and a fabulous gift box of goodies with a Happy Birthday note. You can't top that! The staff were exceptionally helpful and polite. The hotel is situated in a very nice part of Manhattan and very near the subway - you can get just about anywhere! My room had a fridge with small freezer, microwave, china and coffee maker always supplied with coffee. I cannot fault the San Carlos and need to save up to return as soon as I can!

We found this hotel on tripadvisor and were delighted we did. We were given the high floor room we requested -- it was spotless, extremely comfortable, quiet, and pleasant in every way. There was a fridge and microwave as well as free wifi. The staff were friendly and helpful and the few mistakes they made were quickly and pleasantly corrected. Breakfast was fine, too, and the location was perfect. I've been recommending the San Carlos to everyone.

We visited in the first couple of days in August, the staff were friendly and helpful, the rooms were spotless, we had a suite so that our teenager could have his own space. It was plenty big and really clean. Situated right in the heart of midtown we couldn't have been in a better position. I would definitely stay here again without hesitation.

I have stayed at several of the name brand hotels in TimeSquare and in the theater district, but once I found the San Carlos Hotel -- it's hard to imagine staying anywhere else in the city for the same star rating & cost. I've been a guest at the San Carlos 4 times now, and the appeal is the location, the staff and the quality of the rooms. You are conveniently located near many places to see & tour since you are at 50th & Second St. -- you can walk to Radio City, Rockefeller Center and Times Square, plus a subway station is nearby. The choice of restuarants is really great & also in walking distance on 50th & Second & Third & Lexington. Better food and better prices than in Times Square or the theater district. If its your first time in NYC you may be more comfortable in Times Square hotels to easily find your way around, but if you are returning to NYC, you won't be sorry if you try the San Carlos Hotel -- the staff and atmosphere are superb! We got a jr. suite at a special rate on the hotel web-site for a price we had a regular room here and at other places in the past. So check their web site for specials. If you can find a good rate, book with confidence and know you won't be disappointed.

My wife and two younger children stayed here for three nights. The room was spacious, clean, and the most well-lit I've ever been to. There were power outlets EVERYWHERE! There was a refrigerator as well. The pull-out sleep sofa mattress was comfortable, and the service was outstanding. Free wireless is another plus. When we return to NYC, we will definitely stay here again.

Just back from a 2 night stay at San Carlos hotel in one bedroom suite ,greatexperience , staff friendly ,offered late check out free of charge,can't understand themoans about breakfast its included in rate it was a good bonus

We found this hotel through Trip Advisor and couldn't have been happier. We had one bed suite, roomy with kitchenette ideal with 2 children. Staff friendly especially Bobby. We were more than happy with breakfast, and free wifi and cleanliness very good. We stayed longer because of hurricane Irene but were glad to do so.
We stayed at San Carlos Hotel for 4 days. We would definately recommend and return to this hotel.
Great hotel. We couldn't fault it apart from the breakfasts which were a little basic. Great location, clean and comfortable and the staff were always helpful.We really enjoyed our five night stay!

Had never heard of this hotel before, but pictures looked great so we went for it - very hard to find reasonably priced suite in NYC, We were not disappointed! The room was huge, especially for NYC. Very well kept, very quiet, the staff was very friendly, especially Mathew the doorman. The free buffet breakfast was very basic (limited pastry selection, toast, yogurt, plus coffee, etc) but good. Highly recommend it for families. We are a family of 5 (2 parents, a 5 yr old, 2 yr old, and 3 mo old) and it was perfect for us.

Rooms are just fine -- not huge, but lots of really nice touches - a mini bar + fridge + microwave + coffeemaker. The top floor suite, if you 'go for broke' is great with rooftop terrace. But even the basic rooms have really nice flat screen TV, great beds and bedding, and very spiffy brand new telephones. Desk service is delightful - personal, charming, welcoming - you feel like an old friend the moment you walk in. Convenient mid-town location, easy walk to the best shopping- uptown to Bloomingdale's, west a few blocks to Fifth Avenue - and a few more blocks to theatre. And parking just $30 a day -- good price for NYC. And free continental breakfast as well, a real added benefit.

We (Family of 3 including teenage son) have just returned home from a 15 day stay at the San Carlos. We had a one bedroomed suite (2 queens and a sofa bed in lounge).We found all of the staff to be courteous, friendly and professional. The suite was clean and spacious, and the quality of the towels and linen excellent. My son had use of the free WiFi in our suite with his laptop - though there are adequate PC's available to use .on the second floor. I used the dry-cleaning service and this was really quick.The self service breakfast was a selection of pastries, cereal, juice, yogurts,l frech coffee etc., which was more than adequate.The hotel is really handy for the subway, and within walking distance of all the main streets you need to visit.Though our next trip to New York will be a shorter one - we WILL be staying at the San Carlos!

This was my second time staying in this hotel. We were in NYC for 4 nights and this hotel was ideal as a central point for the different activities that we had planned. Rooms are good sized (for NYC) and staff is friendly and helpful. Several times we asked the staff for help on restaurants or directions and their advice was always "spot on". We used the breakfast buffet (adequate continental breakfast) and internet service (good - though not always fast). Lastly....and one of those little things that make service good...on the one very rainy night during our stay they had a large quantity of good portable umbrellas that people could take with them for the evening.

We loved the San Carlos! From the minute we arrived we were treated like old friends. The front desk (Evelyn & Gabriel) were helpful and tried their best to get an early check in into our suite beacuse we arrived at about 9 a.m., but nothing was availble. While we waited, the front desk staff entertained our kids with magic tricks! When they did get us in (still a few hours earlier than official check in time) they gave us a beautiful suite on the 16th floor (quiet, spacious, good air conditioner-we were there during a heat wave). . The bell staff (Bobby, Johan and Matthew) were friendly and knowledgable, and gave us good suggestions for families since we were tourists traveling with a 10- & 11-year-old. During our stay there were thunderstorms and the hotel had "loaner" umbrellas near the door for our use as we cruised around the city, which was great.I've read complaints from others about the conteniental breakfast, but we thought it was plenty of food and choices. Since it was included in the room price for the four of us, it was a terrific value (you can't beat free). The breakfast consisted of rolls, assorted pastries, bagels, (the little chocolate croissants were especially yummy), tea, coffee, hot chocolate, milk, orange juice, assorted yogurts, cottage cheese, whole apples, assorted jams, cream cheese, Rice Krispies and Corn Flakes. The nice lady working at the breakfast kept everything well stocked throughout the morning (7-10 a.m.)Our suite was clean and well appointed and roomy (we couln't believe we had that much space in mid-town Manhattan). The housekeeping staff was wonderful too. They were available the minute we requested anything. Returning from our daily adventures, the place was always spotless and my dirty dishes were the all done. What a luxury! The kitchenette came with a microwave, refridgerator, sink, dishes/service for 4 +. The Hotel location is also wonderful. It's walking distance to many attractions and a variety of restaurants (although there is a subway station not too far away). The front door staff is on top of it when you need a cab hailed (although much of the time we just tried to walk off the great Italian food we'd eaten in the neighborhood).The staff of the hotel went well above our expectations. We will ONLY stay at the San Carlos when we return to NYC. My kids are already saying, "We miss the San Carlos." Me too...
I don't think I have one bad thing to say about the San Carlos.

We flew into Newark and didn't arrive at the hotel until midnight. Bellperson on duty (Matt) was exceptional! Delivered our bags, set our thermostat, gave us a brief rundown of the entire suite. From the staff, we got restaurant recommendations, directions, etc. Always a smile, a joke, a friendly face. The suite itself was like a small apartment! Clean, comfortable beds, with room to move around. Even our 15 year old loved it, and she's the pickiest in our family! Continental breakfast left a bit to be desired, but everything else more than made up for it!!
Great stay! Super clean, fast elevators, small but nice free breakfast, excellent staff. Will definitely stay here again. Not one complaint!

Stayed here with wife and two boys. Rooms huge by new York standards - think of an embassy suites type room with upgraded finishes. Room had kitchenette with mini frig and microwave. Two TVs, two large closets, nice bathroom. View was of building next door. Smallish common areas include a nice computer lodge, nice but smallish lobby, and a breakfast room where the continental breakfast is served. Breakfast has cereals, yogurts, pastries. Great midtown location within short walk of lots of attractions. Subway station one block north. Get the one week metro pass and you can travel all over thes city for the cost of one round trio cab ride. Overall, a great base to explore and a good value compared to other NYC hotels.

Stayed at the San Carlos Hotel for the second time in the past 18 months on a pleasure trip to New York. It is just so conveniently located and with , very spacious rooms which are beautifully appointed with modern style furniture and extremely comfortable. The beds are perfect for a good night's sleep. The hotel staff is extremely gracious and kind. Best of all is its central location and its very attractive room rate which is excellent considering you are talking about Manhattan, one of the world's most expensive cities.

We really enjoyed this hotel. It was the perfect location in NYC. Close enough to walk to major attractions, including Central Park, but tucked on a relatively quiet side street. The staff were very pleasant, especially the nice gentleman at reception who did magic tricks for my son. We'll be booking a return stay this fall!

Just had 6 great nights at the San Carlos New York from the 15th June. Excellent location. a little noisy across the road is a nightclub, but you are in New York & you have to get used to that. The rooms are large for New York, with Queen Size beds which is highly unusual for America, which were extremely comfortable. Great lounge area, with a small kitchenette, enough for us (microwave, fridge & sink). Staff couldn't do enough for us, everytime we came back from a long hard day pounding the streets we were always greeted and asked how our day was. Breakfast for a self serve is excellent, you really dont need the huge buffet everyday, they had a great choice for a continental breakfast, somedays it does get a little crowded though. Some fantastic local restaurants just two blocks away in a really local area, supermarket, pharmacy etc. Very safe area never felt unsafe. Great stay, thank you San Carlos. Highly recommended..

My family of four stayed at the San Carlos Hotel for 3 nights. First trip to NYC. The room, Executive suite king, was fantastic. Very clean, very roomy for the four of us, 2 adults + 2 teens. Extremely comfortable bed meant a great nights rest. Very quiet hotel aside from NYC constant noise. Short walk to all the great sights. Highly recommend for a wonderful stay. Tip for delicious chinese food. Wuliang YE on 48th street around the corner from rockefeller center. Fantastic food.

My first time staying in the city with the family. After reading endless reviews I chose the SC because of the positive reviews, availability, location and because they have 2 beds and not a sofa pullout. I could not have picked a better hotel for my family vacation. First of all the staff was excellent, from the bellhop to the maids, they were over-the-top nice. The room was way more than what I expected for a NY hotel. I had the 2 queen suite. The room was big, and more important VERY clean. Small kitchenette was very helpful with the kids. Other pluses include free breakfast, and wifi. Negatives include air condition units that could be less noisy, street noise if your room is on the lower level street side and $30 a day parking. I will definitely stay here again on my next trip in.

Firstly the staff here are excellent, friendly, helpful and very efficient. The hotel is ideally located on 50th and 3rd, $7 taxi ride to Times Square or a 15 minute stroll, and a similar distance to Central Park. the room sizes are 'huge' by New York standard and while not cheap it certainly delivers value for money by New York standards. We had 2 rooms, a King and a double double. The beds were as comfortable as I have ever experienced away from home. A definite bonus was the 'continental breakfast' included in the room price., nothing extensive but juice, cereals breads, toast and coffee started us off well each morning. Another added extra was 'Free' wireless internet access.

My family of four stayed at the San Carlos the first week of June in a King Suite. The room included a true king size bed and a pull out sofa for the kids. The room was very clean and large enough too accomadate all of the extra bags of souveniers. Only complaint about the room, the AC was too loud for a light sleeper. The hotel offers a continental breakfast of pastries, juice and coffee, that was average. The location can not be beat, easy walk to Rockefeller Center and the rest of 5th Ave. Central Park is a 20 minute walk. The E and 6 subway lines are very close and can get you to the East, North and South parts of Manhatten within minutes. The proximity of the hotel to 3rd and 2nd Ave give great access to local restaurants (Sofrito, Lasagnas, Morning Star Cafe, etc). I usually get to the city every other year and like to try different hotels, but I would not hesitate to stay at the San Carlos again.

What a little gem! I booked a King Suite and had asked for a high floor and quiet room.. We were allowed to check in when we arrived at 11:30AM- how wonderful is that! The front desk staff was very friendly as was the rest of the staff from bellboy to housekeeping.. The hotel even sent a "birthday basket" to my husband with a card wishing him Happy Birthday. We really felt spoiled by the enitre staff.The bed was comfortable and the bathroom a little larger than some other NYC hotel bathrooms I've seen. Housekeeping was very friendly and did a great job- asked for feather pillows which were brought to the room. The air conditioner worked well but the one in the living area was a bit noisy. The only street noise we heard was the occ siren. We never heard any of the other guests in the other rooms. The breakfast was okay. Had plenty of healthy choices fruit and cereal, as well as pastries. Even tho its included in the room rate, I much preferred the Bagels from ESS A Bagel on 3rd and 51st street. The location is great- near GCT and subway. We would walk back from the theater. We really enjoyed our visit and hope to return soon.

Across the street from some night life and walking distance to other great eateries and businesses, this small hotel meet our expectations. Our only complaint would be the sound of the air conditioner as it turned on but that is nothing in comparison to the quality of the room. Compact in size, yes, but offers everything you need.
user_name:
MiekaJB
New York City, New York
