review_body: We booked a double queen room. The room we got was good, fairly big for a new york hotel. The biggest plus is that it comes with a microwave and an empty bar-sized fridge that is for our use! There is a separate drinks fridge that the hotel provides for in-room convenience. But for us with young kids, a microwave in the room is a big plus!The hotel provides a good continental breakfast spread, including fresh pastries, OJ, coffee/tea and yoghurt and cereal selections. We had our breakfast at the hotel everyday. There is a free business center with 6 desktop computers and free internet access. A printer is even provided free to print-out online reservations/tickets and flight check-ins. Wifi is free around the hotel. There is a pool but we did not get to try it.This hotel is has a good location mid-town. A block away is the Metro station on 51th St/Lexington, which covers both the 6 and M line, so it is fairly convenient. We do need to walk to 52nd street Metro entrance which has an elevator for our stroller. It is also a fairly quick 15-20 mins walk towards Times Square with the kids. If supper is needed, there is a number of late night cafes around the hotels. Laundry service is also available down 2 blocks.

What a great hotel - in a fabulous location. The service was excellent - the continental breakfast a welcome start to the day with a large choice of food - all fresh and lots of variety.The staff were courteous and polite without being overwhelming - nothing was too much trouble. The hotel is ideally located - just a few blocks from 5th Avenue St Patricks Cathedral, the Empire State Building and Central Park - the subway is very convenient also and an excellent way of getting around the city - great value too at just $2.25 for a single ride - whatever the distance.Highly recommended

As a previous review says, I'm hesitant to let too many people in on this gem. First of all, it's pretty unusual that the hotel's owner/operator is on site. I checked in with the wonderful Gabriel at the front desk--a most charming and welcoming staff member. I am beyond particular and Gabriel was attentive to the requests that I had made when making the reservation. He actually let me look at a couple of rooms to make sure that my preferences were met. The room that I chose was not yet available (it was very early) so I shopped for a while. When I returned to the hotel, Gabriel said that the owner of the hotel wanted to meet me. I travel at least 80 days a year and have for several years--I've never met the hotel owner. The owner was charming and lovely and was clearly interested in making sure I had a good stay. My room was lovely--a beautiful upgrade. The experience at the San Carlos was very much like staying at a friend's beautiful apartment. Everything was clean and fresh. The bed and linens were a good quality. The location of the San Carlos is excellent with subway and bus lines within steps. I prefer midtown east--so this location is really perfect. Again, I almost don't want to tell too many people about this as I fear it won't be available the next time I go back.

I have alway wanted to visit New York during the festive period and last year me and a friend decided to spoil our seleves and go for it,We made our booking for our 5 Night stay at the waldorf astoria, upon arrival we were informed that the hotel was faced with a difficult situation and that they had very little rooms to cover the amount of guests checking in, I have to admit i was very concerned an a bit distressed we had saved all year for this one off trip and here we were with no room, Our check in clerk quicky re assured us that he could move us to another hotel to the same standard and area of the city and also get the hotel to re issue a refund for the cost of our stay as way of an apology, The hotel in question was the wonderful san carlos hotel, he showed it to us on the internet an phoned to ask for a suite, we were fairly happy with this outcome to be honest, the check in clerk walked us to our car they supplied for the transfer just around the block, The san carlos is not as big and flashy as the waldorf but what it does ooozzzz is sheer class, The check in guy was pleasent and friendly and a good source of information if you required any, our room was just gorgeous, kitchen area was great to keep all our drinks chilled, dining area and a siting area with comfy sofas and a huge 40inch plasma, the seperate bedroom also had another 40inch plasma and a great comfortable bed, plenty of storage space for all our shoping and belongings, The hotel also supplies a contiental breakfast included in your stay if you wish but theres a little cafe just acroos the road that does great food there newyork bagels was amazing.When checking out at 12 the clerk at the reception booked our airport transfer an when he heard we were not due to leave till 4 he gave us our room back till 2.30, the extra time relaxing before our long flight back to ireland was wonderful , which i wasnt looking forward to at all with delta airlines, id recommend aer lingus in future, The reason im only writing my review now is my travel agent thomas cook is now only re issuing the refund of the cash the waldorf promised us 5 months later, they just couldnt understand why they would put us up in another hotel plus give us our money back lol.To sum it up we didnt book this hotel to start with but if i am lucky enough to go back it will be first on my list, A beautiful hidden gem in the middle of the city

My husband and I stayed at the San Carlos Hotel for a week in March. We loved everything about it. The staff at the reception desk were very friendly and efficient. The rooms were fabulous! The bed was super comfortable and the room was spic and span clean. We had stayed at other hotels in Manhattan, including the Hilton. The San Carlos is definitely a few steps above. The rooms are very big and the bathrooms have great bathtubs, which is unusual for a Manhattan hotel. The housekeeping and maintenance staff are courteous and available within a couple of minutes to meet every need or fix any problem. The breakfast gives a delicious and convenient start to your day in the city. There are fresh and delicious rolls, bread, croissants, danishes, muffins, orange juice, delicious coffee, hot chocolate, yogurts, cottage cheese, apples, etc. etc. When it was raining out, the bell boy offered us umbrellas to take with us. The doorman was great at hailing taxis for us, running into the gutter and blowing his whistle. The hotel's location is fabulous. There are tons of restaurants and coffee shops close by. The subway is only a block away. The hotel is walking distance from Rockefeller Center, Central Park, Saks Fifth Avenue, Lord and Taylor's, the Apple Store, FAO Schwartz, etc. etc. etc. There is also great nightlife in the vicinity. We loved being so close to so many attractions in Manhattan. There is no doubt that we will stay at the San Carlos again when we return to New York in July.

Spacious, quiet, very clean midtown gem. We stayed in a 'queen suite' with our 10 and 15 year olds. The 600 square foot room featured a queen bed in a room with a door. There was a queen size pull out sofa bed and a roll away in the next room with a kitchenette, microwave, refrigerator and big screen tv. We've stayed in midtown before and it's common to hear honking and sirens all night long. This hotel was so quiet - - no noise from adjacent rooms and little noise from outside. Even the toilet flushes quietly.It's conveniently located a block from the 4,5, 6 trains (down the east side) and the E train (across to the west side/theater district). At check-in, the kindly gentleman demonstrated his magic tricks. Our 10 year old asked if we could always stay at the San Carlos when we visit NYC. This is one request we're happy to oblige!

Stayed three nights for business/pleasure trip. Booked a King Executive Suite and WOW, great, huge, clean room! Our room faced towards the front of the hotel, 50 street- 11th floor and did not hear any noise at night. Comfortable bed and very friendly housekeeper who tended graciously to our needs. Were able to check in early and given 2 umbrellas to use during our stay as weather was not very good. Actually umbrellas provided to all guests! NICE! Great location, walking distance to basically everywhere. We walked to Time Square, Central Park, Rockerfeller Centre and subway station around the corner. Very basic continental breakfast which included juice, milk, pastries and yogurt but included in the price we paid. Plenty of good restaurants in the vicinity. . Overall a great stay and would go back again.

This hotel feels very much like a small luxury European hotel. The lobby is nice, but the real effort is in the well outfitted and big-for-NYC rooms. We had adjoining standard rooms and each had a large mini fridge with a real freezer (in addition to the mini bar), two sets of table service and a microwave. This enabled us to order groceries on line for delivery on arrival (see The Food Emporium on the web) so that we had easy meals and snacks in the room when the kids ran out of steam. This feature was good for the mind, body and wallet. Location is central, yet very quiet. The beds are the most comfortable beds I have ever slept on-even the 5 year old slept in. Priceless.

We always stay at the San Carlos when traveling to NYC. Rooms are clean, spacious, and QUIET! It has a perfect central location in Midtown only a block from the subway. The staff is outstanding - friendly, helpful courteous and the prices are very reasonable. I highly recommend the San Carlos for your next stay in NYC.

My sister and I took our Mother to New York for a five day girls/birthday trip and had researched hotels on many sites. We are so grateful we found the San Carlos! For one, the service is so friendly, from the desk clerks to the doormen (Hi Matthew and Robert!) and even the housekeeping staff, who greeted us cheerfully every morning. But the real star was the room size. Having stayed in several other four star hotels in Manhattan, I was prepared to be disappointed by the room size. Not this time. Room 1505 was delightful. I've never had a kitchenette/diner AND living room in a hotel before, but it was heaven. After long stays of sightseeing, our favourite time of day was coming home for happy hour in our room.If you stay at the San Carlos, don't forget to walk down to 2nd Ave. and enjoy some of the quaint neighbourhood Pubs and Restaurants. Thumbs up San Carlos, I hope you'll have a room available next time we're lucky enough to be in NYC.

My husband and myself visited with friends for 6 days. We had stayed there before but it was my friends' first trip to New York so I was hoping that the hotel was as good as the last time, I was not disappointed. It is an absolute pleasure from the minute you arrive to the minute you leave and it is all down to the fantastic staff - nothing is too much trouble. The rooms are spacious and quiet, the beds are very comfortable, the hotel is spotless and the breakfast is a lovely touch and adequate to start your day. We are hoping to return to New York next year and wouldn't consider staying anywhere other than The San Carlos Hotel - can't wait. Thanks to everyone at The San Carlos for helping make our holiday special.

Our arrival for our Holiday Weekend in New York started badly; first, Continental Airlines lost our luggage (Gate-Checked on board, because all available space was taken by the slobs who cram full-size suitcases into tiny overhead bins !) Continental was spectacularly UNhelpful...Then the car service we had reserved didn't show up...We called the hotel for directions on how to get from NEWARK to Manhattan, and they simply said, "Take a Cab---get a receipt---we'll reimburse you"...the front desk manager met the cab at the curb, reimbursed us in cash, got us settled, referred us to the in-house restaurant ("MINT"---VERY good!), and throughout our stay treated us literally as GUESTS, not just customers...Next trip to NYC---we're staying HERE !
great hotel,great location, very good choice.Large rooms very comfortable
Great hotel and fantastic location. Highly recommended.Thanks.

My husband , my 18 year old daughter and I, have just returned from The San Carlos. We had a wonderful time and the staff at the hotel helped us a lot to make this trip a great experience. I had read many reviews of the hotel and I knew what to expect. The rooms were big, the beds comfortable, everything was clean, the shower was excellent, the hair drier could be improved, breakfast was Ok, the orange juice was excellent and the pastries were aso good, I would only add that the staff at the hotel are great, always smiling, helping you with any minor problem you might have, joking, making you feel welcome.I would really want to thank Gabriel for being so super nice.I think that location is great, walking distance to several must go places.If I go back to New York, I'll stay at the San Carlos again.

After a thrilling but hot week in a camper van touring Long Island, we were delighted to enter this cool, luxurious, ideally located hotel. Very comfortable Junior Suite. Beds magnificent. Air-con fab. Breakfast buffet appreciated as it meant we could get up and get on with the day.

My friend and I booked a last minute trip to New York. We usually stay at Berkshire Place or The Benjamin, in a suite, but neither hotel was available, so based on recommendations from hotel.com (which Delta connected us to), and the high ranking on Tripadvisor, we chose The San Carlos Hotel. It is in the same block as The Benjamin and The Waldorf Towers, a couple of blocks down 50th from Saks, and a straight route to Rockefeller Center, if you need to get your bearings. Hotels.com had a good rate, but the San Carlos website had an even better non-refundable rate.We arrived at 9.30 am, checked our bags and were shown to the breakfast room for a complimentary breakfast. Our room was great...a king executive suite on the 9th floor. It was one very large room, with a kitchen (true coffeepot, microwave, refrigerator, etc) and dining alcove and a sofa bed. The bed was incredibly comfortable and the room was very large and quiet. We never once waited in line at the desk or for our bags and when we requested something for our room, it arrived instantaneously. One plus or minus is that there was no hassle waiting on assistance getting our bags to our room..we had carry-ons and took them ourselves. The hotel is pretty casual in that way, but leaves out no necessities and handles everything expeditiously.The business center never had a wait for the computers, and thre is no charge for printing or use of the computers.Breakfast was a little hectic, but it was nice to have yogurt, toast, pastries, juice, etc. without leaving the hotel.One of my favorite restaurants, Mint, is next door and owned by the hotel. Mint is a fabulous Indian restaurant with great ambience. Also, on the food topic, just around the corner is Pax, where you can get perfect salads and other items for your room.When I checked out, the manager brought the owner out to meet me, and if I had not already planned to write a rave review, I would have after meeting him. He is extremely personable and wants to be sure that his guests intend to return.We took the hotel car to the airport for about $10 more than a cab and it was perfect...quiet, clean, on time, and hassle free. I do not believe there is any room service, but there are enough good choices for dining out or for bringing gourmet foods back to your own kitchen. All in all, a hassle free, lovely experience.
Very fast check-in, check-out, clean, comfortable beds, convenient parking garage, discounted parking with voucher, friendly staff. Room very quiet. Very good value for NYC.

We stayed with our kids (12 and 17) in a Deluxe Room w/2 queens. No bed bugs!! Room was very clean, roomy, with small fridge, micro wave, tv (never used, too busy walking) and free wi-fi for our four ipods and laptop. Easy access if you're driving and secure parking garage is just before hotel, don't forget to ask front desk for discount voucher if you self park (Bobby actually stopped traffic allowing me to reverse back to parking garage, classic!!). Free continental breakfast includes coffee tea juice, some fruit and yogurt and breads you can toast and also croissants. Access to Subway lines 6, E and M are one block away. Rockfeller Ctr and Central Park are 10-15 minutes away on foot.Perfect.

I have stayed in at least 20 different hotels in New York over the past 20 years and the San Carlos Hotel clearly stands out as one of the best. It is located in midtown near the popular attractions but just far enough away to keep the crowds and street noise to a minimum. The 2Queen bedroom suite at 600 sq ft is massive compared to most Manhattan hotels, and the best I have experienced in NY. The staff was friendly and helpful, and there was no wait to check in, check out, or get bell service. The continental breakfast was adequate, and represented the first time in my memory that I had a breakfast included in the price in a NY hotel. The cost of the room was substantially lower than what many of the popular NY hotels charge for a room half the size. There is nothing about the San Carlos that I can complain about and I would recommend it highly.

"Great location and very friendly staff. Located half a block from Lexinton & 51st Subway and Waldorf Astoria. Close to Rockefeller Centre, Radio City Music Hall and Sachs 5th Avenue for those who can afford to shop there as well as some superb restaurants.Thanks to Fabio, Gabriel and Bobby who were most friendly and helpful and went out of their way to ensure we had a memorable stay.. Even let us store a bag at the hotel while we visited friends in Upstate New York for 4 days. Thanks also to Roberto from the limo company that the hotel arranged to take us to the Airport.

My friend and I stayed here during the first week of the US Open. Fantastic stay!! Wonderful clean comfortable rooms. The staff was incredible, ready to answer any questions we had. Great location for restaurants (Ashtons is great) , spa (Bliss) is right around the corner, and an easy walk to the subway (8 blocks away) to catch the 7 train straight to the Open. Staff was so considerate, we missed breakfast one day and they re-opened the dining room just for us. Could not have been more helpful! Again, I'll never stay anywhere but the San Carlos...I've found my home away from home.

Have you priced hotels in midtown lately? A queen suite with a kitchenette at this price and this location? What a deal! We booked via the hotel's website and got a special rate for the Labor Day holiday when most other hotels in the area were booked up. The taxi ride from LaGuardia was about $40 on the weekday and about $30 on the weekend. Check in was no problem and staff was pleasant. There is no concierge. The room was very nice with a sitting area with desk, flat screen TV, couch, & two chairs. The kitchenette has a sink, refrigerator, microwave, and coffee maker. A small table with two chairs is there also. The room was spotless and in great repair. The walls are cement so there is virtually no noise from adjoining rooms. The bedroom had another TV and a pants press. There are two closets in the room. The bathroom was modern with Aveda products. The hotel was super quiet and we slept great on the comfortable bed. I'm an early riser so it was nice to sit in the sitting area, watch TV, and have a coffee while my wife slept. The breakfast is a typical hotel breakfast; coffee, juice, yogurt, pastries, bagels, etc. If you want more there is a small restaurant right across the street. The hotel is an easy walk to Times Square, Bloomingdales, Rockefeller Center, Saks, and a host of other shopping and dining options. We had dinner one night in the adjoining restaurant - Mint (an Indian restaurant) - it was disappointing to say the least. There is no room service in the hotel. It's on a quiet street so it was relaxing to come back to this little gem after a day of being in the city.

I would highly recommend the San Carlos for families (two adults and four kids in my case). The large suite comfortably slept all the kids. The service was excellent. The only complaint is the continental breakfast was poor and the bad.

Excellent hotel! We usually stay right in Time Square, but bid on a two-night stay at San Carlos Hotel at a charity event to try something different. We were very pleasantly surprised and will stay here again! It is away from the crowds, but is within easy walking , subway or taxi distance from everything. Parking is right next door with discounts for hotel patrons. It was $30 for 24 hours, but we have an SUV so we had to pay an extra $10 for an over-sized vehicle. Still less than parking in Time Square. On our last day, the doorman had us park in front of the hotel after checking out so that we wouldn't have to pay extra in the parking garage. The staff was fantastic and had great suggestions for restaurants, transportation, and sight-seeing. We stayed in an executive suite which I would suggest if you have grown children. There was a king bed and a large sitting area with a pull out sofa-bed. The sitting area had two other chairs so there was plenty of room for all of us. We brought an inflatable twin mattress so our two kids had their own sleeping space and even with the sofa-bed out and mattress inflated, there was room to walk around. We entered the room to see a brand new 42" flat screen still in the box in the living room. They installed it while were hit the town! The suite had a kitchenette area with a breakfast bar and two chairs which was nice. It was separated from the sleeping area a little bit so any early risers could have coffee without tiptoeing around the sleepers. There was also a small refrigerator and microwave. The kitchen was stocked with utensils and plates, and no dishwasher since housekeeping would do the dished every day :) The bathroom was adequate, but not overly large and we had two good-sized closets. This was a very roomy space for NYC! Only downfall for some travelers might be the nightclub across the street. There was a line outside starting at about 11:30 to midnight and we could barely hear them talking, but we really couldn't hear the music inside. We were on the 6th floor so if you go higher, you might not hear anything. We did hear some people singing happy birthday outside the club at around 2 a.m., but we just went back to sleep. The club patrons were not rowdy. They seemed very classy and definitely drove nice cars and showed up in limos. We did not take advantage of the daily continent breakfast and didn't eat at the attached restaurant. All in all, we loved the place and will stay there again!

Great location, walking distance to subway & many popular sites. Staff was friendly & very helpful. Rooms were very clean & spacious. We had 2 queens, which are hard to find in NYC. Room was modern with a very big closet as well as lots of drawer space. Couldn't have been better!! Only thing wrong was that we like the top sheet tucked in at the bottom & the sheets were not long enough to do that.

We have just spent five nights in this fantastic hotel. From the moment we walked in we were greeted warmly and upgraded to the most beautiful suite. It has a separate living area with kitchenette with fridge and microwave. Ample cupboard space and spacious bathroom. Price included breakfast which was run well and managed by one person. I have only got rave reviews about this hotel and would return here and recommend it to anyone.

We would highly recommend this hotel. The gentleman at the reception was polite and very helpful as well as all the other staff. The owner of the hotel was also occasionally around to talk to the people who were staying at his hotel . He was charming and obviously had a a definite pride in his hotel. The rooms were spacious and clean. The location was ideal for visiting New York for the first time. We loved our stay at the San Carlos Hotel and will hopefully return soon.

It isn't often that I travel and have to share a room with one bathroom with 3 other women, but this trip was an exception. We chose the San Carlos because it was one of the only reasonably priced one bedroom suites that had a separate bed for each of us. There were two queens in the bedroom, a fold out sofa, and we added a rollaway for the 4th person ($20 a day extra). It actually worked out really well. Between having a suite layout with a kitchenette (microwave, coffeemaker, sink and refrigerator), and enough mirrors outside of the bathroom for us all to get ready at the same time, we managed quite well. The suites are generous though not super huge, and there was free wifi, and separate temperature controls in each room. The continental breakfast was a bonus, it was like a european breakfast room without the cheese and salami.I would definitely stay here again, and recommend it to a friend.

Stayed here 5 nights from 1st may 2010, stayed in a 1 bedroom suite.The rooms are nice and big seperate lounge and bedroom, small kitchenette with a sink and bar fridge, small 2 seat dining table, lounge room with large tv and free wireless internet. Bedroom had 2 queen beds, bathroom had shower/tub combination. Rooms are lovely and very clean, hotel is close to many restraunts, and convenience store, also near the subway, so is very close to most tourist attractions, easy walk to rockefeller and grand central station. Found all the staff to be exceptional, the doormen always helped with luggage,and were quick to offer directions, also front desk staff were great. I originally selected hotel as I was offered a discounted rate, however I would not hesitate staying again in the future

In this travel to NY I knew I was going to spend most of my day out of the Hotel using it just for sleeping. After reading several reviews this Hotel was the best option for its price.The nice thing about this hotel is that:It has a microwave oven, a small refrigerator and a coffee maker inside the room (you can buy food on the street and keep it inside the refrigerator, make a soup, or cook something on the microwave)It serves breakfast (it was not a big breakfast but they served breads, muffins, cakes, apples, yogurts, coffee and some other beverages)It is quite close to lots and lots of things to see (e.g., Central Park, 5th avenua, Lexington, churches, subway stations, Apple Store, Macys, etc) as it is on 53rdIt is not too expensive (we spent about 100$ per person per day)The rooms are really big and confortable, and they fit 4 grown up with no issues. The bathroom is nice too. The Hotel staff was attentious and did everything to help us. I have no complaint on this Hotel except that there is no view from the rooms. The good thing on this is that there is no street noise.I recommend staying at San Carlos specially for Brazillian as we are used to having breakfast in the morning.As for NY it is a huge city with lots and lots of things to do. The food is really expensive and not so good. I can not remember a place where I ate some really good food for a reasonable price. That is another reason why I recommend this Hotel, as you can buy some stuff from groceries and prepare them at your room.

This is a great little NYC secret! Pretty much everything about our stay in this hotel was pleasant. We traveled with 3 kids under 10 years old and found it incredibly easy. We were very impressed with the professional and courteous staff - they were most helpful in every way. None of our luggage arrived, including our 2 year-old's bed, so I called the hotel on our drive from the airport and asked if they had any cribs available - by the time we arrived at the hotel, the crib was already set up for us in our room! The room was spotless and I personally loved the Aveda bathroom products - housekeeping replenished them every day. The king bed in our suite was incredibly comfortable, as was the fold out couch in the living room where our 2 older children slept - the housekeeping staff prepared the fold out for us complete with down comforter! You could hardly tell it was a fold out and my kids slept beautifully. Loved the refridgerator in the room too - great for keeping bottled water cool and leftovers. The continental breakfast was fantastic - great selection of breads and pastries, organic yogurts, hot choc on tap, good teas, great larger commerical toaster. It was all we needed to get up and going in the morning! Hotel is in a great location - we loved being on a side street yet close to many sites in NYC. Easy to get a cab from there too. Easy and accurate check out process. Loved the free wi-fi! We look forward to staying here again very soon and would DEFINITELY recommend this to anyone!

Found this hotel suggested at oyster.com, was desperate to find a room with 2 queen beds for 2 adults and 2 teenagers, not that easy these days in Manhattan. The San Carlos was not our cheapest option but overall an excellent value, and great location. Rooms don't have views per se, but everything is well arranged, with desk and easy chair, as well as good sized beds, and all decor and amenities are up to date. Bathroom was small but spotless. Beds super comfortable and rooms sooo quiet, no traffic noise or hallway noise. The free breakfast was pretty basic, we ended up eating at a diner across the street, but it would be fine for someone who just wants juice, coffee and Danish. One of the best features though, esp. with teenagers in tow, was the free wifi! The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, suggested a great Chinese restaurant for us at our late night check-in, and there are many other good restaurants nearby. Also close to 4,5,6 subway lines, which makes getting around very easy.

We were so happy to find this hotel. Location can't be beat, and the type of room with the hard to find Queen/Queen configuration was perfect for the 3 of us (2 parents, 1 teenager). Room was very large and clean. The lobby is smallish, but clean and modern. Fastest check-in process ever! The breakfast is basic (pastries, yogurt, fruit, etc.), but it was all we needed to grab a quick bite and head out for the day. We will return!

I booked this hotel for my parents and was concerned about the space and quietness. They stayed in the one bedroom suite. It was extremely spacious, clean and very quiet. Being on the side street made it easy for me to drive over and pick them up (vs in Times Square or somewhere bustling with people and cabs and sound). Hotel is conveniently located, allowing us to walk to 5th ave, central park, NBC studios, Times Square, etc. This saves on cab fare and walking is the best way to experience New York.
user_name:
Gwender
New York City, New York

review_body: I usually visit NYC once a year visiting clients and family. I began staying at the San Carlos perhas five years ago, and return because I find it a great value and a great location. I have always found the service very helpful and the facilities impeccably clean. The May 12, 2010 review is simply not credible. I unhesitatingly recommend the hotel to my friends and business associates.

WE spent a week in the San Carlos Hotel, everything was positive, actually it is an extremely well kept hotel. Everything is spotless, very well maintained and it obvious they must replace immediately anything that gets worn out.It is a good feeling to stay there...WE had a one bedroom suite, consisting of a bedroom with a king bed, a large bathroom, a living room with a sofa bed, a second smaller bathroom and a small kitchenette area with a micro, a sink and dishes and cutlery and a small fridge.There is also a mini bar and a table with two chairs. There was an iron board and iron and a pant presser. Two flat big TVS. Actually everything that we needed was there. They also have FREE wi fi, and also a free breakfast that it is simple, yet comes very handy. IT consisted of coffee, good juice, tea, chocolate, all kind of breads and Danish , cream cheese, butter marmalade and organic yogurts.Breakfast is self service and in paper cups but nevertheless it was done with some flare.Location is very good in 50 between Lexington and Third, the 49-50 crosstown bus makes it very convenient , also a block away is the 6 Subway convenient to go to places like Soho, and one more block the E line good for Greenwich Villages and the Meatpacking district.May be the best thing was that all the people that work there are very pleasant and helpful. Sheets were changed , either every day or every other day, I am not sure, but they were of very good quality and impeccable.WE got a very good rate taking advantage of a 20% discount if pre paying.Never in New York I got all this in one hotel. It was indeed a lovely stay. We had with us one of our grandchildren sleeping in the the living room;s sofa bed while his parents and siblings stayed in separate suite.I highly recommend this very well kept property. They also provide turn down service.

We had another wonderful stay at the San Carlos 4/21-4/25/10. The suite was very spacious, clean and comfortable. Everyone who works here is very helpful and professional. Love the location of this hotel and it's a nice peaceful place to return to after a long day of sightseeing and walking in NYC. Somehow they make you feel like you are returning home instead of to a cold hotel. Breakfast and the computer center are both great perks and Matt, the doorman, is fantastic!! We'll never stay anywhere else.

We were on holiday in Mexico and due to fly back via New York when we had our return flight to the UK cancelled due to the ash from the Icelandic volcano. We knew we could get as far as New York, so on our last night in Mexico we went onto tripadvisor and found the San Carlos in NYC (we had stayed in NYC on our outward journey and knew the area we wanted to be in). After reading the positive reviews we went to the website and got a room for 2 nights that could accommodate the four of us. Yes it was pricey, but all good midtown New York hotels are pricey when you're booking them the night before arriving.Check in took about 30 seconds, and the room was great. Had a fridge (separate to the mini-bar) and a microwave, and bowls/plates/cutlery. Very practical. The hotel has no room service but links to a number of restaurants that will deliver to the hotel and allow you to eat in the room (and charge it to your room as well). Much better quality room than the midtown Omni Berkshire where we had stayed for 4 nights on our outward journey en route to Mexico.Complimentary buffet breakfast was included at the San Carlos, which was a real bonus for New York. The breakfast seems to be the main source of complaint on the tripadvisor reviews. Get over it, it's free, what do you expect? And, we thought it was fine. Toast, good quality orange juice, fruit, yoghurt, tea/coffee - our kids were happy, and we saved ourselves a fortune over our extended stay. I'm sure that the Walfdorf Astoria around the corner would quite happily welcome the moaners in for breakfast at $30-$50 per head! We originally booked for 2 nights, but European airspace remained closed and we had to extend our stay. The hotel was extremely accommodating and at short notice let us extend the room. We were then told by British Airways that we could not get a flight back for another 8 nights (!!!). Unfortunately the San Carlos said that they did not have that same room available for that length of time, but gave us a 15% discount on a suite, which meant we got a room that was twice as big, extra TV, sofa, armchairs, dining area, kitchen sink, fridge , microwave etc for about $25 per night more, for our extended stay. It was a fantastic room (actually 2 rooms and a bathroom) for midtown new york - much like an aparthotel. In fact it was similar to rooms at the Affinia 50 aparthotel, right across the street, but cheaper....and available, which the Affinia wasn't.The hotel had a business/internet lounge with 6 fast PCs and printers, all free of charge. These were frequented most of the time by me and the other stranded European guests looking for flights home! The internet access was great as it enabled us to see that flights were becoming available, which we then phoned up and booked. It meant that we didn't need the full eight nights and our total length of stay was 5 nights. The desk staff were very accommodating and said "no problem" and still gave us the 15% discount.Also should mention are eating options. No restaurant directly in the hotel, but in the lobby there is an adjoining door to the Mint Indian restaurant next door. Fantastic food, and most notable was that it was full of Indian guests, always a good indicator. We ate there on 3 of our 5 nights. Our 2 children 13 and 9 ate everything presented at them - no burgers , nuggets or fries in sight. Hotel had a great location - 1 block from 51st/Lex Subway and 3 blocks from 53rd/Lex Subway which gives you a choice of 3 subway lines. For cheaper options for food (to take back to the room) turn right out of the hotel and then go north one/two blocks on either 3rd or 2nd avenues. Plenty of delis and supermarkets, which you don't tend to see on Lexington, Park or Madison aves (the other direction).So in summary, a great hotel - we would definitely stay there again if we go back to New York. Staff very welcoming and helpful, particularly Bobby on the door/concierge duty. I've stayed in New York 4 times, twice for business, twice for pleasure. By far the best hotel, and not the most expensive.

Spacious for NY hotel rooms, rooms have large comfortable beds with a seating area for watching tv. Rooms have microwave and small fridge, spacious bathrooms which are modern and clean.Our room faced 50th which was a little loud eventhough we were on the 8th floor.Breakfast is included in the price of your room,not the best but its fine.Staff are very helpful and the manager said we could stay in our room after check out time on the day of out departure as our flight was later in the day.Excellent location, could not really fault the hotel in anyway.

Enjoyed a great stay at this hotel that has a family feeling. Perfectly installed in a suite with one big bedroom with 2 double beds and a living room with a small kitechette. Very clean, great room servive and friendly staff. Good location, close to 5th Avenue and St. Patricks Church.Only improvemente that I suggest is the complementary breakfast which lacks the quality that the rest of the hotel has.
A very nice hotel with friendly owner who let us have our room until four pm as we had a late flight. "I don't want to treat anyone like a foreigner," he said!

I needed 2 rooms, one Q/Q & 1 king, no exceptions. Most of the 4 & 5-star hotels in the Midtown/Upper East had no Q/Q this week, I guess because of Spring Break & Easter, so I was pleased to find one at the San Carlos & booked it thinking it could be a backup plan. Nothing else emerged, so I was hesitant but I was completely satisfied. I know a 4-star experience often comes with constant concierge, doorman, more happening lobby, on-site restaurant, but I require none of those (sometimes find them annoying, frankly), and the San Carlos has a small but perfectly clean and nice lobby and the concierge wasn't always around. But the rooms are HUGE and very clean, very decent linens, soft towels, and one of the quickest elevators ever. When we checked in, we were upgraded to a suite, which concerned me at first because bed-sharing wasn't an option and it meant I was on a sofa bed. She said, "Don't worry, it's very comfortable." I was skeptical, but she was right. It's a foam mattress and I requested a duvet and extra pillows, and they were promptly brought to the room. I slept well and only heard any noise from another room inside the hotel one time in 4 days. There was some expected street noise, but we were on the 12th floor, and it certainly didn't affect any sleep. And the suite had the sofa, 2 chairs, a desk, a huge dresser, a kitchenette with a fridge, microwave & sink, 2 barstools, and TWO closets with ample hangers. I had a very good experience with all the staff I worked with and would recommend a stay here for a low-frills, very nice experience.

After all the positive reviews, I felt this hotel was something of a let down. Our kids, ages 6 and 8, my husband, and self rented a junior suite. The room was adequate, but we probably did not get a remodeled one, as there was no flat panel. The breakfast was barely OK, coffee very mediocre, so would give it a pass. The hotel attendants were polite, but didn't have that joviality that I expected based on the reviews of this hotel. By NYC standards this 300 plus a night hotel was moderately priced, but I expected somewhat more for my money.

This was my second stay at the San Carlos. The rooms are large, bathroom spacious with lots of counter space and the staff friendly. The doorman was MIA most of the time, but that didn't really bother me. However, the street noise on E 50th this trip was unbearable. Apparently they are doing renovations in the building next door, and filling 20+ small dumpsters with debris, which gets dumped into a truck at 6 am. This process takes over an hour. So if you're travelling here soon, either plan for a 6 am wake up call or request a room away from E 50th.

This is a nice and greatly located hotel. The facilities and rooms are nice and comfortable. The staff is kind and willing to help.Wifi and breakfast are free and it has a useful busisness center if you are not travelling with your computer.In conclusion is a great hotel, a little expensive, but really nice.

My wife and I spent one night at the San Carlos Hotel last week and had a great time. The check-in took about 2 minutes and the man at the counter was very friendly. Everything in the hotel looked clean and new. Our room was on the ninth floor and was spotless. The room had a very comfortable bed, mini bar, microwave and comfortable chair for watching TV. The hotel is in a nice location on the east side and there are plenty of restaurants in the area. When checking out, the staff was alo great. The price was very reasonable for the quality of this hotel. I would recommend this hotel.

This was our second stay at San Carlos and it was well worth it to return! We were welcomed warmly by the front desk staff who quickly identified us as returning guests and received a room upgrade without even asking for one. The room was spacious (unlike the typical New York Hotel) updated and elegant. Excellent hotel for it's price and location. We will definitely plan more stays at the San Carlos!!!

I stayed over Christmas for 3 nights with my teenage son. The room was large and clean. The staff were attentive and cheery. All my needs were addressed quickly. Free internet. Comfy bed. Fairly noisy at night from the street-life but it IS New York after all. They loan out umbrellas when it rains (which it did). Exceptional midtown location (1 block from subway). It's hard to find fault anywhere except perhaps the breakfast. Included with our stay it was an okay breakfast though I've travelled to large European cities where breakfast is included and the food offered here (buffet style) would be considered low on the quality scale. Stick with the bagels, breads and yoghurts and you'll be fine. If only they didn't serve it on plastic plates and paper cups. What does that say about environmental concerns, the fast-filling landfills, and the need to recycle?Small concerns, I suppose, when rating an otherwise splendid hotel.

I stayed at San Carlos for one night in Nov because I had an event/dinner to attend to in midtownThe hotel is ina great lcoation in midtown East... ideal if you have business in the area or want to do a little shopping on 5th/madison.I was able to check in early (as requested) and the front desk clerk was friendly and fast. I had gotten an executive suite and I was very much pleased with the room - i like larger rooms rather than separate living areas/bedrooms. it had a small kitchenette that im sure would come in handy for longer stays or more people in a room. the bathroom is pretty standard sized - good for one person but i can see how it would be a tight fit for two people to be in at oncethe bed is very comfy and the a/c worked great. the window face e 50th but i didnt notice any noise from outdoors/the street but thats probably because there were no windows near the bed. i also didnt notice any "hallway traffic" or my neighbours through the walls. as my friend called it, "sturdy craftmenship" loli didnt try the complimentary breakfast buffet so cant comment on that. there are tons of great grab & go restaurants on lexington (pret a manger, hale & hearty, etc) and im sure the mini fridge will come in handy for stocking up on a few goodies & treats!i didnt have my laptop with me but wi-fi is free, just make sure the front desk provides you with the access codethis is a great hotel... i often have events/business in midtown east and the location and service of san carlos will bring me back!
user_name:
leetlesasa
New York City, New York

review_body: I wish there was a 3.5 option in overall ratings for this hotel. 4 seems too high, but 3 too low.This hotel is very much as OP's have described. I found it to be a very good value. Pros:Very large rooms which are also VERY clean, lots of closet space, light-blocking window shades, good beds with good quality linens, very friendly multi-lingual staff, good location (altho I personally prefer the west side as it is easier to get around), excellent access to computers and printers- I think there may have been 8 stations- WIFI fast and dependable. Cons:We really could have used another bath or half-bath (3 women and 1 man), Breakfast was not much- yogurt, cottage cheese, coffee, juice, some rather dried out pastries..probably one of the worst "continental breakfasts" anywhere.Noise- the street noise did not bother me too much, but both daughters and husband commented on it. Oldest daughter said to me, "mom, this is the noisiest place we've stayed in NY". Not sure why this is a problem as the street in front is not really a busy street, but there did seem to be a great deal of honking at all hours. If you think this might annoy you, ask for a room that does not face the street.We tried 'Mint", the eating establishment connected to the hotel- not impressed.My husband, our two 20-something daugthers, and myself were visiting NYC and I was looking for a way to avoid 2 hotel rooms at $275 - $325/night for each room for the weekend after Thanksgiving.The San Carlos had a suite with 2 queens in the bedroom and a pullout sleeper in the LR, along with a small "kitchenette" (microwave, sink, refrigerator and utensils) for $300/night. The reviews here on TA were favorable, so I booked it for 3 nights.Thanks to other members for their helpful reviews of this hotel. Very accurate reviews!Saved us hundreds of dollars over 2 separate rooms without sacrificing too much in the way of comfort and space.
user_name:
Kathleen M
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Exceptional friendly service at this midtown hotel.Cosy, quiet clean room with very comfy bed, though tiny bathroom the only downside.

The San Carlos proved to be an excellent choice! The rooms are clean, large (two queen beds) and the bathrooms are modern. Our room had a fridge, microwave and utensils. The location is ideal - across the the street from the Benjamin and Waldolf Astoria. I should also add I never heard any street noise. I would be hard pressed to find a reason not to stay at the San Carlos again.Finally, there is a continental breakfast included. We never tried it out but it didn't look very good.

My husband and I usually stay at the Elysee Hotel but the rates were well over $400 per room for this week. Hubby was in NYC for business and I tagged along. Friends on Trip Advisor recommended the San Carlos over the Affinia 50 for a "suites hotel". We got a nonrefundable rate of $310 per night for an "Executive Suite".The San Carlos is located in a great neighborhood. It is very quiet and very clean. Our room was very nice and large. King sized bed with a living area and small kitchen. The staff was great. The continental breakfast was minimal. They offer muffins and breads. Not quite sure why they do not offer bagels.We would definitely stay here again.

This is our third time staying at the San Carlos, and it was pleasant, as always. We had one room, with two nice beds (no view). The room was clean and comfortable, and the staff is just great. Everyone is friendly and helpful. The free breakfast is a nice touch, but the food is very mediocre--various breads that don't seem particularly fresh, yogurt, cottage cheese, coffee, and juice. We ate it two out of three mornings, but couldn't face it the third morning. The other times we have stayed there, they have had the exact same thing every morning. I wish they would throw in some cereal, oatmeal (packets), and waffles (they do have a toaster). These things would improve the breakfast fare tremendously. The "business center" is nice--quite a few free-use computers and couches. We hung out there for several hours after we checked out until it was time to leave for our plane. One more thing--we were never supplied with hair conditioner in our bathroom, and we had not brought any, so our hair was a mess on this trip. If you stay here, better bring at least a little, just in case.

I was booked into the Bedford on East 40th, but they over booked & sent us to the San Carlos which is in the same ownership as the Bedford. What a delight. Great beds with either two doubles or queen (i forget) soft pillows, breakfast included. Eating places everywhere (par for N York), pleasant staff including the owner. Recommended. Would like to stay there again.Mike Normanhurst Australia

Stayed for 8 nights recently and was not disappointed. We got a great rate through the hotels website for an executive suite. Ample room for 2 people. Kingsize bed comfortable. The housekeeping service was fantastic, they kept that room spotless everyday. Rooms were quiet, aircon worked beautifully. Wifi bonus.The cable tv was a bit dissappointing, an upgrade to a few more interesting channels would be good. As suggested, breakfast is very basic. We bought tubs of cereal at the convenience store across the road and took them in to eat. Also took our real tea cups down to breakfast. We also had a couple of hot breakfasts across the road at the "new york lucheonette"-good. The japanese restuarant across the rd is great, ate there a couple of nights, and there is a fantastic indian around the corner near the steak place. You can walk to broadway easily from there - we made a five minute dash to catch a show. The subway is on the next corner and once you get to know yourway around is fantastic way to travel. Never wait longer than 3 minutes for a train. The hotel was our oasis to return to after a hard day of pounding the pavement to regroup have a drink then either relax or get out there again. We will be back.

Great location close to main sights. Good room including large separate sitting area where the kids slept. Good value without being exciting but also without disappointment. Breakfast included but is basic but really all you need. Feels a bit cheap with plastic plates, cutlery etc. A 3/4* but generally good value.

I found many things to like at the San Carlos. It is the rare NYC hotel that has "double-bedded" rooms with two QUEEN beds. Most hotels only offer a single king or queen bed and those that have two beds only have the smaller, double-sized beds. Wifi was recently installed in the guest rooms and it worked extremely well. We had three computers going at once with really fast connections. If you drive into the city, the hotel's discounted parking in the garage next door is a big perk. We got great service from every employee we encountered. This is a small hotel so there was very little noise from other guests and the lobby was serene. This probably was an apartment building in a past life and it has been renovated with mixed results. The bedding, bathrobes and soaps are luxurious, but the floor creaks with every footstep. The drab decor could use a decorators touch. Every wall, the floors, window curtains and shower curtain are all very blah beige. There is limited room service provided by the Indian restaurant in the building.

Second trip to the San Carlos. This time, we stayed 4 nights in a suite. Not cheap, of course, but we needed two beds and a couch, and having a separate living room is a real plus. The service is, I would guess, as good as you would get spending $900 a night rather than $275 plus tax. The rooms are spacious, the ambience is quiet, and the owner (who is there every morning, I think) is a joy to talk to.The service at the hotel is first-rate. It *can* be a problem getting a cab at a busy time, but they try hard for you, at the door. (In a pinch, you could sneak over to the Waldorf and pretend to be a customer). And if you are going to the airport, they'll have a cab at the door, if you ask. I'll add to the chorus, though: For such a superb hotel, the breakfast really is subpar. I believe they have plans to upgrade it.For many a tourist, the location really can' t be beat. The Waldorf is just out the back door, and it's worth the money to splurge for tea or a cocktail there. St. Patrick's and Rockefeller Center are an easy walk, and on a nice day there is nothing nicer than to take a cab or the subway up to the Metropolitan Museum, and walk back through the Park or down Madison Avenue. And for a Broadway show, if you've got legs, its close enough to walk back from a Broadway play if you can't get a cab.And while we didn't go to a play, we *did*, some of us, stroll down to Grand Central to eat at the Oyster Bar.

We were staying at the Affinia 50 which is directly across the street and moved here on the second day of our one week stay in New York City. We were very happy with the change. The lobby is lovely and tastefully decorated. It was always calm and quiet. The staff were warm and welcoming. The rooms were tastefully decorated with lovely linens, furniture and had a relaxing feel. It always felt great to return every day from a long day of playing tourist. Our stay included a continental breakfast which was simple but nice. A newspaper awaited by the door every weekday morning. We would highly recommend this hotel and would gladly return on our next trip back to the Big Apple.

We planned to go into the city for a long weekend with two friends and didn't want to spend a fortune on just eating, partying, and the sites. We were all happy with our choice. We needed a room that could hold us in 3 seperate beds. The San Marcos offers a two QUEEN bedded suite with a pull out sofa which was a perfect sleeping set up for this trip without having to get two rooms. The room and common areas are very nice for a 3 star. This smaller property is a 3.5 and could be higher except that it is more an apartment rental than a large full service hotel. The service is VERY GOOD, it's just limited to the basics. Concierge, front desk, doormen, maid service, maintenance were all very helpful and friendly. The hotel does not offer room service or a bar ( except for the one restaurant that we didn't need to use ). It does however offer 24 hour front desk and doormen, internet, and a small cardio gym, InnCom, flatscreens and usual inroom amens. The room and common areas are up to date, pretty well maintained, and clean. The rate for our room was reasonable for 3 nights, 4 people, at 1048.US. The website for the San Marcos matches what we found and we were pleased with our stay. Am leaving the 4's on this review because you should be happy with this 3 star level hotel.

Traveled with my friend and our 2 teens. The staff was so friendly, welcoming and helpful in every possible way. The room was large, immaculate and comfortable. The beds were amazing and it included a nice continental breakfast. We felt cosseted and pampered. I have often traveled with my husband on business to more well known, fancy chain hotels and never felt so welcomed or well cared for. I am telling all of my friends about this place and plan to make it our regular stop for travels to New York City. Check their own website for any offered specials.

My stay at the San Carlos is not my first. I have always have had an excellent time, from the time you come in, you are treated like royalty. The staff, not enough can be said about the staff, so respectful. The owner of the San Carlos should be very proud of the employees they hire. He must have very high standards! There is nothing but good things that I can say about this fantastic hotel in the middle of everything! I am so happy I have chosen the San Carlos. Sincerely, Anna A.

We stayed at the San Carlos, 4 girls in a 1 bedroom suite on the 3rd floor. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The room was clean and big enough for us girls and all of our stuff. The staff was great especially all of the Bellman that were working during our stay. They were very helpful in getting Taxi's, directions and even umbrellas.. One thing though, if you are on the lower floors facing 50th, you will hear alot of traffic noise (fire engine sirens, trash trucks etc.) That will not stop us though from staying there again.
Quiet, peaceful, heck of a location, roomy by New York standards.The walls appear to be a little thicker than the standard. Which means that the BOOM from closing doors is mitigated.

My husband and I stayed at the San Carlos for a combination business/leisure trip. I was there for 4 nights and my husband for 6. Before our arrival we called to request a front facing room and when my husband checked in they had upgraded him to a lovely, large room with a sofa, two comfortable chairs and a small kitchen area. It was a very nice surprise.We have stayed at this hotel before and once again everyone on the staff was very friendly and accommodating. The location is terrific, on 50th Street near 3rd Avenue, convenient to subways, buses and within walking distance of many things the city has to offer. The area has many restaurants serving any type of food you might want. One of our favorites is Sip-Sak, a Turkish restaurant on 2nd Avenue. I have only minor complaints about the San Carlos. As other Trip Advisor reviewers have mentioned, the continental breakfast is not very good. It would be much better if they offered cereal and yogurts in addition to breads and pastries. The other is that the hair dryer provided is too small and doesn't have enough power. I would definitely recommend the San Carlos and hope to stay there again the next time we are in New York City.

We arrived at the Bedford Hotel and found out we were being moved to the San Carlos -- really glad we were. Friendly front desk staff set us up in a quite large room (especially by Manhattan standards), very clean, comfortable, etc. A few issues: hair dryer did not work, one electrical outlet was dead, first set of keys didn't open the door -- all minor stuff, just annoying. The location at 50th and 3rd couldn't be much easier, 5-minute walk to Rockefeller, 10-15 minute walk to Broadway, Central Park, Grand Central. Thumbs up from me.

This intimate little hotel is truly a gem. Last time we visited NYC we stayed at the Marriott across from the Waldorf. WHAT a difference! San Carlos is spotlessly clean, spacious, quiet and well appointed. The microwave, fridge and dishes and cutlery for 2 were fantastic. The beds were comfy and warm. We thoroughly enjoyed our visit and will most definitely return to this location again and again. The front desk staff, concierge and the maid service were stellar. EVERY consideration was no trouble. The door staff and the breakfast servers bent over backwards for us. This place was a total find out of the CAA handbook and we heartily recommend it.

Just up from the Rockafella Plaza near the Waldorf Astoria Is The San Carlos. Its not big but what it lacks in size it makes up for every other way. The staff are great, breakfast really nice, the room is clean and pleasant and the location is fabulous and well within walking distance of Times Square and the big stores. We really enjoyed our stay here and will be coming again. A great find!

We chose this hotel because some friends had already been there and told us it was great. Tehy were absolutely right.The staff is really nice. The guy that helps you with your luggage got us tickets for a concert which was impossible to get weeks before.The room was really big and clean, although the view was not so nice. But the good thing was the silence.Everyday we could check teh email, the access was free and only twice we had to wait for a couple of minutes to use one of the computers.Breakfast was bagles, pastry and bread, juice, coffee or tea. But it was free.We would definetly repeat.
user_location: Las Palmas de Gran Canaria, Spain
user_name:
algea
Las Palmas de Gran Canaria, Spain

review_body: Having just returned from New York first time visitor to the city, have to say it, ill Be Back, Yes the hotel San Carlos and all its staff were a dream come true, read the reviews on this hotel prior to departure, and i can fully recommend it to any one visiting the Big Apple.The Location was great, the reception staff doormen in fact all staff could not have been more helpful, if and when i go back, this is where i will stay, and this hotel i would recommend to any one visiting New York. We traveled in a party of 3 my wife and daughter, we had a smoking room,that i requested, which are becoming rare in this day and age, the room was great beds great, facilities in room, great, amenities in hotel were also top notch, they area was safe as is New York and i mean that, they area has shops restaurants very close by not far to walk for main attractions, or grab a taxi which the door staff can arrange and cheap. What more can i say apart from well done San Carlos you made our trip from Scotland an experience that we will never forget, warm friendly people you are a credit to the hotel and New Yorkers Will see you in the future thats a promise.

We stayed here for 4 nights on route from New Zealand to Ft Lauderdale where we were picking up a cruise.We choose this hotel becasue of its location and good sized rooms and the fact they served complimentary continental breakfast. For us, this was the most expensive hotel we stayed in on our trip because of our weak NZ dollar-( a hotel charging the same rate in NZ would give you a entire suite with harbour views, balcony and a full buffet breakfast.) I digress!We arrived at night and check in was smooth.The room was quite big for a Manhattan hotel and nicely appointed. We had heaps of floor space to put out suitcases and purchases. The hotel itself is in a great spot- handy to the subway station one block up and the Rockefeller centre and 5th Ave shops.As some of the other reviews have stated the continental breakfast was poor and let this hotel down. The plastic plates, paper cups and plastic cutlery made this hotel seem cheap.It is not hard to put on a simple but nice breakfast. Also all the disposable cutlery and plates etc is not really good for the environment- especially in light of the global drive to go green. Surely some proper knives and forks and china plates and a dishwasher would be more environmentally friendly??Suggestion for breakfast food:bowls of fruit freshchoice of 3 stewed/canned fruit with a choice of cereals/muesli and yougurtsa good selection of bread to make toast- some pastriesplatters of sliced cheese, tomatoes, hamselcetion of spreads eg jams, peanut butter, marmiteteas and coffeeThis is easy and cost effective.We choose to go to Pret a Manger for breakfast after expericencing the first morning's food on offer!Other than the breakfast we really enjoyed our stay here, the complimentary use of the computers on level 2 was excellent.We would probably stay here again if the breakfast improved.

I recently stayed at the San Carlos for the 1st time after reading the Trip Advisor reviews. The experience was excellent. I booked an Executive Suite and it was HUGE - over 400 square feet. It had a kitchenette (microwave & fridge), a living area with a sleeper sofa and a separate (but open) sleeping area. The employees were all very friendly and helpful. The complimentary breakfast was full of fresh pastries and hot coffee, tea and OJ. The computer lounge on the 2nd floor was a nice feature. My room was on the 11th floor and faced 50th. It was definitely noisy, but it's NYC!I have stayed at The Library on my last few visits and while the vibe there is definitely cooler, I will most likely choose the San Carlos again for the room size alone.

We arrived using Supershuttle at San Carlos Hotel and right away we knew we were going to be looked after. The porter helped us with our bags, the staff were full of holiday cheer and answered my constant questions.The room had 2 queen beds and a small bathroom. It was well decorated and enough space for all our purchases!! There was a turn-down service but we never had enough chocolates left on our pillows!! Also for some strange reason our bin was never emptied, but as we were in the room for such a little time it did not bother us.The breakfast was basic but it was included and filled us up till lunch, croissants, muffins yoghurt, orange juice, tea, coffee and various small danish pastries. The breakfast area is not huge so you may have to wait for a table.The staff answered all the questions and we had some great nights sleep due to being in a quiet room. We would recommend this hotel. I have stayed in NYC five times and this has definitely been the friendliest of all the hotels. Oh there was also free internet access on the second floor which meant we could book our seats for our flights home and check emails.

My husband and I checked into the San Carlos after staying four nights at the Hotel Elysee. We preferred the San Carlos hands down. Our 7th floor suite was spacious, clean, and well appointed. The hotel staff was exceptionally welcoming and made us feel like we were family. The location is excellent--1/2 block east of the Waldorf Astoria and very close to the subway, restaurants and shopping. We passed on the breakfast and instead enjoyed the nearby ldiners that locals frequent. We had a great time at the San Carlos and wished that we had spent our entire week there. The owner also introduced himself and was absolutely delightful. We can't wait to return!

My spouse and I arrived at the San Carlos on a Wed night for a 2-night stay. We checked in and were told we "were upgraded to a better room", whatever that meant - but we were pleased. We arrived on the 4th floor and immediately all you could smell was stale smoke. We overlooked this assuming our room would be fine, but it too also smelled badly of stale smoke. I thought rooms in NYC were non-smoking, but apparently I was wrong given the air purifier functioning in our room, as well as an ashtray in the top drawer of the nightsand. After trying to deal with it for about an hour, we finally we down and asked for a new room. We were told the bell captain would be right up to move us. After 20 minutes of packing, and still no bell captain, I finally went downstairs asked for our keys to our new room, and headed back up sans the bell captain to help us. My spouse and I relocated to what was promised to be a "comparable room" on the 6th floor. Unfortunately we got downgraded from a King to a Queen, and also had a handicapped room with a disgusting tile bathroom floor with visible dirt in the cracks. To make matters worse, I opened the toilet and found someone else's waste there - unflushed! I flushed once, and quickly realized the issue, it was clogged. Immediately water started running over the top and on to the floor - so we called the front desk. Staff showed up with a wet/dry vac and got rid of the water, but not the feeling in the back of our head that we would now be using a bathroom where fecies had spilled over and on to the floor. One of the perks was that after about 10 minutes after this fiasco we did receive a platter of wine and other snacks as an apology from the hotel. Other positive notes of the hotel included the location, free wireless, and a second floor business center/lounge area with 6 working computers. In hotels much larger than the San Carlos, I have seen just one or two computers that the hotel expects all guests to share. It wa a welcome sight to see the 6 options available.In short, we had a bad experience that kept our stay from being really enjoyable. I hope it was a one time issue and just bad luck.

I loved everything about this hotel, the breakfast, the staff, the location, and the cleanliness of our room. It was nice to have amenities as a coffee pot, microwave, and iron. On the second floor there are even computers for the guest to use. It was great to be able to check-in for my air flight and print my boarding passes ahead of time. For a New York hotel it was a pleasure, although costly. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Perfect location for a wonderful New York City experience. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. They made us feel comfortable so that it was easier to enjoy our trip. Our room was spacious and the furnishings seemed new. The room was very clean when we arrived and then maintained that way during our stay. The continental breakfast was convenient. There was even hot milk for our coffee, just the way we like it. All of our requests were cheerfully handled by a hotel staff that clearly enjoys working at the San Carlos.We will definitely stay again and will recommend the San Carlos to our friends.

My husband and I arrived on a Sunday afternoon (after 3 pm). I don't recall seeing a doorman/doorwoman to greet us (not a biggie) at the time. We had no problems with check-in, though we did detect a bit of a "stuffy" attitude from one of the front desk clerks. Not sure what that was all about. That was the only time we experienced any attitude. The other times we communicated with the front desk, whether in person or on the phone, we had no problems. I guess everyone has a bad day.We got our keys and settled into our room on the fourth floor. The room size was decent, I must say (I heard some hotel rooms are really small in NYC; we reserved a room with a king-size bed). OK, there were some, how do I put this, "housekeeping" issues that needed to be addressed. I will preface the following by saying this: I'm kind of "anal retentive" when it comes to bath towels, bathrobes, etc. There were some dark stains on the rug (perhaps a carpet cleaning would do the trick). Also, when I got into bed that evening, our bed sheet had a rip in it. When I was hanging up some of my clothes in the closet, there were two San Carlos hotel bathrobes hanging up that clearly needed to be thrown out. They had stains on them and were ripped. Finally, the next morning when I went to get into the shower, I found one of the towels had a bar of soap stuck to it. Ew! I called housekeeping, and someone promptly brought me fresh, warm towels to replace all of the ones that were in our room. Before we left to go sight-seeing that morning, I left a couple of notes, asking for new bathrobes to use (I wound up not using them, but thought perhaps the next guests might want ones that weren't nasty) as well as a bed sheet that wasn't torn. When we got back that evening, not only were my requests honored, we were given extra Aveda amenities and mints on our pillows. Well done!The bed was VERY comfortable and the shower was great! We slept like a rock (room was pretty quiet). Loved the Aveda products! I didn't realize they make mouthwash, too.The complimentary breakfast was pretty good (OK, so they didn't have a hot breakfast, but muffins, pastries, yogurt, cottage cheese, bagels, fruit, juice and coffee..what more do you want?!). There was one morning we didn't make breakfast; we wound up going to the Morningstar Tavern for breakfast (as well as a couple of other meals...their menu is enormous, and the prices are fairly reasonable). The hotel is also conveniently located near the subway and lots of attractions. When it was time to leave, Luis, the bellman/doorman, was very helpful. He helped with our luggage and hailed us a cab to Penn Station.

It's not easy finding a good hotel in New York City that fits the budget - so we splurged a bit for our couple of nights in New York.Check In isn't until 3pm and we had arrived there earlier in the day. The staff were helpful and held our bags while we went sight seeing. The hotel is located right near Rockefeller Center and a 15 minute walk to Times Square. We had a room on a higher floor to reduce the noise levels which made it easier to sleep at night.We had a suite, since a couple of friends were joining us the second night in the city. There was a King size bed and also a fold out bed from the sofa. Service was great, in particular, when we ordered take-out and had it delivered to our room (very late at night too), the service manager accompanied the delivery man to our room, to make sure we were safe. Little things like that made us feel more comfortable with our stay.The room also came with robes...not an unusual thing but it's always a nice perk. The furnishings were modern and comfortable & if you request, you can have a dvd player bought to your room and they'll set it up for you.It was a nice place, but then, you get what you pay for...

A colleague booked me into the San Carlos for a 3 day business trip to NY. I welcomed the quick check-in, great location, large room, and efficient service. My room was nice, but by no means cheap. Overall, I was impressed, until breakfast, that is. The hotel serves an appalling "continental" breakfast. I was staying in a lovely room in what I thought was a smart hotel, yet when it came to breakfast about 40 guests were cramped into a windowless room which served the most awful pastries I have ever had (a colleague verified this!), with not enough seats and terrible plastic plates and cups, yuk, what a shame.I would probably try one of the other hotels on the same street next time, or if I stay in the San Carlos I'd skip breakfast. I think management should review the breakfast situtation as it is so poor I don't think offering it does the hotel any favours.
Great location, nice two room suite with good facilities.Helpful staff, very basic continental breakfast

We had a great time in New York. The San Carlos was a great place to come back to after long days of sight seeing and shopping. The staff could not have been more courteous. It was a pleasant surprise to be greeted by name and to receive prompt and gracious service.

We (family of 3 with an 18 year old daughter) stayed in San Carlos in July 2008. Chose it because of a special deal that gave 3rd night free for a 3 day suite booking and of course because of the positive views here in the Tripadvisor. However, I must say San Carlos didn't meet the high expectations set by those positive views. It is a very typical boutique hotel that there are even 5 in the 50 meter radius from the hotel (in fact stayed at Affinia50 opposite San Carlos last year and preferred it more). San Carlos is not bad but there is nothing really special for the price you are paying. Yes, there is a complimentary continental breakfast included but it is in a windowless corner room and with a very limited offering that can be beaten by any basic 2 star airport hotel. Maybe the worst disappointment was for the service. It wasn't overly friendly and you had to ask for everything rather than the service being offered. It was also disappointing that during the first day the receptionist was selling us a helicopter tour and his only reason was "You should really do it because we get a commission for it. You should help us make our living". I hate it when the service people see customers being there just to make their living rather than them being there making the customer happy. Left a really bad taste about the whole place which was a shame. Won't be back.

The location of the hotel was fantastic, near a metro station in Middletown East. We were from a walking distance of the UN, Time Square, Rockerfeller Center, Empire State Building, 5th Avenue, etc.The room we got was not great. We were on the first floor and we had view on the ventilation exit. So, no direct light in the room. Beside that, the room was big for New York standards.The breakfast was not great. Just a few toast and some pastries, but these were not tasty.The good point is that the hotel has a free Wifi access and free computers with internet connections.

This was our sixth time in NY, but our first time at the San Carlos. As we were four adults travelling, we took advantage of the third night free offer on suites at the San Carlos which gave us quite a saving over two separate rooms. The suite we had was great with a very large sitting room. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and accommodating and the free breakfast was a bonus. Being British it would have been good to have had a kettle or similar in the room, but apart from that we have no complaints at all and we had a great stay at the San Carlos. The location was very good and within easy walking distance of many attractions and the Hop on Hop off bus stopped just around the corner. We forgot to ask for a high room, so there was some noise at night - but this was our fault for not thinking about it in advance. Fortunately we were so tired that it didn't make much difference. The air conditioning, by the way, was excellent - climate controlled and very efficient as well as quiet, compared to some others we have experienced in New York. I would highly recommend this hotel.

A lovely hotel in a great location. I fell in love with the shower -- super-hot water and powerful shower head made me feel like I'd had a spa treatment every time I took a shower! The hotel was really pretty quiet, too.I didn't much care for the continental breakfast, as the pickings were slim and some of the pastries seemed stale. But if they could just make that one little improvement, I'd call this hotel perfect.

Stayed 5 nights here at end of May, could not fault the hotel in any way. After reading previous reviews on Tripadvisor we upgraded our room to an executive suite, which was well worth it. Some commented on the tiredness of the rooms but we have to disagree as ours was really nice. We were on 6th floor so could hardly hear any noise from streets below. Huge queen bed. double sofa bed for kids, 3 armchairs, 2 big wardrobes, iron and board, safe, minibar, tv. Also had a small kitchen area with fridge, microwave, utensils etc.. and breakfast bar. All the staff were extremely polite and helpful.Did not have the complimentary breakfast so can't comment on that. Went to Morning Star Diner most mornings, 2 mins from hotel, for an excellent start to the day, fantastic place and good value. We bought New york passes before traveling which saves time and money. Weather ideal at this time of year for sightseeing. Our kids are 14 and 8 and one of their best things was 'THE BEAST', its a 30 minute speedboat ride leaving from pier 83 where the Circle Line criuses operate.
