You get WET, very WET, and thats mostly from the crazy guys who run it! They have Supersoaker water guns and water balloons, and play LOUD music, its madness! They take you around statue of Liberty, so you do get a bit of culture!!!!

My husband, daughter and I stayed at the San Carlos for 4 days, 3 nights. Got a deal on a 1 bedroom suite with sofabed. We paid for 2 nights and got 3rd night free. Hotel was attractive and staff was friendly. We stayed on the 3rd floor so we had a slight problem with outside noise at night.

I've been to NYC many times but never stayed the night- read many reviews and San Carlos Hotel was the only one which had great reviews on TripAdvisor. Hotel lived up to every expectation! Clean room, large, we got a free upgrade to an executive suite. Staff was wonderful and humorous- they even advised me that the miny bar was a rip off and to get my goodies somewhere else! Great suggestions for restaurants and they gave us stop by stop instructions for how to get everywhere we wanted to go on the subway. Absolutely the best hotel in this price range, and from the other reviews, better than most that are more expensive. Stay here for a wonderful trip with it's central location (1 block from 6 train which is 1 stop from Grand Central) and only a $7 cab fare from Times Square.

I stayed at the San Carlos Hotel for business in November 2007. I found the service exceptional, the room price high (it was over the holiday season), and the breakfast satisfactory.My room had a small kitchenette, which had I been traveling on vacation, perhaps I would have used, but being on a business trip, I only walked by in order to get to the bedroom area. The hotel has an eye for detail, and I enjoyed the small luxury feel, but it is not a requirement for me when I'm in New York. I spend about 16 hours outside of my hotel room on average per day, so while the San Carlos would probably be a nice place to actually spend some time IN the hotel room, I never do, so it's a bit lost on me.

The San Carlos is a great place to stay in New York - it's central, in a safe area and the room, though not huge, was pleasant and clean. You need to bear in mind you are staying in a city and your building is surrounded by other buildings- be reasonable, you are NOT going to get a view, are you?One of the best things was the complimentary continental buffet breakfast (between 7 and 10am) - you should realise this is really unusual in this city and the pastries etc were very tasty. As you are likely to be eating a huge lunch in a deli/restaurant (bearing in mind NY portion sizes!) this was just what was needed to start the day.Desk staff were pleasant too - nothing was too much trouble. We really enjoyed our stay there.

What a pleasure it was to stay overnight at the San Carlos last week! I am in New York every other month or so, to visit famliy, and none of us had ever heard of the San Carlos before! I usually like to stay in midtown, and the location, at the intersection of 50th and Lexington ,is central to many NY attractions (although it is about a $13 cab fare to downtown). Check-in was a breeze. The lobby is small, but simple, elegant and quiet. I booked a Corner Superior Room for $399 a night (mid week) and found out I had been upgraded to a Corner One Bed Room Suite! Sweet!!!!! Our room (701) was on the 7th floor. It had a mini kitchenette (microwave, sink, table, chairs, coffeemaker, plates, glasses, etc.), a very generous size sitting room, a nice size bedroom with a large queen bed (maybe a small king, we couldn't quite tell), a full bath (large by NY standards) and 2 generous closets. In addition, we had 2 flat screen TVs, fully stocked mini-bar and Aveda bath products. Our views of 50th St. and Lex. were great. You can hear a bit of street noise from the 7th floor, but I am a very light sleeper, and it did not disturb me.The bedding was very soft and comfortable, but the bed was a little harder than I like it. As I was getting ready for bed, I noticed a little sign on the nightstand that said that housekeeping will has various pillows and bed toppers to chose from. I was too tired at that point to see if they has a pillow top for my mattress.The room and bathroom were spotless, as were all common areas. I never had to wait for more than a minute or so for an elevator. My room rate included a continental breakfast, which was served in a room off the lobby. The breakfast was adequate. All tables were taken, so I took my cottage cheese, yogurt and pastry up to my suite, and enjoyed it there. All of the staff I encountered was super friendly and helpful. Someone at the front desk got my husband and I a dinner reservation at Avra for that evening, after we had called ourselves, and were told they were all booked. I don't even think she was a conceirge, but like I said, the staff was wonderful!There is an Indian restaurant on-site, but the room service menu was very limited. If room service is very important to you, this is the one area that this hotel seems lacking in.As a veteran NYC traveler, I 100% recommend the San Carlos hotel.

We've used a number of hotels in the New York area for business travel, most recently the Marriott East Side on Lexington Avenue. The San Carlos is just around the corner from the Marriott but light years ahead in terms of attitude and service. All in all, this was one of the best hotel experiences we've had in New York.Our holiday was a family trip consisting of two adults and two children (11, 5). We booked an Executive suite which as well as the usual huge double bed contained a sofa bed, armchairs, separate dining area and kitchenette. The suite was extremely well kept and provided a very comfortable base for the six day holiday. The hotel is two blocks away from the major shops on Fifth Avenue and a block away from the nearest subway station. Concierge services seemed to be more of a team effort than other hotels and I believe the guests benefit from this approach. In particular Matthew, Quron and Jamal were excellent.We didn't hang around for breakfast at the hotel, but went instead to the Morning Star Cafe on 2nd Avenue. The kids loved this place, it was literally just up the road and offered good food, quick service and set us up for a day of activity.The San Carlos is a wholehearted recommendation for a New York visit and we intend to stay there again.

Four of us stayed for 4 nights at the end of February 2008. This was our first visit to New York and we weren't sure what to expect. We shouldn't have been concerned. We had booked direct with the hotel two de luxe bedrooms but on arrival were upgraded to suites. These were excellent with a lounge area separate from the bedroom, 2 TVs, large bathroom, cooking facilities and so on. There was relatively little noise from traffiic which came as a pleasant surprise. As typical Brits who like to indulge in the cooked breakfast when we go walking in the UK we did wonder about the continental breakfast. This proved an an excellent start to each day. Tthe location was excellent with many sights only a short walking distance.The staff were extermely courteous and helpful- nothing was too much trouble and Matthew in particular was a gem!The four of us thoroughly enjoyed our stay and have no hesitation in recommending San Carlos as a great place to stay.

We really liked this hotel. We decided to stay there based on other reviews we had read and they were spot on. Our first room was on the small side even for NY and only had a Queen bed (we booked a king) They quickly accommodated us and move us to a King room that was extremely large for a hotel in NY. The location is perfect, within walking distance of St Pat's Cathedral and Radio City Music Hall. In the room was also a small fridge, microwave and dishes/utensils. The staff were very friendly and accommodating. Overall a great experience at a reasonable price.

Just back from a four night stay in a one bed suite with my husband and eighteen year old daughter.We were delighted with the space and cleanliness of the suite. We had a very nice sitting room area with comfy sofa bed for our daughter. Two bathrooms and nice kitchen area which was handy for coffee and snacks.Staff were very pleasant and helpful. Continental breakfast was fine with good choice of breads, buns, yogurts, lovely juice and tea/coffee. However I think it would easy to supply small packets of cereal or at least yogurt with cereal on top.The price seemed pretty good for New York but it is annoying to be hit with $60 tax per night when checking out.Overall the location of this hotel is great and our suite was very comfortable and relaxing to come back to after a busy day out and about. Our room was at the front and there was some street noise which only bothered us once or twice early in the morning.We would return to this hotel but request a room at the back next time.One tip about shopping: Friends told us about a great mall in New Jersey called Garden State Plaza. We took a bus from port authority bus terminal. It took 40 minutes and was well worth it. It has most of the stores that are in New York including Macys and it is much easier to walk around than the busy NY streets. Also whatever the weather you stay warm and dry!
Enyoed my stay, great location and free terminals to use the internet. Coffee and bagel for breakfast. Great

I stayed at the San Carlos Hotel for three nights in January. The room was very spacious by NYC standards. The accommodations were clean and well kept. The coffee pot and refrigerator were much appreciated. With its address on E. 50th between Third and Lexington Avenues, the San Carlos is an ideal location. The Lexington Ave subway is around the corner, Rockefeller Center and Fifth Ave shopping is three blocks west, and the Times Square area is several blocks west. If you wish to avoid the craziness but still feel close to Times Square and the theater district, this hotel is an excellent choice. On the second floor overlooking the lobby, the San Carlos provides three computers 24/7. There is also a printer which is helpful for “e-ticket” boarding passes. If you simply can’t leave the lap-top at home, there is wireless access throughout the hotel. Breakfast at San Carlos consists of a variety of breads (including raisin bread), rolls and bagels for toasting, as well as pastries, yogurt and cottage cheese. The dark chocolate pastry roll was particularly good! There was a fruit basket with the usual suspects, too. Beverages included coffee, tea, orange juice and a pitcher of water. Overall, I would say the San Carlos is a good choice for location and accommodation. There are more fashionable places to stay in NYC, but for a fair price the San Carlos has a lot to offer.

Stayed at the San Carlos on a business trip from 1/15-1/18 and was very impressed. Years ago I had stayed across the street at the old Plaza 50 which is now the Affinia 50 and knew this was a great location. I got a great deal on a one bedroom suite on a buy two get the third night free special. What a bargain! The room was huge and a great place to unwind, stretch out, and get some work done in the evenings. There were two bathrooms, a nice kitchenette, and ample space. My colleagues were at the Hilton by our office on W.55th street and were all complaining about their rooms. My only, and I mean only, negative comment about the experience was regarding the continental breakfast. I didn't mind the small selection however what was there wasn't very good. That's a very trivial gripe however and in no way would impact my decision to stay there in the future. I will be back!

This hotel is in the best location on 50th and Lexington. We were within walking distance of all the great shopping (after Christmas sales!), sights and restaurants. There is no need to stray more than a few blocks for great dinners at some of the best restaurants NYC has to offer. The Rockerfeller Center is 3 blocks away, Central Park and Times Square are just a bit further. We hardly needed to use any transportation because we were able to walk almost everywhere we wanted to go. There is a subway station conveniently located on the corner.We stayed in a 1 bedroom apartment on the 11th floor. The space was perfect for our family of four. It was clean, nicely decorated and roomy for NYC. The kids slept on the sofa bed in the living area. The kitchenette was helpful for snacks (we had jet lag, having traveled from Asia) and the continental breakfast downstairs was perfect for our light breakfast eaters. The only downside of our stay was having to be moved to another room on our last night because our bath was leaking into the room below (we had no idea). The staff was very apologetic and did their best to make the move easy for us. The new room on the 10th floor had a lower ceiling and was a bit darker than our previous room. The attached Indian restaurant "Mint" is very good. Try the mint paneer which our whole family loved. The green lighting is a bit odd but the food is good. Across the street is a good family diner, across the corner is the Waldorf Astoria and their restaurants, etc.The hotel staff was very helpful and friendly. Matthew the bellman was particularly wonderful to our family and helped us in numerous ways. I really can't say enough about how pleased I am that we chose to stay here rather than at a large, impersonal hotel chain. We will be back.

This was a difficult one to make out. Booked this without seeing the mainly excellent reviews, based on a friend's recommendation, who I was going to NY with. My friend had stayed here loads of times so I kind of went along with it to avoid having to think where else to stay. I have seen this hotel described by some as a boutique hotel. Still not 100% certain what that really means, as I have also seen the Hudson described as boutique but in terms of design they are chalk and cheese with Hudson as hip, cutting edge and San Carlos very traditional new york.Stayed for 3 nights in September '07. Found nothing wrong with this hotel but at the end of my stay, I asked myself if I would stay here again. My answer was really no. Having now read all the excellent reviews on this hotel I cannot disagree with anything that has been written and my reasons for not wanting to return may not be valid to all people. I felt that the hotel was more of a business orientated hotel. You could walk in to the lobby, go up the lift to your room without seeing another guest. Those occasions you did see a guest - was usually corporate businessmen. Some people like the fact that its quiet but i felt it lacked atmosphere and character.We had a 1 bed suite which was not cheap. $600 a night. But even the standard rooms are $400 a night. The decor was ok. Inoffensive but not luxurious by any means and was certainly not hip or cutting edge. The size of the room was good with a leage seating lounge separate to the bedroom. Air con was a bit noisy but you got used to it. Bathroom was very small and could have done with updating.The location is good, central to Lexington and 5th. The lobby staff were good and helpful.Therefore in summary there was nothing I didn't like about this hotel. but there was nothing really i loved about it either....and for the price (which is not so much in the Top price range, but seems to be the Deluxe price range) i think i expected something a bit more.Not for me then, but would suit others. If you want a hotel with a buzz, good atmosphere, somewhere to hang out in the lobby and do a bit of people watching, I would look elsewhere. But if you're happy with a quiet sanctuary from the bustle of NYC, with a good location, using the hotel purely as a base it may well suit.

My boyfriend and I stayed in the San Carlos Hotel from 27 December 2007 to 1 January. On arrival we were greeted by a very nice porter who helped us with our bags. Check in was swift and the staff were very friendly. We were originally given a room on the 10th floor. It was the smallest hotel room I've ever been in. We were really unimpressed having read other reviews and viewing pictures online. I went back to reception and explained that we booked the hotel because the rooms looked spacious and comfortable but our bed was hard and our room was tiny! The receptionist apologised and told us he would move us the following day, he couldn't have been nicer about it. The following day we were moved to a room on the 15th floor, it was at least three times the size of the original room and the bed was one of the most comfortable I've ever slept on! We were delighted. Lots of TV stations to choose from after a hard day shopping and great shower and bathroom!The location of the hotel is perfect. We walked most places as the main shopping areas are within walking distance. It was my second time in NY and my boyfriends first but he couldn't get over how well laid out the streets are. The breakfast is quite good in the hotel. We had toast and yoghurts most mornings although one morning we decided to treat ourselves and went across the road to the diner and had sausages and eggs. Quite reasonable and the food is very tasty. It's across the road to the left, beside Kimberly Suites.We didn't try the room service. I would also recommend the steak house across on 3rd Avenue, Smith & Wollensky - best steaks we've ever had. Quite pricey but the food is amazing!The staff in the hotel were exceptional! One of the doormen in particular. I didn't catch his name but he comes out and opens the cab door for you when it pulls up, offered us an umbrella when it was raining, he was just a really nice guy. We had no problems in this hotel (apart from the box room which was sorted almost immediately). I would definitely recommend this hotel. It's conveniently located, extremely comfortable and the staff are excellent! A special thank you to Johanna Vargas, who I had been harrassing two weeks before we went over but she managed to find us tickets to the Knicks/Bulls game in Madison Square Garden!If you're going to NY, stay in the San Carlos, I'll definitely be going back!

We have only just returned home from our stay at the San Carlos (Jan 2 - Jan 9). We just loved it. It is a great location just a few blocks from Rockerfella, and 5th Ave. Many things are within walking distance, and if not the subway is handy or a cab ride is just as cost effective.All the doormen are fabulous, as are all the housekeeping staff - nothing is a problem for them, when we first checked in, as we got to our room there were only enough towels for 3 people (we are a family of 4) and my husband was able to catch a staff member in the hall - from then on we had an abundance of towels and toiletries every day and didn't have to ask for anything thereafter - great service.The team behind the desk are so efficent, and check in was a breeze - as was checking out. While we were waiting for our car to JFK, my 2 little daughers were entertained with some tricks which kept them throughly entertained - and they are still talking about it!This is the only place I plan to stay at in NYC from now on - when you're on a good thing, stick to it!

We stayed at the San Carlos for New Year's Eve. This was the second time we had booked rooms and it was as wonderful as the first time. A small, quiet boutique hotel with spacious rooms for NYC and an outstanding staff. I would be reluctant to stay anywhere else! The breakfast buffet is simple but enough to start your day without spending a fortune, the concierge is more than willing to assist with arrangements, taxis. etc., and the rooms are clean with fridge and microwave. Can't say enough good about the place!

Had a fantastic time in the San Carlos in 2006, so when it came to a shopping trip to NYC in November 2007, there was no question of where we wanted to stay. All the staff we met are a credit to the Hotel, and are always very pleasant and helpful. My sister and I stayed in a spacious and very comfortable one bedroom suite on the 5th floor, with 2 double beds, 2 tvs, bathroom and separate living area with fridge, microwave, coffee machine, etc. We had a street view, and yes it can be noisy but it is New York...you don't go there for the peace and quiet! You get used to the noise very quickly and it didn't stop me from sleeping well. There was only two of us staying in this suite but it would probably suit up to 4 adults, as there is a pull out sofa bed in the living area also. The hotel also has a fitness room and lounge on the second floor with internet access available, if you have the time or inclination during your stay. They serve a great free continental breakfast each morning in a room off the lobby with things like oj, coffee, yoghurt, toast, pastries, which get topped up regularly. If you prefer a hot breakfast, recommend you try the deli across the road, which is open 24hrs. It was always full in the morning, and a lot of locals seem to use it. They also do take out as well. The hotel doesn't have it's own restaurant, but "Mint" is well worth a visit. A top class Indian restaurant with a fantastic atmosphere. The room service at the hotel is delivered from "Mint" and is well worth a try if you don't feel like going out. Also try "Lilys" on Lexington Ave for a lovely Sunday brunch. The hotel itself is in a great location, with a subway stop round the corner in 51st Street, you can get around Manhattan quite easily. Buy a Metro card , even if you are only there for a few days, it's well worth the money. The hotel is within comfortable walking distance to most sights, approx 15 minutes to Times square and Central Park, less than 10 to Rockerfeller. Although if your want to give your feet a rest, then try one of the many city bus tours about. For the second year we got a Grayline 48hr hop on hop off ticket, which covers uptown, downtown, Brooklyn and night tours for $49. It's a great deal, and although their main pick up point is at Times Square, the uptown tour stops outside the Waldorf on 49th Street, so you can join it there. Recommend the night tour, which will take you over to Brooklyn, worth it to see the Manhattan skyline alone. You can purchase tours like this and other attractions from the hotel reception, but it may come in the form of a voucher/coupon which you will need to exchange at the tour starting point/attraction for a ticket. Shopping wise, Woodbury Common is worth a visit, with a number of designer outlet stores, selling clothes, shoes, luggage, etc. There are regular buses to Woodbury Common from the Port Authority bus station. If shopping in Manhattan, remember to get your discount card at Macy's to get 11% of most goods there, although be warned you do pay tax on goods bought in Manhattan. To get back to the hotel itself, you won't go wrong if you book to stay here. I have recommended this hotel to many people since my first visit. The location of the hotel, standard of service and accomodation is excellent, and we felt really at home here, it was a wrench to leave. It certainly makes the New York experience one to remember.

We are an Irish couple just back from the San Carlos, where myself and my girlfriend stayed for 4 nights over the new year, We found that the staff were extremely helpfull on our arrival and throughout our stay including the owner who we just happened to bump into at breakfast. Great location Mid-town manhattan. Rooms are a good size and daily maid service with chocolates on your pillow.Only downfall was the the air-con in the room was very noisey and the breakfast room was too small but there is a starbucks across the road. Would stay here again.

I stayed at the San Carlos from 8 - 12 December with my husband, daughter and mother and can't say enough nice things about it. Firstly, this hotel is about a ten minute walk to Times Square so we had no problem sleeping in the lovely comfortable bed, no noise at night. For those who are feeling energetic there is a great gym and on the 2nd floor computers with free internet. The bedrooms were spacious and kept very clean and we really appreciated the breakfast which was ideal for us. There was lots of different kinds of bread, croissants, muffins, yoghurts, butter, jams and cheese, a great way to start the day. The people behind the desk and the doormen were just lovely and very helpful, nothing was too much trouble and even the owner of the hotel introduced himself. Hopefully we will be visiting New York again within the next couple of years and will 100% be staying at the San Carlos. I know the hotel reads the reviews on Trip Advisor so can I just wish you all at the San Carlos a very Merry Christmas and a great New Year. I hope to see you all again soon.

My husband and two teenage daughters stayed at the San Carlos Thanksgiving week. I can't say enough good things about this hotel. We are avid travelers and have stayed in many, many hotels. I always thoroughly research a hotel from the travel books I read but I base my decision on the public's opinion of the hotel (from reading the reviews). I always find that the people who stayed there are the most honest about the accommodations. My husband was hesitant to trust my judgement because he likes to be safe with name chain hotels, but now he can't say enough about how great a choice I made. We choose a hotel for the space, amenities and location. We had a very spacious room for NYC standards with two double beds, two nice windows with controllable roman shades, a comfortable sitting chair and ottoman with a table, a desk area with chair, an armoire with a flat TV and real plants in our room! The furniture was not jammed against each other either- there was lots of space to walk around. We loved the refrigerator, microwave and coffee maker in the room which is one of the main reasons why we chose it. The rooms are decorated in a modern, clean homey atmosphere with bathrobes too. It was extremely quiet in our room (we requested a quiet area of the hotel) with no street noise and we didn't even know there was a family next to us until we saw them leaving their room. We didn't have a view of anything but a building but I'll go to the beach for that. We weren't in the room most of the time anyway. The location was perfect, central to Fifth Ave, Rockefeller Center and the subway, etc. We actually were going to stay at the Waldorf Astoria (which was right on our corner) for $20 more a night but we read the reviews that said the rooms were small and not worth the price. So true! The service was wonderful. When we checked in, we were told about the gym, breakfast times and given coupons during our stay for shopping. Any question I asked of the staff was answered pleasantly. I got directions and a map for the subway and was shown a store around the corner I could go to for snacks and groceries. The doorman went to the corner for us to locate a taxi and set up a car service for us to get to the airport. It was ready and waiting for us when we left! My daughter (18) was most impressed that when she got in the elevator alone, a male employee stepped out and let her ride up by herself. She was also offered an umbrella when we left one night when it was raining and when she tried to return it was told to keep it. Umbrellas were lined up at the door for guests! What service! I did read the reviews about the breakfast just being yogurt, fruit and pastries, but my husband skips breakfast and my teenagers are happy with just a muffin so it worked for us. The assortment of pastries was very diverse and it was free so who's complaining. The only negative thing I could say about the San Carlos was the beds could be queen instead of double because my husband is rather tall and we weren't used to a double bed. But everything else made up for this. We are already talking about our next trip to NYC and staying again at the San Carlos. We loved it! Thanks for all of the honest advice!

Just got back from New York City and loved the hotel, the attractions and the city. The San Carlos was a comfortable hotel with a touch of luxury. There was a free continental breakfast which included, fresh orange juice, coffee, tea, toast pastries, bagels with butter, jam. You can have as much or as little as you want. The staff were superb very helpful and made our stay much easier. Will be coming back and staying here again. A big hello to Virginia a voluntary member of an organisation called the Big Apple Greeters. New Yorkers who give up a few hours of their time to take you around a neighbourhood in New York, we would never have seen as much of Greenwich Village as we did so once again thanks for that. The hop on, hop off buses are good but can take a good hour/hour and half to do the loop so if you want to see a couple of attractions far apart this can be a little time consuming. Ice skating at the Wolfman ice rink and the buggy ride in central park are a must. For Shoppaholics Woodbury Common in New Jersey is a must you can go on a grayline coach for about $40. Just go you will love it!!!!!

We stayed for Thanksgiving this year with our two children. Facilities were excellent. Location was great - short walk to many attractions and great shopping nearby. Room was plenty large with a nice kitchen area and two bathrooms. Staff was excellent. On the first day, the cleaning staff was not very efficient, but this was remedied on the following days of our stay, when their services improved.We will stay again and recommend this hotel to our friends staying in NYC. Thank you, especially to Matthew, who was a great ambassador of the hotel.

Three of us guys stayed here for four nights. Our original booking was taken by Fabio who turned out to be both friendly and proffesional and certainly made sure that we were made more than welcome. The room was huge with a pristine bathroom and was actually two rooms with one containing two beds and one containing a sofa bed and this when made into a bed was a perfectly comfortable bed. We had a kitchenette with all the facilities required available, although we only made coffee.A treat for us was the sylish and untypical Indian restaurant (called Mint and good for celeb spotting) by the lobby where we sipped on many an cocktail at the bar deftly created by the beautiful Erica, whose friendly and helpful nature was a great help to us all.There is a wonderful 24 hour deli two minutes walk from the hotel. Which we all would recommendThe hotel is brilliantly located for seeing all the amazing places that a visitor would want to see in the city. All of decided that we would go nowhere else but the San Carlos the next we are back in New York. Great Hotel - Fantastic Staff - Superb Location!

We stayed here the end of October. Hotel was convenient to many sites, clean, spacious room with comfortable beds(no sags). The beds were firm, but if you like, they had a note that you could order featherbedding to go on top. Everyone was friendly without being too intrusive. We stayed in room 907-was very quiet as we overlooked a back alley and another building- we did not book this hotel for the view, so we were fine with this. There is a nightclub across the street from the front of the building and lots of activity the weekend we were there, but didn't hear anything in our room. The people at the front desk were very helpful. One night we did not want to get dressed up for dinner, wanted something close and they recommended Oscar's at the Waldorf-Astoria-I wasn't expecting much, but our dinners were fabulous! I had Veal Oscar-their signature dish and my husband had their Brandt (all natural)steak. I would definitely stay here again-I liked the relaxed, quiet atmosphere of a smaller hotel, not the madness of some of the "biggies".

We Stayed at the San Carlos for a five day stay during our 3rd anniversary. Excellent service was given the entire stay. Everyone who worked there including maintenance were extremely friendly and professional. Matthew, a doorman at night was particularly friendly. To top it off, the day before we left, the owner came out, introduced himself, and asked us how our stay had been. We were blown away with this hotel. Everything from top to bottom was exquisite. We definitely recommend this place for any business travellers or high class travellers on a budget. What alot of people don't know are the famous names that have stayed in this hotel. Including Puff Daddy, David Justice, and many others. Fifth Ave. class right on East 50th!!! Also very close to Rockefeller Center, St. Patricks Cathedral, and much much more. A definite A+++++

Well my sister in law and I have just returned from a much looked forward to trip to NYC. (Booked in February!) The San Carlos was a lovely place to stay. Excellent area - the two of us were returning to the hotel around 9-10pm at night and felt completely safe. I did do quite a lot of research and it paid off as we were pretty much near to everything. There is no room service facility and I would have taken a kettle but we were hardly in the room so they are little gripes. The complimentary breakfast was a winner for us as we were not looking for fry ups! The staff were extremely polite and friendly which means such a lot. Will definitely recommend the hotel and would definitelty stay there again. What a City!

Stayed here for 3 nights with friends in a two room suite. Have been before so knew the hotel well. The rooms in this hotel are larger than most in New York. Just little gripes - One bedroom ceiling had plaster falling off due to a leak from the floor above and one of the bathrooms had broken tiles covered with cellophane, obviously due to a previous occupant who had been heavy handed with the corner soap dish. Little things I know, but it is these things which helps tell the hotels apart and to what extend they are on top of their maintenance. Tip - ring the hotel directly to negotiate the rate (and ask for any special offers!)

Stayed in the San Carlos for 6 nights in October. We were with a family of four so I booked the one bedroom suite. What a great room! For New York standards it was very spacious. The bedroom had two separate beds. I expected only one so that was a pleasant surprise. One person slept on the sofa bed and the other 3 in the bedroom. It had a small kitchen and the bathroom was nice too. The sitting area was very pleasant to eat something or watch tv. Very friendly staff, especially the doorman. We tried the complimentary breakfast from day 3 until the end. Simple breakast but overall very nice. Loved the orange juice.I was very satisfied about the hotel. Great location, luxurious style, fantastic room. I will certainly return to the San Carlos when I go to NYC the next time.

Wanted to book a great hotel with a great location in New York for our first trip to the Big Apple. WE WERE NOT DISAPPOINTED!! The San Carlos ticked all the boxes. A five minute walk to 5th avenue, St Patricks Cathedral. 10 mins to Central Park. It is in a good area and we felt quite safe walking about. An added bonus was the delicious buffet style continental breakfast. The staff were extremely polite and helpful - booking taxis, advising on restaurants, giving directions- even provided brollies for the sudden downpour of rain! Nothing was too much bother. There was four of us (2 adults, 2 teenagers 19&16) sharing a one bedroom suite. There was plenty of room - 2 toilets, 2 televisions(not that we saw much telly because we were so busy out and about) 1 king size bed and 1 double sofa bed in the living room. There was even a small kitchen area fully equipped with microwave, coffee maker, fridge, cutlery. This allowed us to bring in our own drinks and snacks so we didn't use the mini-bar. Our request for extra towels/toiletries/help with pulling out the sofa bed was promptly dealt with by the housekeeping staff. We were on the 9th floor and at the front of the hotel. There was a lot of street noise but thats New York for you! We had no trouble sleeping! Would highly recommend the sightseeing hop on/off tour with the "Blue Buses" City Sights. Ticket agents on most street corners with bright yellow jackets! We paid 49 dollars each for a 48 hour pass but this gave us an Uptown tour, downtown tour, Brooklyn Tour (don't miss that one - the guide is a legend!!) free cruise to see Statue of Liberty (75 mins)tickets to the museum. All the tour guides were great and informative (leave a tip if you want to!) Saved on shoe leather and aching feet too!! One tip though - you can be on the bus a while especially due to the volume of traffic so a visit to the restroom before boarding is advisable!! There was scaffolding outside the hotel so the front was a bit obscured but looking around other buildings in the city - this was not unusual! Certainly didn't spoil our enjoyment! We had a marvellous experience and would definitely return to New York and definitely to the San Carlos hotel.

The hotel is located just behind the Waldorf Astoria, so the neighbourhood is quite classy and upmarket.Too bad the front of the building - like many many other buildings in New York - was hidden behind scaffolding (oct. 2007). Even the window of our room at the 17th floor had scaffolds in front of it.Inside, the lobby is nice and welcoming: not too big but not small either. The receptionists are friendly and efficient, they even have time to make small jokes. Check-in, as well as check-out, was done quickly and without hassle. We booked, using booking.com and were a little anxcious about it, having travelled 3.700 miles, but everything went fine.The doormen are friendly without expecting tips all the time.The two elevators run smoothly and quick, hardly any delays.The rooms are a nice size for New York, with a soothing colour scheme of greens, golds and browns. Very relaxing. Nice, firm bed but unfortunately rather small: don't expect king or queen-size. Flatscreen-tv, safe, desk with internetconnection (paying), two minibars (why?), a small microwave (first thought it was the safe!), trouser press, ironing board with iron, small closet. The bathroom is sufficient and most of all: clean!The room as well as the rest of the hotel was exceptionally clean. Only downside of the room: the airconditiong was rather noisy and very difficult to set the right temperature.Very friendly staff in general!The included breakfast is nice, but we went out for breakfast because they only serve muffins, cake and coffee. Nevertheless, there was a line every morning, 'cause it's free ofcourse.On the 1st Floor you can use the internetcomputers for free and you can even get printouts for free!Most of the guests in the hotel were hispanic/South American (due to the name, perhaps?) rather than European or Asian.Definately a good choice for your holiday in NY!Located near the Subway entrance at 51st/53rd Street and Lexington Ave. to the green 6-line.Starbuck's and a lot of luncheonettes are nearby, as well as the most fantastic place to have an afterwork-drink amongst the NY-yuppies: St. Bart's!!

After numerous visits to NYC at many different hotels in the city, I have found the hotel I will be returning to from now on! The San Carlos has everything that a larger, chain hotel could never provide its guests -- that personal touch along with wonderful amenities and VERY clean rooms. We stayed on the 3rd floor and didn't care that we had no view of the city from our room-we didn't come to see the city from our room! The hotel Staff are outstanding to say the least, and the owner even took the time to introduce himself to us after we asked about the hotels ownership. Try that at the W Hotel, or most other chain hotels! The bathroom was very nice which matters to women, the rooms were so clean and ours (room 310) was a surprisingly big size with 2 double beds. The continental breakfast was more than enough to get you started on your day, although for me, dry cereal or instant oatmeal could replace the yogurt & cottage cheese. But the complimentary breakfast is a wonderful plus. Also, the subway is around the corner, and VERY easy to use all around the city. Trust me, for the price & personal service, DON"T STAY ANYWHERE ELSE. I read this web site before I travel anywhere, and the comments are mostly true and accurate. That includes mine!!

My wife and I stayed at the San Carlos in the first week of September. On arrival we were upgraded free of charge to a deluxe room, however the room was not far from the buildings air conditioning unit. As my wife is a light sleeper I went down and requested a room change. Not a problem, within a couple of minutes we were given a different room on the other side of the hotel and much higher up.The room itself was much bigger than we expected, there was plenty of room to walk around in and was certainly not cramped like a lot of New York hotel rooms. There was a walk-in wardrobe which was more than big enough to hang up our clothes and store our suitcases. The room also came with a microwave which proved handy. The bathroom was also large and much better than we could have expected.The location of the hotel is great. A minute of Lexington Avenue, 20 minutes walk to Times Square and about 15 minutes to Central Park. It is also right next to a subway stop which gives easy access to the rest of New York. The area around the hotel was safe and we felt quite happy walking back there quite late at night.The staff at the hotel were fantastic. From the doormen to the front desk they were all incredibly helpful in giving tips of what to see and what would be the best way to get to certain sights. They went out of the way to help, including ringing our airline for us to confirm the time we would need to check in for our flight out of New York.Te breakfast at the hotel was fine. Plenty of bagels, croissants, Danish Pastries etc. One suggestion would be go earlier at about 7:30. At this time we fund there was plenty of room to sit down and plenty of food to choose from. We had breakfast at 9 one day and this proved a greater challenge in seating but its free so you can't really complain. If you want an authentic NY bagel then I would suggest Ess-A-Bagel around the corner from the hotel.All in all we had a fantastic time at the hotel and on our next visit to New York would definitely stay there again.

We stayed 3 nts at the hotel and it exceeded in every department...on arrival our bags were taken and we booked in promptly and were in our room ( 8th floor) within a few minutes...the bell boy was informative without being too in your face and gave us a few pointers for things to do...the room size was great(having stayed in N.Y before we have been used to smaller rooms) No Traffic noise at all....comfy bed and good air con. The free internet and gym were a bonus and came in handy.The Breakfast was okay..for nothing,and most people we spoke to enjoyed it....toast,rolls,cereal,hot coffee etc was a good way to start the day.This is by far the best hotel in N.Y for value and we will definetly stay and recommend this hotel to all our family and friends.

Central , safe location. Stayed in Executive Suite (bedroom plus separate loungeroom) with kitchenette and a/c in both rooms, as well as two TV's. Both rooms good size. Plenty of cupboard space for clothes. Bathroom very good. Beds very comfortable. Continental breakfast included also. Gym and internet facilities available. Staff excellent, especially conceirge Matthew. It is worth the extra $ to come back to a clean, comfortable room with plenty of space, after walking around all day sightseeing, and having a glass of wine out of your mini fridge , plus cheese and biscuits(we did not use the mini bar and stocked our own mini fridge in the kitchenette). Not far from restaurants, plus supermarket, pharmacy and subway. Wld definitely recommend and also wld stay again.

We stayed at the San Carlos Hotel in NYC for 7 days and were pleased from the moment we arrived and were greeted by name until the day we left. The entire hotel staff was very friendly and our room was more than adequate. The continental breakfast was not a full blown breakfast, but it was not advertised as such as it was a great start to our day. If you're looking for feather beds and you won't find them here, but after a long exciting day in the city, we were exhausted and slept quite well every night. Not even the street noise bothered us at all. If you are looking for a charming friendly, well located hotel, choose the San Carlos. Check their website for promotions -- it works and we were delightfully pleased with our choice.

I stayed three nights at the San Carlos Hotel and had a wonderful stay. I was traveling with 3 other adults. We had an one-bedroom suite that was extremely spacious and comfortable. The service was terrific, especially the man at the front desk in the mornings. He had quite the sense of humor.The fitness center was small, but had nice equipment. It happened to be located on the same floor as our room, which was very convenient. We were on the 3rd floor and did not find street noise to be a problem.The continental breakfast was not great, but I was not expecting much either. Most hotels don't even offer free breakfast. We only ate there the first morning. There are restaurants all around to choose from and of course Starbucks.The location of the hotel is great. We felt very safe even late at night.I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Our family of five stayed at the San Carlos in July for four nights. We found the hotel property to be immaculate, the staff PERFECT (warm and friendly, and naturally, not overly, so), and the furnishings clean and good quality. The breakfast, which is included, was adequate. It is nice to have coffee and juice, etc. available for a quick start to the day. There were sweets and bread items, but very little fruit (apples?) and no eggs, cheese, or meat. There also was a small refrigerator full of Stonyfield Farms yogurts.We contacted the hotel directly to make the reservation because we wanted a one bedroom suite with two double beds, and I didn't see any available online. Even by calling the hotel, we were only able to get a one bedroom with a queen bed. When we checked in we were upgraded to a room I had not seen online, a one bedroom suite with a king bed and an additional half bath. It was a great room, and the extra half bath made a big difference for five of us getting ready in the morning!The staff was very responsive. When we called to have a rollaway bed delivered, it took less than 5 minutes to arrive. Also, we called the front desk pretty late a night (10 pm?) because we found that the window locks on three of our windows were not secure. The repairman was at our door in just a couple of minutes, and he fixed the one that was broken (and helped us lock the ones that we apparently weren't strong enough to lock our selves!).The location is great too. Very close to an express subway stop for the East side (the Lexington line) and easy walking distance to Grand Central, Rockefeller Center, Central Park South, and the UN.It was a pleasure to come "home" to the San Carlos each night in New York City.

Another great stay at the San Carlos whilst on business in NY. This was my longest stay at 16 nights, and it's only when you're away for so long that a hotel becomes your home. The San Carlos staff are very friendly and knowledgeable, both on the front desk and at the door. Like the previous reviewer, I got the "Suite Deal" which is every 3rd night free. The Deluxe rooms that I have stayed in previously are very nice, and compared to The W Hotel next door on Lexington, cavernous! The suite was a whole new level of capacious, with two closets, two TVs, kitchenette, plenty of storage and comfortable seating - good enough for watching the TV or for entertaining visiting friends and family. The bathroom was no bigger than a deluxe room, but still plenty big enough.The breakfast is perfectly adequate - I'm not a massive fan, but I appreciate that they have decent quality coffee, orange juice and yoghurts.. AND - it's free!Only two gripes about the San Carlos; one was the seemingly random restocking of the amenities (3 days without mouthwash!), and because they're only a small hotel I couldn't claim any reward points for the stay (which would have amounted to at least a free night with Marriott Rewards etc).. But these really are very minor points and after 16 peaceful and relaxing nights in the hotel, I'm grasping at straws really!!Next time I'm in town, I know where I'll be staying!

Three women intended to meet for a "Girls Weekend" , but the the room was so comfy, we mostly stayed in! When we needed to go anywhere or find anything, the staff graciously accomodated us. I enjoyed the location immensely, the neighborhood provides anything you need or want, from a beautiful 24 hour corner store to a couple great restaruants. Ask for a sushi recommendation, they will direct you to an awsome place (and inexpensive). Our value was great because we picked up a stay 2 nights in a suite and get the third free. The suite is awsome and is worth full price. It included everything-dishes, a fridge, 2 tv's, 1&1/2 bath, heavy door between living and sleeping space. Also save $ because internet is included (wireless all over!! even the breakfast room). Ahh, the breakfast isn't tempting, but it's adequate. Although our room was facing the street we slept wonderfully! We want to meet every year and always visit the San Carlos!

We, two adults, two kids (8 & 12) stayed at the San Carlos July 30 to August 2 and have nothing negative to say. The rooms are average size, beautifully decorated and clean (they look just like their website photos) and the hotel has a fabulous location. Right across Lexington from the Waldorf - where the president and prime minister's stay. A 10-minute walk to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, 15 minutes to Central Park, FAO Schwarz and the Apple Store. The front desk crew is fabulous, Gabriel welcomed us with a magic trick and always made us feel welcome and Bobby, not sure what his title is, doorman?!?, he is fabulous and always had a tip or coupon for us no matter what we had planned. Breakfasts were average and not too crowded. Toast, bagels, juice, coffee etc. Parking was easy. There is a lot right next door and if you don't mind backing down 50th Street with the help of Bobby in rush-hour traffic it's fine!! They park the car and keep the keys. With a voucher from the hotel - it was only (and this is cheap compared to others I have read) $30 per day. We felt safe walking in the area day and night and it was very quiet in the rooms at night. Nice towels, comfy bed and right in the heart of the Big Apple - we highly recommend it for the price and will definitely be back - I don't think it gets any better...

This is a lovely hotel. We stayed here for four nights in a one bedroom suite. Very spacious. Anything we asked for was immediately taken care of. Housekeeping was wonderful, left extra towels, and bath products. Having the bonus of the continental breakfast saved alot of time, very nice pastries, bagels, toast, juices and coffee. Front desk and bellmen were very friendly and helpful. Loved having access to computers and the lounge area on the second floor. This was really nice, since we had to check out of our room and spend time there before our flight. Location is perfect! Subway 6 is right around the corner. You could walk to Rock.Plaza, Times Square, Bloomingdales etc. very convenient. We really felt safe walking everywhere. Beds are alittle firm, but that is a personal preference. Our suite was located on the back of the hotel, which was fairly quiet. Super hotel, will come back again.

We are a family of 3 from Denmark and we just have returned from our holif´days in the US. After a luxery 750sq feet suite at THE HOTEL at Mandalay Bay in Las Vegas, we thought there would be difficult for San Carlos to match this. We were wrong! The 1 bedroom suite we booked was really nice. The bathroom was much smaller, but the bed room and living room was nice sice. Specially when you, as we did, are going to stay as long as 6 nights, we find it important to have som space. The room was very clean and the bathroom looked quite new and very modern. The staff at the hotel is very friendly and we got a lot of help - even when we did not ask for it! I agree with the previous written comments about the breakfast. We knew this, so it was not a problem for us. But, I would rather have paid a few dollars more per night and got an upgraded breakfast.We will definitely recommend San Carlos to friends going to New York, and if/when returning in the future, we will also stay here again.

The San Carlos met our needs completely. Our suite was perfect for us, two adults and two teenagers in NYC for some touristy sightseeing and shopping. Surprisingly the hotel looks just like the pictures on the hotel website -- I find hotels usually look much better in the brochure. Not this one. Our suite was spacious (about 600 sq. ft.!) with a kitchenette, very clean, with more than enough lovely soft, fluffy towels for the four of us. Big bathroom, too. (Housekeeping was very generous, leaving us over a dozen little bottles of Aveda shampoo, etc.) One of the two air conditioners in the room didn't seem to function properly, but we only noticed on the last day and reported it at check out. We were comfortable enough with the one working fine. We were at the back of the building on the 16th floor, so street noise was not a concern. The location of the hotel is excellent, and the subway (6 train) is just a block away. The continental breakfast was plentiful and fresh, but pretty standard fare. We did appreciate the convenience of a self-serve breakfast in the hotel, though -- we were able to eat and run, rather than go to a diner and wait for service, etc. The San Carlos staff was always very professional, polite, knowledgeable, friendly and helpful. Oh, and WiFi in the room and computers on the second floor were an added bonus. We were entirely happy with our room and the service at the San Carlos and would definitely recommend it to others.

After leaving the W Hotel on Lexington Ave. between 49th and 50th Streets (see scathing review on that one), the San Carlos seemed like a palace. Stayed three nights, June 21-23, and will stay there next time I go to New York City. All of the staff were friendly and courteous. We stayed in an Executive King Suite (Room 702) and it was bigger than some New York City apartments! Upon entering, the first room had a bar with two bar stools, a stainless steel sink, microwave, refrigerator (for your use, not the mini bar) and cabinets filled with everything you might need including real china, utensils, a corkscrew, cloth napkins, wine glasses, drinking glasses, coffee mugs, etc. The second room was a living room with two chairs, two end tables, a sofa, a coffee table and the mini bar. The third room contained a king size bed, a nice dresser, two nightstands, a pants press (which I used to press shirts and skirts as well), and TWO closets. The bathroom had a tub and shower and a full length mirror. The air conditioning worked great and had a thermostat for better control (not just off all night so you are hot or on all night so you freeze). I could have stayed there indefinitely. The hotel had an excellent location in heart of Midtown East, one block from subway and an easy walk to excellent restaurants. They even had complimentary continental breakfast which is exceedingly rare in New York City. The price was $30 per night less than the horrible W Hotel. Of course, at just under $500 per night, it was not inexpensive, but for the location and the quality it was worth every penny.

A very good base for a stay in Manhattan. Clean, comfortable, not too big hotel with friendly staff. The continental breakfast and free internet facility were additional bonuses. Convenient location with several good restaurants nearby and the subway only one block away. We (married couple in their 60s) would certainly stay there again and would recommend to family, friends - and indeed anyone!

Stayed 7 days mid June and am very glad I chose this hotel, from the many reviews of hotels I read prior to choosing. Firstly the rooms were very large , clean and comfy,and came with fridge and microwave with tea and coffee replenished each day. Bath products were heaven and the room service very punctual and turn down service and mint a nice touch. The business centre allowed for easy access to keep in touch with friends and family . Did not try breakfast although it was complimentary. Staff very friendly. Reasonably priced for New York and was situated near more expensive hotels, (not sure what extra you would need). The location was fantastic to get around, near subway and bus (which passed the hotel), Walking distance to broadway and time square, united nations ( you could also bus it if needed). Restaurants and food stores in other direction lots to choose from. Being a solo female traveller, I have no hesitation recommending this hotel.

My husband, 10-year old daughter and I stayed 4 nights at the San Carlos for our first trip to New York. We found the front desk staff to be very helpful upon check-in, but were extremely disappointed in another front desk staff person who failed to act or react when I called to vehemently complain about a peeping mini-bar employee. (Management made it right, but I had to actually appear at the front desk and tell my story.) No one offered any information, although they answered questions readily, and no one explained how the breakfast worked (hours, location, or even that it existed), or the fact that there are public computers and a printer on the second floor. I was glad I had learned everything I knew on this site! The breakfast was actually perfect for our individual tastes - I enjoyed the yogurts and cottage cheese, my daughter loved the hot milk to make her hot chocolate and pastries and my husband enjoyed the coffee and a variety of food each morning.BE WARNED: We reserved a "2-room suite", and had the opportunity to experience 2 very different configurations - unfortunately - since we requested to be moved after our first night. The street NOISE was horrendous...voices, music, traffic noise, honking, sirens - and ALL NIGHT, every night we were there. We were on the 5th floor the first night, and after hardly sleeping due to voices, music, and never-ending honking and sirens, requested to be moved to the back of the hotel. We were told that the 2-room suites all face the street ... They moved us to the 11th (of 18) floor, which didn't help at all. - we actually didn't sleep well a single night we were there. Don't know why they don't invest in sound-proof windows in those rooms? The master bed was comfortable, but my daughter's pull-out was horrible - sagging middle and very thin. She didn't seem to mind, for what that's worth.The location was excellent, just enough of a walk to all the outlying places we went (Central Park, theaters, shopping, restaurants, landmarks). We did miss having an official concierge - although the front desk staff tries, they made a couple of just so-so recommendations. As a few others have mentioned, we also had the chance to meet the owner - he offered to open the "food room" for my daughter after it had closed.

I picked this hotel from its good rating on Trip Advisor and was thoroughly pleased with the result. It is conveniently located-walking distance to Times Sq., Rockerfeller Ctr., Central Pk. Subway is one block.Small, elegant, Art Deco lobby. Extremely helpful and friendly staff. When we checked out ,the owner came out and thanked us for staying there!The room was spacious (especially by NY standards!), new decor, & elegant bath. We loved having a microwave and small refrigerator in the room..The breakfast is included, a continental type.We had one dinner in the adjoining restaurant, The Mint. It features Indian cuisine. The food was good and the atmosphere lively.We will definitely stay there again.

My husband and I stayed at the San Carlos earlier this week for three days. The location is great. Walking distance to the MOMA, 5th Avenue shops, central park, etc. We walked around the hotel area at 12AM without any problem and felt safe. The hotel was clean, aveda products, coffee maker and small refrigerator in the room. It is not a luxury hotel but the rooms are comfortable and fairly new (I believe it was remodeled recently). My complaint was with our neighbors on the floor that we stayed in - 14th floor. They were extremely loud between 1-5AM each night that we stayed at the San Carlos. We complained the first night to the front desk and then again the second night. Our complaints were not effective. As such, we got little sleep each night. If you have considerate neighbors perhaps you will have a more pleasant stay than we did.

I visited new york for the first time in march, therefore i had no idea what kind of hotel i was getting into so i read users reviews and looked at many photos and found that the san carlos had very few low reviews so for the price i was sure i picked a great hotel, once i told many people i was going to new york and staying there no one had ever hear of this hotel therefore i got a little worried. Once i got to new york and got off the bus at grand central station, i ended up walking about 7 blocks to find myself walking into a very poor area, again i got a little worried that i paid a good amount of money for a low hotel, but once i turned the block and saw this hotel i was very pleased just by seeing the outside, this hotel is just about the nicest hotel in the area! The man at the front desk was very nice and helpful, the room was VERY clean and quite, it had everything it said it would, fridge, microwave, bathrobes, mini bar and lots of room for a new york hotel! the breakfast was great also! This hotel is located perfect to everything also, there is a subway stop on the same corner and its just up the street from rockerfeller center. Every time i return to New York i will be staying here again! I was very pleased!!!

First thing to say is that this hotel has a great location, being within strolling distance of empire state building, chrysler building, central park and times square, to mention but a few of the major city attractions.Check in and out was a smooth process as was anything else we requested from the staff.The room was lovely, with a large and comfortable bed, adequate bathroom, safe (no charge) and being equipped for either business or social use.Room servicing was always good, with the mints that were left each day being a nice touch.Whilst a view of a NY icon would have been nice, we knew beforehand that we'd not have one, and our suspicions that this didn't really matter as we'd spend so little time in our room proved to be true.Business lounge meant we could stay in touch with emails etc if we wanted to, and was handy for checking flight information before leaving.

My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights in early June. Having never been to New York City before and hearing how small hotel rooms were and how noisy, we were a little anxious. The San Carlos surpassed our expectations. We had 2 double beds in a good sized room with mini fridge, microwave and other amenities. The products in the bathroom were Aveda - lovely. Breakfast was very average but included in the price. We can't say enough about the staff - they were friendly, informative and always very helpful. Free internet is a bonus. The Mint restaurant attached to the hotel was a great find with delicious food. We would higly recommend this great hotel and will definitely return.

Stayed at the San Carlos for four nights in mid-May for $269+tax via QuikBook.com.The hotel did not disappoint. It did all that was expected, albeit I wanted a clean, safe hotel in a good location. It's difficult to say more. Service was friendly and efficient, but our needs were probably modest.Room also came with microwave, fridge, coffee machine, and cuttlery so could eat in the room.Best feature of the hotel was the three free PCs for web access. It also had a wireless zone, but I didn't try this.Breakfast - buffet with juice/tea/coffee and rolls/donuts/etc. Included in the price so makes it a better deal.Location - one block from the subway, and plany of restaurants within walking distance - either on 50th Street, or between 2nd and 3rd Avenues and one to two blocks away.

Stayed at the San Carlos from June 2 through June 6. The staff was incredible, helpful and very friendly. We were prepared for street noise, so it didn't bother us too much.The hotel beds and pillows are just awful, but I consider that more a matter of personal taste. WE loved the hotel.

My husband and I travel frequently and are picky about where we stay, generally 4-5 star. With some caution we booked at the San Carlos because we needed room for us, and our two nieces in a central location for a few days. From the time we arrived late, to the rainy day when the door man supplied us with umbrellas (and did not know we were guests because we were runnning down the street to a resturant in the rain), to our 4:00 AM depature, the staff was top notch, some of the best we have ever experienced. The service was outstanding, the rooms clean and spacious, and our overall experience very good. For the money, the location and stay cannot be beat in NYC. We even liked it better than the Waldorf where we stayed last time! The only down side is the hotel should upgrade the mattresses since they are a "little bouncy" in this day and age of "dream sleep" mattresses. The staff were the best, a few hotels could learn from them about service.

Stayed here for an overnight shopping trip to NYC. Booked a suite and wow, what a lot of room for the price ($369) in NYC! Full sized living room, dining area with kitchen and fridge, full bedroom with two (I thought comfortable) double beds and nice sized bath with very nice Aveda products. Two flat screened TVs. Our room overlooked 50th Street and there was some noise from the bar across the street, but we had the windows open and it wasn't enough to keep us awake. Great location walking distance to fabulous Madison Avenue shopping. Very friendly, helpful staff. Had dinner at Mint next door, which was bustling on a Saturday night and offered chic, excellent Indian fare, and quite reasonable for NYC. Highly recommended.

What a place. Do not listen to any negative comments. I have stayed in most large cities in Europe on business and this is up there with the best of them (for the price). The staff are unbelievable and will bend over backwards for you. One example, when we arrived our group wanted a beer. Bobby on the door told us that the hotel was quite expensive and gave us directions to a reasonable irish bar round the corner...this became our 'local' for our stay. This is a great example of customer coming before the hotel!!As for the location, as everybody has already stated, it was great. Far enough away from the mad busy streets but close enough to walk into the 'life' 5th ave was 3-5 mins away. Central park 5-10mins etc etc....People on this site have complained about breakfast. However, most hotels do not even offer this, so I cannot understand why they would mark down the hotel! It was standard but good. We did try the diner over the road, but was not worth the price. The breakfast was more than fine and we returned to the hotel for breakfast for the duration of our stay.Another small but pleasing benefit was the free internet and PCs with printer on the 2nd floor. Very handing as we checked into our return flights on line and received extra leg room exit seats!!!For the $290 we paid per room per night I have already recommended to others and will continue to do so. If/ when I return to NYC I will stay in this hotel.

We just got back from New York and were delighted with our stay at the San Carlos. I am not used to paying so much for a hotel room, ($269) but splurged to celebrate my 60th birthday. And this hotel was a great splurge. It has a beautiful lobby and absolutely terrific people--from the welcoming bellmen, front desk crew and housekeepers to the owner who cruised the breakfast room chatting with guests and making sure our stay was going well.The bed was a bit hard. (We went across the street to the Affinia 50 for a better weekend rate and found their bed to be superb.) The room has free internet, a nice little kitchen nook with a microwave and a refrigerator, a large enough bathroom for two and a great location. We used the buses and subway to get around and there are convenient stops close to the hotel..

As a first time NY visitor having a great hotel was key. The San Carlos fit the bill by being in a great location to attractions and subway. The rooms are nicely sized and the personnel were helpful and friendly. Would definitely stay there again.

Just came back from a weekend at the San Carlos. Paid $269/night on quickbook.com. I loved this hotel. The rooms were large and included a fridge, microwave, utensils, and coffee maker. The bathroom was large with a large counter. We were on the backside of the hotel so we had minimal street noise...(except for the car alarm that continued to go off for 30 minutes Saturday night!) The staff was extremely nice and helpful. Umbrellas were available during the rain. Complimentary breakfast was great. They had toast, muffins, danishes, yogurt, cottage cheese, etc. I recommend choosing this option as we went across the street to a diner for breakfast today and spent over $60 including tip! There were only 2 adults and 2 children. They have no children's menu, so my 5 year old got 2 scrambled eggs, pancakes, and bacon for $11.95! He wanted all of that and there was no way to make the combination at a cheaper price. The hotel is in a great location. Very close to the American Girl Doll store and Build a Bear for those of you with kids. There is a sub station very close (#6) to take you to other parts of NY. My only complaint is unfortunately big enough that I don't know if we'll stay there again. The bed was extremely firm. Now, I know that some people like that, but my husband and I do not! I'm curious to know if other posters felt the same. The second complaint is that the walls are rather thin. There was a family with children staying beside us and we could hear everything at 7:00 am when they chose to get up. We could hear their kids bouncing on the beds. We could even hear the kids pushing the light switches that are over the bed on and off...over and over again. We could hear their alarm clock go off and also heard it go off again after they had already left the room. I had to call the front desk to get them to turn it off. These may not seem like a big deal to some, but I'd sacrifice some of the space from a big room for a comfortable bed. After all that walking...you just want to sleep good at night! :)

We had a great stay @ San Carlos. Our room was spotlessly clean and had everything you could possibly want and MORE !!Location again was excellent.Breakfast was very good indeed and plenty for all, if we were to nit-pick the air-con in Breakfast room was rather fierce.The staff were EXCELLENT happy and so helpful nothing to much trouble.WE WILL DEFINATLEY RETURN TO SAN CARLOS.

This was our first visit to NY and could not have asked for a better location or hotel. The rooms were larger than any we had experienced before and were clean and comfortable.The location was perfect to explore NY by foot close to Central Park, 5th Avenue etc. There is also a metro very close by so if you want to travel further afield it is on your door step.I agree with other comments about the breakfast - very stale, lack of choice and always a full house! I would suggest missing it and heading out for something nicer.The staff are friendly but not the most helpful. BUT I would highly recommend this hotel it made our stay.

I had to meet some people at the Palace Hotel down the street and I couldn't fathom paying their rates, so a search on TripAdvisor led meto the San Carlos. I had stayed across the the street at the Affinia 50, so I knew that the neighborhood was nice. The San Carlos is even quieter and more soothing than the Affinia property with a watchful lobby staff and speedy elevators leading to quiet comfortable rooms with plenty of space. Spotlessly clean and we cared for, I got a roomat the back of the hotel on a lower floor and heard not a thing from the street. Across the street is the New York Deli, an inexpensive, but pleasing diner style with great service.At about $250.00 per night, the San Carlos is a great bargain in a upscale setting yet close to midtown.

The positives: A lovely hotel in a great location with a few negatives. The room was nicely appointed, bathroom was spotlessly clean with granite countertops and Aveeda products. Staff was friendly and helpful with information - no concierge desk. Location is great - easy walking to Rockefeller Plaza and theater district. Close to subway (6 train) and one stop to Grand Central where you can transfer to all other subway lines. Would stay there again. The negatives: "Continental breakfast" was terrible. The bread and pastries were dry and quite stale, and on the third morning by 9:30 am (breakfast ran 7-10am) nothing was left and nothing more was going to be put out. (Fortunately there was a luncheonette across the street.)  Ask for a room on the back side and away from the housekeeping closet. There is a very noisy bar across the street and with the no smoking laws, the bar patrons poor onto the street to smoke. Lastly, the biggest nuisance was the guest room door slamming. The guest room doors spring closed with a bang. . . very annoying especially if you are a light sleeper or you want to sleep in.

Our group of three adults stayed at the San Carlos in March. We had a room with 2 double beds. It was very clean and spacious, the staff was friendly and helpful. I would stay there again. It is very close to the subway station, MOMA, Museum of Television, and a delicious French restaurant a few blocks away (La Bonne Soup). Hotel was a little pricey - but worth it for the great location and nice room.

Fantastic hotel. Very helpful and pleasant staff. Nice basic breakfast (pastries, bread, butter, cottage cheese, yogurt, coffee, orange juice) and very lovely rooms! Our room had a street view, which was a little noisy, but so New-York!Internet connection worked well.Air conditioning helped us through the cold weather that suddenly landed on New-York in March...

What a friendly, helpful staff we met at this boutique hotel. Starting with the bellman and continuing to the front desk staff, we were so impressed with their friendliness. Even the housekeeper we met in the elevator was charming. Mint, the restaurant next door is terrific (Indian cuisine). The room was nicely appointed and very clean, however, it was a bit small and the window was located high in the wall, so you couldn't see outside. Also, I would request a room in back next time since I found the sirens and honking horns of NYC a bit much. But overall, it seems a good location and we appreciated the accommodating staff.

My husband and I recently went to NY City to attend a show taping. We stayed at the San Carlos hotel and what a wonderful place it was! We had a great room that was extremely clean and full of amenities. The staff was quick and accomodating when we requested something be sent up to the room. They were also very friendly. The price was a little more than we wanted to spend, but after staying there, it was worth it. The room was spacious and the entire hotel was very quiet. We would definitely recommend this hotel! And we'd stay there again if we're ever in NY again. Overall, this was the best hotel we've ever stayed at!

Just returned from a 4 night stay at The San Carlos NY and what a gem it is!! We had flown in on a much earlier flight than we had booked as our airline tried to avoid the major snow storm in the EastCoast, and so when we walked in at the hotel soon after noon, we didn't expect to be able to get our room, as check time is 3 pm. But Gabriel at the front desk checked us in with no problems, and up to the 8th floor we went. We had very comfy beds, complimentary internet, cable tv, microwave, coffee maker, cutlery and small fridge, and most importanly a very clean and quiet room. Aveda toiletries were a nice touch.Their complimentary continental breakfast was great. And yes, it is just that, continental style, with pastries, toast, bagels, coffee, teas, yogurt and fruit. But just right for a quick bite before venturing out into the city. No inhouse restaurant, but they do room service from the restaurant next door, Mint. Mint is hip, cool and food is yummy. It is Indian cuisine, but very popular and very good.Location is ideal for visiting the museums, Madison and 5th Ave. shopping, and great restaurants.Service was great, from Bobbie the bellman, to our room attendant and Front Desk, always very helpful and informative.After many past visits to NY and many different hotels, and based on price and service, San Carlos is definitely a future choice for us!

Really comfort hotel, with great great location. The whole staff was very friendly, and they have a very good breakfast. You can believe in the pictures that you're able to see in their homepage. From now on, my first choice in NYC is the San Carlos.

This is a great hotel. One of my biggest "must haves" in a hotel is that it be very clean with updated decor and furnishings. This hotel had both. I was very impressed. We took advantaged of an "off season" promotion...stay two nights get the third free, I think we paid $260 a night?? This deal scored us a one bedroom suite with a king sized bed. It was plenty big for my husband and I and I would actually say it was be large enough for a family of four or for a girls trip of 4. We actually didn't really even take advantage of all the space. There is a full bath and a half bath which made getting ready great. The staff was friendly and the continental breakfast was a nice perk. Location was good. A subway station was close by and it seemed the walk to Central Park / 5th Avenue Shopping and Times Square were pretty much equal in time..give or take. The elevators were super fast for a smaller hotel. Maid service and turn down service was great. My only complaints would be the bed was very firm (which some people like), however the linens were very comfortable. Also, the street noise was distracting (mainly the horns coming from the nearby intersection), but we were on the front side of the hotel on the 10th floor. The rooms on the back may have been less noisy. On my last visit to NYC, a year earlier, on a girls trip we stayed at the Doubletree Suites located in Times Square. While I would recommend that hotel as well, I wanted to stay out of the Times Square crowd this visit. I enjoyed the location of the San Carlos Hotel, I felt a little less like a tourist. I will say that at the Doubletree, because our hotel room was so high and I assume because the building was newer and more sound proof, we heard NO noise from the street... and the beds were way more comfortable. I would highly recommend this hotel, especially at the rate we received.

Great stay at the San Carlos during the last week of 2006 for our family of five, 2 adults and three children ages 10, 8 and 2. The service was perfect and the rooms were unusually large for NYC.
