Highly recommended for families with small children not only because the the very friendly and helpful nature of the staff but also it because is perfectly located for all the attractions for families with small kids.

This was my fifth trip to NYC and I have stayed in some large hotels and one that was small but more famous. Truthfully, this hotel topped them all and was a very good experience. The entire staff seemed to want to make our visit a success and they surely did. We had reserved four rooms for a small wedding party and they were quiet and clean , though not exceptionally large they were adequate. I loved the locatiion and found it extremely easy to get around to all the major attractions. I liked the speed of the elevators as the last boutique hotel where I stayed had very slow ones. We were on the 15th floor on the front of the building and we still could hear noise down below but that is NYC. I have always been able to hear sirens and horns no matter where I have stayed. The free breakfast was a real bonus with lots of choices for a continental style.I would highly recommend this hotel and their staff.

My wife and I have made New York City an annual event for the first week in December for the last 5 years. Having stayed in large hotels before this year for the other stays, a friend recommended this boutique hotel this year saying that it is very nice and small enough to avoid waits for anything.The location is excellent for shopping and shows. The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful. The rooms are quiet and the bed is excellent. We will be back in 2007!!!

I have just returned from a three-night stay in New York City where myself and two friends stayed at the wonderful San Carlos Hotel. We three women, all in our 40's, were celebrating the completion of our Masters of Adult Education program with a trip to the Big Apple. We selected the San Carlos based on the information provided by other travelers. We were not disappointed! The rooms are quite large, spotlessly clean and well appointed. The warm reception we received upon check-in was consistent through all staff from the doormen to the cleaning staff. The complimentary continental breakfast was a nice start to the day. We were never disturbed by external noise, even though the hotel appeared to be quite busy. We really appreciated the small business centre where we checked e-mails and made tour bookings on-line. The location is wonderful - far enough from the madness but within walking distance of Times Square, Broadway, Rockefellow Centre, Central Park, museums and amazing shopping. The neighborhood felt very safe and we often walked after dark. Many good restaurants within easy walking distance. After check out, we were delighted to be introduced to the hotel owner, a gracious, warm gentleman. We would certainly return to the San Carlos again.

I was placed in a room that overlooked an ugly,dirty,noisey alley.My room was a handicapped room."NO BATHTUB."I am not handicapped. Neither was my friend.At "check out" time...rudely taken care of.Sent multiple E-Mail to San Carlos Hotel.Thry never respondedContacted the "YES NETWORK" who sponsorsthe hotel and received a response.

Our Thanksgiving stay was terrific. Rooms were clean and large by New York standards. Staff was very helpful and courteous. Location was a plus. Subway station 1/2 block. Easy to catch the #6 train and get uptown or down town easily. Walking to Times Squire or Central Park was a 10-15 minute walk (I walk slow).When on business I usually stay at Westin, Loews or Ritz Carlton. The hotel does not rival these but it sure does try.Overall very positive. Will definitley stay here again.

We recently stayed at the San Calos Hotel and could not have asked for a better experience.I mentioned we were there for my wife's birthday, and the hotel had a complementary bottle of wine waiting for her in the room We traveled with friends who did not book in time and had to stay a another well established hotel. For double the price, they had problem after problem, constantly faced negative issues and were overly dissatisfied with their stay. They were amazed at the level of care we got.I will definately stay here the next time I am in the city.The San Carlos helped make our stay in New York one of the best trips we've had in years.

First, not every can be pleased and not all experiences are great, BUT I stay in San Carlos every 2-3 weeks for the past 3 years, therefore, I can say that . . .Breakfast - The breakfast is NOT just orange juice and a toaster, for the past 3 years at least from what I know is that they serve yogurt, cereal, milk, pastries, bagels, toast and apples. Also juice, coffee and milk. Last time I checked this IS a continental breakfast. And they are consisent and clean which as a frequent business traveler, this is what is most important. Rooms - The rooms are aged, as it is a boutique hotel in an old building, but I have yet to ever get a dirty room and the decor is very modern. Oh, and they tuck every night with chocolates every seems not to be mentioned, which is definately not something you will get at the Marriott, or some of the nearby hotels. Also, it they are generous with their toiletries (Aveda hair products, mouthwash, ear cleaner, hair cap, cotton balls, etc.) which is in line with a 4 star hotel. Also, bathrooms & linens are always clean with decent decor. Last, most rooms are pretty roomy and about 50% or more now have flat screen LCD TVs or an flat screen TV. There is a mini bar and all the basics like most decent hotels (coffee maker, blow dryer, robes, etc.). Security - They have security cameras EVERYWHERE, not because it is a bad place, but to make sure their guests feel and are always safe. I think this is super important. Gym - Although MOST hotels do not have gyms like the Leows hotel in Philly like a gym club, they do have a roomy gym with decent cardio equipment and water, towels and a bathroom. Noise - This is true, noise cannot be avoided, heck you are in between Lexington and 3rd, I choose this hotel for location and unfortunately, there will be lots of traffic & noise here. For me it is ok, b/c when I want to get out for a coffee or snack at 1 in the morning, there are always people around, so for me, safety overrules noise, but I admit it does not work for all. Service - I have yet to have any bad service, or any of the numerous collegues that I have recommended to stay there. Most of the time, they are super friendly and the door men, boy they can get you a taxi or give directions anytime. Computers - they have 3 computers and a printer on the 2nd floor for use for free. They also have free high speed broadband in all rooms. And the couple times I have a project crunch, the front guys have helped me by holding or sending off packages and faxing for me, which I do not abuse this, but it is nice to have in an emergency. Location - OK, within minutes you can be anywhere worth visiting in NYC. And for the business traveler, there is fed ex kinkos 3 blocks down on 3rd and also another on Lexington and 2 blocks up on Lexington a Staples. Also, there are several subways near by, like 1-2 short NY blocks away that can get you virtually anywhere in NYC. Shopping & restaurants galor, need I say more!!!I agree, there are much nicer hotels, at a heftier price, like the Waldorf, but for $300'ish a night this is a great deal and not less for any of the comparable hotels like the Benjamin or Affinia 50 (trust me, been there, they are pretty much the same!). What has won me over from San Carlos is how they treat their loyal customers, which is something I am seeing less of these days in this economy. I stay there every 2-3 weeks and I now have the owner's email to let him know when I am coming, what other hotel in the 300'ish range is going to care about one person???? But this hotel will treat regulars like a super star and from feedback I have receieved to those visiting 1-2 times, they felt the same way.

I recently stayed at the San Carlos Hotel, and the entire experience was extremely positive. The hotel is centrally located, and the staff is helpful and friendly. My room contained a mini bar, small refrigerator, microwave, and coffee maker. There is a workout room equipped with a few cardio machines and TVs at each machine. The hotel room was immaculate, as were the lobby and workout room. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone, and will stay there again. My overall experience was outstanding; kudos to the management (and all the staff) at the San Carlos Hotel!

Having recently returned from another New York City visit, we thought it necessary to provide another insight for this hotel which seemingly garners good to top reviews. We say NO. This hotel is quite less than what it and others says about it.First, the property is neither elegant nor charming and defnitely not sophisticated. The reality is that the property is nothing more than a bit above a Holiday Inn Express or similar hotels that you may find on any airport strip,Second, while the Hotel trumpets its offering of a free continental breakfast one would be well advised to brace themselves before viewing the selection and confines of the offering. A closed and spartan room with tables and chairs accompanied by an orange juice dispenser and toaster does not, a continental breakfast make. Third, previous commentary on Trip Advisor laud the staff for their friendliness and desire to accommodate. That was not our experience. On our arrival, we were confronted with ATTITUDE and plenty of it from the front desk representative who in a pre-emptory fashion dictated that one of the two rooms that we had booked was to be changed. No discussion or advance advisement. We challenged the representative and only when asking to speak to the Manager, were we able to arrive at a compromise.The room(s) were not elegant nor sophisticated but rather what would you expect from a hotel that is definitely not a 4 star hotel. The interior of our rooms on the 10th floor ( Junior Suite and Exec King) were well worn with the bathroom showing distinct signs of use and needing a good painting,Finally, previous writers on Trip Advisor have referenced the street noise. We agree and there was plenty of it. For a hotel that has spent a significant amount of money on refurbishment ( their words) and notwithstanding that New York is and can be a noisy city, the noise from the street at all hours is quite incredible.For our money ( and the hotel is not cheap) we say that the San Carlos is not what it seems nor says and to that extent, we say exercise caution in choosing the San Carlos Hotel. There are better hotels in the same area at the same price.Ottawa, Ontario

I spent alot of time trying to find a modern hotel that could accommodate 4 friends in one roon in a central location in NYC.We booked a one bedroomed suite for a great price, which was even better when shared between 4!The bedroom had 2 double beds and the lounge had a double sofa bed. The hotel also offered a spare bed to go in the lounge if we needed it. There was also two large wardrobes and plenty of drawer space. The decor was modern and clean with all the essentials needed and more, ie small kitchen area, fridge, iron, etc.The staff were all helpful including whistling for taxis when needed.We stayed at the front of the hotel on the 2nd floor so we did get some street noise so maybe ask for a room higher up if you can. Although it wasnt really a problem and the hotel is in a fairly quiet street and not on the corner of an avenue so traffic was limited. Most central hotels in NYC are noisy as it is a major city that never sleeps, I have yet to find a quiet one.We didnt go in the night club opposite as all our nights were booked up doing other things although it looked cool (it was called NIKKI midtown).Well done to the San Carlos for getting everything right. We all said we would stay here again and reccommend it to our friends.

A fantastic hotel, within easy walking distance of some of New York's most famous attractions - 5th Avenue, Empire State Building and the Rockerfeller centre.We stayed here for 4 night's at the end of October and I cannot wait to go back to NYC. Would defintely consider the San Carlos hotel again.Very clean hotel, friendly staff and our room was huge(and that was a normal room!). Breakfast consisted of pastries, bread, coffee, orange juice & yoghurt. Not the big US breakfasts I was imagining, but for that there are so many cafes and deli's nearby!You will not be disappointed if you stay here :O)

We weren't meant to stay here! We were booked into the Bedford Hotel down on E40th but when we got to the hotel there had been a water leak that had flooded our room, so the Bedford staff had transfered us to their sister hotel - the San Carlos. They even gave us the $5 so we could catch a cab the 10 blocks.The San Carlos is a great little hotel - nice entrance, great friendly staff and the benefits of a free buffet breakfast and free internet in their business lounge. We had specifically requested a suite for the 3 of us at the Bedford and we ended up having a suite at the San Carlos. A good sized bedroom, with seperate lounge and pull out sofa bed, small kitchenette area that seemed well equipped and good bathroom.We could not have been happier! No idea how much this place costs but it is obviously must costlier than the Bedford - we just got lucky!Next door there is a trendy Indian restaurant called 'Mint' that looked really nice.Traditional New York bagel breakfasts available on 3rd at Ess-a Bagels - complete with insults and New York attitude!

We really enjoyed our stay at the San Carlos. The staff were friendly and helpful, especially the doorstaff. Our room was clean and spacious with plenty of towels and tolietries. The microwave and coffee-maker were very useful. The continental breakfast was a nice touch, although the yogurt wasn't the best, it was good to start the day with some OJ, fruit and a bagel. The San Carlos is very central, we walked to most of our destinations. We would all stay there again.

The hotel is nice and the staff is great but the rooms on the front of the hotel are bombarded with street noise from a night club across the street until 3:00 or 4:00 AM on Friday and Saturday nights. We aslo had street paving until 2:00 AM on Friday night. It was the worst street noise I have experienced in NYC and we travel there a lot. If you stay at the San Carlos, ask for a room in the back of the hotel.

The San carlos Provided us with a great week of accomodation in New York. This is a hotel that does a lot of little things right. The staff is superb and helpful, and having your bed turned down nightly is a nice touch. The rooms are clean and relatively spacious for New York. The bathrooms are new and water pressure in the shower is great! There's a complimentary business centre and continental breakfast, which we missed all 7 days....It's quiet as well. But at its price point, the clientele is a little older.We loved it and will definitely stay there again.

After reading many reviews of many NYC hotels, we chose the Thanks to previous Tripadvisor reviewers, we stayed at the San Carlos in August, 2006 for 8 wonderful nights. We previously had reservations at the Avalon hotel, but the reviews of the Avalon started getting worse, so I took advantage of Tripadvisor's review and found the San Carlos. The San Carlos is PERFECT. We traveled with our two grandchildren (age 10 and 7 years) and they loved the hotel too. We took advantage of the business center on the 2nd floor to "play" on the internet during the evenings and the kids used the workout room a lot (always with our supervision). We enjoyed having the continental breakfast available...it was nice to have a quick bite to eat before we journeyed out in the morning. Gabriel at the front desk taught our grandson magic tricks (that was a hit!) and Matthew on the door was wonderful. Housekeeping staff are friendly and do a fabulous job. We also saw quite a bit of the hotel owner, whom we found to be charming. The kids were really impressed that the HOTEL OWNER knew them! You don't get that kind of attention in the chain hotels.We adored the rooms (we had a one bedroom suite), and appreciated having two televisions. The refrigerator and microwave both came in handy as we were able to bring leftovers home from restaurants and enjoy them later. The hotel is very quiet, and in a great neighborhood. We are from Seattle and we felt a lot safer walking around NYC after dark than we do in our city. It's also extremely close to a subway entrance.We were lucky enough to have Arlene Dunn as our Big Apple greeter (this is a great thing to schedule... you'll learn so much and it's free!). She felt like family to us. We took the all day Royal tour of New York and it was wonderful. Steve, the owner, was very informative and made us feel like he was an old friend who was showing us around his home town. His tour costs a little more than the others, but I think it is well worth it. He doesn't book a lot of people on each tour so you don't spend half your time waiting for someone to show up so you can go on to the next stop. We did most of the things that tourists do in NYC, and thought that the Top of the Rock was a better view than the Empire State building. Highlights:Tony and Tina's wedding (an interactive play). We all loved this! The Statue of LibertyTrinity Church, where the rescuers went on and after 9-11 (be prepared to cry).St. Patrick's CathedralA New York Yankee gameBronx ZooConey Island (everyone needs to go there once)Canal Street in Chinatown...you get to barter there, and believe me, it's very addicting.A cruise around all of Manhattan with Circle Line tours (we had a very informative and dapper narrator). [--]Eating at Mickey Mantle's restaurant and PJ Clarkes. I know I'm forgetting some things that we did and loved.Bottom line..when we come back to visit NYC, we will stay at the San Carlos. This is one of the best hotels we have stayed at.

The San Carlos Hotel is one of the nicest place I have ever stayed. The service was trememdous, rooms are spotless, and it is well within walking distance to all area attractions. I highly reccomend the San Carlos to anybody wanting to stay in Midtown Manhattan.

My family stayed at the San Carlos for 4 nights in July and had a wonderful experience. They had a special rate on a 1 bedroom suite to get one night free if you booked for four nights. The room was very nice and well kept. The kitchenette and bathroom were very nice with beautiful marble countertops. It was very nice have real coffe cups to use in the morning. The hotel staff was very courteous and helpful. The breakfast bar was nice but could of use a little more variety by the 3rd morning. This was a convenient location for touring the city by foot, subway, or doubledecker tour bus. I would recommend this hotel to others and I would stay here again.BW, Lexington, KY

We enjoyed a relaxing week-long stay at the San Carlos Hotel. The location couldn't be beat (walking distance to 5th Avenue shops, wonderful 2nd Street restaurants, theatre, etc.). The frontdesk staff and doormen were friendly and provided excellent recommendations to nearby restaurants. The only complaint was the extra firm bed that bothered our backs. But when you're in New York, who has time to sleep!

The San Carlos is a wonderful hotel and an outstanding value. Immaculately clean and recently redecorated with an understated, yet elegant decor, it provides supreme comfort and every amenity I required - an in-room safe, a well-lit magnifying mirror in the bathroom, firm beds with good pillows, and a delicious continental breakfast every morning including orange juice, coffee, yogurts, cottage cheese, fresh fruit, pastries, and the best bagels I ever tasted. And it was QUIET - I never heard the first siren or horn blow - no city noise at all! I was travelling with two friends; we acted on a great online offer for a one-bedroom suite - stay two nights, receive the third night free. Divided three ways, this was an excellent deal for us! Our cost per person for this first-class property in New York (including tax) was only around $106 per night! This delightful lodging experience was perfected by the graciousness, humor and unfailing helpfulness of staff that obviously take great pride in their work. The owner is a delightful gentleman who visits the breakfast room every morning, banters with his guests, and sets the tone of relaxed charm and efficient service for this fine hotel. I will never lodge anywhere else in New York again!

We found the San Carlos via the reviews on this website, we did lots of research and this one looked to be the best in this side of NYC. This hotel is great, great location, great staff, great rooms, and a great room rate given its in a very expensive neighbourhood. We travelled with our 2 kids, requested a quiet room away from lifts and were given exactly that, room 910. The room was clean, housekeeping ere through by noon each day, the guys on the front desk were good and the doormen were excellent. It rained a couple of days and they had plenty of umbrellas for guests to take out each day. Only downside is that the only room service available was from the Indian restaurant located on the ground floor, irrespective there is a 24hour convenience store that also served a great selection of cooked and fresh food. The complimentary breakfast served on the ground floor was just right, serving pastries, coffees, yoghurts, toast. An excellent hotel that we recommend 100%. Thanks.

After reading many reviews of many NYC hotels, we chose the San Carlos for a 5 night stay in NY--and we're so glad we did. For us (two women in our late 40s) it was PERFECT: the room was quiet, comfortable, large, and spotlessly clean; we had high-speed internet access from the room (WiFi from the Business lounge on the 2nd floor). We appreciated, as well, the small fridge and countertop. All the staff (from the desk to the front door to the housekeepers) were friendly and professional but not intrusive. When we return to NY, we'll definitely check out the San Carlos first. As other reviews have noted, there's a decent grocery store on 2nd, and numerous restaurants within walking distance. We were most satisfied with the restaurants in the more residential areas (to the N, E, and NE) of the hotel. Thanks to all the previous reviewers who tipped us off to the San Carlos--I don't know that we would have found it w/o TripAdvisor! A great place!

got a room through Expedia and had hoped for a king sized bed, but they were all sold out, so down to a queen. but the room was great -- well appointed, a sitting room, kitchenette , and nice bathroom, TVs in both bedroom and sitting room which worked well for my kids for the short amounts of tim we were in the room. Location is great, easy access to subway, nice walk to time square, we also walked to central pk and the metropolotin mus. of art (long, but fun walk up Lex.) Would return w/o hesitation. All staff polite and helpful. continental breakfast (pastries, toast, juice, coffee, yogurt)

We have stayed at a number of different Manhattan hotesl for each of our mini-getaways over the course of the past several years, but the San Carlos is the one we've decided we'll return to when we don't wish to indulge in a big splurge. Located across the street from the comparable Kimberly and Affinia 50, we ike it better than either of those. The San Carlos offers a lobby with ample & comfy seating (unlike the Kimberly); a very well equipped, sunny "fitness center" with individual TV screens at each of the treatdmills, the recumbent bike, and stepper ( this workout room isn't huge, but this isn't a large hotel, I had the place to myself on more than one occasion); an attractive breakfast room; and a computer center on the mezzanine with 4 PC's which have high speed internet service and a laser printer for which there are absolutely no charges (also WiFi).The high-ceilinged rooms are generously proportioned, airy and serene with windows you can open (always a plus in my book) covered by both semi-sheer draperies to the marble sills and "blackout" Roman shades which operate smoothly. The climate controls in both the bedroom and LR & the variety of lighting throughout -- little "downlights" over framed artwork in both the living room and bedroom (we had a 1-bedroom suite), wall sconces, table lamps, overhead lighting and a good desk lamp -- are notable. And the contemporary furnishings are tasteful, comfortable and more upscale than those we found in our rooms at the Affinia or the Kimberly. In addition to the well-stocked "honor bar" (with less outrageous prices for its contents than at many Manhattan hotels), there is an under-the-counter refrigerator, a microwave, and small sink in the kitchenette/wet bar area whose cupboards and drawers hold glassware, dishware & flatware. The two closets and a number of deep drawers gave us more than enough storage space for our clothes & luggage. There are no drawers or cupboards in the bathroom, but the counter is wide and runs the length of the room, so we found it perfectly acceptable & the Aveda toiletries are a nice touch. Lastly, everything was scrupulously clean & well-maintained; we never heard any noise from fellow guests in the hallways or the rooms around/above us; and our sleep was not disrupted by street noise as is often the case in Manhattan.The free breakfast isn't the spread you'll find at the Embassy Suites, but it doesn't pretend to be more than a continental breakfast: the pastries were skippable, the coffee & OJ were above average. And since there are a number of eateries just outside the door and most hotels don't offer anything to their guests, I'm not going to knock the SC on this score. We did experience a few intermittent problems with the in-room internet access, but they were short-lived, and with the computer center on the 2nd floor, you'll never be "stranded".Where the San Carlos falls a bit short is on its front-end service. With the exception of Gabriel (who I think is the manager and seemed topnotch), the desk clerks and doormen were quite young... very pleasant, but not super polished, could use a bit more training & level of information about what's in the neighborhood. Check-in/check-out, however, was efficient and there were no errors in our billing.In short, given its location, the quality of accommodations and the amenities, the San Carlos is an exceptional value. I recommend it highly!

Having just returned from the San Carlos I can't think of one fault with this hotel. The rooms were large for NYC standards and absolutely spotless. The staff were friendly and very helpful especially the older gentleman on the front desk. Hotel in good area which felt really safe and good location for major attractions.Business suite with free use of computers and internet.Indian restaurant ajoining hotel is excellent. Breakfast good with toast, pastries, yoghurts etc; Will definitely be going back.

In all honesty I can not say anything really bad about my stay(4 days). Perhaps, the web description and some of the reviews I read got the better part of my expectations. When I arrived(5:30p.m.)there was no one at the curbside to greet me and say "welcome to the San Carlos", as a matter of fact, I had to carry my lugage inside(three of us), while a doorman looked at us with out moving a finger. The check in process was average and no special attentions or welcomes were provided. The room was fine(one bedroom suite) The a/c unit is within the inside of the room, looking bulky and occupying space. The kitchenette is a plus. Flat screen TV's do not mean flat screen TV's(not plasmas). Pillows are of foam and not confortable at all. Bath towels are very small and ver thin. Bed is ok and linnens are not what they are potrayed. Bathroom inside of master bedroom with out an independent entry from living room. Requested ice a couple of times and was delivered very promptly and courteous. A young lady at the desk recomended an Italian Restaurant"Pescattore" and turned to be excellent. No maps were available at the front desk. Breakfast is somewhat simple, with paper cups, plastic forks/spoons/knifes(not what I expected).I went to visit the Benjamin, The Kimberly, and the Affinia 50, all located in the same block and across the street. In my humble opinion, for the price the San Carlos charges, a better, more confortable and luxurious accomodation can be obtained from any of these three suite hotels. I can say that the best part of my stay was the reservation process. A very attentive person(susan) handled my reservation in the outmost proffesional and amicable manner. Will I stay here again? I dont know.

Just returned from a four day stay at the San Carlos, during the Blizzard of 2006!! I found it to be a delightful, comfortable, well located gem for slightly high but reasonable rates. The rooms are larger than typical NYC, are decorated nicely and very comfortable with wonderful reading chair and ottoman, along with desk and two double beds. Ample closet space. Bathroom was a little on the small side with little room to store toiletries, makeup, etc, but very nicely done. There is an internet room on the mezzanine at no charge, which was wonderful for checking email, etc. Had four computers with very little waiting. Also very nicely done small fitness room. Staff was very courteous and helpful, suggesting alternate transportation on the subway when cabs were not in abundance during the snow storm. No bar or restaurant directly in hotel, but an Indian Restaurant is attached and provides room service. We didn't try it, so can't comment. However, there is a great little luncheonette across the street which we used for breakfast and lunch once each. Also ate at the steak place directly across the street - it was fabulous. Wish we had tried it sooner. The breakfast buffet provided by hotel was adequate - coffee, juices, pastries, bagels and toast only. Nothing to write home about, but a nice touch for the days you don't want to eat heavy early in the day. There was a small refrigerator, a microwave, plates, silverware and coffee bar in each room, along with an honor bar, which was much appreciated. Hotel definitely has more charm than typical large chain hotels. Very welcoming and homey. The location was great, about 20-25 minute walk to most Broadway plays and Times Square, and only blocks from St. Pat's, shopping and Radio City Music Hall. Felt very safe in the neighborhood even very late at night.Would definitely stay again.

As a Mum travelling alone with 2 boys aged 12 and 10, I would thoroughly recommend the San Carlos hotel. It was extremely comfortable and absolutely spotlessly clean. The staff were really friendly and helpful and we were made to feel very welcome. Our room had a fridge, a microwave and coffee making facilities. There were plates and cutlery too. The sheets on the beds were changed daily unless you were mindful of enviromental issues! Same with the towels and fluffy dressing gowns! We had continental breakfast each day. The gym is small but well equipped and all in good condition. There was free access to the internet.Location is very good too. You can walk to Central Park in about 15 minutes but it is close to the trains and buses. There are a couple of cafes nearby that do good meals at reasonable prices. If you are thinking of staying here, just go for it. One of my friends stayed a couple of months ago and she was really impressed too. I would stay here again without a doubt.

the san carlos hotel is wonderful. although a small hotel it has friendly staff, great rooms, very clean, comfortable beds, excellent service. the location is great too, on 50th street, between lexington and 3rd, it is a quiet street, so no trash cans being collected at night, just bliss in new york. although there is no restaurant the irish bar just across the road provides the best in room service and late night drinks. the rooms were spacious and warm with everything from microwave ovens to a flat screen tv. i would strongly recommend this hotel to anyone. we are definately going to return to this hotel. it has everything and more you could want. well done san carlos, you made our holiday great!!!!

We stayed there for four nights. Rooms are small, but in excellent conditions. STaff extremely friendly. Free computers for internet, very helpful. The house has a nice atmosphere and is completely renovated, although it is a very old hotel. Compared to the Hotel Chelsea, which was a real adventure, this was a very good starting point for our NY vacation. Hotel Chelsea is much rougher and unique, but also has much less of luxury appeal and the amenities. One weakness clearly is the breakfast, it is very basic.

We have booked at the Bedford Hotel but when we arrived a very rude man told us that they had problems and had no rooms for us. So he gave us $5 dollars and the address of the San Carlos...WOW! that was luck!This is a very nice, clean and comfortable hotel. The rooms are spacious as well as the bathroom. All the staff was very friendly. And it is located in a WONDERFUL zone. Definitely will stay there in the future!

I was upset to read the review of the person who posted before me complaining about the old man in this hotel. To me it seemed the reviewer in question would prefer the staff to be grumpy and not offer him any friendly assistance whatsoever. Well I know that's not what I look for in a hotel...I stayed at the San Carlos with two other relatives for a week in September and we all thought the experience was wonderful. The hotel has a very friendly and homely feel to it as I guess it's relatively small compared to some of the other hotels around the city. It was our first time to New York and all the staff were really helpful in advising us in what was worth seeing during our stay. There was always someone waiting outside the hotel to open the door for you when you came back to the hotel and the staff always said hello; nothing seemed to much trouble.I guess it was lacking in facilities compared to some of the giant firms, there is no pool or hotel bar/restaurant, but in New York you only have to step outside the hotel to find whatever you are looking for so we were not bothered at all by this. The gym was small but I thought it was brilliant, each station is equipt with a tv so you can watch while you work out. The cyber lounge is a brilliant idea and was really useful; there is even a printer if you need to print anything off.The rooms have such comfortable beds and are kept immaculately clean everyday by the wonderful housekeeping staff; the Aveda bath products are a great addition. The TV is fab too - a pretty big flatscreen - wonderful! You get a complimentary newspaper every morning and complimentary breakfast. Some people have complained about the breakfast but I found it pretty fine. It is basically just coffee, orange juice, yoghurts, bread, pastries and toast; we all found this wonderful though because we weren't interested in having anything too heavy for breakfast.Definitely worth the money and definitely worth staying in again. I'm going to miss this hotel!

I have travelled for business for the past 30 years and the first time I stayed here was last year and was disappointed with the annoying older gentleman at the front desk. I was first trying to check-in because I needed to get ready for a business meeting but he kept making making small talk which was very annoying. Then upon check-out he insisted that I use a particular car service, that turned out to be a nightmare in itself!Just recently I could not get in anywhere else so I had to book there again once again the older gentleman was annoying(shouldn't he retire already) but thank god for the afternoon staff, they were pleasant but not overly talkative! The hotel is lovely and a great location but until (hopefully) he retires in the next year I won't be back!

I was treated as a theif in this hotel. You can see housekeepings laziness during your stay at this hotel. My room was dusty, some of amenity kits seem like used already, white towels weren't white. Turndown service is mess. A housekeeper came to my room around 10:30pm. All reviewers here are saying "kidding" , I guess. I didn't care all the problems I saw through my stay since it was only one night. However, when I got charged $170 from the hotel, I called them and they told me that I took two bathrobes from the room I stayed. I NEVER SAW THOSE BATHROBES in my room! The office manager was keeping telling me two bathrobes are missing. Before charging customers, don't they check housekeepers? This is ridiculous. My point is you want to be treated what you have paid, and you want to be treated as a customer, not a theif.

We stayed 2 nights at the San Carlos Hotel - 3 adults & 2 children. We all cannot rave enough about this hotel. The hotel staff are extremely friendly & very helpful. The room we had was a 1 bedroom suite & it was quite large, very clean & elegant. Loved the Aveda products. The hotel is in a great location. We would not hesitate to book here again especially when you consider the price of such a large room - it seems like a bargain.

We have looked at this hotel before, having stayed at the Kimberly and the Benjamin Hotels across the street. In contrast to the Benjamin and the Kimberly, this hotel has a quiet, european feel to it.  We booked through ---, and immediately had problems at check in. The staff, however, was extremely helpful, and got things straightened out immediately. The suite was spacious and quiet. One problem we had, however, was that the bathroom was in the bedroom area. This was contrary to what we had been promised, and it proved to be in inconvenience with 4 people in the suite. The continental breakfast was very nice, and the cybersuite on the second floor provided a great opportunity for our teenagers to get away. This is a great area in which to stay. Rockefeller Center and St. Patrick's Cathedral are just 3 blocks away, and Times Square is 6 blocks away. The area is very safe; you can walk anywhere in this section of Manhattan. I would say that the San Carlos is an excellent value in mid-town. The many european tourists staying in the hotel provide an indication of its value and quality. We would definitely stay here again.

After flying up from Florida with great expectations for a cheaper hotel on the West side (in which we fled in horror), we found ourselves struggling to find a place to stay with no time to spare. Fortunately for us the fabulous San Carlos was able to give us a suite immediately and turn a horrible day into a wonderful stay. We had stayed at the San Carlos before with a positive experience but looked for a less expensive hotel as we were also paying for our two student family members. But as we found out, you get what you pay for. After the disappointment of another hotel, the San Carlos was worth paying for. The service as always was swift, efficient, pleasant and professional. Now if they would only give discounts for frequent guests I would feel complete...Would definitely stay again.

This is the second time we have stayed at the San Carlos. The rooms are beautiful and comfortable. The hotel is in an excellent area, close to everything Manhattan has to offer. The staff was attentive to our needs and very friendly. We actually forgot some items we had just purchased and they mailed them to us. We even had a chance to meet the owner and chat with him. I would highly recommend this hotel to everyone, from singles to families. We traveled with family and the suite was perfect for our needs.
Recently renovated, this hotel has wonderful amenities and a great location. It makes for a terrific base to explore the city. Better than similarly priced hotels in the same neighborhood.

At first missed the big time feel of the larger hotel but then realized how great it was to return to such a comfortable hotel after a busy day. Rooms are supberb! Do not expect much in the way in of service (i.e. concierge) but the cleanliness and location make up for that! Definately would stay again. (Walked by the Benjamin and that looked good too)

My husband and I stayed at the San Carlos the first week of June. We had an Executive Suite on the 12th floor. The room was fabulous! Extremely spacious and comfortable. We had a wet bar, refrigerator, microwave, 2 TVs, and a separate sitting room from the bedroom. The only complaint about the room was that the air conditioner couldn't keep up with the steamy 85+ degree weather. The staff was friendly except for one desk attendant with an attitude. We didn't let this discourage us as he was the exception to a mostly friendly and attentive staff. The hotel was in a great location! Would recommend this hotel to others and would return.

San Carlos is conviently located. We stayed in a suite with one king bed and a pull out double in adjoining sitting room. For a Manhattan hotel, room was spacious. Room temp and air control good. Room facing street a bit noisy (but what hotel in NYC isn't?). Bathroom was modern, marble floors, granite counter top. Aveda products. Two tv's with good movie rental selections. Staff was superb- all whom we encounted to be very friendly and more than willing to assist, or go the extra mile to help with any requests. Check in was efficient. Parking available next door for $30/day. Room rate included continental b'fast, which consisted of sweet rolls, toast, yogurt, coffee, and oj. Basic. Room rate reasonable for hotel location and amenities. Great place to stay, we would return.

We were impressed with the San Carlos as soon as we arrived. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was very nicely furnished and clean although a little on the small side - we thought nothing of this (it is in NY after all!) until the hotel owner came to chat to us at breakfast and seemed a little apologetic when we told him our room number!Recommended for the rooms, the staff and the location.

Good location. this hotel had everything you could want. My only complaint was that my room faced on to the street and was a little noisy - but it is New York so there is not much you can do about that! Recommended - good Midtown location too.

Stayed for a few nights and had a great stay. Rooms were large and quiet and furnished nicely. The bellmen were very nice but the women working the front desk were not happy at all, never a smile the four days that we were there. I can live with that though as long as the room is nice. You can skip the continental breakfast though it was pretty weak. I would stay there again.

From the telephone and email contact before our trip, to the friendly and knowledgeable staff, to the beautiful and quiet suite, I loved everything about the San Carlos Hotel. The location was amazing, so close to everything and the service and accomodations were excellent. We had a one bedroom suite with two double beds and this suite had more floor space than many Manhattan apartments. The kitchenette was fine. There was no cook top but there was a sink, fridge, and microwave oven.This was my first trip to NYC and I will happily stay at the San Carlos the next time I go.

I really liked the San Carlos, but my husband didn't. It is near the Waldorf Astoria and within walking distance to everything on the East side. (Of course, we were there on a gorgeous spring weekend, when walking is a pleasure.) The room was large and clean. We loved having a refrigerator and a microwave. Great for leftovers from dinner! Conceirge wasn't helpful or knowledgeable at all. They told us the Rainbow Room was closed when it was open and couldn't help us get tickets for a show. We didn't try the breakfast since it was only available until 10:00 on a Sunday morning and we wanted to sleep in after painting the town red. Comfortable, clean and a good price. I would stay there again but husband won't. He prefers a room with a view and a concierge that is willing and ready to serve him.

I stayed here 4 nites ending 4/1/05, and was very happy with the property. I actually rented 2 rooms, 1 suite and one double. Both are nice, but I would always opt for the upgrade, as then you acquire a fridge for your beer! Did I mention the rooms were very clean, and the staff was both friendly and helpful? They were. I also found the breakfast convenient and a nice time saver. The #6 subway is only about 1/2 block away so you can easily explore from the Southern tip to the museum area using one line. Can you tell I was on vacation? The staff also gave good dining recommendations. Conclusion, you will enjoy this property, I did. (So did my wife and children.) I am not in the hotel review business, but since I read numerous reviews on 6 or 8 properties and selected the San Carlos based on feedback, I don't mind sharing mine. Final note: I couldn't run them out of hot water!

I have just come back from a week at the San Carlos. I got a decent rate via their website (a good $100 less than the other hotels across the road) and was very pleased with the hotel. My sister and I took a double room which was absolutely HUGE (not only for Manhattan standards) and was very well appointed and comfortable. The bathroom was similarly large, and despite my fears from earlier reviews, there were no problems with as much piping hot water as and when we desired. It would have been nice if they had replaced the shampoo and body lotion that we used (my personal test of hotel quality). To their credit, on the last night we were given refills during the turndown service. From the waiting pile of umbrellas (because let's face it, who is going to spend $5 on an umbrella you need for one day) to the friendly staff and comfortable rooms, this hotel is one to which I will hopefully return.

Spent a night at the San Carlos with a few friends over the weekend. For the price and location, its tough to beat in NYC. After taxes ($48!!!), we paid only $300 for the night. Definitely worth the price, for a 4-star hotel. Room was big enough for all of us, very clean, and the staff was friendly (not the in-your-face type). Parking was right next door at a valet type garage, for a discounted $30 for a 24 hr period, not bad at all. Have the front desk of the hotel stamp your parking ticket for the discount. Unless there's another 4-star hotel offering a much lower price than the San Carlos, I have no need to search for another place to stay while in NYC.

This hotel is nothing short of outstanding and is one of the best kept secrets in New York. Our kids LOVED IT. It is a small boutique, European-style of hotel with plush robes for all guest, European quality linens and furnishings and the rooms are among the largest in NYC at 400 square feet. There is internet access and computer available for us on the 2nd floor. Every morning there is a wonderful continental breakfast with toast, bages. cereals, juices, coffee, yogurt, fresh fruit, pastries. It is simply fabulous and I would love to stay there again! It also has a great location...a block away from the Waldorf Astoria and 3-4 blocks from St. Patrick's Cathedral.

Stayed here in November 04. When we arrived the reception staff were surly and inattentive - they ignored us until I inconvenienced them by politely asking if we could check in. We were then shown to a room in which the heater was not working - it was like an ice box in there. They must have known about this because it was clear that noone had been staying in the room for some time (despite all other rooms in the hotel being occupied). We complained and so they sent up an engineer who dismantled the heater while we sat shivering. The engineer eventually gave up and so we were shown to another room. It looked like a nice room until the porter realised that it was still occupied! HOW could this happen?Apparently, all the other rooms were full so we were then given the option of moving back to the icebox and the manager said they'd get us a fan heater! I told her that that was unacceptable and that they had to give us another room or find us another hotel.After a long delay we were finally given another room. In the land where customer service is king, I didn't expect this kind of incompetence.Once were installed in our new room, we quite liked the hotel (although the breakfast facilities are very mediocre). Trouble was, by then, we already had the bitter taste in our mouths. Won't stay there again I'm afraid.

I stayed at the San Carlos with 3 children for 3 nights (March 15-18) in room 1108 - a suite with 2 double beds in the bedroom and a full size pull out sofa in the main room. There was plenty of room, the linens and bed spreads were clean and new, the bathroom very clean and modern. We had a microwave, small fridge with little freezer, and a sink and coffee maker in the kitchenette. There was a small table and two chairs in addition to the sitting area. There was a tv in both the bedroom and the sitting room. They gave us a complimentary cord to connect our laptop to the internet and there was no charge for the internet. My son forgot his toothbrush and called down and they sent us up two. There was a minimal continental breakfast served 7-10- coffee and decaf, tea and oj. Lots of sugary white breads - no bagels or whole wheat bread. Cottage cheese and assorted yogurts. Only steps away are plenty of great places for a more ambitious breakfast. The owner was very visible and greeted most of the breakfast patrons and let us know that the breakfast is entirely kosher.The fitness room is quite nice and the business center is very convenient.Our room had no view at all and was a bit dark. No overhead lights and it was hard for me to read comfortably, but that was my only problem in the room. Housekeepers, front desk and bellmen were all very friendly and helpful. I believe even the regular rooms have a microwave, coffee maker and fridge. I would be perfectly comfortable staying here anytime though I must admit I prefer staying at one of the hotels between 5th and 7th if they are available.

For $330 a night, one can't expect five star service in Manhattan; for that same $330, however, the San Carlos is a reasonable stay. The location is decent -- close to the 1-5-6 subway and a short walk to Rockefeller Plaza -- and the ambience is sleek. Though we had booked a regular room, we were upgraded to a suite at check-in. The suite was well-appointed, with a bar sink, microwave, and dining area in the anteroom. The bedroom was ample, as was the bathroom. There were, however, three issues that arose. First, our fifth-floor location on the street side meant a bit of noise from both the traffic and the nightclub across the street. Second, we had to wait to take showers, as we discovered no hot water flowing through the pipes; when I called to notify the front desk, the attendant apologized, claiming that the hotel was fully booked and they weren't prepared for the demand for showers. (I believe that this is the sort of planning that quality hotels are supposed to do, yes?) Finally, the front desk clerk who handled our check out was, to my tastes, unreasonably agressive in trying to sell us a private car ride to Newark Airport, using tactics that cast doubt on our "quality" as travelers / guests. In this, I was reminded how the attitude and behavior of even one staff member can cast a negative pall over an otherwise reasonable stay -- especially if this person's the last one with whom you have contact.

My wife and I entered the hotel hopeful that it would be as nice as it looked on line. It simply isn't. It's one of those hotels that seemed to have been designed fast with a formula in mind: lure customers with a neat website and then when they arrive, greet them with friendly desk clerks. The hotel felt empty, soul free, clean. The room we were shown to had lots of polyester, and a touch of Ikea. We left after fifteen minutes. With everything NY has to offer, this is one place to pass up.

Beautiful hotel. Very Clean. Good location. Nice rooms - love the bathroom. Doorman was superb- Always offering help for various things. Internet lounge was great. Adequate Fitness facility. Would highly recomend this hotel.

Stayed at the San Carlos 8th December for 7 nights. Rooms very spacious and well equiped, even had a small cooking area with microwave, fridge etc. The hotel appeared to be full of business people so obviously populaur for them. Breakfast was included and was continental, dissapointing never had bagels in all the 7 breakfasts, same food each day, no variety... but hey if you want more there are loads of restaraunts and diners around. Could do with a bar / lounge to relax in after all the walking. Good hotel would stay again.

Eco-unfriendly plastic cutlery aside.... this was a great place to stay. I was in NYC for the marathon - it's a short walk down to the meeting point for runners outside the Library. The Chrysler Building and Grand Central Station are close, the subway stop is on the corner and you can even walk to the Guggenheim if you're feeling energetic. The rooms are great - clean, nice fittings, comfy bed, fridge, microwave, giant telly etc. Staff are very friendly and helpful and the breakfast was good enough - not great but hey, everything else was.

Just spent 4 nights in the San Carlos and while it was fine, very clean, nice decent sized room although very,very dark, I didn't really warm to it. The older check in clerk was nice and friendly but apart from that the staff were not . It is strange to be in a hotel that has no bar or no where to eat , you can't even get a cup of cofffe and sit in the lobby and that feels weird. I have stayed in 3 Summit Group hotels in the last year and this really didn't compare.

Great location (near the subway) and a very friendly and accommodating staff. Well appointed rooms with amenities. No in-house restaurant, but a few of nice ones near by.If you're a light sleeper and going to be there on a Friday or Saturday night, ask for a room on the back side of the hotel as there is a night club across the street that's pretty busy and noisy until the wee hours of the mornings. Also lots of sirens and horn blowing all night long.

Took a well-deserved vacation in early October and was incredibly pleased with the San Carlos. I stayed in a one-bedroom suite for 9 days and I found the staff most gracious. Upon check-in, the person at reception was absolutely wonderful despite a hectic morning. When departing, a car was awaiting to take us to the airport, sparing us the sometimes dreadful taxi ride. Room was nicely decorated and quite spacious. Located in an area where just about everything is accessible 24 hours a day. I have plans to return to NYC and will most definitely be calling on the San Carlos!

My husband and I arrived at the San Carlos in mid October 2004 for our honeymoon. When my husband told the lovely front desk clerk that it was our honeymoon, she upgraded us to a one-bedroom suite and sent us a complimentary basket of wine, chocolates, and savories, plus a handwritten note to congratulate us. What a lovely way to begin our vacation! The suite was beautifully furnished with modern pieces in gentle, neutral colors, and artwork was displayed amongst lovely lighting. It appears that their recent renovation was well worth it. The staff were friendly and very accommodating, they gave us great tips on restaurants and directions, and we felt very much at home in our suite. I highly recommend the San Carlos for it's incredible location, charm, and understated elegance.
Just returned from a stay at The San Carlos, 10/04. Each member of the staff that we had contact with were friendly and very helpful. I would highly recommend you try it out.

Just returned from a business trip that included a week at the San Carlos in NYC. The hotel is well located, the staff extremely friendly, and the rooms very large by NY standards. The microwave, fridge, and coffee maker are all appreciated additions. The price was right and the accommodations excellent. One suggestion however, check to see if the U.N. is in session during your stay. If so, security in and around the hotel is very tight and the surrounding streets can be closed resulting in difficulty getting a cab in or out of midtown East.

We chose this hotel based on Trip Advisor feedback. Pro's - separate fridge, microwave & crockery for eating in. Complemantary NYT & USA Today. Very friendly staff. Con's - small room for a quad (we were 2 adults 7 2 children). We got room with no view, but was quiet.

Stayed here over Easter with the family and really enjoyed our stay. Rooms well equiped and large, staff friendly and location very convenient.Although the reception does not appear to grand and the breakfast is very basic.

The San Carlos is an amazing hotel. The price is so reasonable for midtown and the room was gorgeous. It was so roomy and really well taken care of. The staff was very helpful, and the doorman even helped us get a deal on a limo to take us to little italy. Highly recommended!

The hotel has no cooker, no dishwasher, no drinks in stock... Consequence :- Simple continental breakfast (no eggs, no cold meat, ...)- Plastic cups, knives, forks, plates, ...- Like a Fast Food restaurant, once you had finished your breakfast, you had to clean your table yourself, and throw all the rubish and plastic place settings away in the two big dustbins that were placed nearby the basket of bread.- If you have drunk the bottle of water in your minibar, and want another bottle, you have to wait for the next day, because they have no provisions at the hotel.

This hotel greatly exceeded expectations. It underwent a renovation and wow, it looks wonderful. The location was great, the staff was great, and the rooms were great. I can not imagine anyone not being completely satisfied with the San Carlos. I lived and worked in NYC a year ago, and miss the city tremendously. I will definitely return to San Carlos for my next visit to NYC. Thank you for such a wonderful stay.

A friend and I stayed at the San Carlos for four days this summer. The room and puiblic areas are beautifully appointed. Our room had a microwave and small refridgerator which was a real plus. The staff was unfailingly polite, helpful and available. The desk arranged for a car to take us to the airport. The location was excellent - we were be able to walk to and from Broadway as well as all over Manhatten. I look forward to staying there again.

After extensive searching on the internet, I found the perfect hotel for my first trip to NYC. The San Carlos Hotel is located in a great location, within walking distance to the theatre district, Times Square, Central Park and the Empire State Building. The staff is very accomodating and friendly and the rooms are nicely appointed. The sheets on the bed were very soft and welcoming after a long day. There is no restaurant in the hotel, but so many great choices within walking distance. The only things that would make the hotel better is if the it had a city view and if the continental breakfast were improved with more variety (got there at 9:00 and they were out of bread) but the comfort and coziniess of the room made up for those shortcomings. When I booked, I found the best price on the hotel's own website. However, if I would have booked a week or two earlier I could have gotten the room for $178 on orbitz.

Dear Readers,I had a wonderful time at this hotel in March 2004. It was my first time to NYC and the concierge was absolutly wonderful. They would actually draw my path on the map, reccomend all the palce close by to shop etc. They went above and beyond the call of duty. As for breakfast it was fine as well. They do specify that is continental, not buffet. (In response to one of the other reviewers) Location is great as well. 10 min walk from TS.I will definetly stay here next time I am in NYC

We stayed Saturday night at the San Carlos in order to visit my daughter living in NYC. The entire hotel recently unwent a total renovation and it has all been done in impeccable taste and very high quality. It is a moderately-sized hotel (18 floors) but has a pleasingly intimate feel. All the employees are very nice and the lobby and rooms are extremely comfortable. The location was perfect for us but the only drawback is that the hotel does not have a kitchen. Room service involves neighborhood restaurants. The complimentary breakfast on the first floor is very basic (and disappointing) with coffee, pastries, juice and yogurt. It is not in alignment with the sophistication that the hotel otherwise exhibits, it being a part of the worldwide Summit Hotel chain. The space where the restaurant is intended to be is awaiting a tennant to operate it. We would happily stay again, but we can't call it a full-service hotel.

Went to NYC with my my husband and two daughters. Searched high and low for a hotel to accomodate four. Wanted a good location and a decent size room. This hotel was excellent! The service was great. I'd stay there again tomorrow if I could. I highly recommend it.

Needed a 1 bedroom suite, to share with my Japanese guest. After reviewing many, and I mean many, hotels I decided on the San Carlos based on the favorable reviews. Wonderful experience. Good location, excellent staff. Very nicely appointed rooms. Very spacious, and well kept.The booking company I used, also highly recommended this hotel [their staff members had stayed here].

A great family hotel. We shared a one bedroom suite with our two teenagers and everyone was happy. There was enough room to spread out and the kitchenette was great for snacks and breakfasts. Service was also terrific. The entire property is fresh and clean.

After having used tripadvisor for researching other hotels in nyc, all the good reviews led me to the san carlos hotel. I booked the room for my family and I who were all visiting for my brother's graduation. We had a great experience. I was upgraded at no charge to a suite with a queen bed and pull-out sofa. The bed was great but the pull-out sofa wasn't so comfortable. We asked for extra towels and shampoo and was asked how many for each. They arrived quickly and with a smile. The Aveda products were the best and the bathrooms were spacious and clean. The living area in the suite was big and roomy as was the bedroom. The staff was pleasant from the front desk, bellhop, doorman and housekeeping. I would definitely stay here again. The location was also great with subway access nearby, coffee shop, restaurants and parking next door. Great place for a good price.

Ideal location, - I was able to walk to every one of my appointments. It is a very friendly hotel with all you need for a business trip - free high speed internet, business centre (basic but 3 free PCs.), microwave fridge & coffee machine in room. My room backed onto a light well - so no view but very quiet even with window open which is great for noisy New York. I would choose the quiet over the view.The breakfast was comprehensive for a continental tho cereal would be nice. Good size rooms and very friendly helpful staff.

I was picking out the hotel not only for my family but for my two sisters' families as well. I spent quite a bit of time researching hotels on the web and after a phone call to the San Carlos decided to go with them. The whole experience with the San Carlos was wonderful. Every interaction with the hotel, whether it was a phone call prior to the stay, talking to the lobby or speaking with one of the maids was totally pleasant. Everybody was incredibly nice. For example, I called the hotel before coming down to ask how far away Bloomingdales and Central Park was. Not only were they nice about the phone call they obviously had some kind of map which they could reference saying how far these things were from the hotel. When the maid saw us going into the room she offered us more towels. The hotel is beautiful and has a great location. From the hotel we walked to Bloomingdales, Central park zoo, St.Patrick's cathedral and Times Square easily. I thought the decor in the hotel rooms was very classy and the rooms were immaculate. Everybody in my family was very impressed with the hotel. We're all on a budget and the price of $199 seemed very fair for what you got. The only thing that could have been improved was the continental breakfast but since I really didn't even include the free breakfast in our decision to stay there I consider that pretty trivial. I can't say enough good things about this hotel!

We (mom, dad, two kids) stayed at the San Carlos for four nights. The suite was very large by New York standards--a living room with a full-sized sofa sleeper, small table and chairs, and a "kitchen" area with microwave, refrigerator and bar-sized sink. Many small amenities that were unexpected--for instance, plates and cutlery, which many "suites" hotels do not provide. Also, a nice work desk with free high-speed internet access, and both of the television sets had front video plugs, making it easy to hook up a portable dvd player. The staff was very accomodating. Overall, an extremely positive experience.

The San Carlos was really impressive, and overall a damn good experience. I decided to stay here based on comments on this web site (four nights), so I thought I should offer my own remarks. The room was spacious and cleaned promptly each morning. The staff was professional and courteous. The small kitchen was a huge bonus, especially traveling with children (sink, microwave, fridge, mini-bar). A small portable crib was in our room upon arrival. We skipped the free breakfast... not much to it. The diner across the street was quick and the food was decent. The location is ideal... walking distance to St. Patricks, the Waldorf, 5th Ave., Rockefeller Center. On the downside, the rate I was quoted changed upon my arrival. After a brief discussion with the manager, he changed the rate to the one that I was quoted initially... $199 per night plus tax or $230 total. I have stayed in much more expensive hotels in NYC, but none that were this good. Well worth it.

We stayed at this hotel March 15 to March 19/04 and found it to be an excellent experience. The room was very clean, well decorated and spacious. It's not a very large hotel and the personal service was appreciated.The room was made up promptly each day. We left a note and a tip asking for extra towels and they were restocked each day of our stay without having to be reminded. Also we were always greeted as we left and came back to the hotel. The location is great, and you can walk to 5th Ave shopping, Central Park, Broadway. etc. Breakfast which is included was simple and enough to get you started each day. We would definitely stay here again and highly recommend it to others.

This is a long, but informative review. My boyfriend and I thoroughly enjoyed our Valentine's day weekend thanks to the San Carlos Hotel. I booked an executive suite weekend special through the hotel's website about 2-3 weeks in advance and was excited to have a beautifully appointed and newly renovated room. On Friday, we parked the car next to the hotel, checked in and got upgraded to a one bedroom suite, then quickly made our way to the 14th floor (out of 18.) When we walked in we were amazed--closet and bar area to your left and bathroom (with a full length mirror on the door) to your right and straight ahead was the living room with new couches, chairs, endtables, a glass table (magazines included) and a 2 person eating area (with a lovely bamboo plant for decoration!) There was also an entertainment center which had the flat screen tv and N64 control (just in case) and next to that was the desk with complimentary high speed internet access (a huge plus--my boyfriend brought his laptop.) The door to the bedroom was just past the bar area on the left. The bed was a queen size, but we weren't complaining since there was the mini-bar in the room (which was adequately stocked--best bottled water ever, and the liquor/beer selection was great too) as well as another flat screen tv, alarm/cd player, a corby press pants, chair and closet. The bathroom didn't have a huge bathtub, but it was definitely up to par (be sure to make use of their bathrobes and aveda products.) Also to be noted was the separate air/heat controls between the bedroom and the living room. The suite was beautifully decorated with paintings and pictures and the bedding/furniture was modern yet had a homey feel to it. We thought "if only there was a kitchen" that we'd ask how much the rent was, we wanted to move in! Once we settled in, we made use of their delivery menus. Since there is no restaurant in the hotel yet, they supply you with 5 or 6 different types of restaurants that deliver--from Japanese to Italian. Ordering the food was a piece of cake and the bill gets added to your hotel account. The service at the hotel was excellent--they promptly brought up our food along with a bucket of ice, which we asked for. There was also alot of good on-demand movies to choose from, so we watched one later that evening. Saturday morning we woke up on our own (no maids knocking--they take the Do Not Disturb sign very literally) and ordered breakfast, although there is also a comlimentary continental breakfast between 7-10. When we had to leave the suite the doorman was ready to hail a cab for us. We were always greeted when we came back to the hotel. Check-out was also a breeze and was asked if we enjoyed our stay and if we were taken care of, which we were. All in all, we had a fantastic time at the San Carlos. We've stayed at many other hotels in the city, but this newly renovated gem on the east side is ranked #1 on our list so far, so we'll definitely come back in the future.

I stayed here on Valentines Day and arrived around 8pm. The only downside to my stay was the fact that the garage was full and the hotel only validates parking for the garage next door. I parked down the street and got $200 in parking tickets. The hotel staff was friendly and the room was large and clean. The bathroom was nice but could be a little cleaner. I stayed in a suite with a refrigerator and a kitchenette. The linens and Aveda products were nice. Would probably stay again, the room rates were really good - better rate by booking directly w/the hotel.

I was really impressed with the genuine hospitality of the staff. I don't like it when I am made to feel as if I am intruding or making someone's job difficult. The San Carlos staff was so accomadating I really felt like a guest and not some customer. There was discounted parking nearby, which is important for NYC. I was also very pleased with the location. We were within walking distance of Rockefeller Center, Grand Central Station, Times Square, and a number of really good restuarants. This hotel is definitely what I paid and more.

I have grown accustomed to luxury hotels, and my travel agent recommended the San Carlos. Wow! Was I pleased! New York has many fine hotels, but few have the space, the staff, and the unbeatable location of the San Carlos. I mean, if New York weren't such a compelling city, I think we would have been happy spending our time in the room.We had a true one bedroom suite, with the bedroom completely separate from the living room - and our winter rate was something under $300. The small kitchen, two TV's and all the other amenities were nice to have, - there was even a device in the room that ironed trousers, - but somehow we most appreciated the light continental breakfast served so cheerfully each morning.The San Carlos is located on East 50th St., less than a block from the Waldorf Astoria, and it's near Rockefeller Center, Saks, Grand Central Station, and plenty of great restaurants. We discovered a classic Japanese suhshi place across the street - Nada Sushi - that in almost 30 years never made into Zagats but is beloved by the local cognoscenti.We can never stay away from New York for long, and we are looking forward to a repeat performance with our new friends at the San Carlos.

We just returned from a pre-Christmas weekend in NYC and had a great stay at the San Carlos. The hotel is located several blocks behind St. Patrick's Cathedral, where we walked to church on a snowy, Sunday morning. The hotel also is very close to Shun Lee Palace and Serendipity restaurants, Bloomingdales, Saks, and Rockefeller Center. We walked to all those places, as well as to Lincoln Center and the skating rink in Central Park, which were a bit farther. The hotel staff was wonderful and welcoming to us (me, my husband, and two kids, ages 7 and 11). We had a one bedroom suite, which included two small but comfortable rooms, one containing a sofa bed, table and chairs, and kitchette area (sink, microwave, fridge), and the bedroom containing a nice bed and lovely bathroom. We also had two tvs, which is great when you are traveling with children. The free continental breakfast in the morning consisted of a variety of breads to toast, muffins, pasteries, yogurt, bagels, coffee, and juice--nothing fancy, but enough to fill us up and get us going without wasting time and dropping another $40 on breakfast each day. Our only complaint was that the noise from the street kept us up the first night, even on the 11th floor. By the second night, we were so tired, we didn't even hear it. On the way out, the concierge arranged a car service for us to the airport and the car was ready and waiting when we were ready to go. All in all, we had a great time and loved the hotel. We would have no qualms about staying there again.

Stayed here the 2nd week in October for three nights and thought the hotel was terrific. Had stayed across the street at the Kimberely for a Thanksgiving trip a few years back and did not remember that this hotel was even there. The staff was wonderful and the continential breakfast a really nice amenity. The beds were not the most comfortable, but the rooms were large, nicely appointed and the location was great. Adjacent to the subway, 5 minute walk to Rockefeller Center, 10 minutes to Times Square and just a block off beautiful Park Avenue. We had a great time and the price was right. Would stay here again anytime.

Just spent the last weekend at the San Carlos. Overalll I would give this hotel a high rating. we had a one bedroom suite (2 double beds) for $259, and then a $30 rate for parking. The room was very nice, and very fresh as just renovated. The staff was very pleasant, and when we called for extra towels and ice, were very prompt. I have recently stayed at The Muse, and while this Hotel is not the Muse, the current prices are much better, and I enjoyed the East side location more than the West side. Overall I will have no qualms in recommending the San Carlos to friends who want a nice place to stay at a reasonable price!

Stayed at the San Carlos on Aug 9-10, 2003! The place was BEAUTIFUL! Not terribly expensive given NYC, $199 plus all the NYC taxes. Got discounted parking next door for $30 rather than $47! The place was just renovated, and it's beautiful! Rooms were beautiful, lobby was gorgeous, staff very courtious! Definitely stay there again! Try it out. I'm sure you'll be very happy with your choice!
